finding: The SNP rs63750197 (p.Ser130Leu) was noted as a conflicting clinical variant but labeled as pathogenic in OMIM and Alzforum, indicating its potential relevance to clinical outcomes.
title: Frequency of Variants in Mendelian Alzheimer’s Disease Genes within the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project (ADSP)

finding: The SNP rs3003378 was identified as a causal SNP in a GWAS study that generated phenotypic values through a linear regression model, with an effect size of β=0.02.
title: A High-resolution Haplotype-resolved Reference Panel Constructed from the China Kadoorie Biobank Study

finding: The SNP rs10915307 was recognized as a causal SNP with an effect size of β=0.01 in the context of the GWAS.
title: A High-resolution Haplotype-resolved Reference Panel Constructed from the China Kadoorie Biobank Study

finding: The SNP rs301799 was associated with total log acceleration (TLA) between 6pm to 8pm, indicating a connection to early evening physical activity.
title: Genome-wide association studies of 27 accelerometry-derived physical activity measurements identifies novel loci and genetic mechanisms

finding: The SNP rs1144566 was connected to sleep proxy phenotypes such as timing of the least active period (L5) and TLA during late night hours.
title: Genome-wide association studies of 27 accelerometry-derived physical activity measurements identifies novel loci and genetic mechanisms

finding: The A allele of rs7514261 associated with CFH was noted for higher risk of macular degeneration, as well as lower FVC, suggesting its dual role in lung function and ocular health.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study improves resolution of genes, pathways and pleiotropy for lung function and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: The common variant rs3850625 in CACNA1S showed lower FVC and FEV1 associations and was connected with decreased muscle mass and grip strength, strengthening the link between pulmonary and muscular health.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study improves resolution of genes, pathways and pleiotropy for lung function and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: The novel locus at 1q25.2 (rs12031894) was identified through meta-analysis as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) influencing nearby genes across various tissues, primarily in brain tissues, and was shown to be linked to both depression and SCZ.
title: Multi-trait genetic analysis identifies novel pleiotropic loci for depression and schizophrenia in East Asians

finding: The locus at 1q25.2 (rs61824368) was noted as a novel signal in the meta-analysis of SCZ, contributing to the association with both SCZ and depression.
title: Multi-trait genetic analysis identifies novel pleiotropic loci for depression and schizophrenia in East Asians

finding: The SNP rs6025 was strongly associated with primary hypercoagulable state (phecode: 286.81) and linked to multiple phecode traits related to coagulation defects. This variant in the F5 gene had previously confirmed associations with venous thromboembolism and thrombosis.
title: The Michigan Genomics Initiative: a biobank linking genotypes and electronic clinical records in Michigan Medicine patients

finding: The CAD and aortic aneurysm risk allele (C) of SNP rs6681093 was associated with lower HRNR protein secretion from SMCs, illustrating its role in vascular-related diseases.
title: Secreted protein profiling of human aortic smooth muscle cells identifies vascular disease associations

finding: The diastolic blood pressure risk allele (T) of SNP rs10797858 was shown to be associated with lower LAMC2 protein secretion from SMCs, linking it to blood pressure regulation.
title: Secreted protein profiling of human aortic smooth muscle cells identifies vascular disease associations

finding: The variant rs7528419, located in the SORT1 gene locus, was strongly associated with coronary heart disease (CHD) in prior genome-wide association studies (GWAS). PRISM indicated that this variant demonstrated a direct effect on apolipoprotein B (apoB), through which it influenced CHD. This finding was consistent with recent evidence that sortilin, the protein encoded by SORT1, restricts the secretion of apoB, a major marker for lipid-induced cardiovascular risk.
title: Inferring genetic variant causal networks by leveraging pleiotropy

finding: The intronic variant rs12724121 was identified within a conserved CHD-enhancer element. It was associated with regulatory potential in cardiac tissues, indicating its significance in cardiac gene regulation and possibly in the pathogenesis of congenital heart disease.
title: Computational analysis of congenital heart disease associated SNPs: Unveiling their impact on the gene regulatory system

finding: In this study, the SNP rs1805087 in the MTR gene was reported to be in linkage disequilibrium (r² ≥ 0.97) with a suggestive SNP (rs10925261) and was associated with blood pressure traits, further highlighting the role of MTR in cardiovascular health and hypertension.
title: Genomic Exploration of Essential Hypertension in African-Brazilian Quilombo Populations: A Comprehensive Approach with Pedigree Analysis and Family-Based Association Studies

finding: The finding related to SNP rs12082297 was linked to lymphatic function and implied a connection with lymphatic valve functionality, contributing to the understanding of conditions like lymphedema. This was established through the study on lymphatic valves and lymph flow, suggesting that genetic variations at this locus could play a role in lymphatic drainage efficiency, thereby influencing disease processes like rheumatoid arthritis and cancer-related lymphedema.
title: Near-Infrared Imaging of Indocyanine Green Identifies Novel Routes of Lymphatic Drainage from Metacarpophalangeal Joints in Healthy Human Hands

finding: Patients with the rs12083537 AA genotype were found to have a decreased response to tocilizumab treatment compared to those with the AG genotype, suggesting a higher risk of therapeutic failure.
title: Interleukin-6 receptor genetic variation and tocilizumab treatment response to COVID-19

finding: The rs11265618 CC genotype was associated with an increased response to tocilizumab compared to patients with CT and TT genotypes, indicating potential for better treatment outcomes.
title: Interleukin-6 receptor genetic variation and tocilizumab treatment response to COVID-19

finding: The FCGR3A rs396991 AA genotype was associated with increased response to tocilizumab when compared to patients with AC or CC genotypes, indicating its relevance in treatment response.
title: Interleukin-6 receptor genetic variation and tocilizumab treatment response to COVID-19

finding: The SNP rs114101204, which localized to the LINC00970 gene, was associated with severe COVID-19 and venous thromboembolism (VTE). It demonstrated a very strong association with a P-meta value of 1.44×10−37.
title: Shared genetic etiology and causality between COVID-19 and venous thromboembolism: evidence from genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs12040925 was reported in the context of prognostic implications regarding sarcopenia and skeletal muscle loss during neoadjuvant chemoradiotherapy in esophageal cancer. This finding highlighted its relevance to patient management and survival in individuals undergoing treatment for this type of cancer.
title: MuViSS : Muscle, Visceral and Subcutaneous Segmentation by an automatic evaluation method using Deep Learning

finding: At the RUNX3 locus, rs146887912 was identified as a fine-mapped variant for height. It was fine-mapped in Afr47k but not in European cohorts due to a significantly lower MAF. Interestingly, this single-nucleotide insertion had not been previously implicated by GWAS, highlighting its potential significance in height variation.
title: MultiSuSiE improves multi-ancestry fine-mapping in All of Us whole-genome sequencing data

finding: This SNP was associated with endometrial cancer susceptibility, relating to the established risk factors mentioned in the GWAS study. The findings emphasized its relevance in the context of candidate susceptibility genes for endometrial cancer.
title: Multi-tissue transcriptome-wide association study identifies genetic mechanisms underlying endometrial cancer susceptibility

finding: This SNP was found to be an SMC-specific caQTL regulating chromatin accessibility at an enhancer linked to HSD52, disrupting a transcription factor binding site for BACH1, and showing a strong association with decreased expression of HSD52 in the presence of a risk allele.
title: Single cell variant to enhancer to gene map for coronary artery disease

finding: Another novel locus identified for accelerometer-measured MVPA was rs4480415, which achieved a genome-wide significant association with a p-value of 8.7×10⁻⁹, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors influencing PA.
title: Association of Sedentary and Physical Activity Behaviors with Body Composition: a Genome-Wide Association and Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: This SNP was associated with the <italic>INKA2</italic> gene and showed relevance in context with prostate cancer through its influence on PSA.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: Found in <italic>FAF1</italic>, this variant showcased strong association with PSA levels, potentially influencing prostate cancer outcomes.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: Associated with lower ASAT, lower HDL, and higher TG, indicating significant impacts on both body fat and lipid metabolic traits.
title: Sex-stratified GWAS of Body Fat Percentage after Adjusting for Testosterone and SHBG in the UK Biobank

finding: Identified in the Million Veteran Program, rs4478781 was associated with smoking trajectories in over 300,000 individuals, specifically in African-Americans alone, highlighting its significance in smoking behavior.
title: Genetic insights into smoking behaviours in 10,558 men of African ancestry from continental Africa and the UK

finding: The Duffy SNP (rs2814778) located at 1q23.2 was included in the analysis of white blood cell count and C-reactive protein due to its strong association with admixture. It served as a crucial proxy for local ancestry analysis as it is highly differentiated across ancestries, with alternate allele frequencies of 0.006 in one ancestry versus 0.964 in another, indicating a significant genetic distinction that could influence trait variation.
title: Causal effects on complex traits are similar across segments of different continental ancestries within admixed individuals

finding: The finding for rs17024393 associated with GSTM3 was part of 4 detected SNP-transcript-BMI associations, contributing to understanding the genetic framework of BMI variability.
title: Integrating Genetic and Transcriptomic Data to Identify Genes Underlying Obesity Risk Loci

finding: The variant rs10911021 in GLUL was associated with cardiovascular disease (CVD) among T2D patients, having been identified through a genome-wide association study (GWAS) and confirmed in two additional studies. This variant was the only single variant showing significant associations in multiple studies.
title: Precision Prognostics for Cardiovascular Disease in Type 2 Diabetes: A Systematic Review and Meta-analysis

finding: rs1937455 was identified as a lead SNP mapping to PDE4B with significant causal potential. This SNP was part of a credible set of 123 genome-wide significant SNPs indicating its role in substance use disorder risk.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: this SNP was linked to PDE4B, reinforcing its relevance in the genetics of substance use disorders.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: Identified as associated with cervical cancer (p=3.1 × 10⁻⁸), this SNP relates to CDC42, whose expression has implications in cancer invasion.
title: GWAS meta-analysis and gene expression data link reproductive tract development, immune response and cellular proliferation/apoptosis with cervical cancer and clarify overlap with other cervical phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs4915019 identified the NTNG1 ligand SV found in 26% of ASD cases, reinforcing connections to axon guidance processes linked to ASD.
title: Structural Variants Are a Major Component of the Missing Heritability of Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: In Hispanic populations, rs114831731 linked to AHCYL1 showed a significant interaction with STST for PP (P_GxE=1.6×10^-9).
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: Evidence of interaction for SBP at rs143863772, associated with MROH7, was significant when tested under STST (P_GxE=5.8×10^-5).
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: The SNP rs1497828 located in the ESRRG-GPATCH2 region showed a significant correlation with type 2 diabetes risk. The risk genotype G/C-C/C demonstrated an increased risk of IR with a significant OR of 2.90 (95% CI: 1.51-5.57; P=0.0011), revealing the importance of this genetic variant in the context of metabolic disorders.
title: Insulin Resistance Risk in Normal BMI Individuals: Investigating the Role of Genetic Polymorphisms in RNF138, ABCA1, and ESRRG-GPATCH2 Genes - A Case-Control Study in the Indian Population

finding: The SNP rs13303010 was identified as a significant risk locus for Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma (PDAC) through a genome-wide association study (GWAS). Initial analyses suggested its association with a P-value of 7.3×10^-7 and an odds ratio (OR) of 1.20 (95% CI: 1.12-1.29). Subsequent meta-analysis improved these results, achieving an OR of 1.26 (95% CI: 1.19-1.35) with a P-value of 8.36×10^-14, thus supporting its role as a PDAC risk factor.
title: Allelic effects on KLHL17 expression likely mediated by JunB/D underlie a PDAC GWAS signal at chr1p36.33

finding: The SNP rs13303160 exhibited allele-preferential binding of JunB and JunD, implicating it in the regulation of KLHL17, a gene considered a potential target in the 1p36.33 locus for PDAC risk. The study demonstrated that the risk allele (G) of rs13303160 disrupted the binding of Activator Protein-1 (AP-1) factors and showed significant enhancer activity in vitro, with the protective allele (A) associated with greater expression of KLHL17.
title: Allelic effects on KLHL17 expression likely mediated by JunB/D underlie a PDAC GWAS signal at chr1p36.33

finding: The SNP rs13303327 showed allele-preferential binding of transcription factors from the E74-like factor family, linking it to regulatory activity relevant to PDAC risk. The A allele demonstrated a stronger regulatory effect in luciferase assays compared to the G allele, thereby indicating its potential role in modulating PDAC risk.
title: Allelic effects on KLHL17 expression likely mediated by JunB/D underlie a PDAC GWAS signal at chr1p36.33

finding: The SNP rs2230288 was associated with 'slow' progression in PD, despite GBA mutation carriers being excluded from the analysis, indicating a connection to an increased PD risk.
title: Artificial Intelligence-Based Clustering and Characterization of Parkinson’s Disease Trajectories

finding: The SNP rs12752133 demonstrated association with the risk of 'slow' progression of PD, tying it to genetic factors influencing disease risk even though GBA mutation carriers were not included.
title: Artificial Intelligence-Based Clustering and Characterization of Parkinson’s Disease Trajectories

finding: The SNP rs76763715 was identified as linked to 'slow' progression of PD, maintaining an association with an increased risk of developing the disease.
title: Artificial Intelligence-Based Clustering and Characterization of Parkinson’s Disease Trajectories

finding: The missense variant rs2228145 (p.Asp358Ala) in the IL6R locus was significantly associated with increased soluble IL6R levels and was found to be associated with a higher risk of asthma and urticaria. The variant resulted in the loss of an important interaction with ADAM17, which could increase the turnover rate and cleavage of IL6R, thereby impacting IgAV risk.
title: Genome-wide studies define new genetic mechanisms of IgA vasculitis

finding: The SNP rs6694258 was associated with increased plasma levels of IL6R but lower blood transcript levels. This SNP co-localized with both eQTL and pQTL, further supporting its role in IgAV susceptibility.
title: Genome-wide studies define new genetic mechanisms of IgA vasculitis

finding: The SNP rs4129267 explained a significant portion of the variance in plasma IL6R levels, reinforcing its role in elevated soluble IL6R associated with increased IgAV risk.
title: Genome-wide studies define new genetic mechanisms of IgA vasculitis

finding: SNP rs2758600 was indicated as tagging the gene PMF1, which showed significant association with stroke in the summary-based Mendelian randomization (SMR) analyses. This SNP was found to have pleiotropic or potential causal links with stroke risk.
title: Integration of Mendelian randomisation and systems biology models to identify novel blood-based biomarkers for stroke

finding: Like rs2758600, SNP rs887953 was also linked to PMF1 and showed significant associations with stroke in the SMR analyses, suggesting it may have a direct impact on gene expression related to stroke risk.
title: Integration of Mendelian randomisation and systems biology models to identify novel blood-based biomarkers for stroke

finding: The SNP rs2476601 was associated with all three thyroid phenotypes—hyperthyroidism, hypothyroidism, and TSH levels—indicating its significant role in thyroid function.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: Lead variant rs7520586 was one of the novel hypothyroidism loci associated with genes influencing thyroid function in mice.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: The SNP rs11591147, corresponding to the R46L variant in PCSK9, was identified as having a significant interaction with age regarding ApoB levels, with a p-value of 3.9e-09. This interaction remained significant across genders.
title: Large-scale genome-wide interaction analyses on multiple cardiometabolic risk factors to identify age-specific genetic risk factors

finding: The missense variant in SLC2A9 (rs1689079; p.V253I) was confirmed to be associated with decreased mean levels of serum uric acid (3.7 ± 0.27 mg/dL compared to 4.6 ± 0.20 mg/dL; p=0.02), reproducing previous findings of an effect size of 0.44 ± 0.06 mg/dL per variant allele in the Old Order Amish.
title: Pharmacogenetics of SGLT2 Inhibitors: Validation of a sex-agnostic pharmacodynamic biomarker

finding: This SNP was associated with RhD negative haplotype Rh dce, showing a significant association to blood donorship (beta = 0.16, p = 8.88 x 10^-89). It was also previously linked to height.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals the unique genetic structure of active blood donors

finding: The CFH Y402H variant rs1061170 exhibited a modest effect in the AA population with an OR of 1.13, although this was lower compared to European ancestry populations.
title: Distinctive cross-ancestry genetic architecture for age-related macular degeneration

finding: The SNP rs2724360, located at CD46/CD55, demonstrated a significant splice QTL and was linked to expression changes relevant for AMD risk.
title: Distinctive cross-ancestry genetic architecture for age-related macular degeneration

finding: Heterozygotes for NOS1AP rs12143842 had a reduced incidence of myocardial infarction/angina (p=0.03) suggesting better treatment response.
title: Calcium Channel Blockers: clinical outcome associations with reported pharmacogenetics variants in 32,000 patients

finding: NPPA rs5063 TT homozygotes had a specific increased incidence of edema after treatment (HR 4.40, p=0.04).
title: Calcium Channel Blockers: clinical outcome associations with reported pharmacogenetics variants in 32,000 patients

finding: NOS1AP rs10494366 heterozygotes had a reduced chance of chronic kidney disease compared to common homozygotes.
title: Calcium Channel Blockers: clinical outcome associations with reported pharmacogenetics variants in 32,000 patients

finding: This sentinel SNP on chromosome 1 was noted to potentially have deleterious effects (CADD scores > 12.37) and was indicated to be an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL), suggesting it may influence gene expression linked to RAG.
title: Genomic Determinants of Biological Age Estimated By Deep Learning Applied to Retinal Images

finding: This variant extended its association to opioid addiction, showing a relationship with a significance of p = 0.009.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study of opioid addiction: OPRM1 and Beyond

finding: The SNP <italic>rs2479413</italic> was associated with low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol, displaying five independent associations with different loci, highlighting its significant role in blood biomarkers across ancestries.
title: Inter-population differences of allele frequency and regulome tagging are associated with the heterogeneity of loci identified by cross-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs12061443 was associated with the diagnosis of Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma through a biomarker panel study, which reported a high specificity of 100% when using Leucine as a biomarker for early pancreatic cancer detection.
title: Nano Sensing for Early Diagnosis of Pancreatic Cancer

finding: The SNP rs12041002 was linked to the discovery of pancreatic adenocarcinoma biomarkers via untargeted metabolomics, contributing to the identification of novel indicators for early cancer diagnosis.
title: Nano Sensing for Early Diagnosis of Pancreatic Cancer

finding: The SNP rs12124523, an intronic variant in NEGR1, showed significant SNP heterogeneity among different phenotyping definitions of major depression. The common factor association P was highly significant at 8.4 × 10^-14, and the Q heterogeneity P value was 2.9 × 10^-10 with an I² statistic of 0.71. This SNP had a stronger association in studies based on self-reported depression, yielding an odds ratio of 1.081 (CI 1.065–1.098), compared to an odds ratio of 1.008 (CI 0.999–1.018) in other cohorts. This finding supports the idea that phenotype definitions can influence genetic association results in major depression.
title: Genome-wide study of half a million individuals with major depression identifies 697 independent associations, infers causal neuronal subtypes and biological targets for novel pharmacotherapies

finding: The study confirmed that the rare rs684923 SNP was heterozygous in the RYR2-hiPSC-CMs, while control cells were homozygous for this SNP. Expression of both alleles in RYR2-hiPSC-CMs was observed, indicating that the transcript evaded nonsense-mediated decay. Furthermore, total RYR2 expression was significantly reduced in RYR2-hiPSC-CMs compared to controls, suggesting that the presence of the p.(Arg4790Ter) variant is associated with calcium handling abnormalities.
title: Characterisation of the mechanism by which a nonsense variant in RYR2 results in ventricular arrhythmia

finding: The STX6 SNP rs1411478 was found to be associated with PSP, presenting an odds ratio of 0.84 and a p-value of 0.03, corroborating earlier reports regarding its impact on PSP.
title: A Novel Susceptibility Locus in NFASC Highlights Oligodendrocytes and Myelination in Progressive Supranuclear Palsy Pathology

finding: The DUSP10 SNP rs6687758 presented an odds ratio of 0.80 and statistically significant p-value of 0.02, indicating its protective effect against PSP.
title: A Novel Susceptibility Locus in NFASC Highlights Oligodendrocytes and Myelination in Progressive Supranuclear Palsy Pathology

finding: The novel SNP rs12744678 in the NFASC locus showed a genome-wide significant association with PSP, with an odds ratio of 0.83 and a p-value of 4.15·10^-08, indicating its potential role in PSP biology.
title: A Novel Susceptibility Locus in NFASC Highlights Oligodendrocytes and Myelination in Progressive Supranuclear Palsy Pathology

finding: The SNP rs4951151 was identified as an eQTL for CNTN2 and linked to intrathecal protein levels, indicating its relevance in PSP pathophysiology.
title: A Novel Susceptibility Locus in NFASC Highlights Oligodendrocytes and Myelination in Progressive Supranuclear Palsy Pathology

finding: The SNP (HSPB7) displayed significant effects in the MVP African American cohort after Bonferroni correction, supporting its association with heart failure.
title: Genetic Architecture of Heart Failure with Preserved versus Reduced Ejection Fraction

finding: The SNP rs72730526 was found to be statistically significant in the context of suicide attempts with a p-value of 3.69×10⁻⁸, demonstrating its association within the context of the largest study involving military veterans.
title: Genome-wide association study meta-analysis of suicide attempt in 43,871 cases identifies twelve genome-wide significant loci

finding: Associated with hypothalamus volume (β = 0.04) and prior associations with menopause timing highlighted its influence on female reproductive health.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: Linked to hypothalamic grey matter volume (β = 0.05), it has prior associations with menopause, reinforcing its role in reproductive hormone regulation.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: This SNP was associated with an eQTL in oesophagus mucosa, indicating its broader biological significance beyond neuroendocrine structures.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: Colocalizing with eQTLs in brain regions, it emphasized the genetic underpinnings linking neuroendocrine anatomy with broader neurodevelopmental processes.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: The variant rs3820282 was identified as a lead endometrial cancer risk variant at the novel 1p36.12 locus. It was significantly associated with endometrial cancer risk and replicated in an independent cohort. This SNP was also linked to various traits such as endometriosis and pelvic organ prolapse, demonstrating its relevance in gynecological conditions.
title: Genetic analyses of gynecological disease identify genetic relationships between uterine fibroids and endometrial cancer, and a novel endometrial cancer genetic risk region at the WNT4 1p36.12 locus

finding: The SNP rs61768001 was noted as a candidate causal risk variant associated with expression of the gene CDC42 in blood. Its involvement in the endometrial cancer risk locus at 1p36.12 indicated a genetic link to endometrial cancer.
title: Genetic analyses of gynecological disease identify genetic relationships between uterine fibroids and endometrial cancer, and a novel endometrial cancer genetic risk region at the WNT4 1p36.12 locus

finding: rs12037376 was classified as a candidate causal variant at the 1p36.12 endometrial cancer risk locus, with associations to the expression of the long non-coding RNA LINC00339 in blood and endometrial tissues, reinforcing its potential role in endometrial cancer.
title: Genetic analyses of gynecological disease identify genetic relationships between uterine fibroids and endometrial cancer, and a novel endometrial cancer genetic risk region at the WNT4 1p36.12 locus

finding: The SNP rs6655975 at the ADAMTSL4-AS1 locus was newly identified in this study as associated with increased coffee consumption.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: This variant was grouped into a cluster associated with hypertension (HTN) traits, exhibiting an average effect size of -2.05, indicating it may have a risk association.
title: CLUSTERING OF RARE VARIANTS FOR CAUSAL VARIANTS IDENTIFICATION AND EFFECT DIRECTION CLASSIFICATION

finding: rs61757359 was also found in the cluster with an average effect size of -2.05, suggesting a potential risk association with hypertension (HTN).
title: CLUSTERING OF RARE VARIANTS FOR CAUSAL VARIANTS IDENTIFICATION AND EFFECT DIRECTION CLASSIFICATION

finding: Similar to the previous SNPs, rs61758562 was included in the same cluster with an average effect size of -2.05, reinforcing its possible risk association regarding hypertension (HTN).
title: CLUSTERING OF RARE VARIANTS FOR CAUSAL VARIANTS IDENTIFICATION AND EFFECT DIRECTION CLASSIFICATION

finding: This variant was noted for having the smallest p-value in single variant analysis regarding hypertension (HTN), at 1.46E-5, and formed a distinct cluster with a substantial effect size of 4.33, indicating it may act as a protective variant.
title: CLUSTERING OF RARE VARIANTS FOR CAUSAL VARIANTS IDENTIFICATION AND EFFECT DIRECTION CLASSIFICATION

finding: The SNP rs6697359 was associated with RBS-R compulsive with p = 4.8 × 10^-7 and is located within 50 kb of SEC16B, which has been implicated in autism as a somatic mosaic mutation.
title: Clinical autism subscales have common genetic liability that is heritable, pleiotropic, and generalizable to the general population

finding: The minor G-allele of SNP rs1051047 exerted a protective role on primary Sjögren’s syndrome (SS) susceptibility by increasing DNA methylation levels at the upstream region of the IFI44 gene. This finding suggested a link between this SNP and reduced risk of developing SS.
title: An integrative multi-omics approach in Sjögren’s Syndrome identifies novel genetic drivers with regulatory function and disease-specificity

finding: The minor G-allele of SNP rs76397273 exerted a protective effect on SS by decreasing GBP5 gene expression, suggesting that higher GBP5 levels might have detrimental effects in SS pathology.
title: An integrative multi-omics approach in Sjögren’s Syndrome identifies novel genetic drivers with regulatory function and disease-specificity

finding: The lead SNP rs6661808 at the TACSTD2 locus was linked to both endometriosis and IBS, indicating a role in disease risk through its involvement in gene expression.
title: Evidence of shared genetic factors in the aetiology of gastrointestinal disorders and endometriosis and clinical implications for disease management

finding: A novel protective recessive association was identified between rs61746559, a missense variant in SGLT4, and hypertension with an odds ratio of 0.2, p-value of 3×10⁻⁸, and a dominance deviation p-value of 7×10⁻⁶. This suggests a role for SGLT4 in the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system.
title: Widespread recessive effects on common diseases in a cohort of 44,000 British Pakistanis and Bangladeshis with high autozygosity

finding: A recessive association between rs1801133, a missense variant in MTHFR, and folate deficiency was reported with an odds ratio of 2.1 and a p-value of 5×10⁻⁹, indicating possible recessive effects on folate metabolism and neural tube defect risks.
title: Widespread recessive effects on common diseases in a cohort of 44,000 British Pakistanis and Bangladeshis with high autozygosity

finding: The variant rs6330 in the NGF gene had a PIP of 0.59 and was determined to be associated with migraine risk. It was observed to be a significant cis-eQTL for NGF-AS1, and was also linked to musculoskeletal diseases in FinnGen.
title: Fine-mapping a genome-wide meta-analysis of 98,374 migraine cases identifies 181 sets of candidate causal variants

finding: The variant rs10218452 was identified in the PHACTR1 gene and had a PENC of 1.29, indicating it is likely causal for migraine. The lead variant in this region had a PIP of 1.00.
title: Fine-mapping a genome-wide meta-analysis of 98,374 migraine cases identifies 181 sets of candidate causal variants

finding: This SNP was identified at the known SERPINC1 locus, which encodes for antithrombin. It's significant for its role in VTE, reinforcing the known pathways involved in coagulation.
title: Cross-Ancestry Investigation of Venous Thromboembolism Genomic Predictors

finding: The SNP rs11591147 contributed to disease burden through ischemic heart disease but specific DALY contributions were not extracted in detail; however, it was noted as one of the significant common variants affecting overall health outcomes.
title: Genetic risk factors have a substantial impact on healthy life years

finding: This SNP was associated with a subtype of congenital heart defect (bicuspid aortic valve) and impacted chromatin accessibility at an enhancer regulating PALMD in both valvular and endothelial cells, tying it to morphogenic processes critical for heart valve development.
title: Molecular convergence of risk variants for congenital heart defects leveraging a regulatory map of the human fetal heart

finding: The rs10888690 variant had a credible set covering multiple genes, specifically FAF1 and DMRTA2, the former being involved in programmed cell death across various organ systems. This variant contributed to the identification of significant loci for sporadic miscarriage.
title: Trans-ancestral Genome Wide Association Study of Sporadic and Recurrent Miscarriage

finding: The rs66499095 is an indel located in TARS2, with high linkage disequilibrium (LD) with multiple eQTLs related to TARS2, MRPS21, and RPRD2. TARS2 is linked to combination oxidative phosphorylation deficiency and was part of the significant loci for sporadic miscarriage.
title: Trans-ancestral Genome Wide Association Study of Sporadic and Recurrent Miscarriage

finding: The <italic>CFH</italic> Y402H variant (rs1061170) was previously established to associate independently with age-related macular degeneration (AMD) risk. It was adjusted for in the analyses, thus emphasizing its significance in AMD pathogenesis.
title: Rare predicted loss-of-function and damaging missense variants in CFHR5 associate with protection from age-related macular degeneration

finding: The SNP rs6677604 served as a proxy for the deletion <italic>ΔCFHR3-CFHR1</italic>, which is closely linked to AMD, and was included as a covariate in the analytical models to control for its potential confounding effect on the results.
title: Rare predicted loss-of-function and damaging missense variants in CFHR5 associate with protection from age-related macular degeneration

finding: This SNP was mentioned as being in near perfect linkage disequilibrium with <italic>CFH</italic> Y402H and was not separately reported due to already being accounted for in association analyses with AMD.
title: Rare predicted loss-of-function and damaging missense variants in CFHR5 associate with protection from age-related macular degeneration

finding: The C allele of rs10926981 was associated with reduced risk of thyrotoxicosis and thyroid cancer, as well as improved kidney function metrics.
title: Genome-wide association study of thyroid-stimulating hormone highlights new genes, pathways and associations with thyroid disease susceptibility and age-of-onset

finding: The SNP rs1801265, which is a variant of the DPYD gene, was associated with dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase activity affecting the metabolism of 5-fluorouracil (5FU). This finding suggested implications for 5FU toxicity, making it a significant marker for predicting adverse effects in patients undergoing therapies involving 5FU.
title: Dynamic phospho-proteogenomic analysis of gastric cancer cells suggests host immunity provides survival benefit

finding: The SNP rs2297595, similarly a variant of the DPYD gene, also played a role in determining the dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase activity. Like rs1801265, it was relevant for understanding patient responses to 5FU, particularly regarding toxicity and the potential need for adjustments in chemotherapy dosing.
title: Dynamic phospho-proteogenomic analysis of gastric cancer cells suggests host immunity provides survival benefit

finding: The SNP rs12030683 was associated with enhanced functionality of antigen-specific CD8+ T cells when combined blockade of PD-L1 and TIM-3 was applied. This finding related to increased T cell expansion and reduced T cell dysfunction, relevant to the treatment of solid tumors as evidenced in the study by Chrusciel et al. (2020).
title: Combined PD-L1 and TIM-3 blockade improves the expansion of fit human CD8+ antigen-specific T cells for adoptive immunotherapy

finding: For SNP rs12030738, there was an original finding indicating its role in the response to immune checkpoint inhibitors based on NCCN guidelines. This SNP was linked to efficacy in T cell therapies and the review provided by Vaddepally et al. (2020) highlighted its importance in the overall therapeutic landscape involving immune checkpoints.
title: Combined PD-L1 and TIM-3 blockade improves the expansion of fit human CD8+ antigen-specific T cells for adoptive immunotherapy

finding: The variant rs760077 was found to be genome-wide significant for gastric cancer when analyzed using the TAPE and TAPE-LTFH methods in a study on Korean samples. This variant had been previously reported to be associated with gastric cancer in Chinese and Japanese populations, indicating its relevance in gastric cancer genetics.
title: Incorporating family disease history and controlling case-control imbalance for population based genetic association studies

finding: This SNP was associated with Parkinson's disease in MAPT H2 carriers near VANGL1, with an OR of 1.69 (95% CI = 1.40-2.03, p = 2.72E-08). It suggested an increased risk for those carrying the H2 haplotype.
title: Genome-wide association study stratified by MAPT haplotypes identifies potential novel loci in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs72700813 was linked to the modulation of GOLPH3Le eRNA expression, which was closely associated with neurological disorders.
title: Enhancer RNA transcriptome-wide association study reveals an atlas of pan-cancer susceptibility eRNAs

finding: The SNP rs6703982 was observed to downregulate the expression of NENFe eRNA and its target gene NENF, highlighting its role in the regulation of eRNA expression.
title: Enhancer RNA transcriptome-wide association study reveals an atlas of pan-cancer susceptibility eRNAs

finding: The locus associated with the variant rs1492258 showed significant linkage to seven autoencoder-derived embedded features, with a minimum p-value of 1.4 x 10^-15. Although LPHN2/ADGRL2, the gene associated with this SNP, is expressed in the retina, particularly in bipolar cells, it had not been previously linked to retinal phenotypes, thus revealing a novel genetic relationship.
title: Autoencoder-based phenotyping of ophthalmic images highlights genetic loci influencing retinal morphology and provides informative biomarkers

finding: This SNP was previously identified in genome-wide association studies (GWAS) of unipolar depression (EFO ID EFO_0003761). It was associated with specific major depressive symptoms, contributing to understanding various subtypes of major depression.
title: Genetic structure of major depression symptoms across clinical and community cohorts

finding: Identified in meta-analyses of major depressive disorder, this SNP was associated with individual symptoms of major depression, adding to the genetic understanding of the disorder.
title: Genetic structure of major depression symptoms across clinical and community cohorts

finding: The SNP rs2230288 was associated with pathologically confirmed DLB without Alzheimer's disease pathology, indicating its significance as a risk variant in DLB.
title: Lack of Epistatic Interaction of SNCA with APOE in Synucleinopathies

finding: This SNP was found to have robust evidence of transcription factor binding, indicating a potential role in AD pathogenesis; it showed significant associations particularly in non-cognitive measures.
title: Genome Wide Analysis Across Alzheimer’s Disease Endophenotypes: Main Effects and Stage Specific Interactions

finding: The SNP rs12071933 was identified in the context of studying mitochondrial DNA heteroplasmy associated with oral squamous cell carcinoma. It was described as an original finding that contributed to understanding the genetic variation in mitochondrial genomes, particularly emphasizing its role in cancer biology.
title: Single-cell mtDNA heteroplasmy in colorectal cancer

finding: The non-coding GBA1 rs3115534 risk variant was found to be associated with increased symptoms of REM sleep behavior disorder (RBD) in individuals of Nigerian origin, with a beta value of 0.3640 and a significant p-value of 4.093e-04. This association remained significant even after adjusting for Parkinson's disease (PD) status, suggesting this variant has similar consequences as coding variants at the same locus.
title: The non-coding GBA1 rs3115534 variant is associated with REM sleep behavior disorder in Nigerians

finding: The SNP rs597999 located in an intron of GPM6B on the X chromosome was characterized as an eQTL for the GPM6B gene, which is implicated in serotonin uptake and appears particularly relevant in brain tissue.
title: Genome-wide analysis of brain age identifies 25 associated loci and unveils relationships with mental and physical health

finding: The SNP rs10797576 was associated with increased skipping of exon 4 in the SIPA1L2 gene, functioning as a splicing quantitative trait locus (sQTL). This SNP displayed high linkage disequilibrium with other associated variants, and its role in influencing exon skipping highlighted a potential mechanism through which it affected Parkinson's disease risk loci.
title: Long-read RNA-seq atlas of novel microglia isoforms elucidates disease-associated genetic regulation of splicing

finding: SNP rs16857578 was linked to the regulation of a 5' splice site impacting exon 4 of SIPA1L2. It was found in very high linkage disequilibrium with the lead GWAS SNPs and was predicted by spliceAI and Pangolin models to weaken the 5' splice site, suggesting significant effects on splicing that could have implications for disease risk.
title: Long-read RNA-seq atlas of novel microglia isoforms elucidates disease-associated genetic regulation of splicing

finding: The SNP rs2476601 in the PTPN22 gene was associated with Graves' disease (GD) hyperthyroidism and its recurrence rate. This genetic variant was highlighted as a potential predictor of Graves’ disease outcomes.
title: Outcome of Graves’ Disease and Associated Genetic Predisposition: A Systematic Review of Literature

finding: The homozygous deep intronic variant c.4885+740A>T in the USH2A gene was identified in a proband with Usher syndrome. This variant was predicted to be splice-altering with a strong score of 0.7. It was absent from the GnomAD database, extremely rare in the TOPMed Bravo dataset, and present in 15 out of 19,896 alleles from the Mexico City Prospective Study (MCPS). This discovery contributed to a definitive diagnosis for the proband.
title: Resolving the diagnostic odyssey in inherited retinal dystrophies through long-read genome sequencing

finding: The CC genotype of rs7512462 was associated with greater lung function in cystic fibrosis (CF) individuals carrying minimal function variants (p=0.008), gating variants (p=0.033), and those homozygous for p.Phe508del (p=0.006). Additionally, a meta-analysis showed a significant association between rs7512462 and lung function across the UK Biobank and Spirometa Consortium data with a minimal p-value of 2.74×10-44. Furthermore, in an analysis of COPD case-control status, it provided a p-value of 0.0891, indicating a potential role in broader obstructive lung diseases.
title: Genetic evidence supports the development of SLC26A9 targeting therapies for the treatment of lung disease

finding: The SNP rs76763715, derived from the GBA gene, showed a strong positive association with cluster C1 and a strong negative association with C2, underscoring its significance in neurodegenerative disease risk assessment.
title: Genetic risk factor clustering within and across neurodegenerative diseases

finding: The variant TNNT2; NM_001001430.3: c.571-1G>A (rs483352835) was identified in two unrelated probands with cardiac phenotypes of Oceanian ancestry. This variant disrupted the canonical splice acceptor site, activating a cryptic acceptor, and resulted in an in-frame deletion (p.Gln191del). It was deemed rare in population databases, showing a frequency of 0.002% in gnomAD v4.0.0, while it had higher frequencies among South Asians and within Oceanian populations. Despite the initial concerns of pathogenicity, the analysis ultimately classified the variant as benign, indicating it did not serve as a monogenic cause of disease.
title: A rare splice-site variant in cardiac troponin-T (TNNT2): The need for ancestral diversity in genomic reference datasets

finding: The study reported that rs1432639 was part of a genetic cluster linked to light-intensity physical activity (LIPA), which was associated with a significantly lower risk of self-harm behavior (adjusted hazard ratio [HR], 0.26 [95% CI, 0.08 – 0.88]). Previous findings suggested that rs1432639 is related to obesity/BMI, indicating a potential connection between this SNP and depressive symptoms as they relate to physical activity.
title: Associations between physical activities and self-harm behavior in depression across the genotype: findings from the UK Biobank

finding: rs11209948 was identified in the genetic cluster related to the reduced risk of self-harm behavior associated with light-intensity physical activity (LIPA). This variant has been previously linked to body fat percentage, which connects to the study's focus on the interplay between physical activity, body composition, and depression outcomes.
title: Associations between physical activities and self-harm behavior in depression across the genotype: findings from the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs17849501, linked to the NCF2 gene, has been shown to act as an eQTL affecting several genes across multiple immune cell types. It demonstrated strong enhancer activity, directly correlating with increased expression of target genes, which are enriched in immune-related pathways.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS analysis pipeline defines functional variants and target genes for systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)

finding: The missense SNP rs78555129, which mutated a conserved arginine in adipolin, was predicted to disrupt protein structure, potentially affecting its anti-inflammatory function and interaction with unknown receptors.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS analysis pipeline defines functional variants and target genes for systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)

finding: The SNP rs762710288 was also identified as likely pathogenic in another biallelic SLC34A3-associated case of USD. Similar to rs199690076, this variant was implicated in hereditary hypophosphataemic rickets with hypercalciuria, underscoring its significance in the genetic landscape of USD.
title: Rare variants in SLC34A3 explain missing heritability of urinary stone disease

finding: The study reported that the A allele of rs7535263 was significantly more frequent in Dutch patients with CRB1-associated inherited retinal dystrophies (CRB1-IRDs) compared to healthy controls, with an odds ratio of 2.85. This SNP was also shown to influence plasma complement levels, correlating with increased levels of proteins related to the complement system, specifically CFHR2, indicating a linkage between this SNP and the dysregulation of immune responses in CRB1-IRD patients.
title: Elevated Plasma Complement Factors in CRB1-associated Inherited Retinal Dystrophies

finding: The SNP rs876793, located in the intronic region of the gene RYR2, was associated with generalized genetic epilepsies (GGE). The analysis showed that there were 14 protein-truncating ultrarare variants (URVs) observed in the GGE cohort, with a log odds ratio of 1.8 and a significance level of P = 8.6x10^-6. Mutations in RYR2 are well established in the etiology of arrhythmogenic disorders, and recent studies indicated that similar mutations could also cause GGE independently of arrhythmias. This emerged finding contributed to the hypothesis of RYR2 mutations being part of a neuro-cardiac calcium channelopathy that could lead to either cardiac arrhythmias or generalized genetic epilepsy, depending on where the mutant receptors are expressed.
title: Exome sequencing of 20,979 individuals with epilepsy reveals shared and distinct ultra-rare genetic risk across disorder subtypes

finding: The SNP rs263526 was associated with DFFA expression in the African ancestry group (AFR). Despite being nominally significant (P < 0.05), the local-eQTL showed an effect direction that was opposite to that of its counterpart in European ancestry (EUR). This difference highlighted the importance of considering ancestry-specific effects in gene expression and asthma risk.
title: Best practices for multi-ancestry, meta-analytic transcriptome-wide association studies: lessons from the Global Biobank Meta-analysis Initiative

finding: The SNP rs903916, linked to DFFA expression in the European ancestry group (EUR), similarly exhibited an opposite effect direction when compared to rs263526 in the AFR group. Like rs263526, it was only nominally significant (P < 0.05), which emphasized the need for cautious interpretation of cross-ancestry genetic associations.
title: Best practices for multi-ancestry, meta-analytic transcriptome-wide association studies: lessons from the Global Biobank Meta-analysis Initiative

finding: The SNP rs12023347, annotated to the RP4-598G3.1 gene, was identified as a shared locus across the analyses, implicating it in the genetic architecture of multiple psychiatric conditions.
title: Identification of Novel Genomic Loci for Anxiety and Extensive Genetic Overlap with Psychiatric Disorders

finding: The variant rs11118119 (A>G) located in LINC02869 was identified as a novel cis-pQTL for circulating TGF-β2 levels in patients with metastatic colorectal cancer (mCRC). The G allele was associated with higher TGF-β2 levels with a P-value less than 1.4e-14, confirmed in a cohort of castration-resistant prostate cancer patients with a P-value less than 3.3e-25. This finding related specifically to the protein levels of TGF-β2, a key regulator in cancer biology.
title: Common variation in a long non-coding RNA gene modulates variation of circulating TGF-β2 levels in metastatic colorectal cancer patients (Alliance)

finding: The SNP rs2292096 was identified as significantly associated with focal epilepsy (FE) in individuals of Asian ancestry. This was part of a broader investigation into genetic variants affecting epilepsy.
title: Systematic review of genome wide association studies (GWAS) of epilepsy identifies common risk variants and associated genes

finding: The study identified rs4971091 on chromosome 1 as a genome-wide significant locus associated with ectopic pregnancy, with a p-value of 5.32×10⁻⁹. It was highlighted as being in an exon of the KRTCAP2 non-coding transcript and closely located to the MUC1 gene, a candidate implicated in ectopic pregnancy due to its role in barrier function.
title: Genome-wide association study meta-analysis supports association between MUC1 and ectopic pregnancy

finding: This SNP was identified as an independent signal in the GBAP1 pseudogene region with a p-value of 1.38×10⁻⁸. It was shown to be in linkage disequilibrium with rs4072037, which was hypothesized to potentially influence MUC1 expression implicated in ectopic pregnancy.
title: Genome-wide association study meta-analysis supports association between MUC1 and ectopic pregnancy

finding: The splice acceptor variant rs4072037 in the 2nd exon of MUC1 was associated with ectopic pregnancy, showing a p-value of 1.87×10⁻⁷. The T-allele was noted for causing a significant deletion that may alter MUC1 function, impacting embryo implantation and correlating with the observed genetic background of ectopic pregnancy.
title: Genome-wide association study meta-analysis supports association between MUC1 and ectopic pregnancy

finding: The rs769009649 SNP in C1orf52 was significantly linked to mortality risk with a hazard ratio of 3.2 and p-value of 7.4 x 10^-7.
title: Genetic associations with human longevity are enriched for oncogenic genes

finding: The minor 358Ala allele of the IL6R SNP rs2228145 was associated with a reduced risk of developing type 1 diabetes, highlighting its relevance in the disease's genetic landscape.
title: Genetic evidence for efficacy of targeting IL-2, IL-6, and TYK2 signaling in prevention of type 1 diabetes: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: The variant rs2229238 near IL6R was associated with an increased risk of type 1 diabetes, demonstrating its association with the condition as identified in major GWAS studies.
title: Genetic evidence for efficacy of targeting IL-2, IL-6, and TYK2 signaling in prevention of type 1 diabetes: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: The rs10908839 SNP showed a significant association with increased risk of type 1 diabetes with a posterior probability of 96.5%, indicating it is a critical genetic variant linked to IL6R expression.
title: Genetic evidence for efficacy of targeting IL-2, IL-6, and TYK2 signaling in prevention of type 1 diabetes: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: The variant rs115982800 reached genome-wide significance with a p-value of 3.68×10−8 in the discovery GWAS meta-analysis and showed an association with an annual decline in forced vital capacity (FVC) of 140 ml/year per copy of the risk allele A (95% CI [−180, −100], p=9.14×10−12). This variant maintained consistent effects across all studies analyzed, including a nominally significant result in the CleanUP-IPF study (p=0.007). It was primarily located upstream of the Protein Kinase N2 gene in the introns of the antisense RNA PKN2-AS1, indicating its potential role in IPF disease progression.
title: Genome-wide analysis of longitudinal lung function and gas transfer in individuals with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis

finding: The SNP rs145213510 was specifically linked to chronic pain susceptibility in females, showing an odds ratio of 2.02 with a P-value of 3.7 × 10−8. This polymorphism was identified within the gene PER3, which is linked to circadian rhythms and has implications for chronic pain disorders, suggesting that variations in PER3 could influence pain susceptibility through mechanisms related to circadian cycles and sleep patterns.
title: GWAS of Extended Prescription Analgesic Use Identifies Novel Genetic Loci in Chronic Pain

finding: Located in the CHRNB2 gene on chromosome 1, this SNP exhibited a significant association with TUD, with a p-value of 7.61E-09, signifying its involvement in smoking behavior through the nicotinic acetylcholine receptor pathway.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorders based on electronic health record data prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: This SNP in KDM4A on chromosome 1 was found significant with a p-value of 1.47E-10, previously implicated in addiction-related traits and interactions with dopaminergic agents.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorders based on electronic health record data prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: Located in PDE4B on chromosome 1, with a p-value of 5.68E-10, this SNP was associated with dopaminergic pathways and related traits such as smoking initiation and addictive behaviors.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorders based on electronic health record data prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: This variant in ALDH4A1 was associated with levels of S-1-pyrroline-5-carboxylate, having implications in proline metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The AQP10 variant was associated with arabonate/xylonate, suggesting its role in transport mechanisms.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: This variant in DEGS1 was associated with palmitoyl dihydrosphingomyelin levels, relevant to sphingolipid metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The DPYD variant was linked to uracil, important for nucleotide metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: Found a significant association (p=9.70E-10) near PTPRF, associated with substance use and cognition.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans, with further support from studies of Cadm2 mutant mice

finding: The study identified the MTHFR 677C allele (rs1801133) as a low-penetrant risk factor for rectal cancer. This finding indicated that individuals with the 677CC genotype had an increased risk of developing rectal cancer, while the combined genotype of 677CT/1298AC provided a protective effect.
title: Methylenetetrahydrofolate reductase polymorphic variants in rectal cancer: significance for cancer risk and response to chemoradiotherapy

finding: The MTHFR 1298A allele (rs1801131) was also associated with increased risk for rectal cancer but was identified together with the 677C allele in the context of a low-penetrant risk factor. Similar to the 677C allele, certain genotype combinations (specifically 677CC/1298AA) were associated with heightened risk.
title: Methylenetetrahydrofolate reductase polymorphic variants in rectal cancer: significance for cancer risk and response to chemoradiotherapy

finding: This SNP was associated with the GBA gene, which is well-known in the context of PD, and it exhibited eQTL effects that were documented in the study.
title: Machine learning identifies six genetic variants and alterations in the Heart Atrial Appendage as key contributors to PD risk predictivity

finding: Linked to the GBA gene through strong linkage disequilibrium, rs12726330 was noted as part of the genetic risk profile associated with PD.
title: Machine learning identifies six genetic variants and alterations in the Heart Atrial Appendage as key contributors to PD risk predictivity

finding: This missense variant within the GBA gene was previously associated with PD and contributed to its risk profile, being linked to other SNPs in its network.
title: Machine learning identifies six genetic variants and alterations in the Heart Atrial Appendage as key contributors to PD risk predictivity

finding: The SNP rs2296172 was found to be associated with susceptibility to Type 2 Diabetes (T2D) in the Mizo population from Northeast India, highlighting its significance as a genetic risk factor for this complex disease.
title: Polygenic Risk Score Comparative Analyses Reveals Risk Disparity of Genetic Predisposition to Chronic Kidney Disease- A Multi Ancestry Approach

finding: The SNP rs17367504 exhibited consistent effects across the cohort for preeclampsia, confirming its role as a previously identified risk variant near the MTHFR gene.
title: Genetic Polymorphisms Associated with Adverse Pregnancy Outcomes in Nulliparas

finding: The variant rs56319427, associated with CDC42, revealed a substantial association with endometriosis, evidenced by a P-value of 4.91E-11, and was in high linkage disequilibrium with a known CDC42 locus.
title: Expanding the genetic landscape of endometriosis: Integrative -omics analyses uncover key pathways from a multi-ancestry study of over 900,000 women

finding: The SNP rs2814778 was identified as the most replicated genetic variant affecting neutrophil count in people of African ancestry, with the CC genotype associated with decreased neutrophil count. This SNP was notably located upstream of the ACKR1 gene, influencing its expression and thus impacting immune response.
title: Investigating a causal role for neutrophil count on P. falciparum severe malaria: a Mendelian Randomization study

finding: Identified as an index SNP influencing neutrophil count, this variant displayed a similarly impactful effect size in influenced studies, emphasizing its role in splicing regulation associated with neutrophil dynamics.
title: Investigating a causal role for neutrophil count on P. falciparum severe malaria: a Mendelian Randomization study

finding: This SNP was noted for its association with decreased granulocyte count, further linking it to neutrophil counts in individuals of African ancestry.
title: Investigating a causal role for neutrophil count on P. falciparum severe malaria: a Mendelian Randomization study

finding: The SNP rs3747957 in the STX6 locus showed strong evidence of genetic upregulation of STX6 being significantly associated with increased risk of sporadic Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease (sCJD) in multiple datasets, particularly in oligodendrocytes.
title: Multiomic Analyses Direct Hypotheses for Creutzfeldt-Jakob Disease Risk Genes

finding: The A-allele of rs324420 was associated with lower well-being scores across two measurement periods, indicating a significant dose-dependent relationship, where each additional A-allele led to a decrease in well-being scores. Specifically, in PART Wave I, each A-allele was associated with a decrease of 0.54 units in well-being scores, and the association remained significant after adjustments for age and sex. In the subsequent PART Wave II, the findings were replicated, showing similar patterns. The study also revealed that individuals homozygous for the A-allele experienced significantly lower well-being compared to those homozygous for the C-allele.
title: Functional Variation in the FAAH Gene is Directly Associated with Subjective Well-being and Indirectly Associated with Problematic Alcohol Use

finding: The SNP rs598253 near ANGPTL3 was associated with VLDL and LDL-C levels, revealing its significance in lipid reduction therapies.
title: Lipo-proteomic and metabolic fine-mapping of genetic lipid risk loci

finding: The SNP rs11591147 near PCSK9 was linked to LDLR degradation, confirming its impact on LDL metabolism.
title: Lipo-proteomic and metabolic fine-mapping of genetic lipid risk loci

finding: As the most strongly associated lead variant with TSH, rs10799824's connection to thyroid-stimulating hormone levels was confirmed, aligning with previous GWAS findings in different populations.
title: Genome-wide association studies in a large Korean cohort identify novel quantitative trait loci for 36 traits and illuminates their genetic architectures

finding: The SNP rs7549881 at 1p31.3 was significantly associated with Parkinson's disease (PD) in females, where 26% of female subjects homozygous for the GG allele had PD compared to 22.2% who did not have PD (p = 0.004). Additionally, logistic regression indicated that the GG genotype of rs7549881 was associated with an increased risk of PD when compared to the AA genotype (OR 1.208, p = 0.015). PheWAS further revealed significant associations of rs7549881 with various digestive disorders, emphasizing a potential gut-brain axis in PD.
title: SNP rs7549881, near SGIP1 at 1p31.3, is significantly associated with digestive disorders and Parkinsonism in women

finding: The variant rs3115534 was identified as an African ancestry specific risk factor for Parkinson's disease (PD), with an estimated frequency of approximately 50% among West African PD cases. This variant conferred a risk with an odds ratio of 1.58 per allele, as well as an association with an earlier age of onset by about 2 years per allele. It also acted as both an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) and protein quantitative trait locus (pQTL) for the gene GBA1, demonstrating significant downstream effects on GBA1 transcript splicing and glucocerebrosidase activity.
title: African ancestry neurodegeneration risk variant disrupts an intronic branchpoint in GBA1

finding: The lead SNP at this locus, rs560804, showed a significant association (p-value=9.30x10^-9) intronic to NAV1. It colocalized with NAV1 expression in heart tissues and has been linked to cardiovascular traits as well as potential roles in aortic valve stenosis, making it a notable candidate in relation to AAC.
title: Calcification of abdominal aorta is a high risk underappreciated cardiovascular disease factor in a general population

finding: This SNP was one of the first lead variants at the IL6R locus, independently associated with RA, and contributed to the understanding of the genetic risk mechanisms affecting RA via expression regulation.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide association study identifies novel genetic mechanisms in rheumatoid arthritis

finding: As the second lead variant at the IL6R locus, rs4341355 was shown to independently influence RA risk and was linked to splicing quantitative trait loci (sQTL) impacting IL6R expression.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide association study identifies novel genetic mechanisms in rheumatoid arthritis

finding: This SNP was identified as the second lead variant at the PADI2 locus, contributing to novel insights into the genetics of RA via independent associations at this locus.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide association study identifies novel genetic mechanisms in rheumatoid arthritis

finding: Identified as a missense variant of the PTPN22 gene, this SNP represented one of the EUR-specific signals, highlighting its possible significant effect on RA risk within European populations.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide association study identifies novel genetic mechanisms in rheumatoid arthritis

finding: The SNP rs12123730 was identified as a significant marker associated with ovarian cancer risk, particularly in relation to the biomarker CA-125, which is crucial for diagnosing and monitoring this type of cancer. The context of this finding was outlined in the comprehensive review of CA-125 as a relevant biomarker for ovarian cancer, particularly discussing its correlation with genetic predispositions in the study by Charkhchi et al. (2020).
title: A Wearable In-pad Diagnostic for the Detection of Disease Biomarkers in Menstruation Blood

finding: The SNP rs661849 was linked to allele associated interactions with the genes TRAF3IP3 and IRF6 in CD4+ T cells. It was identified as an eQTL for those genes, showing evidence of its role in immune-related functions.
title: Functional genomics in primary T cells and monocytes identifies mechanisms by which genetic susceptibility loci influence systemic sclerosis risk

finding: The SNP rs2056626 demonstrated significant interactions with the CD247 gene promoter specifically in CD4+ T cells, correlating with increased CD247 expression levels and acting as an eQTL for CD247.
title: Functional genomics in primary T cells and monocytes identifies mechanisms by which genetic susceptibility loci influence systemic sclerosis risk

finding: The partial loss of function allele rs2228145:C was found to have a 39% allele frequency in Europeans and was associated with several clinical outcomes. It contributed to a 7% lower CRP (C-reactive protein) levels, reduced surface IL-6 receptor levels by 50%, increased IL-6 receptor shedding by 50%, and raised serum levels of soluble IL-6R by 34%. Moreover, this allele reduced the risk of rheumatoid arthritis and coronary artery disease by 7% and 5% respectively, while it increased the risk of asthma and atopic dermatitis by 9% and 15%. Analyses indicated that the allele also correlated with reduced odds of hospitalization due to COVID-19, with a per-allele odds ratio of 0.96 (95% CI, 0.93 to 0.99; P=0.007) among hospitalized patients compared to population-level controls.
title: A Randomized Placebo-Controlled Trial of Sarilumab in Hospitalized Patients with Covid-19

finding: The SNP rs12071817 was noted as a positive original finding associated with adult diffuse gliomas. This association contributed to understanding genetic and molecular features beyond IDH-mutation, thus implicating its relevance in the classification and prognosis of high-grade astrocytomas.
title: Vascular differences between glioblastoma IDH-wildtype and astrocytoma IDH-mutant grade 4 at imaging and transcriptomic level

finding: The SNPrs684559 variant in the CHI3L2 gene was part of two clinically-relevant polymorphisms identified through a genome-wide screen. This variant was associated with an over 2-fold increase in the risk for tumour-related death, supported by retrospective studies from Europe and the U.S., with a similar hazard ratio of 0.38 and a p-value of 1x10^-8.
title: Prospective validation of a predictive non-invasive SNP-based biomarker signature in resectable pancreatic cancer: a study protocol

finding: The IL6R missense variant (p.Asp358Ala, rs2228145) was found to be significantly protective against chronic liver disease among individuals with clonal hematopoiesis of indeterminate potential (CHIP), with an odds ratio of 0.32 (CI 0.11, 0.95, p=0.04). In contrast, this variant did not show a significant association with chronic liver disease risk in individuals without CHIP, having an odds ratio of 1.17 (CI 0.91, 1.50, p=0.21). These findings indicated a protective role of Asp358Ala related to IL6 signaling in the context of CHIP and its association with chronic liver disease.
title: Clonal hematopoiesis and risk of chronic liver disease

finding: The rs6679677 SNP was associated with the homeodomain interacting kinase (HIPK1) locus, which showed decreased expression in CD4+ T cells of patients with active juvenile idiopathic arthritis (JIA) compared to healthy controls. HIPK1 was suggested to have a pathogenic role in JIA, as its reduced activity influenced the expression of pro-inflammatory genes regulated via the transcription factors GATA4 and TP53.
title: Using Genetics, Genomics, and Transcriptomics to Identify Therapeutic Targets in Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis

finding: The SNP rs2228145 (Asp358Ala) was associated with a reduced risk for cardiovascular disease (CVD) and peripheral arterial disease, while increasing the risk for rheumatoid arthritis (RA). This variant led to reduced expression of the interleukin-6 receptor (IL6R), corresponding to lower inflammation markers such as high sensitivity C-reactive protein (hsCRP) and higher hemoglobin levels, reflecting a similar phenotypic profile to those receiving IL6R-targeted drug therapy, such as tocilizumab. Additionally, differential associations were noted in populations of African vs European ancestry, revealing a lower risk of type 2 diabetes in African individuals carrying the variant.
title: Differential Associations of Interleukin 6 Receptor Variant Across Genetic Ancestries and Implications for Targeted Therapies

finding: The SNP rs6696218 was associated with a high odds ratio of 21.45 for atopic dermatitis (AD). It was located within the LYST gene and had previously been linked to markedly elevated IgE and severe AD in a pediatric case report, indicating its significance in the pathology of the condition.
title: An Integrated Genomic and Transcriptomic Analysis Reveals Distinct Molecular Features Associated with Mild-to-moderate Atopic Dermatitis

finding: The missense variant rs4074536 (p.Thr66Ala) was identified as the lead SNP for LAEF on chromosome 1. The T allele of this SNP was associated with reduced LAEF and decreased expression of CASQ2 in cardiac tissues. This T allele was in complete linkage disequilibrium with the AF lead SNP rs4484922, where the rs4484922-G allele was found to increase the risk for AF, showcasing an inverse relationship between LAEF and AF risk.
title: Deep Learning of Left Atrial Structure and Function Provides Link to Atrial Fibrillation Risk

finding: SNP rs4484922 was identified as a lead SNP for AF risk in the study. It was found that the risk-increasing G allele of rs4484922 had an inverse relationship with LAEF, which was associated with the T allele of rs4074536, indicating a genetic link between the risk for AF and impaired LA contractile function.
title: Deep Learning of Left Atrial Structure and Function Provides Link to Atrial Fibrillation Risk

finding: The SNP rs12037376 in WNT4 was replicated with a nominal level P-value of 6.8×10−4 in association with gestational length. Functional analysis suggested WNT4 plays a crucial role in the decidualization process critical for embryo implantation.
title: Searching and visualizing genetic associations of pregnancy traits by using GnuMoM2b

finding: The SNP rs12404660 in WNT4 was shown to be significantly associated with cervical length (P-value of 1.0×10−15) and identified in the meta-analysis of cervical length as the most significant SNP with P-value 2.3×10−12. However, the associations for both rs12037376 and rs12404660 with gestational length were not significant at the genome-wide level.
title: Searching and visualizing genetic associations of pregnancy traits by using GnuMoM2b

finding: The SNP rs4655584 in the LEPR locus was associated with hs-CRP levels, with a highly significant P-value of 5.57e-27, indicating its role in immune and hepatic metabolic pathways.
title: The combined impact of persistent infections and human genetic variation on C-reactive protein levels

finding: The SNP rs4129267 in the IL6R locus demonstrated a strong association with hs-CRP levels (P-value = 4.23e-19), highlighting its involvement in the regulation of inflammation.
title: The combined impact of persistent infections and human genetic variation on C-reactive protein levels

finding: The SNP rs2794520 in the CRP locus was significantly associated with hs-CRP levels, evidenced by a P-value of 2.51e-32, underlining its relevance to chronic inflammation.
title: The combined impact of persistent infections and human genetic variation on C-reactive protein levels

finding: The SNP rs2794520, identified as a cis-protein quantitative trait locus located approximately 3kb downstream of the CRP gene, showed a strong association with circulating maternal CRP levels. This SNP explained up to 1.4% of the variance in CRP levels by itself. In the context of Mendelian Randomization analysis, the use of rs2794520 allowed for the estimation of the effect of genetically increased maternal CRP levels on gestational duration, where it was associated with a reduction of 2.75 days per unit increase in log-transformed CRP levels. Furthermore, this SNP also indicated a causal effect on birth weight, with a negative association shown as a decrease of 136.9g per unit increase in log-transformed maternal CRP levels.
title: Interrogating the causal effects of maternal circulating CRP on gestational duration and birth weight

finding: The SNP rs1558498928, which caused the pathogenic variant p.Arg299Ter in the KDM5B gene, was studied in detail. Although individuals carrying this SNP did not have a documented diagnosis of intellectual developmental disorder, they still displayed significantly lower cognitive function as measured by educational attainment (EDU) and verbal numerical reasoning (VNR) compared to non-carriers. This finding indicated that even heterozygous carriers of KDM5B PTVs showed impairments in cognitive performance.
title: The impact of rare protein coding genetic variation on adult cognitive function

finding: The SNP rs10798888 was identified as being associated with educational attainment (EDU) through a minor allele frequency of 0.1725 and an association p-value of 5.15x10^-14. This SNP was located in the region associated with the ADGRB2 gene's rare coding variant burden that demonstrated a strong link with cognitive function.
title: The impact of rare protein coding genetic variation on adult cognitive function

finding: The rs7542235 genotype GG was associated with a homozygous deletion at the CFHR1 locus on chromosome 1. This mismatch showed a significant association with acute rejection, where the adjusted hazard ratio (HR) was 2.97 (95% CI, 1.46–6.05; P=0.003) indicating a higher risk of acute rejection compared to no mismatch status.
title: Mismatches in gene deletions and kidney-related proteins are novel histocompatibility factors in kidney transplantation

finding: The rs750046020 variant in the MPL gene was found to be associated with thrombocytosis and had a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.009 in the Qatari population, highlighting its significance due to the founder effect.
title: Qatar Genome: Insights on Genomics from the Middle East

finding: The SNP rs486907 was associated with a sex-specific effect on melanoma skin cancer susceptibility, with a significant interaction noted between this polymorphism and miR-146a rs2910164, impacting disease risk particularly in one sex.
title: Systematic review reveals multiple sexually antagonistic polymorphisms affecting human disease and complex traits

finding: In analyses concerning rs12408798, it was associated with higher genetically-predicted expression of PLA2G5 and an elevated risk of coronary heart disease, as demonstrated by a p-value of 3.18x10^-6. This instrumental finding in aortic artery tissue was strongly significant (PPH4=0.99). However, it also raised questions regarding the efficacy of Varespladib methyl in reducing coronary events, which appeared inconclusive in clinical trials.
title: Transcriptome- and proteome-wide Mendelian randomization to prioritize therapeutic targets for coronary heart disease

finding: SNP rs2724384 is an intronic variant of <italic>CD46</italic> and is in linkage disequilibrium with other SNPs associated with Aβ42 levels. This suggested its potential role as an eQTL for CD46, implicating it in the amyloid cascade.
title: A multi-omics approach identifies a blood-based miRNA signature of cognitive decline in two large observational trials

finding: SNP rs4844390 is another intronic variant in <italic>CD46</italic>, affecting the binding of transcription factors involved in APP expression. This SNP is associated with decreased expression of CD46 and contributed to the effects observed on Aβ and BACE1 activity levels.
title: A multi-omics approach identifies a blood-based miRNA signature of cognitive decline in two large observational trials
