finding: The SNP rs7538463 was identified as part of a novel shared locus located on chromosome 1 between ADHD and ASD. It was associated with both disorders, providing insights into the overlapping genetic architecture of these neurodevelopmental conditions.
title: Identification of shared and differentiating genetic risk for autism spectrum disorder, attention deficit hyperactivity disorder and case subgroups

finding: The SNP rs3791033 was associated with increased risk for ASD and cognitive performance, while the ADHD risk allele was linked to decreased performance. This illustrated the contrasting effects this allele had on cognitive function across disorders.
title: Identification of shared and differentiating genetic risk for autism spectrum disorder, attention deficit hyperactivity disorder and case subgroups

finding: The SNP rs74752626 served as the lead SNP for the DFFB locus, which had a significant p-value of 5.14e-281. This locus was shown to be associated with cfDNA molecular signatures, contributing to the study's findings.
title: cfGWAS reveal genetic basis of cell-free DNA features

finding: The SNP rs35265408 was used in a replication study for the DFFB locus and exhibited a p-value of 7.07e-13. Although removed initially from the discovery study due to Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium filtration, it contributed to confirming the association of DFFB with cfDNA.
title: cfGWAS reveal genetic basis of cell-free DNA features

finding: The SNP rs1050316 was associated with a substantial decrease in risk for pain, with an odds ratio of 0.34. This SNP was located in the 3' UTR of MEF2D, previously linked to decreased expression of the gene. Mendelian randomization analysis suggested that the protective effect might be mediated through decreased platelet count and volume, pointing to a role for this locus in the immune function.
title: GWAS meta-analysis reveals dual neuronal and immunological etiology for pain susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs13294 was associated with decreased risk for pain, encoding a missense variant in ECM1 (Gly442Ser). The alternate allele showed an association with decreased blood protein levels, which may implicate immune cell functions. This finding supported previous connections of ECM genes to chronic pain via differential expression studies.
title: GWAS meta-analysis reveals dual neuronal and immunological etiology for pain susceptibility

finding: SNP rs5779595, identified in the female-specific GWAS, was associated with neck or shoulder pain near the LINC02770 gene on chromosome 1 (p = 3.57 x 10^-8). This locus was linked with sleep disorders and indicated a potential mechanism underlying pain susceptibility in females.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Neck or Shoulder Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: The SNP rs570516915 was identified as strongly associated with isolated cleft palate (CP) in the Finnish population, demonstrating genome-wide significance (P = 5.25 × 10−34, OR = 8.65). It disrupted a conserved binding site for the transcription factor IRF6 and reduced the enhancer activity of MCS-9.7, leading to decreased expression of IRF6, which is crucial for palatal development.
title: High incidence and geographic distribution of cleft palate cases in Finland are associated with a regulatory variant in IRF6

finding: The SNP rs2125232 showed a strong positive isoQTL effect on the isoform ENST00000492957 of AKT3 but indicated an insignificant association alongside the overall AKT3 expression, which was negatively correlated with SCZ outcomes despite the isoQTL signal being highly significant (P < 10⁻¹⁵).
title: Isoform-level transcriptome-wide association uncovers extensive novel genetic risk mechanisms for neuropsychiatric disorders in the human brain

finding: The SNP rs2790052 showed significant association with glaucoma and intraocular pressure (IOP) when analyzed in conjunction with the VNTR at the TMCO1 locus, contributing to the risk factors for these phenotypes.
title: Repeat polymorphisms in non-coding DNA underlie top genetic risk loci for glaucoma and colorectal cancer

finding: This SNP was linked to the longest VNTR allele length among carriers in the UK Biobank and associated with an increased glaucoma risk (OR=1.70) and elevated IOP (β=0.201). Its association was confirmed in independent cohorts.
title: Repeat polymorphisms in non-coding DNA underlie top genetic risk loci for glaucoma and colorectal cancer

finding: As a tag SNP for the common risk haplotype (AF=0.12), rs2790053 was involved in associations with VNTR alleles that showed a mixture of long alleles contributing to glaucoma.
title: Repeat polymorphisms in non-coding DNA underlie top genetic risk loci for glaucoma and colorectal cancer

finding: The SNP rs2235370 was identified as a sentinel variant associated with the risk of cleft lip/palate (CL/P) in a prior Genome-Wide Association Study (GWAS) cross-ancestry meta-analysis. The study found that the direct effects (DE) of TRAF3IP3 transcriptomic-PGS on CL/P risk became insignificant when removing 8 SNPs in linkage disequilibrium with rs2235370, suggesting its pivotal role in association strength. However, the genetic score based solely on those 8 SNPs remained highly significant, indicating a haplotype presence with possible protective effects on orofacial cleft (OFC) risk, likely through TRAF3IP3 gene expression.
title: Estimation of Direct and Indirect Polygenic Effects and Gene-Environment Interactions using Polygenic Scores in Case-Parent Trio Studies

finding: SNP rs74538320 displayed evidence of pleiotropy impacting both PPP risk and expression of FCGR3B, with a significant SMR analysis result (pSMR=5.3x10^-6). This indicated a biological relevance in the context of PPP.
title: A genome-wide meta-analysis of palmoplantar pustulosis implicates Th2 responses and cigarette smoking in disease pathogenesis

finding: The <italic>FCGR2A</italic><sup>rs1801274</sup> GG genotype was linked to predicting subsequent symptomatic events during follow-up and exhibited an excellent accuracy (AUC 0.796) in distinguishing patients, solidifying its role as a prognostic biomarker for symptom development in CCM patients.
title: Genetic Markers and Predictive Factors Influencing the Aggressive Behavior of Cerebral Cavernous Malformation

finding: The SNP NUCKS1 rs823118 was found to be significant in affecting gene expression in the context of brain regions involved in Parkinson's disease.
title: The multi-modality neuroimaging analysis identified an essential genetic variant associated with Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs3791033 was identified as an intronic variant of KDM4A and was found to be significantly associated with problematic opioid use (POU). It was associated with various traits including smoking phenotypes (p=1.01E-12), ADHD (p=2.76E-10), and educational attainment (p=1.01E-10), indicating that it plays a role in multiple behavioral and psychiatric conditions.
title: Genome-wide association study of problematic opioid prescription use in 132,113 23andMe research participants of European ancestry

finding: The SNP rs640561 was recognized as an intergenic variant near LRRIQ3 and was associated with POU. A phenome-wide scan suggested its nominal associations with ADHD and other neurological and metabolic traits, highlighting its potential role in diverse psychiatric and health-related behaviors.
title: Genome-wide association study of problematic opioid prescription use in 132,113 23andMe research participants of European ancestry

finding: The variant rs12037951 demonstrated a significant main effect on protein levels of ACP6, thereby establishing its role as a vQTL with direct implications for the protein's expression.
title: Systematic discovery of gene-environment interactions underlying the human plasma proteome in UK Biobank

finding: It was found that rs190188611 significantly influenced the causal inference of lymphocyte FSC-A parameters, emphasizing its role in the analysis of immune influences in psychiatric disorders.
title: Causal effect of the gut microbiota on the risk of psychiatric disorders and the mediating role of immunophenotypes

finding: The SNP rs12041621 significantly drove the causal inferences related to the effects of <italic>R. bromii</italic> on the level of CD33 on basophils, indicating its influence in the mediation analysis framework.
title: Causal effect of the gut microbiota on the risk of psychiatric disorders and the mediating role of immunophenotypes

finding: The rs2228145 SNP (C allele) was associated with reduced odds of developing tuberculosis (TB) disease, with a summary odds ratio (OR) of 0.94 (95% CI 0.91 - 0.97, p = 2.92 × 10^-5) based on meta-analysis across 16 studies. The meta-analysis also confirmed that reduced classical IL-6 signalling, as indicated by this SNP, was causally associated with a lower risk of TB disease.
title: Altered IL-6 signalling and risk of tuberculosis disease: a meta-analysis and Mendelian randomisation study

finding: At the NPPB-RNU5E-1 locus (lead SNP rs75014290), a known association with 5-methyltetrahydrofolate was confirmed.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The AGMAT locus (lead SNP rs6679229) identified a novel association with magnesium levels.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The SNP rs7542235, tagging for the homozygous deletion in the CFHR3-1 locus, was associated with a significantly higher rejection rate in kidney transplant patients, with 53% of those carrying the GG genotype experiencing rejection compared to 19% among AG/AA patients (p < 0.001). All patients with the GG genotype showed complete homozygous deletions of the CFHR1 gene, resulting in the absence of CFHR1 protein in serum samples, as confirmed by Western blot analysis. Further proteomics analyses indicated that the GG allele G was associated with altered expression levels of 23 proteins involved in various pathways, hinting at possible implications for alloimmune responses and transplantation outcomes.
title: Gene deletions in complement factor H related protein gene locus and kidney transplantation

finding: The SNP rs581342 at the LMNA locus was linked to neutropenia among individuals of African ancestry, with an OR of 1.29 (p=4.1 × 10^-13). This association was strong and significant only in the African ancestry group.
title: A Phenome-Wide Association Study of genes associated with COVID-19 severity reveals shared genetics with complex diseases in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The SNP rs1776354 was indicated as a cis-eQTL in Natural Killer Cells for TNFRSF9.
title: Mapping pQTLs of circulating inflammatory proteins identifies drivers of immune-related disease risk and novel therapeutic targets

finding: The SNP rs12075 functioned as a trans-pQTL associated with multiple chemokines and linked to inflammation mechanisms.
title: Mapping pQTLs of circulating inflammatory proteins identifies drivers of immune-related disease risk and novel therapeutic targets

finding: The rs74113753 variant in the C1orf194 locus was identified as an African-specific variant linked to POAG risk, in complete linkage disequilibrium with rs111739240. This variant was associated with significant but slightly weaker association signals within an African ancestry population.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The rs17641032 proxy variant for the African-specific missense variant rs74113753 was evaluated and associated with gene expression changes for several genes in muscle skeletal tissues, solidifying its role as a significant marker in African ancestry populations associated with POAG.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The rs74315329 MYOC variant was confirmed to be European-specific and associated only with European populations indicating its potential narrow ancestry effect concerning POAG.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The novel rs1469837390 variant was reported in this study and classified as a northern European-specific association linked to POAG.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The novel rs147660927 variant was similarly classified as a northern European-specific association related to POAG in the recent analyses.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The novel rs111739240 variant was shown to be in perfect LD with rs74113753 and was associated with significant risk for POAG, reinforcing the involvement of variants in this locus within African populations.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The rs993471 variant has been previously implicated in shared loci for both POAG and PACG, emphasizing a potential overlap in genetic risk factors across these glaucoma types.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The SNP rs10919543 was associated with red blood cell count and detected as a potentially invalid instrumental variable by MR-SPI in the relationship of TREM2 on Alzheimer's disease (AD). Since red blood cell count is a known risk factor for AD, this SNP might exhibit pleiotropy. After excluding rs10919543 from the analysis, MR-SPI indicated a negative association of TREM2 with the risk of AD, with a highly significant p-value of 1.20 × 10^-18.
title: Robust Mendelian Randomization Analysis by Automatically Selecting Valid Genetic Instruments for Inferring Causal Relationships between Complex Traits and Diseases

finding: Located in an intron of CHI3L1, this SNP showed a significant association with the non-AD inflammation component (PC4). Its T allele favored lower levels of non-AD inflammation but also increased injury/inflammation profiles, which elevated AD risk.
title: Multivariate GWAS of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarker profiles implies GRIN2D in synaptic functioning

finding: This SNP, located upstream of CHI3L1, was associated with the non-AD inflammation component (PC4). It contributed negatively to non-AD inflammation levels, showing similar characteristics as observed for rs7551263.
title: Multivariate GWAS of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarker profiles implies GRIN2D in synaptic functioning

finding: The SNP rs17367504-G was identified as a possible novel protective locus for preeclampsia. This finding was significant in the context of investigating genetic factors related to hypertensive disorders of pregnancy, particularly emphasizing the potential role of the MTHFR gene. The research suggested that this polymorphism could contribute to a lower risk of developing preeclampsia, providing insights into the genetic predisposition toward this condition.
title: Integrated Protein Network Analysis of Whole Exome Sequencing of Severe Preeclampsia

finding: The minor allele for rs1518111 was associated with decreased odds of late-onset neonatal sepsis, with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.74. It was located near the transcription start site of the IL10 gene.
title: Genetic study of late-onset neonatal sepsis reveals significant differences by sex

finding: The minor allele for rs1800871 also associated with decreased odds of late-onset neonatal sepsis, with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.69. Like rs1518111, it was found near the transcription start site of the IL10 gene.
title: Genetic study of late-onset neonatal sepsis reveals significant differences by sex

finding: The minor allele for rs55705316 was associated with increased odds of late-onset neonatal sepsis, yielding an odds ratio (OR) of 1.47. This SNP was located at the 3’ end of the IL10 gene.
title: Genetic study of late-onset neonatal sepsis reveals significant differences by sex

finding: The minor allele for rs3024505 was associated with increased odds of late-onset neonatal sepsis, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.60. It was also located at the 3’ end of the IL10 gene.
title: Genetic study of late-onset neonatal sepsis reveals significant differences by sex

finding: The minor allele for rs3024493 was linked to an increased odds of late-onset neonatal sepsis, presenting an odds ratio (OR) between 1.47 and 1.60. This SNP was situated near the 3’ end of the IL10 gene.
title: Genetic study of late-onset neonatal sepsis reveals significant differences by sex

finding: This missense variant caused a Val to Glu amino-acid substitution that led to antithrombin deficiency, increasing the risk of venous thromboembolism (VTE).
title: Antithrombin, protein C and protein S: Genome and transcriptome wide association studies identify 7 novel loci regulating plasma levels

finding: This intronic variant in GPX7 was notable for its strong eQTL status in aorta and association with ample aortic traits.
title: GENOME-WIDE ASSOCIATIONS OF AORTIC DISTENSIBILITY SUGGEST CAUSAL RELATIONSHIPS WITH AORTIC ANEURYSMS AND BRAIN WHITE MATTER HYPERINTENSITIES

finding: The ARID1A variant rs114165349-C demonstrated distinct metabolic associations, being particularly linked to intermediate-density lipoprotein (IDL) and low-density lipoprotein (LDL) particles, and exhibited negative effects on HDL particles and a strong negative association with CRP.
title: Exploring metabolic changes in gout – Insights from a genetic study

finding: The SNP rs4950119 was initially found not to show a significant association with educational attainment (EA), with an IVW estimate of β = -0.016 (p = 0.08). However, after the removal of this highly influential outlier variant, the relationship between SZspecific-PGS and EA became significant, with an updated IVW estimate of β = -0.021 (p = 0.01). This indicated a negative association that was corroborated by all sensitivity analyses conducted, except for the MR Egger test, which remained non-significant. This finding related to the genetic components specific to schizophrenia (SZspecific), showing the complex interplay between genetic predisposition to schizophrenia and its influence on educational outcomes.
title: Splitting Schizophrenia: Divergent Cognitive and Educational Outcomes Revealed by Genomic Structural Equation Modelling

finding: The Factor V Leiden mutation (FVL) associated with increased COVID-19 positive testing rates specifically in individuals with wild type F5 (OR 1.05; 95% CI [1.02-1.07]). However, this association did not hold in FVL carriers (OR 0.97, [0.91-1.94]).
title: Polygenic predisposition to venous thromboembolism is associated with increased COVID-19 positive testing rates

finding: The lead variant rs3766405 in the CFH locus demonstrated significant association in European, Asian, and other ancestries, with odds ratios between 1.76 and 2.67. However, it did not show a significant association in African ancestry, suggesting either a lack of effect or insufficient power in the studied African cohort.
title: Diverse ancestry GWAS for advanced age-related macular degeneration in TOPMed-imputed and Ophthalmologically-confirmed 16,108 cases and 18,038 controls

finding: The study reported a strong genetic association between rs2228145 and abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA) risk. An odds ratio (OR) of 0.91 was observed in the AAAgen consortium (from 39,221 cases and 1,086,107 controls) and an OR of 0.90 in the UK Biobank (2,215 cases and 365,428 controls), suggesting that additional copies of the C allele were protective against AAA. The results indicated that IL6 signaling inhibition was associated with lower AAA risk, specifically showing linear effects across minor allele distributions.
title: Human genetic evidence to inform clinical development of interleukin-6 signaling inhibition for abdominal aortic aneurysm

finding: In the congenital obstructive uropathy cohort, the missense variant rs777251055 within the NCF2 gene was detected in two individuals. It was noted as likely deleterious with an allele frequency of 6.57×10⁻⁶ in gnomAD, and was associated with kidney anomalies such as renal hypoplasia and cystic renal dysplasia.
title: Whole-genome sequencing reveals contribution of rare and common variation to structural kidney and urinary tract malformations

finding: This SNP was utilized in the analyses focusing on the genetic variants associated with pancreas fat levels. It was linked to a 2.46 odds ratio for PDAC risk per 1 standard deviation increase in pancreas fat levels, indicating a significant association.
title: Genetic Evidence Causally Linking Pancreas Fat to Pancreatic Cancer: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: Serving as a proxy for rs775103516, this SNP was part of the genetic variants contributing to the observed odds ratios for PDAC associated with pancreas fat levels.
title: Genetic Evidence Causally Linking Pancreas Fat to Pancreatic Cancer: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The SNP rs16835198 in the FNDC5 gene, associated with irisin, was positively correlated with exceptional longevity. This finding suggested that individuals possessing this variant might experience a slower aging process, contributing to better health outcomes in older age.
title: DNA methylation clock DNAmFitAge shows regular exercise is associated with slower aging and systemic adaptation

finding: The SNP rs726344 in the FNDC5 gene also demonstrated a positive association with exceptional longevity. This SNP indicated a potential role in longevity and aging, similarly reflecting enhancements in physiological and biological aging markers among individuals who carried this variant.
title: DNA methylation clock DNAmFitAge shows regular exercise is associated with slower aging and systemic adaptation

finding: This SNP was part of the 18 novel findings indicating shared genetic architecture of BMI with MS.
title: Investigating shared genetic architecture between obesity and multiple sclerosis

finding: The study found a significant association of rs2476601 (PTPN22) with ME/CFS patients potentially triggered by an acute infection. The allele-related odds ratio for this SNP was reported as 1.63 [95%CI = (1.04, 2.55)] when comparing healthy controls to ME/CFS patients with an infectious disease onset.
title: Impact of imperfect diagnosis in ME/CFS association studies

finding: The SNP rs211710 was associated with the odds of missingness of 3-decenoylcarnitine, identified as a metabolome Quantitative Trait Locus (mQTL) for decenoylcarnitine, indicating its role in acylcarnitine metabolism and energy production.
title: Genome-wide Association Studies of Missing Metabolite Measures: Results From Two Population-based Studies

finding: The SNP rs12030555 was linked to biomarkers related to carcinogenesis in the context of the Wnt signaling pathway, specifically discussed in the paper by Bai et al. (2020). This SNP showed relevance to epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT) in oral squamous cell carcinoma, highlighting its role in tumor biology and potential diagnostics.
title: Lymphoid Enhancer-Binding Factor 1 (LEF1) immunostaining as a surrogate of β-catenin (CTNNB1) mutations

finding: SNP rs12407731 within EIF4G3 was significantly associated with a p-value of 2.36×10^-8 in stage 3, adding to the understanding of genetic risk.

The Duffy/DARC null variant (rs2814778) showed a significant association with neutrophil and white blood cell (WBC) counts. In SCD patients, this variant had a weaker effect on neutrophil count, contributing only 0.9-3.3% of the variance compared to 18.4-23.1% in non-SCD participants. The mean reduction for WBC and neutrophil counts in SCD patients was statistically significant, indicating the variant's notable impact on hematological traits despite its reduced influence in the SCD context.
title: Variation and impact of polygenic hematological traits in monogenic sickle cell disease

finding: The SNP IFI44L IVS2+3T/A (rs1333973) was found to affect the splicing pattern of the IFI44L gene. It did not impact the overall expression level of the gene but exhibited opposing effects on various isoforms. The study indicated that the alternative allele (T) reduced the amount of longer fragments from the minigene assay, leading to splicing aberration that skipped exon 2.
title: Long-read sequencing reveals novel isoform-specific eQTLs and regulatory mechanisms of isoform expression

finding: The study replicated the well-known association of the ACKR1 Duffy-null allele with reduced neutrophil counts, reporting a very significant p-value of 1.06e-19 and a beta value of -0.87.
title: A Southern African Map of Blood Regulatory Variation Enables GWAS Interpretation

finding: The lead intergenic variant rs2099684 at locus 1q23.3 was genome-wide significant for COPD (P = 1.7 × 10^-11) and was found in strong LD (r^2 = 0.92) with different functional variants.
title: Meta-analysis fine-mapping is often miscalibrated at single-variant resolution

finding: This SNP was identified as a novel risk SNP associated with DENND1B, which may explain the reduced expression of DENND1B in Ulcerative Colitis (UC). It played a role in the genetic architecture contributing to the comorbidity between IBD and PBC.
title: Rare Comorbidity between Inflammatory Bowel Disease and Primary Biliary Cholangitis: Evidence from Causality, Shared Genetic Architecture and Transcriptomics

finding: It was significant in the CD-PBC cross-trait GWAS, indicating a genetic association relevant to the comorbidity of IBD and PBC.
title: Rare Comorbidity between Inflammatory Bowel Disease and Primary Biliary Cholangitis: Evidence from Causality, Shared Genetic Architecture and Transcriptomics

finding: This SNP was identified as significant in the UC-PBC analysis, supporting the genetic correlation between these two phenotypes.
title: Rare Comorbidity between Inflammatory Bowel Disease and Primary Biliary Cholangitis: Evidence from Causality, Shared Genetic Architecture and Transcriptomics

finding: This SNP was associated with DENND1B, which has been previously reported in relation to IBD, particularly Crohn's Disease (CD).
title: Rare Comorbidity between Inflammatory Bowel Disease and Primary Biliary Cholangitis: Evidence from Causality, Shared Genetic Architecture and Transcriptomics

finding: This SNP was noted to be associated with PBC and CD, linking it to the shared genetic architecture between these diseases.
title: Rare Comorbidity between Inflammatory Bowel Disease and Primary Biliary Cholangitis: Evidence from Causality, Shared Genetic Architecture and Transcriptomics

finding: The variant rs17047661 in the gene CR1 was associated with Focal Segmental Glomerulosclerosis (FSGS) and was replicated in Latin-American descent individuals. The rs17047661 variant impacts the R1601G allele, which was previously linked to protection against cerebral malaria, highlighting its potential role in adaptive immunity and revealing differences in allele frequencies across ancestries.
title: CR1 variants contribute to FSGS susceptibility across multiple populations

finding: This variant, leading to a missense mutation in <italic>PARP1</italic>, was shown to be protective against DNMT3A-CH, suggesting a crucial role of PARP inhibition in related CH.
title: Genome-wide analyses of 200,453 individuals yields new insights into the causes and consequences of clonal hematopoiesis

finding: The SNP rs140308485 was identified as one of the four <italic>cis</italic>-variants near <italic>APCS</italic> that were significantly associated with higher plasma serum amyloid P component (SAP) values. This association was tied to Alzheimer's disease (AD), Lewy body dementia, and plasma tau concentration.
title: Genetic evidence for serum amyloid P component as a drug target for treatment of neurodegenerative disorders

finding: Similar to rs140308485, SNP rs13374652 was found to be a <italic>cis</italic>-variant near <italic>APCS</italic>, significantly associated with elevated plasma SAP levels, indicating a connection to neurodegenerative diseases such as AD.
title: Genetic evidence for serum amyloid P component as a drug target for treatment of neurodegenerative disorders

finding: The SNP rs1341664 was highlighted as the <italic>APCS</italic> <italic>cis</italic>-variant with the strongest association with plasma SAP values. This finding linked it to neurodegeneration, particularly AD and Lewy body dementia.
title: Genetic evidence for serum amyloid P component as a drug target for treatment of neurodegenerative disorders

finding: The SNP rs78228389 was also classified as a <italic>cis</italic>-variant near <italic>APCS</italic>, showing a significant association with SAP levels, further supporting its relevance in neurodegenerative disorders.
title: Genetic evidence for serum amyloid P component as a drug target for treatment of neurodegenerative disorders

finding: The rs2228145 IL-6 receptor variant was associated with the abrogation of increased mortality risk in patients with chronic ischemic heart failure and clonal hematopoiesis. This variant, found in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs4129267 and rs4537545, reduced risk for fatal outcomes in the presence of CH driver mutations.
title: Interaction of inherited genetic variants in the NLRP3 inflammasome/IL-6 pathway with acquired clonal hematopoiesis to modulate mortality risk in patients with HFrEF

finding: The rs4129267 variant in the IL-6 receptor gene significantly reduced mortality risk in patients with chronic ischemic heart failure and clonal hematopoiesis. It was shown to be in strong linkage disequilibrium with the protective variant rs2228145.
title: Interaction of inherited genetic variants in the NLRP3 inflammasome/IL-6 pathway with acquired clonal hematopoiesis to modulate mortality risk in patients with HFrEF

finding: The rs4537545 variant located in the intron of the IL-6 receptor was associated with a protective effect against increased mortality in patients with chronic ischemic heart failure who also had clonal hematopoiesis. This variant predicted reduced circulating IL-6 and hs-CRP levels.
title: Interaction of inherited genetic variants in the NLRP3 inflammasome/IL-6 pathway with acquired clonal hematopoiesis to modulate mortality risk in patients with HFrEF

finding: The SNP rs10801555 at the CFH locus was highly significantly associated with drusen with a p-value of 6.0e-33, confirming its well-established link with AMD.
title: Genetic Distinctions Between Reticular Pseudodrusen and Drusen: Insights from a Genome-Wide Association Study

finding: This genetic variant, previously reported in associations with melanoma susceptibility, proved noteworthy in multiple cancer contexts.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The T allele of rs1967017 was associated with increased expression of the PDZK1 protein, which correlates with higher serum urate levels. This was evidenced by in vitro experiments that elucidated the mechanism through which the T allele increased PDZK1 expression, leading to elevated serum urate levels.
title: The individual and global impact of copy number variants on complex human traits

finding: The PDZK1 truncating variant rs191362962 was identified as being associated with decreased serum urate levels. This suggests that lower PDZK1 expression due to the truncating variant could be responsible for reduced serum urate levels.
title: The individual and global impact of copy number variants on complex human traits

finding: As a strong expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL), rs55794721 was shown to have a significant impact on the expression of both RHD and RSRP1 genes. Its presence was linked to notable changes in hematological traits such as reticulocyte count, platelet count, and glycated hemoglobin (HbA1c) levels, with the expression levels influenced by rs55794721 indicating a potential causal relationship.
title: The individual and global impact of copy number variants on complex human traits

finding: The SNP rs74315329, a stop-gain variant in <italic>MYOC</italic>, was associated with elevated intraocular pressure (IOP) with a significance level of <italic>P</italic> = 1.22 × 10<sup>−26</sup>. It was recognized as a well-known variant related to primary open-angle glaucoma (POAG).
title: Whole-exome sequencing study identifies novel rare variants and genes associated with intraocular pressure and glaucoma

finding: The SNP rs28991009 in <italic>ANGPTL7</italic>, which was previously identified in an array-based genome-wide association study (GWAS), showed a significant association with IOP in the exome-wide association study (ExWAS) using whole exome sequencing (WES) data.
title: Whole-exome sequencing study identifies novel rare variants and genes associated with intraocular pressure and glaucoma

finding: Associated with MUC1, this variant indicated a potential mediating effect on the development of critical illness in COVID-19.
title: Whole genome sequencing identifies multiple loci for critical illness caused by COVID-19

finding: The study by Si et al. (2020) reported that female carriers of the G allele for rs1061622, located in the tumor necrosis factor receptor 2 gene, showed increased TG/HDL-C levels, which was associated with suicidal ideation (SI). This finding provided a link between genetic predisposition, lipid metabolism, and the risk of developing SI, signaling the relevance of this SNP in the context of mental health.
title: Inflammation and nitro-oxidative stress in current suicidal attempts and current suicidal ideation: a systematic review and meta-analysis

finding: The SNP rs1166698 was identified as a missense variant in the NEXN gene, which is associated with cardiomyopathies (OMIM: 613121). It was included in the category of variants predicted to be deleterious.
title: Genetic analyses of the QT interval and its components in over 250K individuals identifies new loci and pathways affecting ventricular depolarization and repolarization

finding: The lead variant rs12042862 at the NOS1AP locus was associated with increased risk for sudden cardiac death (SCD), specifically showing a significant positive association in females with a reported log OR of 0.11 (95% CI: 0.036-0.190, P=0.004). This association was reaffirmed by previous reports.
title: Genetic analyses of the QT interval and its components in over 250K individuals identifies new loci and pathways affecting ventricular depolarization and repolarization

finding: The rs2476601-G variant in the PTPN22 gene was associated with an increased risk of NMSC with an OR of 1.14 (95% CI 1.06-1.21). This variant was considered a positive original finding as it replicated successfully in the validation cohort.
title: Inflammatory Bowel Disease Risk Variants Are Associated with an Increased Risk of Skin Cancer

finding: The rs17391694-C variant located in the GIPC2 gene was identified to decrease the risk of MSC (OR 0.92, 95% CI 0.86-0.997), which was reproduced across cohorts.
title: Inflammatory Bowel Disease Risk Variants Are Associated with an Increased Risk of Skin Cancer

finding: The SNP rs12079745 was associated with QTc duration, revealing that individuals carrying this variant showed a significant increase in QTc interval length compared to those without the variant. This finding contributed to the understanding of genetic factors underlying prolonged QT intervals.
title: Genetic QT Score and Sleep Apnea as Predictors of Sudden Cardiac Death in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs2076343, located in the HMGCL gene, was identified as causally associated with multiple sclerosis (MS) susceptibility. This association was evidenced by mRNA levels that exhibited a consistent direction of effects at the protein levels suggesting its involvement in MS pathology.
title: Multi-omics integration prioritizes potential drug targets for multiple sclerosis

finding: For the 1:154605882-155673527 locus, the variant rs41264915 was significant in association with hospitalized COVID-19 patients (B2 phenotype), marking it as an independent signal from another variant in the same locus.
title: Insights into genetic factors contributing to variability in SARS-CoV-2 susceptibility and COVID-19 disease severity

finding: At the same 1:154605882-155673527 locus, rs4971066 was identified as the lead variant associated with the C2 phenotype (COVID-19 patients vs. population), indicating separate genetic signals within this locus.
title: Insights into genetic factors contributing to variability in SARS-CoV-2 susceptibility and COVID-19 disease severity

finding: An FEV1/FVC-associated SV deletion mapped only to the gene MEGF6. The phenome-wide MR and colocalization analyses indicated strong evidence for a causal relationship between MEGF6 expression and lower FEV1/FVC measures in tissues associated with respiratory diseases, with a minimum MR p value of 6.3×10^-7.
title: Imputation of structural variants using a multi-ancestry long-read sequencing panel enables identification of disease associations

finding: The C allele of rs7512462, located in intron 5 of SLC26A9, was associated with greater expression of the SLC26A9 gene in the adult pancreas. This finding became notable from genome-wide association studies (GWAS), which initially identified it in relation to meconium ileus in cystic fibrosis. Although the association with CF lung function was debated, some studies suggested a beneficial effect of this allele on lung function and response to CFTR modulators in patients with specific CFTR variants. Overall, the evidence indicated a significant role for rs7512462 as a modifier in cystic fibrosis, notably impacting disease-related traits.
title: The Solute Carrier Family 26 Member 9 Is a Modifier of the Rapidly Progressing Cystic Fibrosis Associated with F508del CFTR Mutations

finding: The study reported that rs2274700 was associated with AMD risk and was the only instrument strongly associated with Complement factor H in the analysis, highlighting a potential causal relationship between complement traits and AMD.
title: Phenome-wide Mendelian randomisation analysis identifies causal factors for age-related macular degeneration

finding: The SNP rs1339882991 was positively correlated with both persistence and adherence to blood pressure (BP) medications. This finding was significant as it was previously reported to be positively associated with hypertension, indicating its relevance in pharmacological treatments for hypertensive patients.
title: Socio-demographic and genetic risk factors for drug adherence and persistence: a retrospective nation-wide and biobank study across 5 medication classes and 1 814 521 individuals

finding: The SNP rs2369633 was identified as a lead variant associated with melanoma risk at the MDM4 locus. It was linked to the regulation of MDM4, demonstrating allelic regulatory potential and supporting a role in melanoma susceptibility.
title: Mapping chromatin interactions at melanoma susceptibility loci and cell-type specific dataset integration uncovers distant gene targets of cis-regulation

finding: The SNP rs12119098 appeared as a significant independent GWAS signal at the MDM4 locus, showing a correlation with lower MDM4 expression in melanocytes and suggesting its protective role against melanoma.
title: Mapping chromatin interactions at melanoma susceptibility loci and cell-type specific dataset integration uncovers distant gene targets of cis-regulation

finding: The SNP rs6700182 was validated for significantly reducing MDM4 expression, highlighting its role in regulation at the locus associated with melanoma.
title: Mapping chromatin interactions at melanoma susceptibility loci and cell-type specific dataset integration uncovers distant gene targets of cis-regulation

finding: The SNP rs3128125 was identified as the independent SNP associated with the AGRN gene, which encoded agrin, a protein crucial for neuromuscular junction formation, highlighting AGRN as a novel MG susceptibility locus.
title: A Myasthenia Gravis genomewide association study of three cohorts identifies Agrin as a novel risk locus

finding: The SNP rs12057769 was linked to the C4BPA gene that encodes a C4 binding protein, indicating its role in C4 protein regulation.
title: The genetic and phenotypic correlates of neonatal Complement Component 3 and 4 protein concentrations with a focus on psychiatric and autoimmune disorders

finding: The SNP rs558103 encoded Complement Factor H, suggesting an essential role in regulating the alternative pathway of complement activation.
title: The genetic and phenotypic correlates of neonatal Complement Component 3 and 4 protein concentrations with a focus on psychiatric and autoimmune disorders

finding: Similar to rs558103, this SNP also encodes Complement Factor H, linking it to complement system regulation.
title: The genetic and phenotypic correlates of neonatal Complement Component 3 and 4 protein concentrations with a focus on psychiatric and autoimmune disorders

finding: The SNP rs1296721356 was identified as a statistically significant interaction variant for the metabolite ascorbic acid 2 sulfate. This finding was part of the research that aimed to understand genetic factors influencing vitamin C metabolite levels and how these may differ by sex.
title: Effect modification by sex of genetic associations of vitamin C related metabolites in the Canadian Longitudinal Study on Aging

finding: The SNP rs1301173408 was also classified as a statistically significant interaction variant for ascorbic acid 2 sulfate, indicating its relevance in the context of gene-metabolite interactions modified by sex.
title: Effect modification by sex of genetic associations of vitamin C related metabolites in the Canadian Longitudinal Study on Aging

finding: The SNP rs855865 was associated with neuropsychological functions related to nonword repetition (NSW) in the Cleveland Family Speech and Reading study (CFSRS) with a significance level of p=7×10⁻⁶. Additionally, it had a significant association with vocabulary as measured by WISC-V in the Avon Longitudinal Study of Parents and Children (ALSPAC) with a p-value of 0.01.
title: Association between genes regulating neural pathways for quantitative traits of speech and language disorders

finding: The SNP rs12124059 was identified as a methylation quantitative trait locus (meQTL) associated with the methylation marker cg07196514, which in turn was related to nonword repetition (NSW) at p=0.018 in CFSRS.
title: Association between genes regulating neural pathways for quantitative traits of speech and language disorders

finding: The high-risk variant rs3814316 was highlighted as a potential causal variant regulating MUC1, demonstrating higher CADD scores and stronger effects on MUC1 expression compared to the lead SNP rs2070803.
title: Locus-specific stratification and prioritization unveil high risk genes underlying hyperuricemia

finding: The rs590787 SNP in the RHD gene was used to classify individuals from the Milieu Interieur cohort as RhD-positive or -negative. The analysis showed that RhD-negative males displayed significantly different immune response patterns compared to RhD-positive males, which included over 30 differentially expressed genes. Furthermore, there was enhanced IFNγ signaling in RhD-negative males, which may explain their increased viral resistance.
title: Rhesus negative males have an enhanced IFNγ-mediated immune response to influenza A virus

finding: The SNP rs2297480 was associated with local-eQTLs of RUSC1-AS1 and showed strong colocalization with overall breast cancer risk, with a significant posterior probability of colocalization. RUSC1-AS1 is involved in the silencing of genes through epigenetic signaling and has been correlated with breast cancer progression.
title: Distal gene regulation mediated by non-coding RNAs contributes to germline risk for breast and prostate cancer

finding: The SNP rs2075571 was identified as a distal-eQTL for SH2B1 and was strongly colocalized with overall breast cancer risk, revealing a significant colocalization signal. SH2B1 plays a role in cytokine signaling related to cell proliferation and migration.
title: Distal gene regulation mediated by non-coding RNAs contributes to germline risk for breast and prostate cancer

finding: The SNP rs1061170 in the CFH gene was associated with a significantly increased risk of progression to advanced AMD, with an odds ratio (OR) of 3.53 (P < 0.0001). This finding contributed to understanding the genetic factors influencing AMD progression.
title: Rare Dysfunctional Complement Factor I Genetic Variants and Progression to Advanced Age-Related Macular Degeneration

finding: The SNP rs121913059 in the CFH gene, identified as R1210C, was highlighted as a rare variant significantly associated with advanced AMD, carrying a high risk with an odds ratio (OR) of 3.53 (P < 0.0001).
title: Rare Dysfunctional Complement Factor I Genetic Variants and Progression to Advanced Age-Related Macular Degeneration

finding: The variant rs2120461 was identified as a cis-regulatory element for the gene RERE and was involved in the trans-regulation of AUTS2. This relationship was statistically supported through mediation analysis and colocalization with genetic risk for schizophrenia (SZ), indicating a potential mechanism for susceptibility to this neuropsychiatric disorder.
title: Single-Nucleus Atlas of Cell-Type Specific Genetic Regulation in the Human Brain

finding: Located at 1p35.1 and initially showing p=3.32×10^-7 and OR=3.15, this SNP remained suggestive in meta-analysis with p=1.87×10^-6, relating it specifically to ASD risk.
title: Genome-wide association studies of Down syndrome associated congenital heart defects

finding: This SNP from the previous ASD GWAS showed replicated significance in the DS+AVSD (p=1.53×10^-2, OR=0.74) and DS+VSD (p=4.86×10^-2, OR=0.71).
title: Genome-wide association studies of Down syndrome associated congenital heart defects

finding: The lead SNP rs2479868 was identified in the 3' untranslated region of SPTA1. It was significantly associated with spleen iron, showing a beta of -0.083 and p=2.5e-22, indicating its potential role in influencing spleen iron concentrations.
title: Analysis of MRI-derived spleen iron in the UK Biobank identifies genetic variation linked to iron homeostasis and erythrocyte morphology

finding: The missense variant rs1061170 in the CFH gene was reported as the first common genetic risk factor for age-related macular degeneration (AMD), accounting for a significant portion of AMD risk.
title: A Proteogenomic Signature of Age-related Macular Degeneration in Blood

finding: The intronic variant rs1410996 at the CFH locus was identified as another contributing variant to AMD risk, together with rs1061170, accounting for 17% of the overall AMD risk.
title: A Proteogenomic Signature of Age-related Macular Degeneration in Blood

finding: The AMD-associated variant rs10922109 in the CFH gene was significantly associated with AMD (P = 2.6x10^-16) and influenced the levels of 40 serum proteins, with over-representation of complement system proteins.
title: A Proteogenomic Signature of Age-related Macular Degeneration in Blood

finding: The variant rs570618, also located in the CFH gene, controlled 217 serum proteins, including those related to the innate immune response, thus reinforcing its connection to AMD.
title: A Proteogenomic Signature of Age-related Macular Degeneration in Blood

finding: The SNP rs12040957 was identified as a positive original finding related to the overall survival outcomes of patients undergoing radiotherapy for glioblastoma (GBM). The research indicated that this SNP was significantly associated with improved survival rates in GBM patients, highlighting its importance in understanding individual responses to radiotherapy.
title: Variability in Radiotherapy Outcomes Across Cancer Types: A Comparative Study of Glioblastoma Multiforme and Low-Grade Gliomas

finding: The SNP rs2310819 was noted to have shared causal implications connecting PTSD with cardiovascular disease.
title: Genetics of posttraumatic stress disorder and cardiovascular conditions using Life’s Essential 8, Electronic Health Records, and Heart Imaging

finding: The SNP rs340874 was part of loci demonstrating high posterior probabilities of sharing causation with PTSD in cardiovascular contexts.
title: Genetics of posttraumatic stress disorder and cardiovascular conditions using Life’s Essential 8, Electronic Health Records, and Heart Imaging

finding: The SNP rs11581459 was highlighted in the analysis for contributing to the shared genetic landscape of PTSD and CV health indicators.
title: Genetics of posttraumatic stress disorder and cardiovascular conditions using Life’s Essential 8, Electronic Health Records, and Heart Imaging

finding: The SNP rs142709330 at the 1q41 locus was identified as a significant pleiotropic locus shared among MDD, MI and BL traits, suggesting a multifaceted genetic interaction.
title: Role of Blood Lipids in the Shared Genetic Etiology Between Major Depressive Disorder and Myocardial Infarction: A Large-scale Multi-trait Association Analysis

finding: The SNP rs12092700 was associated with an increased risk of Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD) in patients who also had Chronic Myeloproliferative Neoplasms, as reported in a nationwide cohort study. This finding contributed to understanding the genetic risk factors for IBD in a specific patient population, reflecting the utility of imputed transcriptome analyses in revealing important gene-phenotype relationships.
title: Clinical and Therapeutic Applications of Individual-level Tissue-Specific Imputed Transcriptomes

finding: SNP rs2165870 exhibited an approximate 70% alternate allele frequency in the Japanese population. The study confirmed the presence of the alternate G allele in all five analyzed samples, supporting its association with perioperative outcomes.
title: Rapid detection of single nucleotide polymorphisms using the MinION nanopore sequencer: a feasibility study for perioperative precision medicine

finding: Identified at 1p36.22, this SNP was associated with UC with a P-value of 7.4×10−3 and an OR of 1.47, suggesting a risk variant related to immune response, as it is linked to TNFRSF8.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: The intronic variant rs773646156 was associated at suggestive significance with P-value of 4.53×10−7 and an OR of 1.33, relating to the OTUD3 gene.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: The SNP rs149344982 was associated with the ALPL gene, responsible for encoding alkaline phosphatase. It was noted as the leading missense variant for prostate cancer, linking higher ALP levels with poor survival rates.
title: A scalable variational approach to characterize pleiotropic components across thousands of human diseases and complex traits using GWAS summary statistics

finding: This coding variant was linked to alkaline phosphatase levels through changes in MARC1.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: Associated with gamma-glutamyl transferase levels and affecting expression of EPHA2.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: This variant was fine-mapped for mean corpuscular volume, and is located downstream of PTPRC.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: Fine-mapped for carpal tunnel syndrome in the Finnish population.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: The AMD risk-raising variant <italic>CFH</italic>:rs570618-T was significantly associated with photoreceptor segment (PS) thinning, indicating a relationship with the early stages of age-related macular degeneration (AMD).
title: Photoreceptor layer thinning is an early biomarker for age-related macular degeneration development: Epidemiological and genetic evidence from UK Biobank optical coherence tomography data

finding: The variant <italic>CFH</italic>:rs187328863-T was notable for its genome-wide significant association with PS thinning, deepening the understanding of genetic influences in AMD.
title: Photoreceptor layer thinning is an early biomarker for age-related macular degeneration development: Epidemiological and genetic evidence from UK Biobank optical coherence tomography data

finding: The AMD risk variant <italic>CFH</italic>:rs10922109-C was significantly linked to PS thinning, highlighting its potential impact on AMD progression.
title: Photoreceptor layer thinning is an early biomarker for age-related macular degeneration development: Epidemiological and genetic evidence from UK Biobank optical coherence tomography data

finding: The SNP rs2230288 in the GBA gene was associated with cognitive progression in PD, showing an HR of 2.33, emphasizing its importance in affecting progression towards dementia.
title: Association between the LRP1B and APOE loci and the development of Parkinson’s disease dementia

finding: The SNP rs952593 was associated with gestational age and linked to the gene TBX15, emphasizing its relevance in pregnancy outcomes.
title: Clotting factor genes are associated with preeclampsia in high altitude pregnant women in the Peruvian Andes

finding: The Duffy-null genotype (rs2814778; C/C homozygote) was associated with decreased absolute neutrophil count (ANC) in clozapine users from African, Asian, and Middle Eastern ancestries. This finding highlighted the genotype's relevance in predicting neutrophil levels among specific population groups.
title: Mediation and Longitudinal Analysis to interpret the association between clozapine pharmacokinetics, pharmacogenomics, and absolute neutrophil count

finding: This SNP was located in an enhancer within the CR1 gene body, further elucidating genetic factors associated with Alzheimer's disease.
title: Cell-type specific cis-eQTLs in eight brain cell-types identifies novel risk genes for human brain disorders

finding: The variant rs6701619 was associated with a subtype of congenital heart defect (bicuspid aortic valve) and calcific aortic valve stenosis, influencing quantitative traits related to aorta and aortic valve in adults. It overlapped an enhancer for PALMD in both valvular endocardial cells and aortic endothelial cells, affecting chromatin accessibility.
title: Molecular convergence of risk variants for congenital heart defects leveraging a regulatory map of the human fetal heart

finding: The SNP rs11207978 had a very strong effect on liver ANGPTL3 expression and subsequently on plasma triglyceride levels. It demonstrated a modest effect on LDL cholesterol and a weaker effect on apoB levels, but it showed no association with CAD or other cardiometabolic diseases.
title: Genetic inhibition of angiopoietin-like protein-3, lipoprotein-lipid levels and cardiometabolic diseases

finding: The SNP rs10889352 also exhibited a very strong effect on plasma ANGPTL3 levels impacting triglyceride levels significantly, similar to rs11207978. It revealed modest effects on LDL cholesterol and weaker effects on apoB levels, but like rs11207978, it was not associated with CAD or other cardiometabolic diseases.
title: Genetic inhibition of angiopoietin-like protein-3, lipoprotein-lipid levels and cardiometabolic diseases

finding: Located near GIPC2, this SNP was implicated in autoimmune responses and cancer susceptibility, particularly Crohn's disease.
title: A multi-phenotype analysis reveals 19 novel susceptibility loci for basal cell carcinoma and 15 for squamous cell carcinoma

finding: This SNP was associated with PABPC4 and HDL cholesterol levels, indicating a role in cancer risk assessment.
title: A multi-phenotype analysis reveals 19 novel susceptibility loci for basal cell carcinoma and 15 for squamous cell carcinoma

finding: The rs2412208 polymorphism in CAMTA1 emerged from the Cox multivariable analysis as independently related to survival in ALS, highlighting its significance as a genetic modifier.
title: The additive effect of genetic modifiers on ALS prognosis: a population-based study

finding: The variant rs17400517 was associated in conjunction with rs79568124, rs4040189, rs546559546, and rs182782047, explaining 58% of variance in protein levels of Fc Fragment Of IgG Receptor IIIa (FCGR3A) in European ancestry.
title: Ancestrally diverse genome-wide association analysis highlights ancestry-specific differences in genetic regulation of plasma protein levels

finding: This variant was part of a group of SNPs that collectively explained 58% of the variance in protein levels of FCGR3A in European ancestry.
title: Ancestrally diverse genome-wide association analysis highlights ancestry-specific differences in genetic regulation of plasma protein levels

finding: This variant was identified alongside other variants as part of the association explaining 58% of variance in protein levels of FCGR3A in individuals of European ancestry.
title: Ancestrally diverse genome-wide association analysis highlights ancestry-specific differences in genetic regulation of plasma protein levels

finding: The variant rs546559546 was involved in the significant association with FCGR3A protein levels, explaining 58% of the variance in the European ancestry cohort.
title: Ancestrally diverse genome-wide association analysis highlights ancestry-specific differences in genetic regulation of plasma protein levels

finding: This variant was found to have significant associations with FCGR3A protein levels in European ancestry, collectively explaining 58% of the variance with other mentioned SNPs.
title: Ancestrally diverse genome-wide association analysis highlights ancestry-specific differences in genetic regulation of plasma protein levels

finding: This variant was reported to have a colocalization signal with heart failure and protein sPLA2-XIII.
title: Ancestrally diverse genome-wide association analysis highlights ancestry-specific differences in genetic regulation of plasma protein levels

finding: This SNP was involved in a significant association at the GORAB locus and contributed to the understanding of regulatory mechanisms related to PRRX1 in DD.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies in 614,243 individuals identifies 59 novel susceptibility loci underlying Dupuytren’s contracture

finding: This SNP was noted for its significant association with DD, maintaining a connection to previously reported findings.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies in 614,243 individuals identifies 59 novel susceptibility loci underlying Dupuytren’s contracture

finding: Described as a previously reported lead SNP which along with rs10799859 provides important continuity in our understanding of DD associations.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies in 614,243 individuals identifies 59 novel susceptibility loci underlying Dupuytren’s contracture

finding: Incorporating rs113665082, findings indicated an approximately sevenfold increase in risk for IBS-U, highlighting its potential significance in IBS pathophysiology.
title: Genetic Variants in Carbohydrate Digestive Enzyme and Transport Genes Associated with Risk of Irritable Bowel Syndrome

finding: The SNP rs111429581 was also implicated in the increased odds of IBS-U similar to rs113665082, supporting the gene's involvement in IBS risk.
title: Genetic Variants in Carbohydrate Digestive Enzyme and Transport Genes Associated with Risk of Irritable Bowel Syndrome

finding: The SNP rs2306627 was recognized in the context of shared genetic loci for RA and COVID-19 hospitalization.
title: Disentangling the common genetic architecture and causality of rheumatoid arthritis and systemic lupus erythematosus with COVID-19 outcomes: genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The study identified rs3115534 at the GBA1 locus as a novel common risk factor for Parkinson's disease (PD) with an odds ratio of 1.58 (95% CI = 1.37 - 1.80, P = 2.397E-14) and associated with an earlier age at onset (AAO), indicating a decrease in onset of PD by approximately three years per risk allele (BETA = -2.004, SE = 0.57, P = 0.0005). This variant was more frequent in African and African admixed populations relative to others.
title: Genome-wide Association Identifies Novel Etiological Insights Associated with Parkinson’s Disease in African and African Admixed Populations

finding: The missense SNV on USH2A was a novel suggestive-level association identified in the AD-age score linear regression and replicated nominally.
title: A novel age-informed approach for genetic association analysis in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The eQTL rs1491377616 was associated with the gene LCE3C and demonstrated the most significant interaction with local skin inflammation, with an interaction beta of -3.86 and an FDR of 1.59e-79. The risk allele of this SNP was identified as being in perfect linkage disequilibrium with the psoriasis-associated variant rs4845453, highlighting its role in psoriasis susceptibility.
title: Immunosuppression causes dynamic changes in expression QTLs in psoriatic skin

finding: The sQTL rs4072037:C>T was linked with an increased risk of reported SARS-CoV-2 infection, although it did not correlate consistently with COVID-19 severity. This SNP exhibited alternative splicing effects that may influence susceptibility to SARS-CoV-2.
title: Alternative splicing in the lung influences COVID-19 severity and respiratory diseases

finding: The SNP rs12082304 was reported in the context of retinoblastoma (RB) as it relates to its etiology, modeling, and treatment strategies based on the publication by Kaewkhaw and Rojanaporn. This study discussed various genetic components associated with RB, confirming the relevance of the SNP in understanding the disease's genetic basis.
title: TFF1 – a new Biomarker in Liquid Biopsies of Retinoblastoma under Therapy

finding: The rs144126567 variant was found to be a shared causal variant for the percentage of M6 in total neutral plasma glycans (M6n) and asthma. The analysis indicated a statistically significant positive causal effect of M6n on asthma, with the direction of this effect being consistent with the observed associations between asthma and related polygenic scores.
title: A genome-wide association study in 10,000 individuals links plasma N-glycome to liver disease and anti-inflammatory proteins

finding: The SNP rs1801133, which involves a C>T mutation in exon 5 of the MTHFR gene, was found in patients of family F9. It was identified as pathogenic and conserved, potentially affecting protein function, and was associated with a positive family history of pulmonary cysts.
title: Genetic Insight into Birt-Hogg-Dubé syndrome in Indian patients reveals novel mutations in FLCN

finding: Similar to rs1801133, the SNP rs138189536, a C>T mutation in exon 2 of the MTHFR gene, was also detected in family F9 along with rs1801133. This SNP was associated with a misdiagnosis of BHDS due to the presence of pulmonary cysts, highlighting its potential pathogenic role.
title: Genetic Insight into Birt-Hogg-Dubé syndrome in Indian patients reveals novel mutations in FLCN

finding: The sQTL rs2245425 for TOR1AIP1 exhibited significant effects on splice excision events in coronary artery tissues, illustrating its relevance in disease-related gene expression.
title: Integrative multi-ancestry genetic analysis of gene regulation in coronary arteries prioritizes disease risk loci

finding: The SNP rs410895 was associated with CFHR2, which has prior links to age-related macular degeneration (AMD), showing its relevance to alterations in PRC thickness.
title: Sub-cellular level resolution of common genetic variation in the photoreceptor layer identifies continuum between rare disease and common variation

finding: The SNP rs6025, representing the thrombophilic mutation F5 p.Arg534Gln (commonly known as factor V Leiden), was identified as a novel risk variant for varicose veins. This association supported a pathophysiological role for venous thromboembolism, recognized as a secondary etiology of varicose veins within the CEAP classification of chronic venous disorders.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome-wide Association Study of Varicose Veins Reveals Polygenic Architecture, Genetic Overlap with Arterial and Venous Disease, and Novel Therapeutic Opportunities

finding: The SNP rs55750792 was identified near MFAP2 (microfibrillar associated protein 2) as a risk variant for varicose veins. Circulating levels of MFAP2 showed a strong association with increased risk, with significant colocalization between varicose veins and MFAP2 levels, highlighting the role of extracellular matrix proteins on venous structure.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome-wide Association Study of Varicose Veins Reveals Polygenic Architecture, Genetic Overlap with Arterial and Venous Disease, and Novel Therapeutic Opportunities

finding: The SNP rs12123737 was identified at the TGFBR3 locus, and genetically-proxied circulating levels of TGFBI (TGF-β induced protein) were associated with a higher risk of varicose veins. Elevated TGFBI levels were previously documented in varicose veins, underlining its potential role in the disease's pathogenesis.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome-wide Association Study of Varicose Veins Reveals Polygenic Architecture, Genetic Overlap with Arterial and Venous Disease, and Novel Therapeutic Opportunities

finding: This SNP was found to be significant (p=8.1E-03) and was replicated in reports associating it with tuberculosis.
title: Large Registry Based Analysis of Genetic Predisposition to Tuberculosis Identifies Genetic Risk Factors at HLA

finding: The SNP rs6587520 was associated with significant results in the lymphocyte count GWAS for European ancestry (EUR), with a minimum P-value of 7 × 10^-22. In contrast, no significant association was found in the East Asian (EAS) GWAS for the same SNP, where the P-value was 0.52. The study observed significant differences in marginal allele effect sizes for the T allele of rs6587520, with a per-allele effect size of -0.004 ± 0.006 in EAS and -0.023 ± 0.002 in EUR. A significant difference in these effect sizes was noted with a P-value of 1 × 10^-3. These findings suggested that the lower expression of the MCL1 gene in European populations contributes to reduced B cell counts, and rs6587520 might function to counterbalance this effect, leading to higher lymphocyte counts in EUR.
title: Ancestry-specific regulatory and disease architectures are likely due to cell-type-specific gene-by-environment interactions

finding: For SNP 1298A/C (rs1801131), a significant protective effect of the homozygous C genotype was identified in breast cancer patients. This was noted in a recessive model (CC vs AA+AC; OR: 0.320) and in a homozygous co-dominant model (CC vs AA; OR: 0.379), suggesting a decreased breast cancer risk associated with this genotype in the South-Asian population studied.
title: Independent and Combined Associations of 677C/T and 1298A/C Polymorphisms in the MTHFR gene with Breast Cancers in a South-Asian Population

finding: The SNP rs12740374, located in LD block 96, exhibited strong co-localization evidence indicating it influenced both estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) and conditions such as venous thromboembolism (VTE) and coronary artery disease (CAD), with a posterior probability (PP) greater than 0.7.
title: Disentangling shared genetic etiologies for kidney function and cardiovascular diseases

finding: Located in the CELSR2 gene at the 1p13.3 locus, SNP rs660240 exhibited strong co-localization for both eGFR and heart failure (HF), as well as for eGFR and VTE, with a PP exceeding 0.7. This suggests a significant pleiotropic effect influencing multiple cardiovascular-related traits.
title: Disentangling shared genetic etiologies for kidney function and cardiovascular diseases

finding: The study highlighted that the HLA-DQ genotype, particularly the DQ1/DQ1 genotype, was an independent predictor of durable response and a lower incidence of relapse/progression in patients with relapsed/refractory large B-cell lymphoma receiving CAR-T cell therapy. This provided insight into the role of HLA evolutionary divergence metrics, including the SNP rs12071835, in influencing the immune response and antitumor efficacy of CAR-T therapies.
title: Germline HLA-DQ genotype influences response to CAR T-cell therapy in patients with large B-cell lymphoma

finding: The SNP rs147036913 was one of the top associations identified in the Neurodevelopmental GenomicSEM GWAS. It was located near the gene PAPPA2, which is implicated in neuronal development and neurodevelopmental disorders.
title: Enhancing the Discriminatory Power of ADHD and Autism Spectrum Disorder Polygenic Scores in Clinical and Non-Clinical Samples

finding: SNP rs10789205 was identified in the Neurodevelopmental GenomicSEM GWAS and is located near PDE4B, a gene associated with various neurodevelopmental processes.
title: Enhancing the Discriminatory Power of ADHD and Autism Spectrum Disorder Polygenic Scores in Clinical and Non-Clinical Samples

finding: A variant in the TMC01 locus, specifically rs4656461, was previously identified to confer a 12% increase in cumulative incidence of primary open-angle glaucoma (POAG) in a subgroup of participants from the Ocular Hypertension Treatment Study (OHTS). This finding highlighted the potential of genetic variants to significantly influence POAG risk, illustrating that even with a broader polygenic risk score encompassing multiple genetic factors, this specific SNP had a notable impact on glaucoma risk in patients with ocular hypertension.
title: Polygenic Risk Score Improves Prediction of Primary Open Angle Glaucoma Onset in the Ocular Hypertension Treatment Study

finding: The rs3115534 variant at the GBA1 locus was identified as a major contributor to PAR in the African/African Admixed ancestry population, indicating its relevance in the profile of genetic risk for PD.
title: Multi-ancestry population attributable risk assessment of common genetic variation in Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s diseases

finding: The SNP rs6025 at the F5 locus, associated with Factor V Leiden (FVL), showed a strong association with DVT, with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.20, indicating a significant risk factor identified in the analysis.
title: Using genotyping and whole-exome sequencing data to improve genetic risk prediction in deep venous thrombosis

finding: The lead variant rs360060 was associated with the NHW FEV1 NetSHy2 network, and it was reported to function as an eQTL for TMEM63A, LEFTY1, and EPHX1. This suggested its potential role in the mechanisms underpinning COPD pathology.
title: Proteomic Networks and Related Genetic Variants Associated with Smoking and Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease

finding: SNP rs1175550 demonstrated a significant association, with a β value indicating a connection between zinc genetic variations and the increased risk of congenital foot deformities.
title: The Mendelian randomization analysis of trace elements Zinc, Selenium, Copper, Iron, and Phosphate with congenital foot deformities

finding: SNP rs2769264 also indicated a significant effect in the analysis that linked zinc levels to the risk of congenital foot deformities.
title: The Mendelian randomization analysis of trace elements Zinc, Selenium, Copper, Iron, and Phosphate with congenital foot deformities

finding: The rs2986758 SNP was identified as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for both the ESPN and TNFRSF25 genes. This SNP showed a significant association with hearing score, indicating its potential involvement in the molecular mechanisms of age-related hearing loss (ARHL) through modulation of gene expression linked to audiometric patterns.
title: DNA Methylation Study in Presbycusis Patients

finding: The C-allele of the IL6R SNP (Asp358Ala; rs2228145 A>C) in donor kidneys conferred a reduced risk of rejection following renal transplantation, with a hazard ratio of 0.78 per C-allele (95%-CI 0.67–0.90; P=0.001). This finding indicated a significant association between the donor IL6R genotype and a lower incidence of biopsy-proven acute rejection.
title: Donor genetic variants in interleukin-6 and interleukin-6 receptor associate with biopsy-proven rejection following kidney transplantation

finding: The variant rs6537747 at locus 1p13.2 influenced both chronotype and retinal thickness in the left eye.
title: The role of sleep in the human brain and body: insights from multi-organ imaging genetics

finding: The SNP rs12061470 was identified as having a significant association with ovarian cancer, showing positive correlations with prognostic factors related to the disease. Specifically, this SNP was linked to previously recognized prognostic genes like EPCAM and UBE2C, which influenced OC occurrence and survival.
title: Transcriptomic Gene Network Profiling and Weak Signal Detection for Prediction of Ovarian Cancer Occurrence, Survival, and Severity by Integrating Bulk and Single-cell RNAseq Data

finding: The rs1801133 variant, located in the fifth exon of the MTHFR gene, was found to have a significant association with early-onset schizophrenia (EOS) in a large-scale meta-analysis which compared 2,159 EOS patients with 6,561 healthy controls. This finding supported the established risk of the MTHFR gene in EOS cases, aligning with both previous genome-wide association studies and the current study's findings of rare variants.
title: Early-onset schizophrenia is associated with immune-related rare variants in a Chinese sample

finding: The SNP rs2476601 from the PTPN22 locus was associated with 9 types of autoantibody specificities, including Cit-Vim60-75, with results indicating a range of p-values from 1.57×10−5 to 2.24×10−9 and odds ratios ranging from 1.19 to 1.28. This association also persisted in HLA-DRB1 SE positive RA patients.
title: Identification of loci genetically associated with antibodies to specific sets of citrullinated peptides in rheumatoid arthritis patients

finding: The SNP rs6679677, which is in full linkage disequilibrium with rs2476601, showed significant associations with various autoantibody specificities, mirroring the findings of rs2476601, particularly in the context of HLA-DRB1 SE positive patients.
title: Identification of loci genetically associated with antibodies to specific sets of citrullinated peptides in rheumatoid arthritis patients

finding: The SNP rs6679667 was associated with Cit-Vim67-85 autoantibody specificity in HLA-DRB1 SE positive patients with significant p-values ranging from 5.352×10−7 to 7.567×10−6.
title: Identification of loci genetically associated with antibodies to specific sets of citrullinated peptides in rheumatoid arthritis patients

finding: The missense SNP rs2228145 was associated with alterations in the ectodomain shedding of IL6R by ADAM10/17 metalloproteinases, which indicated a significant impact on the cleavage site related to this receptor.
title: Genetic determinants of blood gene expression and splicing and their contribution to molecular phenotypes and health outcomes

finding: This SNP tagged the missense variant rs2228145 and was linked to a transmembrane splicing event that mediated a portion of the variation in Olink-measured plasma protein abundance, suggesting a dual mechanism involving both splicing and proteolytic pathways.
title: Genetic determinants of blood gene expression and splicing and their contribution to molecular phenotypes and health outcomes

finding: The variant rs2228145 (Asp358Ala missense mutation) was associated with IL6R protein and transcript levels, influencing AD risk through its role in shifting IL6R from membrane-bound to soluble form, thus impacting inflammatory signaling.
title: Triangulating molecular evidence to prioritise candidate causal genes at established atopic dermatitis loci

finding: The functional polymorphism rs6127 (p.Asp603Asn) in the SELP gene was associated with severe COVID-19 outcomes, specifically thromboembolism. The homozygous Asn/Asn genotype demonstrated a strong Odds Ratio of 2.27 (95% CI 1.54-3.36), particularly in males aged over 50 years where the Odds Ratio increased to 2.42 (95% CI 1.53-3.82). This polymorphism enhances platelet activation and is linked to increased D-dimer levels in affected individuals.
title: SELP Asp603Asn and severe thrombosis in COVID-19 males: implication for anti P-selectin monoclonal antibodies treatment

finding: The SNP rs1337526 had a significant association with the urinary albumin-to-creatinine ratio (UACR) in adult study participants from GWAS meta-analyses. This SNP was part of credible set SNPs identified through fine-mapping, suggesting its role in albuminuria, particularly in relation to the kidney's functioning.
title: Implication of FOXD2 dysfunction in syndromic congenital anomalies of the kidney and urinary tract (CAKUT)

finding: The SNP rs17453832 was identified as an independent common variant upstream of FOXD2, presenting significant overlap with accessible chromatin regions in podocytes, which are crucial for albuminuria of glomerular origin. The findings point to rs17453832 as a potential regulatory variant associated with albuminuria.
title: Implication of FOXD2 dysfunction in syndromic congenital anomalies of the kidney and urinary tract (CAKUT)

finding: KASP-PCR screening for the MTHFR1 mutation (C677T) identified that approximately 24% of the patients were heterozygous for this mutation. Only about 2% of samples were homozygous recessive (TT), while the remaining samples were homozygous wild (CC). This indicated that approximately 26% of the patients had at least one allele of the MTHFR1 mutation, contributing to their risk of developing thrombophilia.
title: KASP-PCR method to screen thrombophilia genetic risk factors

finding: The optimized KASP-PCR assay for the MTHFR2 mutation (A1286C) showed that around 39% of the patients carried one allele of the mutation, while approximately 6.3% were homozygous recessive (CC), and about 53% were free of mutation (wild). This highlighted that approximately 45% of susceptible thrombophilia patients had at least one mutation within the MTHFR2 gene.
title: KASP-PCR method to screen thrombophilia genetic risk factors
