finding: The rs4844610 variant was part of the multi-trait analysis with Alzheimer disease and showed significant association with delirium, with an odds ratio of 1.01 [1.006 - 1.014] and a p-value of 1.4×10^-8.
title: Dissecting the genetic and proteomic risk factors for delirium

finding: The study found that the frequency of the minor G allele of rs1800947 was significantly higher in the preterm labour (PTL) group compared to the control group. This finding indicated a potential association between the rs1800947 SNP and the risk of PTL, suggesting that mutations in rs1800947 could be a useful genetic marker for assessing PTL risk in pregnant women.
title: Association of C-reactive protein and Interleukin-6 single nucleotide polymorphisms with preterm labour: results of a pilot study

finding: The SNP rs1415287 showed colocalization with T2D-related gene CBLN4 in trans. The risk allele was associated with increased CBLN4 levels, while it also colocalized with IGFBP-1, which had decreased levels correlated with the risk allele. These findings suggested a potential pathway for T2D risk through these markers.
title: Multi-omics characterization of type 2 diabetes associated genetic variation

finding: This SNP reached genome-wide suggestive significance (p<1×10^-6) and was located in the locus of Usp48, a gene implicated in pathogen responses, particularly involved in the regulation of type I interferon signalling in antiviral responses.
title: Plasma proteomic associates of infection mortality in UK Biobank

finding: The analysis revealed that rs11240388 was associated with Covid-19 hospitalization, showing a significant association primarily in Brazilian individuals with high European ancestry. This SNP was part of a newly identified 79Kb haplotype near the DSTYK and RBBP5 genes, which had previously been linked to several traits, particularly blood cell-related traits. Additionally, it was confirmed as an eQTL for genes such as CNTN2, TMEM81, RBBP5, and DSTYK in multiple tissues, indicating its potential role in modulating immune response during Covid-19.
title: Genetic risk factors and Covid-19 severity in Brazil: results from BRACOVID Study

finding: The SNP rs146953046 in the gene PHGDH was associated with MacTel disease, showing a significant association (P=7.90×10^-22) and was linked to decreased expression of PHGDH in the retina. It represented a rare risk haplotype with a MAF of 0.059 in cases, contrasting with 0.016 in controls, resulting in an OR of 5.47.
title: Identification of genetic factors influencing metabolic dysregulation and retinal support for MacTel, a retinal disorder

finding: The SNP rs532303 showed a strong association within the PHGDH locus (P=2.3×10^-20) and was in strong LD with rs477992. Its presence further indicated complex genetic interactions influencing MacTel.
title: Identification of genetic factors influencing metabolic dysregulation and retinal support for MacTel, a retinal disorder

finding: The SNP rs20558 was linked to colorectal cancer (CRC) risk and identified as the lead isoQTL for the isoform ENST00000466964.1 of LAMC1. While observing a significant isoform-eQTL signal, this SNP did not have a corresponding gene-eQTL effect, highlighting the importance of isoform expression in CRC risk assessment.
title: Isoform-level analyses of 6 cancers uncover extensive genetic risk mechanisms undetected at the gene-level

finding: The variant rs11576941 was associated with eosinophil count on the fatty acid amide hydrolase gene (FAAH), which is involved in endocannabinoid metabolism. This SNP had been previously identified in relation to cannabis use and dependence, particularly in the Mexican American population under study. The association indicated a potential role of FAAH in the genetic basis of Cannabis Use Disorder (CUD).
title: Pleiotropic Loci for Cannabis Use Disorder Severity in Multi-Ancestry High-Risk Populations

finding: SNP rs7522520 was recognized as a second independent hit with significance (p= 3.57 × 10^{-8}), located on chromosome 1 near the pseudogene RN7SK.
title: Genetic evidence for the link of misophonia with psychiatric disorders and personality

finding: The SNP rs4430311 was identified as the lead isoQTL for the isoform ENST00000492957 of AKT3, indicating a significant negative association with schizophrenia risk. This SNP showed low linkage disequilibrium with GWAS-significant SNPs in the same locus, suggesting complex allelic relationships affecting distinct isoforms of AKT3.
title: Isoform-level transcriptome-wide association uncovers extensive novel genetic risk mechanisms for neuropsychiatric disorders in the human brain

finding: The SNP rs6695837, located near the LAMC1 gene, was implicated in increasing the risk of colorectal cancer among Chinese populations, demonstrating a positive association with CRC risk.
title: Integrating multi-tissue expression and splicing data to prioritise anatomical subsite- and sex-specific colorectal cancer susceptibility genes with therapeutic potential

finding: In the context of haemolytic anaemia, the missense variant rs113403872 in the PKLR gene was associated with both plasma pyruvate levels and red blood cell count, confirming its role in the known disease association.
title: Mendelian randomisation with proxy exposures: challenges and opportunities

finding: Similar to rs113403872, the variant rs116100695 also showed strong associations with plasma pyruvate levels and red blood cell count, reinforcing its significance in the pathology of haemolytic anaemia.
title: Mendelian randomisation with proxy exposures: challenges and opportunities

finding: Similar to rs2042528, rs61804494 also showed a different pattern of interaction with fish oil supplementation regarding dementia incidence, indicating its role in the genetic architecture of dementia.
title: Gene-diet interaction analysis in UK Biobank identified genetic loci that modify the association between fish oil supplementation and the incidence of dementia

finding: Similar to rs7528419, rs629301 displayed a vertical effect on CHD and a direct effect on apoB. PRISM highlighted that the impact on CHD was primarily through its causal relationship with apoB, reinforcing the comprehension of SNPs' roles in CHD via lipid metabolism.
title: Inferring genetic variant causal network by leveraging pleiotropy

finding: The findings for rs646776 mirrored those of rs7528419 and rs629301, showing a direct effect on apolipoprotein B and a vertical effect on CHD. This reinforced the understanding that these variants within the SORT1 locus had implications for coronary heart disease primarily through the regulation of apoB.
title: Inferring genetic variant causal network by leveraging pleiotropy

finding: The rs143038218 locus was implicated in POAG and harbored previously reported rare variants, suggesting a significant role in the disorder.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The SNP rs75437404, located near the loricrin gene (LOR) on chromosome 1, was associated with astrovirus diarrheal infection in children under one year old. Children with at least one A allele had a 2.71 times higher likelihood of infection compared to those with the T allele, indicating a significant genetic risk factor for astrovirus susceptibility.
title: Genetic Susceptibility to Astrovirus Diarrhea in Bangladeshi Infants

finding: The SNP rs12125683 was identified as having associations with the expression of innate immune response genes S100A9, S100A12, and PGLYRP4 in the context of astrovirus diarrheal infection. The C allele of this SNP was linked to increased expression levels and higher odds of infection, suggesting a regulatory role in immune response related to astrovirus susceptibility.
title: Genetic Susceptibility to Astrovirus Diarrhea in Bangladeshi Infants

finding: The SNP rs17020312 was found associated with the IKBKE gene, marking its relevance in signal response mechanisms in naive CD4+ T cells in the context of lupus.
title: Hypomethylation of miR-17-92 cluster in lupus T cells and no significant role for genetic factors in the lupus-associated DNA methylation signature

finding: SNP rs67652997 was identified as a top association for both cleft lip (CL) and cleft lip plus cleft palate (CLP), emphasizing its significance as a risk factor across these phenotypes.
title: Genome-wide association study of multiethnic non-syndromic orofacial cleft families identifies novel loci specific to family and phenotypic subtypes

finding: The SNP rs2076149 was associated with both the CLP subtype and enhanced the understanding of genetic risk factors differentiating between cleft lip alone and cleft lip plus cleft palate.
title: Genome-wide association study of multiethnic non-syndromic orofacial cleft families identifies novel loci specific to family and phenotypic subtypes

finding: The study identified that rs1690789, a genetic variant linked to emphysema through genome-wide association analysis, was situated in a genomic region that contains an active enhancer element. This enhancer element was found to increase the expression of the TGFB2 gene in human lung fibroblasts, linking the variant to TGF-β signaling dysregulation associated with emphysema.
title: Lung transcriptomics of radiologic emphysema reveal barrier function impairment and macrophage M1-M2 imbalance

finding: The SNP rs2072659 was associated with multiple smoking phenotypes, all showing protective associations. Specifically, it linked with 'cig-per-day' (Beta=-0.04, CI=-0.02--0.05, P=7.5e-8), 'heavy-smoker' (OR=0.96, CI=0.94-0.98, P=5.3e-6), 'ever-smoker' (OR=0.98, CI=0.97-0.99, P=0.001), and 'nicotine-dependence' (OR=0.97; CI=0.95-0.99; P=0.003), indicating a protective role in smoking behavior.
title: Rare coding variants in CHRNB2 reduce the likelihood of smoking

finding: The missense variant rs202079239 (Arg460Gly) was identified as contributing significantly to the pLOF-plus-missense burden association related to smoking. This variant alone exhibited a protective association with heavy smoking (OR=0.58; CI=0.45-0.74; P=2e-5), indicating lower odds of heavy smoking.
title: Rare coding variants in CHRNB2 reduce the likelihood of smoking

finding: The analysis established that genetically lowered circulating ANGPTL3 levels, which included the rs34483103 variant, did not show an association with coronary artery disease (CAD). However, a meta-analysis of loss-of-function variants indicated that ANGPTL3 inactivation, including potential effects linked to the rs34483103 variant, offered protection against CAD with an odds ratio of 0.71 (95% CI, 0.62–0.82).
title: Drug-target Mendelian randomization analysis supports lowering plasma ANGPTL3, ANGPTL4, and APOC3 levels as strategies for reducing cardiovascular disease risk

finding: The SNP rs10917151, located in the CDC42/WNT4 region, showed an ancestry-specific effect on the risk of uterine fibroids. Specifically, the A allele was associated with a reduced risk of uterine fibroids in women of African ancestry (OR=0.84) and an increased risk in women of European ancestry (OR=1.16). This variant was noted for its potential involvement in hormone-related traits, such as endometriosis and endometrial cancer, suggesting a role in the development of leiomyomas through influence on hormone metabolism.
title: Exploring potential causal genes for uterine leiomyomas: A summary data-based Mendelian randomization and FUMA analysis

finding: The SNP rs2340405 was identified as having convergent effects on both alcohol use disorder (AUD) and schizophrenia (SCZ). It had significant associations with AUD (p = 5.8e-8) and SCZ (p = 2.2e-13), indicating a potential common genetic risk factor between these two disorders.
title: Evidence of shared genetic influences underlying schizophrenia and alcohol use disorder, but not alcohol consumption

finding: SNP rs113663169 was significantly associated with at least one trait out of 706 traits in UK Biobank. TraitScan identified the trait alkaline phosphatase linked to this SNP, which suggested a causal relationship between alkaline phosphatase levels and Ewing Sarcoma (EWS), as elevated alkaline phosphatase activity is present in EWS tumor cells.
title: Subset scanning for multi-trait analysis using GWAS summary statistics

finding: Associated with APOE4 status, rs429328 was shown to explain part of the variance in tau deposition along with rs2113389, indicating a collaborative effect in tau pathology.
title: Novel CYP1B1-RMDN2 Alzheimer’s disease locus identified by genome-wide association analysis of cerebral tau deposition on PET

finding: The SNP rs10789207 was included in the group of variants previously associated with cardiovascular traits in Europeans, reinforcing the genetic associations relevant to cardiovascular health.
title: Distinct Genetic Loci and Variations in Blood Pressure and Pulse Rate in Europeans and Africans from the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs11240569 in SLC41A1 was investigated in a case-control study that demonstrated a potential link between cognitive impairment and genetic polymorphism in patients with Parkinson's disease in Upper Egypt, suggesting an original finding related to phenotype.
title: The State of Play of Parkinson’s Disease in Africa: A Systematic Review and Point of View

finding: The allele A of rs6677604 was confirmed to tag for a heterozygous deletion of both CFHR3 and CFHR1 genes. Patients carrying this allele also displayed alterations in the levels of several proteins, contributing to an increased rejection risk post-kidney transplantation.
title: The impact of complement factor H-related protein gene deletions on kidney transplantation

finding: The A allele at rs140584594 showed a positive association with Glutathione S-Transferase Mu 1 (GSTM1) expression in macrophages, with a significant eQTL effect denoted by a p-value of 3.4 x 10^-30.
title: History of tuberculosis disease is associated with genetic regulatory variation in Peruvians

finding: The SNP rs366316 was found to influence CD1A expression levels specifically in dendritic cells, validated by flow cytometry, showing the significance of this SNP in regulating immune function.
title: History of tuberculosis disease is associated with genetic regulatory variation in Peruvians

finding: This novel intronic variant in NEGR1 was associated with AUDIT-C, linked to intelligence and educational attainment.
title: Genetic underpinnings of the transition from alcohol consumption to alcohol use disorder: shared and unique genetic architectures in a cross-ancestry sample

finding: Identified with strong direct effects on AUD, through mediation analysis.
title: Genetic underpinnings of the transition from alcohol consumption to alcohol use disorder: shared and unique genetic architectures in a cross-ancestry sample

finding: This missense variant was found in the SPEN gene and was associated with disrupted cardiac conduction pathways linked to AF risk.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide analysis of atrial fibrillation provides new insights into disease biology and enables polygenic prediction of cardioembolic risk

finding: The SNP rs12040800 was associated with a nine-gene signature that could predict the response to preoperative chemoradiotherapy in patients with locally advanced rectal cancer. This finding was published in the study from Park et al. in 2020, indicating its relevance in identifying patients likely to benefit from neoadjuvant treatment.
title: Exploring novel inflammation-related genetic and hematological predictors of response to neoadjuvant chemoradiotherapy in locally advanced rectal cancer

finding: The SNP rs2282440 was positively associated with metabolic syndrome in the Taiwanese population, indicating its potential role in the pathology of obesity and related cardiometabolic diseases. This finding related to genetic susceptibility in the context of the disease mechanisms connecting obesity with metabolic disorders.
title: Plasma proteomic signatures of adiposity are associated with cardiovascular risk factors and type 2 diabetes risk in a multi-ethnic Asian population

finding: The rs1479489847 SNP located in the SRRM1 gene showed an odds ratio of 4.17 in relation to hospitalization for COVID-19, indicating a significant association with increased risk.
title: Exome-wide association study to identify rare variants influencing COVID-19 outcomes: Results from the Host Genetics Initiative

finding: The rs911647797 SNP in the IL6R gene had an odds ratio of 6.19, suggesting a strong association with hospitalization due to COVID-19. This relationship underscored the biological relevance of this locus in the pathology of COVID-19.
title: Exome-wide association study to identify rare variants influencing COVID-19 outcomes: Results from the Host Genetics Initiative

finding: The missense variant rs11591147 in the PCSK9 gene showed a strong association with LDL cholesterol levels (β = 0.50, 95% CI [0.46, 0.53], p = 9 × 10^-143) and coronary artery disease (CAD) (allelic β = 0.50, 95% CI [0.46, 0.53], p = 9 × 10^-143) according to findings from the Global Lipids Genetics Consortium and CARDIoGRAMplusC4D consortium. Despite explaining only 0.86% of the overall variance in genotypes, this SNP was identified as an outlier of the component weight distribution for the PC14 principal component in PCSK9, indicating its strong contribution to LDL-c levels and CAD.
title: ExPheWas: a browser for gene-based pheWAS associations

finding: The variant rs4745 (p.D159V; PIP = 0.05 for DU; CADD score = 15.2) in the EFNA1 gene was identified as common in East Asian and European populations. It was associated with gastric cancer and was the lead variant of cis-splicing quantitative trait loci in the stomach.
title: East Asian-specific and cross-ancestry genome-wide meta-analyses provide mechanistic insights into peptic ulcer disease

finding: The SNP rs4390169 was found to be upstream of EFNA1 with a PIP = 0.06 for DU. It was recognized as the lead variant of cis-protein QTL in plasma for EFNA1 and was in high LD with rs4745 (r2 = 0.99).
title: East Asian-specific and cross-ancestry genome-wide meta-analyses provide mechanistic insights into peptic ulcer disease

finding: SNP rs2814778 was found to be associated with differences in baseline levels of high-sensitivity C-reactive protein (hs-CRP). However, this association was not statistically significant when adjusting for known CRP locus alleles in linkage disequilibrium with the Duffy gene, suggesting that elevated hs-CRP levels in Duffy null individuals resulted from the co-inheritance of those CRP alleles rather than a direct consequence of Duffy null status itself.
title: The Relationship of Duffy Gene Polymorphism, High Sensitivity C-Reactive Protein, and Long-term Outcomes

finding: SNP rs372257803, located in the splice region of ANGPTL3, had a demonstrable protective association with an odds ratio of 0.69 and was noted for its connection to lower non-HDL cholesterol and triglycerides.
title: Weighted burden analysis of rare coding variants in 470,000 exome-sequenced UK Biobank subject characterises effects on hyperlipidaemia risk

finding: The SNP rs2993439, located upstream of the LGR6 gene on Chromosome 1, exhibited a trend of genome-wide significant association with niacin response, specifically showing a p-value of 8.32E-08 and a beta coefficient of 3.066. This finding related to the total niacin flushing score in schizophrenia patients, indicating its potential significance in understanding schizophrenia's relationship with niacin response.
title: Causal associations between niacin bluntness and schizophrenia: a GWAS and Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs3010092, found in the intron of the LRG6 gene, also demonstrated a trend of genome-wide significant association with niacin response in schizophrenia patients, marked by a p-value of 8.32E-08 and a beta coefficient of 3.066. Similar to rs2993439, this finding was significant in the context of total niacin flushing scores, underscoring its relevance to schizophrenia research.
title: Causal associations between niacin bluntness and schizophrenia: a GWAS and Mendelian randomization study

finding: The meta-analysis suggested that the IL-10 -592 C>A polymorphism was associated with prostate cancer risk in the Caucasian population, showing significance in various models: allele contrast (OR=1.08), homozygote (OR=1.24), and dominant model (OR=1.10). No such association was observed in the Asian population.
title: Interleukin- 10 (IL-10) gene polymorphisms and prostate cancer susceptibility: evidence from a meta-analysis

finding: The rs72660908 variant was associated with Rhesus isoimmunization in pregnancy, exhibiting a strong recessive inheritance pattern linked to the deletion of the RHD gene. Homozygotes for this variant demonstrated a high odds ratio (OR=24.3), while heterozygotes did not show significant risk (OR=1.18).
title: Decoding Genetics, Ancestry, and Geospatial Context for Precision Health

finding: The rs6025 variant, known as Factor V Leiden (c.1601G>A, p.Arg534Gln), was associated with congenital deficiency of other clotting factors, yielding a strong odds ratio (OR=11.56). This indicates a pronounced impact on clotting-related diseases.
title: Decoding Genetics, Ancestry, and Geospatial Context for Precision Health

finding: SNP rs1040070, positioned within the LRRIQ3 gene at the TNNI3K locus, was detected as a novel contender for obesity risk, impacted by promoter interactions in specific cell types.
title: 3D genomic features across >50 diverse cell types reveal insights into the genomic architecture of childhood obesity

finding: The rs10493544 SNP also influenced the LRRIQ3 gene expression in NTERA2 cells, suggesting its regulatory importance in metabolic pathways associated with childhood obesity.
title: 3D genomic features across >50 diverse cell types reveal insights into the genomic architecture of childhood obesity

finding: The SNP rs2235529 at the WNT4 locus (1p36.12) was significant at a Bonferroni-corrected threshold with a p-value of 9.12x10^-8, linked to endometriosis.
title: Enhancing Genetic Association Power in Endometriosis through Unsupervised Clustering of Clinical Subtypes Identified from Electronic Health Records

finding: The SNP rs655853 at the DNM3 locus (1q24.3) demonstrated significance at a Bonferroni-corrected threshold with a p-value of 3.54x10^-5 in the context of endometriosis.
title: Enhancing Genetic Association Power in Endometriosis through Unsupervised Clustering of Clinical Subtypes Identified from Electronic Health Records

finding: Lead SNP rs7413471 was identified as a risk locus for PTSD and was highlighted in the study due to its functional relevance, as it was associated with non-coding RNA related to gene expression.
title: The genetic relationships between post-traumatic stress disorder and its corresponding neural circuit structures

finding: The intronic variant rs41264915 in the THBS3 gene was identified in a genome-wide association study as being associated with increased mucin-1 expression. This variant has been linked to critical outcomes in COVID-19 patients, indicating that increased levels of mucin-1 may be harmful and correlate with worse and more severe COVID-19 outcomes.
title: Eight-Fold Increased COVID-19 Mortality in Autosomal Dominant Tubulointerstitial Kidney Disease due to MUC1 Mutations: An Observational Study

finding: The SNP rs2282440, associated with Syndecan-3, was positively linked to metabolic syndrome in the Taiwanese population. This finding highlighted a genetic contribution to metabolic health and associated disorders.
title: Variability in proteoglycan biosynthetic genes reveals new facets of heparan sulfates diversity. A systematic review and analysis

finding: There was a significant difference found between the mixed PID cohort and controls for the <italic>FCGR2A</italic> H131R SNP (X² = 7.884, p = 0.019), indicating a link between this SNP and the development of primary immunodeficiency.
title: FCGR2A-131H/H is under-represented amongst patients with primary immunodeficiencies

finding: The SNP rs3397 in the TNF Receptor Superfamily 1B (TNFRSF1B) was linked to Mycobacterium avium paratuberculosis infection and osteoporosis in individuals with rheumatoid arthritis. This finding builds on previous studies indicating the relevance of TNFRSF1B polymorphisms in susceptibility to infections including those caused by MAP, which is of interest given its connection to autoimmune diseases like Crohn's disease.
title: Presence Of Infection By Mycobacterium Avium Subsp. Paratuberculosis In The Blood Of Patients With Crohn’s Disease And Control Subjects Shown By Multiple Laboratory Culture And Antibody Methods

finding: The lead variant rs11118288 was noted for its colocalization with the lead variant of a pulse rate locus, representing one of the novel loci found in the study. This association underscores the potential relevance of this variant to cardiovascular traits.
title: Unsupervised cardiac MRI phenotyping with 3D diffusion autoencoders reveals novel genetic insights

finding: The SNP rs12141375:A was found to explain 32.7% of the variance in plasma CHIT1 levels, making it a significant and strong cis-association signal in the context of protein levels.
title: Mapping genetic determinants of 184 circulating proteins in 26,494 individuals to connect proteins and diseases

finding: The SNP rs10889338, associated with DOCK7, was identified in the study's CC-liability method for hypercholesterolemia. This SNP was also noted to be significant in earlier GWAS studies, indicating its consistent role in cholesterol regulation.
title: Genetic association studies using disease liabilities from deep neural networks

finding: The SNP rs1674395504, located at chr1:224431591T>C, was associated with the Skraban-Deardorff syndrome and found to create an alternative splice acceptor site within the second intron of the WDR26 gene. Analysis of RNA sequencing data indicated that about 58% of junctions included this new acceptor site, suggesting that around half of the transcripts were alternatively spliced due to this variant. This finding was further supported by in-silico analysis that indicated a deleterious effect on splicing, corroborating the clinical significance and varied interpretations reported in ClinVar. Overall, this SNP contributed to the identification of splicing abnormalities and was validated as a significant finding related to Mendelian disorders.
title: RNA sequencing uplifts diagnostic rate in undiagnosed rare disease patients

finding: This SNP in an intergenic region on chromosome 1 showed a risk direction associated with the minor allele and reached study wide significance in association with cognitive measures.
title: Genome Wide Analysis Across Alzheimer’s Disease Endophenotypes: Main Effects and Stage Specific Interactions

finding: The SNP rs10753232 from the STX6 region associated with PSP, reflecting a p-value of 6.79 × 10^-10 and a beta value of 0.31.
title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Analysis Reveals New Susceptibility Loci and Structural Variants Associated with Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

finding: The SNP rs6687758 associated with DUSP10 was noted with p = 3.36 × 10^-6, demonstrating relevance to PSP.
title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Analysis Reveals New Susceptibility Loci and Structural Variants Associated with Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

finding: The lead SNP rs12026659 in DUSP10 was significant with a p-value of 9.48 × 10^-7.
title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Analysis Reveals New Susceptibility Loci and Structural Variants Associated with Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

finding: The SNP rs839764 in ELOVL1 showed suggestive evidence of association with a p-value of 7.94 × 10^-7.
title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Analysis Reveals New Susceptibility Loci and Structural Variants Associated with Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

finding: SNP rs12030534 was associated with optimal adjuvant strategies for resected pancreatic cancers through systematic reviews, contributing to the therapeutic framework.
title: Graph Attention Networks for Drug Combination Discovery: Targeting Pancreatic Cancer Genes with RAIN Protocol

finding: The rs1800896 SNP in the IL-10 gene was associated with COVID-19, suggesting that polymorphisms in this gene could influence susceptibility to SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: COVID-19 and non-Hodgkin’s lymphoma: a common susceptibility pattern?

finding: The SNP rs1805407 was identified as increasing sensitivity to PARP1 inhibitors in cancer cells. This finding suggested an improved therapeutic strategy for cancer treatment, although there was no direct mention of its relation to COPD-specific mortality in the presented context.
title: Disentangling Predictors of COPD Mortality with Probabilistic Graphical Models

finding: The SNP rs35937944, causing a p.Tyr212Cys mutation in COLGALT2, was significantly associated with arthrosis, evidenced by a P-value of 2×10^-14.
title: Leveraging large-scale multi-omics to identify therapeutic targets from genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs2228145 led to an Asp358Ala change in IL6R and was implicated in increased risk of coronary atherosclerosis, demonstrating its relevance in cardiovascular health.
title: Leveraging large-scale multi-omics to identify therapeutic targets from genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs6691952 was associated with RBS-R restricted with a p-value of 6.9 × 10^-8. This SNP is located within an intron of HHAT, which has previously been linked to schizophrenia.
title: Clinical autism subscales have common genetic liability that is heritable, pleiotropic, and generalizable to the general population

finding: The SNP rs6695837 was identified as having a functional polymorphism located at transcription factor binding sites near the LAMC1 gene, which conferred risk of colorectal cancer in Chinese populations. This finding highlighted the potential role of transcription factor binding in cancer susceptibility, particularly in the context of colorectal cancer.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Signaling Pathways Associated with the Progression of Glioblastoma multiform

finding: The SNP rs28633797 was identified as an intronic variant showing variance effects in the context of serum 25OHD concentrations but not mean effects, indicating it plays a role in the variability of 25OHD levels, likely linked to hematopoiesis and the anti-inflammatory properties of vitamin D.
title: Improved characterization of gene-environment interactions for vitamin D through variance quantitative trait loci

finding: The SNP rs6025, a missense variant in the F5 gene, was associated with the phenotypes of 'iatrogenic pulmonary embolism and infarction' and 'other venous embolism and thrombosis'. This finding was consistent with existing literature on venous thromboembolism and the biological pathways involved, demonstrating the potential of PheWAS to elucidate genetic influences on clinically relevant traits.
title: The UCLA ATLAS Community Health Initiative: promoting precision health research in a diverse biobank

finding: There was strong evidence associating interleukin-23 receptor concentrations with increased pancreatic cancer risk (OR 1.42, 95% CI 1.20-1.69, q-value=0.055). This SNP was in perfect linkage disequilibrium with a missense variant (rs11209026) but Mendelian randomization findings remained consistent when excluding this variant.
title: Association between circulating inflammatory markers and adult cancer risk: a Mendelian randomization analysis

finding: As rs11209026 was in perfect linkage disequilibrium (r2=1.0) with rs11581607, it contributed indirectly to the strong evidence found for interleukin-23 receptor concentrations' association with increased pancreatic cancer risk (OR 1.42, 95% CI 1.20-1.69, q-value=0.055).
title: Association between circulating inflammatory markers and adult cancer risk: a Mendelian randomization analysis

finding: The SNP rs146862216 (G>A) was identified as an eQTL in Trimester 1, where it had a beta estimate of -0.89 and an FDR of 3.88e-13, indicating a strong association with gene regulation. In contrast, it was not significant in Trimester 2 (beta=-0.03, P=0.71). This finding related to gene expression differences in early fetal development.
title: Cross-ancestry, cell-type-informed atlas of gene, isoform, and splicing regulation in the developing human brain

finding: The ieQTL relating to SNP rs17659437 was linked to the BRINP2 gene, with significant colocalization observed in a specific gene module associated with synaptic function and deep layer neurons in SCZ. This underscored the module's connections to neuropsychiatric disorders and development.
title: Cross-ancestry, cell-type-informed atlas of gene, isoform, and splicing regulation in the developing human brain

finding: The novel variant rs61817953, located near PIK3C2B, was associated with a decreased risk of overall HNSCC with an odds ratio of 0.90 (95% CI: 0.87, 0.93) and a p-value of 2.17×10^-8.
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: The SNP rs6679311, near MDM4, was associated with an increased risk of overall HNSCC, presenting an odds ratio of 1.11 (95% CI: 1.07, 1.14) and a p-value of 1.25×10^-10.
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: The rs1146473 variant was associated with an increased risk for spontaneous coronary artery dissection (SCAD), with an odds ratio of 1.32 (P=5.8 × 10⁻⁹). This SNP was linked to the tissue factor gene (F3), which plays a crucial role in the blood coagulation cascade. It was identified as a novel locus for SCAD, with evidence suggesting that the risk allele was associated with lower F3 expression in the arteries, providing insights into a potential biological mechanism for the development of SCAD.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis of spontaneous coronary artery dissection reveals common variants and genes related to artery integrity and tissue-mediated coagulation

finding: The SNP rs6679677 was identified as significantly associated (p=1.91 × 10⁻²⁴, OR=1.63) with pernicious anemia and was linked to the PTPN22 gene, an immune regulator associated with multiple autoimmune diseases.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies five risk loci for pernicious anemia and implicates the role of HLA-DR15 haplotype

finding: The missense variant rs1801133, related to the MTHFR gene, was tied to reduced enzymatic activity and higher homocysteine levels. In the study, it was linked to enQTL-colocalized events in CD8 cells associated with the gene KIAA2013, suggesting an interaction that impacts multiple diseases like colorectal cancer and Alzheimer's.
title: Genetic determinants of gene expression noise and its role in complex trait variation

finding: SNP rs742510 was identified as an intronic variant in DNM3, associated with substance use traits in this MTAG study.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: The SNP rs12071819 was associated with sex and gender disparities in melanoma. It was reported that this SNP significantly correlated with differences in melanoma outcomes and survival between males and females, which may have contributed to the observed survival differences in patients diagnosed with malignant melanoma in Hungary. This finding was part of a broader examination of genetic factors influencing melanoma susceptibility and survival.
title: SIGNIFICANT IMPROVEMENT IN MELANOMA SURVIVAL OVER THE LAST DECADE: A HUNGARIAN NATIONWIDE STUDY BETWEEN 2011–2019

finding: The SNP rs7531118 was identified as the most significant variant associated with depression (P = 3.20 × 10−31) and was located approximately 89 kb downstream of the NEGR1 gene. Functional genomic analysis suggested that this SNP affects the binding of transcription factors (CTCF), implicating its role in regulating NEGR1 expression in the context of depression.
title: Cross-ancestry genome-wide association study and systems-level integrative analyses implicate new risk genes and therapeutic targets for depression

finding: Found in the intron of CDC42-AS1, this SNP showed high colocalisation with cervical cancer risk, indicating its contribution to shared genetic signals.
title: GWAS meta-analysis and gene expression data link reproductive tract development, immune response and cellular proliferation/apoptosis with cervical cancer and clarify overlap with other cervical phenotypes

finding: This SNP flanked the TSS of LINC00339, reinforcing its role in cervical cancer inception and was part of credible sets linked to disease risk.
title: GWAS meta-analysis and gene expression data link reproductive tract development, immune response and cellular proliferation/apoptosis with cervical cancer and clarify overlap with other cervical phenotypes

finding: Also located in TSS flanking regions of LINC00339 and CDC42, this SNP indicated regulatory potential influencing cervical cancer pathways.
title: GWAS meta-analysis and gene expression data link reproductive tract development, immune response and cellular proliferation/apoptosis with cervical cancer and clarify overlap with other cervical phenotypes

finding: This SNP was noted for overlap with enhancer marks, implicating it in transcriptional regulation relevant to cervical cancer.
title: GWAS meta-analysis and gene expression data link reproductive tract development, immune response and cellular proliferation/apoptosis with cervical cancer and clarify overlap with other cervical phenotypes

finding: Identified as overlapping with enhancer marks as well, providing further insight into cancer susceptibility through its regulatory mechanisms.
title: GWAS meta-analysis and gene expression data link reproductive tract development, immune response and cellular proliferation/apoptosis with cervical cancer and clarify overlap with other cervical phenotypes

finding: SNP rs11583641 was noted for mediating decreased DNA methylation at the COLGALT2 enhancer, subsequently increasing expression of <italic>COLGALT2</italic> in lesioned cartilage (meta-Φ=0.54, FDR=0.00132).
title: Allelic expression imbalance in articular cartilage and subchondral bone refined genome-wide association signals in osteoarthritis

finding: SNP rs12023991, in high linkage disequilibrium with rs11583641, demonstrated an upregulation effect on <italic>COLGALT2</italic>, indicating a potential mechanism of gene expression regulation relevant to OA.
title: Allelic expression imbalance in articular cartilage and subchondral bone refined genome-wide association signals in osteoarthritis

finding: Variant rs4379719 was correlated with increased motor decline and had a significant effect estimate upon its removal, indicating the detrimental effect of insomnia on motor progression in Parkinson's disease. This variant was also associated with an increase in naps, which may have contributed to its pleiotropic effects.
title: Relationship between sleep and progression of Parkinson’s disease – A Mendelian randomization study

finding: The variant rs11591147, known as a protective loss-of-function mutation in PCSK9, was associated with total cholesterol (p=3.0×10^-4), reinforcing its role in cholesterol regulation.
title: Novel protein-altering variants associated with serum apolipoprotein and lipid levels

finding: The SNP rs2229682 was identified as part of a credible set of eQTLs that were associated with the SLC2A1 gene. This analysis provided a connection to the regulation of SLC2A1 expression in the context of depression, contributing to the understanding of depression risk related to the SLC2A1 gene.
title: Whole exome sequencing in the UK Biobank reveals risk gene SLC2A1 and biological insights for major depressive disorder

finding: The SNP rs11537641 was also included in the credible set of eQTLs linked to the SLC2A1 gene. Similar to rs2229682, it played a role in revealing how regulatory variations could affect SLC2A1 expression, hence supporting its association with depression risk.
title: Whole exome sequencing in the UK Biobank reveals risk gene SLC2A1 and biological insights for major depressive disorder

finding: The SNP rs1136410 (Val762Ala in PARP1) was associated with a reduced risk of DNMT3A-CHIP, with an odds ratio of 0.88 (P = 1.88 x 10^-15), suggesting its protective role.
title: Exome sequencing of 628,388 individuals identifies common and rare variant associations with clonal hematopoiesis phenotypes

finding: The rs140190628 variant in TIE1 was noted for increasing the risk of mCAaut phenotype with an odds ratio of 8.5 (P = 4.5 x 10^-23), showing its contribution to risk elevation.
title: Exome sequencing of 628,388 individuals identifies common and rare variant associations with clonal hematopoiesis phenotypes

finding: The variant rs142117073 in PTPRF was also related to increased risk of mCAaut phenotype (OR = 16.47; P = 3.89 x 10^-8), signifying its impact on health risks.
title: Exome sequencing of 628,388 individuals identifies common and rare variant associations with clonal hematopoiesis phenotypes

finding: In contrast to earlier findings, this SNP was not supported by analysis in the full cohort, showing no significant effect on cardiovascular disease among CHIP carriers.
title: Exome sequencing of 628,388 individuals identifies common and rare variant associations with clonal hematopoiesis phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs2479867[T] in the <italic>SPTA1</italic> locus was tested for replication and showed a significant association with mean corpuscular hemoglobin concentration and reticulocyte volume.
title: Analysis of MRI-derived spleen iron in the UK Biobank identifies genetic variation linked to iron recycling and erythrocyte morphology

finding: The rs1801133 variant in the MTHFR gene was found to be more prevalent in PD patients who possessed 32-52% Native American ancestry compared to controls, with an OR of 2.02 (p=0.043). This variant has only been reported in the Mexican population, indicating that unique genetic factors may affect PD incidence in this group.
title: MEX-PD: A National Network for the Epidemiological & Genetic Research of Parkinson’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs12092716 was identified as having a significant association with the development of radiation-induced hypothyroidism (RIHT) in patients with head and neck cancers who underwent intensity-modulated radiation therapy (IMRT). The context of this finding related to the study's analysis of radiomic features and metrics, where the SNP was analyzed alongside imaging biomarkers to improve NTCP models for predicting RIHT.
title: Prediction of radiation-induced hypothyroidism using radiomic data analysis does not show superiority over standard normal tissue complication models

finding: At the GJA5 locus, the significant proxy SNP rs12037169 was linked to the axial rate of progression in Parkinson's disease, with a Beta of -0.25 and a P-value of 3.93e-10.
title: Association of genetic variation at the GJA5/ACP6 locus with motor progression in Parkinson’s

finding: There was weak evidence suggesting that the Factor V Leiden (rs6025) variant was associated with a slightly reduced risk of colorectal cancer, with an odds ratio of 0.94 (95% CI 0.89 - 1.00, P=0.04). This implies a potential biological interaction independent of thrombosis.
title: Causal relationships between risk of venous thromboembolism and 18 cancers: a bidirectional Mendelian randomisation analysis

finding: The SNP rs301817 was associated with total brain volume when using a 47-SNP instrument for habitual daytime napping. The finding indicated that this genetic variant contributed to a larger total brain volume, supporting the main results of the study.
title: Is there an association between daytime napping, cognitive function and brain volume? A Mendelian randomisation study in the UK Biobank

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with motor progression in PD (p < 5 x 10^-8) and was identified within the MORN1 gene.
title: Genome-wide determinants of mortality and motor progression in Parkinson’s disease

finding: This SNP, near KRTCAP2 and tagging the GBA1 p.E326K variant, was significantly associated with mortality (p=3.6 x 10^-4).
title: Genome-wide determinants of mortality and motor progression in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The analysis showed that the diplotype combination of 677CC and 1298AC significantly increased the risk of breast cancers with an odds ratio of 2.553 (95% CI: 1.177-5.541). This finding indicates a unique association of the MTHFR 677C/T SNP with breast cancer susceptibility, reflecting its impact on enzymatic activity and disease risk in the studied South-Asian population.
title: Independent, Diplotype and Haplotype Association Analyses of the Selected MTHFR SNPs with the Risk of Breast Cancers in a South-Asian Population

finding: The SNP rs9436127 was identified in a study associated with chronic pain, specifically within a locus that contained one independent signal, contributing to the understanding of shared genetic backgrounds in multiple chronic pain conditions.
title: Decomposing the genetic background of chronic back pain

finding: The RHD weak D type 4.0 allele (rs1053355) was found in a homozygous state in 10 individuals within the Middle Eastern population. This allele is responsible for the weak expression of the D antigen and was noted to be frequently mistyped as D- in serological tests, indicating its clinical significance in transfusion settings.
title: A comprehensive characterization of blood group antigen variants in the Middle Eastern population genomes - Insights into genetic epidemiology

finding: The rare low-frequency antigen Cw+ (Rh8 - rs138268848) was identified in about 0.17% of the Middle Eastern population, with 0.13% in the Iranome dataset and 0.36% in the Greater Middle Eastern Variome. This antigen is associated with severe transfusion implications, including the hemolytic disease of the newborn when mismatched.
title: A comprehensive characterization of blood group antigen variants in the Middle Eastern population genomes - Insights into genetic epidemiology

finding: The variant rs12075 was identified as a missense variant in the ACKR1 gene, which negatively impacted chemokine binding efficiency. This impairment resulted in elevated circulating levels of chemokines such as CCL2/MCP-1, CCL7/MCP-3, CCL11/eotaxin-1, CXCL1/GROa, and CXCL8/IL-8. The finding was related to the role of ACKR1 as a scavenger receptor modulating cytokine bioavailability, thereby influencing inflammatory responses. Additionally, the study indicated a potential compensatory increase in ACKR1 expression due to the elevated levels of its ligands.
title: The Genomic Architecture of Circulating Cytokine Levels Points to Drug Targets for Immune-Related Diseases

finding: The variant rs72744832, an intronic variant in LMOD1, was associated with transient global amnesia (TGA) with an odds ratio of 1.41. This genetic variant did not show associations with other diseases but was linked to lean mass phenotypes in the UK Biobank. Despite LMOD1 having high observed expression in arterial tissues, quantitative trait analysis did not indicate that rs72744832 was involved in regulating LMOD1's expression.
title: Genetics of transient amnesia highlights a vascular role in memory

finding: The SNP rs4265380 was prioritized as a trans pQTL variant for IL22RA2, linking it to the IL-22 signaling pathway which is significant in the context of atopic dermatitis. It was located at the RUNX3 locus and indicated potential involvement in inflammatory responses.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome-Wide Association Meta-Analysis Identifies Novel Loci in Atopic Dermatitis

finding: The SNP rs12041051 was identified as linked to pancreatic cancer, revealing a relationship with radiomics characteristics that predict tumor behavior and survival rates. The correlation suggested that this locus might play a role in determining the tumor's structural diversity and, consequently, the prognosis for patients.
title: radioGWAS: link radiome to genome to discover driver genes with somatic mutations for heterogeneous tumor image phenotype in pancreatic cancer

finding: The rs60642321 SNP acted in cis with CFHR1 plasma levels, previously reported in blood. It was part of a highly linked pair of SNPs at the CFHR4 locus.
title: Integrative genetic and immune cell analysis of plasma proteins in healthy donors identifies novel associations involving primary immune deficiency genes

finding: The common variant rs2504780 was associated with a decrease in Ficolin-3 levels and is located upstream of the FCN3 gene, implicating it in Ficolin-3 deficiency and associated immunodeficiency diseases.
title: Integrative genetic and immune cell analysis of plasma proteins in healthy donors identifies novel associations involving primary immune deficiency genes

finding: The ARID1A gene variant rs114165349 showed associations with variations in serum levels of 17 biomarkers, indicating its importance across multiple traits.
title: Mapping Epigenetic Gene Variant Dynamics: Comparative Analysis of Frequency, Functional Impact and Trait Associations in African and European Populations

finding: This SNP was noted for influencing gene expression related to FCGR2B/FCRLB, suggesting its relevance in immune response mechanisms, although specific effects were not detailed in the provided context.
title: Genetic factors affecting immune phenotypes in type 1 diabetes

finding: This SNP was associated with IL10, suggesting its important role in modulating cytokine production relevant to T1D pathogenesis.
title: Genetic factors affecting immune phenotypes in type 1 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs4660756 was identified in association with ADHD through the ADuLT method. The closest gene to this SNP is ST3GAL3, which had previously been associated with both educational attainment and ADHD.
title: ADuLT: An efficient and robust time-to-event GWAS

finding: The rs3768321 variant, linked to the gene PABPC4, was associated with a reduction in the risk for heart failure with preserved ejection fraction (HFpEF). This result was consistent with MR findings, showing reduced levels of BMI, risk of type 2 diabetes mellitus, and an increase in HDL-C levels.
title: Large-scale Mendelian randomization identifies novel pathways as therapeutic targets for heart failure with reduced ejection fraction and with preserved ejection fraction

finding: This SNP was linked to the deletion at chr1:146485371-147995694 and had a reported p-value of 0.0001 in a GWAS of general intelligence. The region was important for cognitive development and was associated with neurodevelopmental disorders and intellectual disability, validating the connection to cognitive performance.
title: The copy number variant architecture of psychopathology and cognitive development in the ABCD® study

finding: The lead SNP rs6701496 was associated with the INAVA gene, showing a significant odds ratio (OR = 0.91, p = 1.03 x 10^-8) for anterior uveitis. This association was strongest in the FinnGen cohort (OR = 0.90, p = 2.99 x 10^-7) and was linked to inflammatory bowel disease and various colitis types.
title: Genome-wide association study of anterior uveitis

finding: SNP rs296520, a missense variant in linkage disequilibrium with rs6701496, was associated with inflammatory bowel disease (p = 3.66 x 10^-11) and other immune-related phenotypes, highlighting its role in the innate immunity context.
title: Genome-wide association study of anterior uveitis

finding: The SNP rs145759877, located near the OR2L13 and NLRP3 genes, revealed a strong association with anterior uveitis (OR = 6.49, p = 3.7 x 10^-19), driven mainly by FinnGen data, pointing to its involvement in inflammation and immune regulation.
title: Genome-wide association study of anterior uveitis

finding: The Asp358Ala SNP (rs2228145) was tested as a single instrument in the analysis of IL6R blockade. It had a known functional effect on IL6R and downstream effects. The overall results indicated that blockade of IL6R was causally associated with reduced incidence of sepsis, improved critical care admission outcomes, and decreased mortality in sepsis, which were comparable in magnitude to similar findings in severe COVID-19 cases.
title: Therapeutic potential of IL6R blockade for the treatment of sepsis and sepsis-related death: Findings from a Mendelian randomisation study

finding: The SNP rs76859653 was associated with lower one-year APE scores in breast cancer patients who carried the minor alleles compared to non-carriers and control groups. This locus is located intronically within the HMCN1 gene on chromosome 1, which is thought to have connections to immune function and cancer pathways.
title: Genetic variants associated with longitudinal cognitive performance in older breast cancer patients and controls

finding: The rs12117661 SNP was determined to be a strong eQTL for PCSK9 expression with a noteworthy association (p = 8.31E-11). This finding extended the analysis of genetic factors potentially mediating statin effects on depression through lipid-lowering pathways.
title: Using Genomic data to Investigate the Anti-Depressive Effects of Statins

finding: Colocalization analysis suggested that the sQTL at chr1:172398537:A:G and rs143863391 influenced PIGC expression, highlighting its potential role in POAG risk.
title: Integrating genetic regulation and single-cell expression with GWAS prioritizes causal genes and cell types for glaucoma

finding: This variant colocalized with a sQTL acting on PIGC, indicating its potential role in increasing POAG risk.
title: Integrating genetic regulation and single-cell expression with GWAS prioritizes causal genes and cell types for glaucoma

finding: Identified as a low-frequency SNP that passed genome-wide significance, this variant indicated potential association with POAG outcomes.
title: Integrating genetic regulation and single-cell expression with GWAS prioritizes causal genes and cell types for glaucoma

finding: This SNP was associated with a finding of significance in the context of genomic studies related to POAG.
title: Integrating genetic regulation and single-cell expression with GWAS prioritizes causal genes and cell types for glaucoma

finding: The variant rs6689226 was identified as the most significant novel association with anxiety disorders (ANX) in the EUR-specific genome-wide association study (GWAS), with a beta value of 0.01 and a p-value of 4.8×10^-12. It was located in an intergenic region downstream of the LINC01360 gene, which has previously been linked to various mental health outcomes.
title: Gene Discovery and Biological Insights into Anxiety Disorders from a Multi-Ancestry Genome-wide Association Study of >1.2 Million Participants

finding: The SNP rs2476601 (R620W) in the PTPN22 locus was significantly associated with type 1 diabetes risk specifically in individuals of European ancestry, with its association being among the strongest noted in the study. This finding aligned with previous reports that documented its relation to earlier onset age of type 1 diabetes within this population.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide association study in type 1 diabetes

finding: SNP rs6679677 in linkage disequilibrium with rs2476601 was recognized in the PTPN22 locus and was part of a strong association with type 1 diabetes risk in European ancestry individuals, confirming earlier findings.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide association study in type 1 diabetes

finding: The intronic variant rs61777963 (c.643-7G>T) was reported to manifest an association with alcoholic chronic pancreatitis (CP), showing a small protective effect with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.59 (95% CI 0.39 to 0.89; P = 0.01) based on an analysis of 120 alcoholic CP patients. However, this finding was called into question due to a small sample size, as no significant association was found in a cohort of 105 non-alcoholic CP patients (OR = 0.84, P = 0.4). Further analyses in the current study showed no significant association between alcohol-related CP patients and controls (OR = 1.01, P = 1.0, allele frequency: 17.2% in patients vs. 17.1% in controls), leading to the conclusion that the original protective association was likely spurious.
title: The reversion variant (p.Arg90Leu) at the evolutionarily adaptive p.Arg90 site in CELA3B predisposes to chronic pancreatitis

finding: The rs1205 SNP, a T-Dominant genotype variant in the CRP gene, was associated with COVID-19 death or hospitalization. This association demonstrated a nominally significant odds ratio of 1.859 (95% CI 1.001-3.453, p=0.049) after adjustments for age, sex, center, body mass index, and cardiovascular disease history. The association was particularly strong in a younger subset of the population. This highlighted the impact of the CRP variant on COVID-19 morbidity and mortality outcomes.
title: Genetic Variant rs1205 is Associated with COVID-19 Outcomes: The Strong Heart Study and Strong Heart Family Study

finding: The SNP rs5779595 was part of a female-specific locus within the LRMDA gene on chromosome 10, with a significant p-value of 4.04 x 10^-8, indicating its association with widespread pain in females.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Widespread Pain in the UK Biobank (N=172,230)

finding: The intronic variant rs61768001 in WNT4 was associated with female infertility across three categories: F-ALL, F-EXCL, and F-INCL, with corresponding odds ratios of 0.909, 0.923, and 0.870, indicating a protective effect against infertility.
title: Genome-wide analyses identify 21 infertility loci and over 400 reproductive hormone loci across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: An ROH diplotype was associated with eczema/dermatitis at chr1:151515188-151902494. This finding was significant as it overlapped with the GWAS finding of rs4845604 located at chr1:151829204, indicating a potential link between the ROH and this dermatological condition.
title: Discovery of runs-of-homozygosity diplotype clusters and their associations with diseases in UK Biobank

finding: The analysis revealed mutations in the MUTYH gene (snp rs34612342), which are linked to an increased risk of colorectal cancer. This discovery highlighted another participant's genetic risk, allowing for the possibility of tailored preventive strategies.
title: Cohort profile: The I AM Frontier prospective cohort study in Flanders

finding: This stop-gained variant (p.Arg501Ter) was associated with a significant lead variant impacting atopic dermatitis, although fine-mapping suffered from being treated as a single causal variant.
title: Meta-analysis fine-mapping is often miscalibrated at single-variant resolution

finding: The variant rs1801274 was associated with IgGFcRII-b, which has been implicated in autoimmune diseases.
title: Genetic regulation of the plasma proteome and its link to cardiometabolic disease in Greenlandic Inuit

finding: This SNP was among the lead SNPs in the most significant locus at chromosome 1p31.3, with a P-value of 2.14×10^-32, indicating its strong association with TBS and bone microarchitectural deterioration.
title: Genetic Determinants of Bone Microarchitecture and its Association with Health Outcomes: A Genome-wide Association and Mendelian Randomization Study on Trabecular Bone Score

finding: This SNP was also identified as a lead SNP in the significant locus 1p31.3, confirming its association with TBS and highlighting its relevance to bone microarchitecture.
title: Genetic Determinants of Bone Microarchitecture and its Association with Health Outcomes: A Genome-wide Association and Mendelian Randomization Study on Trabecular Bone Score

finding: As another lead SNP in locus 1p31.3, rs7554551 was significantly correlated with TBS in the study, emphasizing its role in genetic factors influencing bone microarchitecture.
title: Genetic Determinants of Bone Microarchitecture and its Association with Health Outcomes: A Genome-wide Association and Mendelian Randomization Study on Trabecular Bone Score

finding: The variant in F5 was protective for pulmonary embolism, demonstrating a relationship with reduced plasma F5 levels.
title: Genetic associations of protein-coding variants in human disease

finding: The intergenic variant was connected to AF through association with a low frequency missense variant in METTL11B, indicating its role in cardiac conditions.
title: Genetic associations of protein-coding variants in human disease

finding: The missense variant in METTL11B was associated with increased atrial fibrillation risk, demonstrating its potential as a causal variant.
title: Genetic associations of protein-coding variants in human disease

finding: The SNP rs553741 was identified as a key variant showing strong evidence of association with prostate cancer (PrCa) risk through genetic colocalization analysis. It had a colocalization posterior probability (CLPP) of 0.103, suggesting it may be a shared causal variant between liver-specific PCSK9 expression and PrCa risk, thereby linking it to the overall findings of the study.
title: Genetically proxied PCSK9 inhibition provides indication of lower prostate cancer risk: a Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs61748535 was identified as part of a compound heterozygous mutation in family 9. It was linked to the missense mutation c.574G>A; p.(Ala192Thr), which showed clinical significance and was predicted to be probably damaging and disease-causing according to PolyPhen-2 and MutationTaster, although SIFT reported it as tolerated.
title: ABCA4-Related Retinopathies in Lebanon: a novel mutation and significant heterogeneity

finding: The SNP rs61749417 was also part of the compound heterozygous mutations identified in family 9. It corresponded to the missense mutation c.1927G>A; p.(Val643Met), classified as a rare variant and predicted to be probably damaging and disease-causing by PolyPhen-2 and MutationTaster.
title: ABCA4-Related Retinopathies in Lebanon: a novel mutation and significant heterogeneity

finding: The SNP rs1800553 was found in family 31 associated with a homozygous missense mutation c.5882G>A; p.(Gly1961Glu). It was noted as a rare occurrence with damaging predictions across PolyPhen-2, SIFT, and MutationTaster, therefore confirmed to be disease-causing.
title: ABCA4-Related Retinopathies in Lebanon: a novel mutation and significant heterogeneity

finding: The SNP rs61751383 was linked to a homozygous nonsense mutation c.6088C>T; p.(Arg2030Ter) found in family 37. This mutation was predicted to be disease-causing by MutationTaster and damaging by SIFT, reaffirming its significance.
title: ABCA4-Related Retinopathies in Lebanon: a novel mutation and significant heterogeneity

finding: The SNP rs61751398 was discovered in a homozygous missense mutation c.3259G>A; p.(Glu1087Lys) in family 58. This mutation indicated a rare occurrence and was predicted to be likely damaging by PolyPhen-2 and disease-causing by MutationTaster, corroborating its involvement in IRD.
title: ABCA4-Related Retinopathies in Lebanon: a novel mutation and significant heterogeneity

finding: The SNP rs2789422 was associated with the protein Transgelin-2, which shared genetic variants with MI risk as identified in the colocalization analysis.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian Randomization Analysis Identified Potential Drug Targets for Myocardial Infarction

finding: The SNP rs11591147 was linked to the PCSK9 protein, which was shown to share genetic variants with MI risk in the colocalization analysis.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian Randomization Analysis Identified Potential Drug Targets for Myocardial Infarction

finding: The SNP rs472495 was identified in association with the PCSK9 protein and was found to contribute to MI risk in the colocalization analysis.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian Randomization Analysis Identified Potential Drug Targets for Myocardial Infarction

finding: The SNP rs505151 was associated with the PCSK9 protein and shared variants connected to MI risk as identified in the colocalization analysis.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian Randomization Analysis Identified Potential Drug Targets for Myocardial Infarction

finding: The SNP rs58255540 was identified as having shared variants associated with MI risk through its relation to the PCSK9 protein in the colocalization analysis.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian Randomization Analysis Identified Potential Drug Targets for Myocardial Infarction

finding: The study assessed GBA1 at rs35749011 and found that heterozygous and homozygous 'A' alleles were associated with a genetic risk for neurodegenerative diseases, underscoring the role of GBA1 mutations in increasing susceptibility to conditions like Parkinson's disease.
title: Gut-Brain Nexus: Mapping Multi-Modal Links to Neurodegeneration at Biobank Scale

finding: At GBA1 N370S, the analysis showed that individuals with heterozygous and homozygous 'C' alleles at rs76763715 were linked to a greater genetic risk for neurodegenerative disorders, reinforcing the relevance of GBA1 variants in understanding disease susceptibility.
title: Gut-Brain Nexus: Mapping Multi-Modal Links to Neurodegeneration at Biobank Scale

finding: The rs7525578 SNP near the RAP1A gene showed the most significant association with AF, registering a p-value of 1.24×10⁻²⁶. This finding was novel and indicated that RAP1A might be implicated in the fibrosis mechanism associated with AF.
title: Identification of two new genetic loci associated with atrial fibrillation in the Taiwanese population-implication of metabolism and fibrosis in atrial fibrillation mechanism

finding: The variant rs2230288 (E326K) was part of the aggregated GBA carrier status, which was associated with increased odds of Parkinson's disease (PD). This finding related to genetic susceptibility as it indicated that carriers exhibited reduced GCase activity, potentially influencing their risk for PD.
title: Gene-environment interactions for Parkinson’s disease

finding: The variant rs75548401 (T369M) was included in the GBA carrier status, similarly associating with increased odds of PD. Like E326K, this variant contributed to a significant reduction in GCase activity, being relevant to the genetic basis of PD risk.
title: Gene-environment interactions for Parkinson’s disease

finding: The variant rs76763715 (N370S) also formed part of the GBA carrier status, exhibiting an association with increased odds of PD. This SNP, along with others, was noted for causing decreased GCase activity, thereby impacting the likelihood of developing PD.
title: Gene-environment interactions for Parkinson’s disease

finding: The rs10157379 variant was positively associated with the presence of SARS, SARS severity, and severe critical COVID-19 outcomes, specifically indicating that the CT genotype was linked to increased SARS symptoms.
title: In COVID-19, NLRP3 inflammasome genetic variants are associated with critical disease and these effects are partly mediated by the sickness symptom complex: a nomothetic network approach

finding: The rs10754558 variant was significantly associated with SSC and revealed that the CG genotype was inversely associated with SSC severity. This variant was also positively related to critical COVID-19 outcomes through mediating effects of SSC severity.
title: In COVID-19, NLRP3 inflammasome genetic variants are associated with critical disease and these effects are partly mediated by the sickness symptom complex: a nomothetic network approach

finding: This intergenic SNP located between long intergenic non-coding RNA RP4-710M16.2 and the PPAP2B gene was associated with time until relapse to heavy drinking (THR) in patients treated with naltrexone, showing a hazard ratio (HR) of 2.90 and a p-value of 3.9E-08.
title: Genetic Contributions to Alcohol Use Disorder Treatment Outcomes: A Genome-wide Pharmacogenomics Study

finding: The missense variant rs188273166 in the SLC30A10 gene was linked to higher corrected T1 liver iron levels, with an effect of 63.72 milliseconds (ms), equivalent to an effect size of 1.18 s.d. units and P-value of 2.1 × 10^-22, supporting its role in manganese metabolism.
title: Mapping rare protein-coding variants on multi-organ imaging traits

finding: The SNP rs12730036, located in the IL6R region, was identified with a significance level of P = 5.61 × 10−8. It was suggested to have a potential role in pneumonia given its proximity to an interleukin receptor, highlighting its possible biological relevance to the disease.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of pneumonia suggests a role for mucin biology and provides novel drug repurposing opportunities

finding: The variant rs112106699 near DHRS3 was identified as a potentially novel locus that displayed significant association in African ancestry cohorts but was rare in European ancestries, highlighting the importance of multi-ancestry analysis.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS for venous thromboembolism identifies novel loci followed by experimental validation in zebrafish

finding: The SNP rs12071817 was identified within the context of a study that investigated emerging molecular diagnostic and prognostic features in adult diffuse gliomas. It was found that mutations in MUC17, which included this SNP, correlated with poorer prognosis in glioblastoma (GBM) and non-GBM glioma cohorts.
title: MUC17 mutations and methylation are associated with poor prognosis in adult-type diffuse glioma patients

finding: This SNP related to the cardiac-specific RYR2 gene, where GxE interactions with smoking were observed, highlighting contributions from ICD codes I25.1 and I25.9, which could indicate increased ischemic heart disease risk due to potential interactions.
title: Improving Genetic Association Studies with a Novel Methodology that Unveils the Hidden Complexity of All-Cause Heart Failure

finding: The SNP rs10789158 located at 1p31.1 showed a borderline significant association with AML (P = 2.25 × 10^-7, OR 1.22, 95% CI 1.13-1.31) and linked to CACHD1.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies susceptibility loci for acute myeloid leukemia

finding: The study found a significant association of rs10900585 with severe malaria (SM) in a Senegalese population, where the TT genotype was identified as the risk genotype (OR=1.94, P=0.029). This association was validated in a meta-analysis showing OR=1.12 under a genetic dominant model.
title: Identification of ATP2B4 regulatory element containing functional genetic variants associated with severe malaria

finding: rs11240734 was significantly associated with SM (P=0.002), with an OR of 2.52. Most SM individuals carried the TT genotype. The association remained significant even after adjusting for age.
title: Identification of ATP2B4 regulatory element containing functional genetic variants associated with severe malaria

finding: This SNP was found to be significantly associated with SM (P=0.002; OR=2.52). The analysis indicated strong linkage disequilibrium with other candidate SNPs, reinforcing the association.
title: Identification of ATP2B4 regulatory element containing functional genetic variants associated with severe malaria

finding: There was a significant association between rs1541253 and SM (P=0.002; OR=2.52). Similar to other SNPs, it was part of a cluster showing strong linkage disequilibrium indicating a shared regulatory mechanism.
title: Identification of ATP2B4 regulatory element containing functional genetic variants associated with severe malaria

finding: rs1541254 demonstrated significant association with SM (P=0.002; OR=2.52). It was identified in strong linkage with other candidate SNPs and was part of a regulatory cluster affecting ATP2B4 expression.
title: Identification of ATP2B4 regulatory element containing functional genetic variants associated with severe malaria

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with SM (P=0.002; OR=2.52) and showed strong linkage disequilibrium with the other SNPs within the regulatory region of ATP2B4.
title: Identification of ATP2B4 regulatory element containing functional genetic variants associated with severe malaria

finding: Confirmed as a regulatory SNP, rs10751450 showed a significant association with SM (P=0.016; OR=2.07). It was located within a regulatory region potentially influencing ATP2B4 expression.
title: Identification of ATP2B4 regulatory element containing functional genetic variants associated with severe malaria

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with SM (P=0.002; OR=2.49). It was also part of a regulatory region and was shown to influence ATP2B4 expression.
title: Identification of ATP2B4 regulatory element containing functional genetic variants associated with severe malaria

finding: rs10751452 exhibited a significant association with SM (P=0.006; OR=2.27). Like its counterparts, it belonged to the same regulatory region influencing ATP2B4.
title: Identification of ATP2B4 regulatory element containing functional genetic variants associated with severe malaria

finding: The common coding variant rs10927887 was implicated in heart failure and its functional characterization revealed loss-of-function in the ClC-K<sub>a</sub> chloride channel, suggesting a relationship with a Bartter syndrome-like cardio-renal axis in heart failure.
title: Multi-ancestry Multivariate Genome-Wide Analysis Highlights the Role of Common Genetic Variation in Cardiac Structure, Function, and Heart Failure-related Traits

finding: The finding associated with rs6127 (p.Asp603Asn) was significant in male patients who were homozygous for this variant. This mutation in the SELP gene increased the propensity for clot formation, thereby making these patients more susceptible to COVID-19-related thrombosis. The relevance of this finding pointed toward potential therapeutic interventions involving anti-Selectin P antibodies, which are already approved for other conditions.
title: Common, low-frequency, rare, and ultra-rare coding variants contribute to COVID-19 severity

finding: The <italic>CR1</italic> variant (chr1:207629207:A:C) was identified as co-segregating with common variants within EFIGA families, suggesting its importance in Alzheimer's disease.
title: Identification of Rare Damaging Missense and Loss of Function Variants in GWAS Loci Using Genome Sequencing Data from Two Cohorts of Familial Late-Onset Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This SNP was confirmed to be nominally significant for pancreatic cancer risk (P<3.84×10^-5) and was among the previously reported loci validated in the current meta-analysis.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel GP2 gene risk variants for pancreatic cancer in the Japanese population

finding: It was identified as nominally significant in the context of pancreatic cancer in this study, corroborating earlier associations from other investigations.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel GP2 gene risk variants for pancreatic cancer in the Japanese population

finding: The SNP rs11121880 was identified in a study by Chroni et al. (2019) as a significant marker related to the pathways of tumor migration using a Bayesian approach. This finding contributed to understanding how specific genetic variations are involved in the migration of cancer cells from primary tumors to metastases, highlighting the role of genetic mutations in establishing metastasis.
title: PathFinder: Bayesian inference of clone migration histories in cancer

finding: The frequency of the A allele in rs14103 (C1orf212) in Amami-Oshima island (0.791) was significantly lower than in the Hondo cluster (0.855) with a p-value of 0.022, while showing no significant difference from Kikai island and other mentioned populations.
title: Genetic lineage of the Amami islanders inferred from classical genetic markers

finding: The SNP rs12071811 was identified as significantly contributing to the proliferative classification of HER2-positive breast cancer cell lines when analyzed in conjunction with other genomic data from the study. This finding aligned with the context of the metastatic behaviors observed, specifically indicating a link to brain proliferation abilities in certain HER2-positive cell lines, as previously reported.
title: Metastatic profiling of HER2-positive breast cancer cell lines in xenograft models

finding: The SNP rs4645978 in the CASP9 gene was associated with high breast cancer risk, indicating that CASP9 contributes to breast cancer development. This finding was derived from a study that specifically investigated CASP9 mutations and their implications for breast cancer.
title: Using Published Pathway Figures in Enrichment Analysis and Machine Learning

finding: Similar to rs4645978, the SNP rs4645981 in the CASP9 gene was associated with an increased risk of breast cancer, suggesting that mutations in CASP9 are linked to breast cancer development. This was highlighted in research focused on the impact of CASP9 SNPs in breast cancer patients.
title: Using Published Pathway Figures in Enrichment Analysis and Machine Learning

finding: The SNP rs11249433 in NOTCH2 was linked to increased expression in breast cancer patient data. This association suggested that the polymorphism may contribute to the development of ER+ luminal tumors, as demonstrated through the research conducted by Fu et al.
title: Using Published Pathway Figures in Enrichment Analysis and Machine Learning

finding: The SNP rs28411352 was found to overlap with an SE associated with the MTF1 gene. Significantly, MTF1 expression was shown to be induced under proinflammatory conditions, highlighting the therapeutic relevance of this SNP in RA.
title: Parsing multiomics landscape of activated synovial fibroblasts highlights drug targets linked to genetic risk of rheumatoid arthritis

finding: The SNP rs4526602 was identified as the top-ranked and most significantly associated SNP for the monocyte percentage blood trait. It was located in an intergenic region between the genes AIM1L and CD52, with the closest gene's transcription start site being UBXN11. Gene expression analysis showed that CD52 was the only gene with a significant decrease in expression (log2 fold-change = -1.92, SCEPTRE p-value = 4.5×10^-12) following perturbation.
title: Discovery of target genes and pathways of blood trait loci using pooled CRISPR screens and single cell RNA sequencing

finding: The SNP rs3093077 showed strong evidence of interaction with both body mass index (BMI) and HbA1c. It was associated with elevated levels of C-reactive protein (CRP), indicating that BMI modified the genetic influence of this variant on CRP.
title: Genetic effect modification of cis-acting C-reactive protein variants in cardiometabolic disease status

finding: Similar to rs3093077, rs1205 displayed a significant interaction with BMI and HbA1c, reinforcing the association of this SNP with increased CRP levels. The results indicated that the effect of rs1205 on CRP levels was influenced by an individual's BMI.
title: Genetic effect modification of cis-acting C-reactive protein variants in cardiometabolic disease status
