finding: The SNP rs10158878, located 20 kb upstream of the LACTBL1 gene, was associated with refractive error, indicating potential involvement in eye-related functions and traits.
title: Vision-related convergent gene losses reveal SERPINE3’s unknown role in the eye

finding: The SNP rs12071791 was associated with inflammatory cytokine production related to apoptosis and pyroptosis mechanisms in breast cancer cells. It was noted to influence IL-1β levels, which connects to the findings surrounding NOXA and MCL-1 interactions, revealing its potential role in regulating cell death pathways.
title: NOXA/MCL-1 axis determines cell-death decision between apoptosis and pyroptosis and the inflammatory secretome of breast cancer cells treated with anti-mitotics

finding: The study indicated that the SNP rs12092644 was associated with the density of tumor adjacent tertiary lymphoid structures (TA-TLSs) in patients undergoing BCG therapy for NMIBC. Specifically, individuals categorized as BCG non-responders exhibited a higher density of TA-TLSs, suggesting a potential genetic influence on immune responses and disease progression linked to B cell activity.
title: Carcinogen induced expansion of atypical B cells and pre-treatment tumor adjacent tertiary lymphoid structures associate with poor response to BCG in non-muscle invasive bladder cancer

finding: The SNP rs2821230 was identified as having a significant interactive effect near known obesity-related genes via the Latent Interaction Testing method.
title: Identifying latent genetic interactions in genome-wide association studies using multiple traits

finding: The SNP rs2820444 exhibited a significant interactive effect linked to the LYPLAL1 gene, reinforcing its impact on obesity traits.
title: Identifying latent genetic interactions in genome-wide association studies using multiple traits

finding: Intronic to MARC1, this SNP colocalised with cholesterol levels but was not directly linked to liver fat.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI

finding: The variant rs609320 (Ala226Pro) was noted for having a 99% concordance in inferring E and e antigen expression, indicating its significance in blood typing.
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: The variant rs141398055 (Arg201Thr) was identified in a discordant sample and linked to weak E expression; its frequency was notably higher in the Omani population.
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: The variant rs12075 (Gly42Asp) contributed to a 96% concordance in the inference of Duffy blood group antigens Fy(a) and Fy(b).
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: The variant rs2814778 was used to infer the silent ES allele in the Duffy blood group, together with rs12075, resulting in a concordance of 96%.
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: The rs34599082 variant (Arg89Cys) was found in discordant individuals who were genetically inferred as Fy(a-b+) but reported as Fy(a-b-), influencing Duffy group phenotype inference.
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: The SNP rs1805407, located in the PARP1 gene, was associated with increased sensitivity to PARP1 inhibitors in cancer cells. This finding suggested a potentially improved therapeutic strategy for cancers where PARP1 is targeted, highlighting the role of this SNP in influencing treatment outcomes.
title: Towards Hierarchical Causal Representation Learning for Nonstationary Multi-Omics Data

finding: This SNP was identified as a primary signal at the PROX1 locus, associated with tissue-shared regulation effects in pancreatic islets (TOA=0.50) and liver (TOA=0.49).
title: A multi-omic integrative scheme characterizes tissues of action at loci associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: Identified as a potential outlier for total breast cancer risk and its association with various phenotypes.
title: Coffee consumption and risk of breast cancer: a Mendelian Randomization study

finding: The homozygous missense G->C mutation at base 1692 of the CTPS1 gene (rs145092287) altered an intronic splice acceptor site. Although this mutation did not affect the catalytic activity of CTPS1, it caused a significant loss of CTPS1 protein abundance, estimated to be between 80-90%. This deficiency was associated with a high prevalence of B-cell driven EBV-associated diseases, indicating a potential link to EBV-driven lymphomas in individuals with CTPS1 deficiency. Despite having normal total T and B-cell numbers, these patients exhibited a reduced frequency of memory B-cells, which are critical for EBV persistence.
title: Epstein-Barr Virus Induced Cytidine Metabolism Roles in Transformed B-cell Growth and Survival

finding: The rs61837569 variant was identified as a trimodal QTL showing association with TLR5, involving effects on contact, accessibility, and gene expression.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: The SNP rs35479618 was strongly associated with systolic blood pressure (BP), with a reported association of 0.0617 SD change in BP per change in SNP dosage. Additionally, it had an association with coronary artery disease (CAD) quantified as an odds ratio of 0.0652 associated with SNP dosage change. Using Mendelian randomisation, the estimated causal effect of BP on CAD was determined to be 1.06, indicating a log odds ratio for the occurrence of CAD per one-standard-deviation increase in BP.
title: Causal Inference on Neuroimaging Data with Mendelian Randomisation

finding: The SNP rs12061670 was associated with the acquisition of cisplatin resistance in HNSCC. It was found that resistance led to a shift in the cancer's metabolism toward the neutralization of oxidative stress, which was a significant factor in the aggressive behavior of HNSCC.
title: Tobacco smoke exposure is a driver of altered oxidative stress response and immunity in head and neck cancer

finding: For rs2814778, the finding noted that this SNP yielded significant association for the traits NEU, WBC, and MON, selected due to being the lowest p-value SNP from chromosome 1 in the multi-ancestry context.
title: Interpreting SNP heritability in admixed populations

finding: The variant rs2476601 in the PTPN22 gene caused a missense mutation (Cys1858Thr) and was linked to Crohn's disease but not ulcerative colitis. It contributed to shared genetic signals for increased Crohn's disease risk and decreased white blood cell (WBC) count, highlighting a specific clinical association with Crohn’s disease.
title: Genetic colocalization atlas points to common regulatory sites and genes for hematopoietic traits and hematopoietic contributions to disease phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs12040857 was linked to the structure and function of tunneling nanotubes in cancer. It was identified as being significant in the formation of these structures, which have been observed to play a critical role in tumor microenvironments, enhancing the interactions between tumor cells and macrophages during cancer progression.
title: Macrophages Promote Tumor Cell Extravasation across an Endothelial Barrier through Thin Membranous Connections

finding: The study indicated that the rs1137101 variant of the LEPR gene was significantly associated with bladder cancer. This finding was part of a larger investigation into the role of serum leptin receptor levels and genetic variants in the context of bladder cancer, highlighting the importance of genetic factors in cancer susceptibility.
title: Integrating genetic and gene expression data in network-based stratification analysis of cancers

finding: The SNP rs4360494 was found to disrupt the CTCF motif on the maternal allele, leading to reduced CTCF binding as well as the loss of cohesin (RAD21) binding in the GM12878 cell line. Despite similar chromatin accessibility on both alleles, this SNP was identified as a GWAS SNP associated with colon cancer and cardiometabolic traits, highlighting its significance in genetic studies related to these phenotypes.
title: A genome wide code to define cell-type specific CTCF binding and chromatin organization

finding: For the CR1 locus, rs6701713 was identified as a causal variant validated by massively parallel reporter assays (MPRA) with a p-value of 8 × 10⁻³³ and by CRISPR in microglia with a p-value of 2.9 × 10⁻³. The variant was correctly identified by CIT-Lasso as a putative causal variant.
title: Beyond guilty by association at scale: searching for causal variants on the basis of genome-wide summary statistics

finding: The study by Lv et al. (2020) identified that the SNP rs12071074 was pivotal in the delineation and grading of actual crop production units within modern smallholder areas utilizing remote sensing data. This finding demonstrated its relevance in improving agricultural practices and resource management through enhanced spatial data interpretation.
title: Model-based prediction and ascription of deforestation risk within commodity sourcing domains: Improving traceability in the palm oil supply chain

finding: The SNP rs12061489 was linked to the regulation of C-Src in relation to cardiac fibroblast responses, as presented in a study by Belli et al. In this context, C-Src's role was highlighted in signaling pathways that could impact the effectiveness of anti-fibrotic therapies, suggesting potential therapeutic implications for targeting this locus in cardiac fibrosis management.
title: Logic-based mechanistic machine learning on high-content images reveals how drugs differentially regulate cardiac fibroblasts

finding: SNP rs2485997, located within the ST3GAL3 gene, was identified as a significant SNP linked to intelligence and educational attainment. It was mentioned in the context of a notable association with AGG, having a P-value of 2.48E-06.
title: Genetic Association Study of Childhood Aggression across raters, instruments and age

finding: The SNP rs3791116 was noted for its role in the IPO13 gene, associated with intelligence and educational attainment, and had a P-value of 1.19E-05, indicating relevance to AGG.
title: Genetic Association Study of Childhood Aggression across raters, instruments and age

finding: The SNP rs12082209 was identified as a significant finding in the context of non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) and was associated with the therapeutic efficacy of miR-489 in overcoming drug resistance. This finding emphasized the role of polymorphisms in microRNA-related pathways in cancer therapeutics, particularly in overcoming resistance to treatment.
title: Development of a 5-FU Modified miR-129 Mimic as a Therapeutic for Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer

finding: This variant, located at the MEF2D gene locus within a SMC peak, was associated with peak accessibility and increased MEF2D RNA expression.
title: Cell-specific chromatin landscape of human coronary artery resolves regulatory mechanisms of disease risk

finding: This missense variant in PRDM16 was noted for its coding effects alongside significant links to CAD-associated risks.
title: Cell-specific chromatin landscape of human coronary artery resolves regulatory mechanisms of disease risk

finding: In the study by González-Rivero et al. (2020), it was found that the use of artificial intelligence in conjunction with citizen science provided a feasible and cost-effective approach to monitor coral reefs. This SNP was associated with advancements in technology aimed at enhancing coral reef conservation efforts.
title: Broadscale reconnaissance of coral reefs from citizen science and deep learning

finding: The SNP rs4657473, located in an AluJb repeat downstream of the TMCO1 gene, was identified as protective for primary open-angle glaucoma (POAG) specifically in African American populations. This finding was supported by a study published in the British Journal of Ophthalmology in 2019.
title: Deep Learning-based Identification of Intraocular Pressure-Associated Genes Influencing Trabecular Meshwork Cell and Organelle Morphology

finding: The SNP rs12123810 was identified in relation to the paradoxical effects of PARP inhibitor BGP-15 on irinotecan-induced cachexia and skeletal muscle dysfunction, showcasing a genetic factor influencing chemotherapy's effects on muscle integrity as reported by Campelj et al. (2020).
title: Haptoglobin and glutamine synthetase may biomark cachexia induced by anti-acute myeloid leukemia chemotherapy

finding: SNP rs61781314 was female-specific and showed association with Eggerthella and its pathogenic implications in diseases like type 2 diabetes.
title: M-GWAS for the gut microbiome in Chinese adults illuminates on complex diseases

finding: The SNP rs114697636 was associated with fertility-related processes influencing the age at first sexual intercourse (AFS). It was linked to the expression of the gene NUP210L, which showed a significant expression in prefrontal cortex neurons of individuals carrying the G allele. This SNP exhibited a minor allele frequency of 3% and a strong linkage disequilibrium with the lead AFS SNP, rs113142203, indicating that variations in this locus may affect behavioral aspects related to fertility and reproductive timing.
title: Identification of 370 genetic loci for age at first sex and birth linked to externalising behaviour

finding: The SNP rs113142203 was identified as a lead SNP associated with age at first sexual intercourse (AFS). This SNP's genetic contribution was highlighted in the context of intrinsic biological processes that influence fertility, aligning with findings related to the gene NUP210L and its role in both reproductive biology and behavior.
title: Identification of 370 genetic loci for age at first sex and birth linked to externalising behaviour

finding: The SNP rs3748817 correlated with mTOR signaling pathways and affected MS-associated gene expression, suggesting its importance in the regulation of muscle strength and pathways associated with neurological health.
title: Shared regulatory pathways reveal novel genetic correlations between grip strength and neuromuscular disorders

finding: In the context of Ewing sarcoma, the SNP rs12040948 was associated with the developmental context of the disease as revealed by mass-scale transcriptomics. Specifically, it was linked to the permissibility characteristics of the EWSR1-FLI1 fusion protein, which is crucial in the pathogenesis of Ewing sarcoma.
title: Modeling Progression of Single Cell Populations Through the Cell Cycle as a Sequence of Switches

finding: The SNP rs12071811 was identified in the study conducted by Kuroiwa et al. (2020) which focused on the proliferative classification of HER2-positive breast cancer cell lines. The findings suggested that this SNP had a correlation with the drug response of cell lines that closely resembled patient tumor samples, thereby providing insights into personalized medicine approaches for treating breast cancer.
title: Finding the best cell lines across pan-cancer to use in pre-clinical research as a proxy for patient tumor samples considering immune cells, multi-omics, and cancer pathways

finding: The rs11588763 SNP was identified as a trans pQTL connected to metabolic processes with genes related to mitochondrial function, illustrating its regulatory impact on protein levels pertinent to AF.
title: Tissue-specific multiOMICs analysis of atrial fibrillation

finding: The rs2477599 SNP was fine-mapped as a putative causal splicing variant for ERO1B, where it caused an exon skipping event leading to a truncated protein associated with T2D risk. It demonstrated significant sTWAS T2D associations.
title: Genetic regulation of RNA splicing in human pancreatic islets

finding: Intronic variant rs1254190 showed a significant T2D association in the FinnGen biobank study. Although it was only moderately linked to rs2477599, it contributed to T2D susceptibility through variations affecting ERO1B.
title: Genetic regulation of RNA splicing in human pancreatic islets

finding: The SNP rs35383942 was identified as a predicted deleterious missense variant (Arg28Gln, CADD=24.3) in the gene PHLDA3, which is associated with breast cancer. PHLDA3 functions as a tumor suppressor by inhibiting AKT1, an oncogene important for cell proliferation and survival.
title: Open Targets Genetics: An open approach to systematically prioritize causal variants and genes at all published human GWAS trait-associated loci

finding: The synonymous variant rs2228079 was the only credibly causal variant for an eQTL that altered ADORA1 expression in whole blood and colocalized with asthma in the UK Biobank (H4>0.99). ADORA1, encoding a type of adenosine receptor, is a known drug target for asthma treatment with Theophylline.
title: Open Targets Genetics: An open approach to systematically prioritize causal variants and genes at all published human GWAS trait-associated loci

finding: The splice region variant rs11589479 caused an increase in ADAM15 expression across various states of monocytes and colocalized with Crohn's disease (H4=0.99). ADAM15 plays a significant role in inflammatory bowel disease by affecting leukocyte trans-migration and regeneration of colonic mucosa.
title: Open Targets Genetics: An open approach to systematically prioritize causal variants and genes at all published human GWAS trait-associated loci

finding: The SBP GWAS identified SNP rs6687360, which was strongly associated with AGT expression in kidney tubules; the study showed T allele dosage increased AGT expression, indicating significant PT cell-type dependent regulation.
title: Mapping the genetic architecture of human traits to cell types in the kidney identifies mechanisms of disease and potential treatments

finding: The SNP rs3010994 was positively associated with cancer development, particularly in relation to the regulation of the p53 gene as described in the study by Ozaki and Nakagawara (2011). This finding indicated a significant role of p53 in cell death pathways and its implications in human cancers, linking genetic variations at this locus to tumor biology and malignancy.
title: Adaptation of human cell populations to different levels of centriole amplification involves a two-step response

finding: The SNP rs12061482 was identified in the study by Junca et al. (2020) as a significant marker for the detection of colorectal cancer and advanced adenomas through liquid biopsy methods. This finding highlighted the potential of using circulating tumor DNA (ctDNA) in capturing genomic alterations associated with precancerous lesions, thereby emphasizing its role in enhancing diagnostic accuracy for colorectal cancer screening.
title: Machine learning guided signal enrichment for ultrasensitive plasma tumor burden monitoring

finding: Identified as a top result in the ADHD-ASD GWAS meta-analysis (p = 7.61 x 10^-11) with strong m-values (> 0.9) for both disorders, indicating a significant shared genetic risk.
title: Cross-disorder GWAS meta-analysis for Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder, Autism Spectrum Disorder, Obsessive Compulsive Disorder, and Tourette Syndrome

finding: Showed significant association in the ADHD-OCD meta-analysis (p = 5.25 x 10^-11) with high m-value for ADHD (m = 1), suggesting it may have a role in the genetic architecture between these two disorders.
title: Cross-disorder GWAS meta-analysis for Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder, Autism Spectrum Disorder, Obsessive Compulsive Disorder, and Tourette Syndrome

finding: This SNP was highlighted in the ADHD and TS analysis, demonstrating a significant p-value of 2.30 x 10^-12, indicating a strong influence from ADHD on the association.
title: Cross-disorder GWAS meta-analysis for Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder, Autism Spectrum Disorder, Obsessive Compulsive Disorder, and Tourette Syndrome

finding: Associated with ADHD and TS (p = 4.07 x 10^-12, m-values indicating high probability for shared effects), contributing to evidence for overlapping genetic risk.
title: Cross-disorder GWAS meta-analysis for Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder, Autism Spectrum Disorder, Obsessive Compulsive Disorder, and Tourette Syndrome

finding: The SNP rs12123696 was associated with the orchestration of immune and tumor interaction networks via extracellular vesicles. This finding underscored the role of this SNP in mediating tumor-stroma interactions, which could play a significant part in the progression and metastatic potential of HCC.
title: Modelling liver cancer microenvironment: novel 3D culture system as a potential anti-cancer drug screening tool

finding: The SNP rs12123789 was linked to the neural networks recapitulation in cancer cells, a process that was implicated in disease progression. This SNP's association suggested a role in the modulation of cancer-neuronal crosstalk, reflecting the functional interplay between cancer progression and neuronal pathways.
title: The SWI/SNF PBAF complex facilitates REST occupancy at repressive chromatin

finding: The SNP rs12071760 was implicated in the context of MHC Class I downregulation in cancers. It was found that lower MHC-I expression was associated with MYC signaling in triple negative breast cancer (TNBC) cases. This finding related to the observed immune evasion by MYC-elevated tumors, and represented a significant insight into how specific genetic variations might impact immunotherapy response in cancer patients.
title: Combinatorial Immunotherapies Overcome MYC-Driven Immune Evasion

finding: Found as a trans pQTL in the IL15 signalling pathway, this rare missense mutation was associated with receptor components IL15RA and IL15RB.
title: Genetic regulation of the human plasma proteome in 54,306 UK Biobank participants

finding: Associated as a trans pQTL with MASP1 levels, this low-frequency frameshift variant resulted in MASP1 deficiency.
title: Genetic regulation of the human plasma proteome in 54,306 UK Biobank participants

finding: This missense variant in MASP2 was linked to reduced FCN2 levels, indicating a potential MASP2 deficiency.
title: Genetic regulation of the human plasma proteome in 54,306 UK Biobank participants

finding: The allele C of rs4916219 located in the PRDX6 gene was identified as a risk haplotype for systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) through <italic>cis</italic>-eQTL analysis utilizing GWAS data from Japanese and Asian SLE patients. This finding suggested a significant association between this SNP and the expression levels of PRDX6, implicating it in the pathogenesis of SLE and highlighting its potential role as a genetic marker for the disease.
title: Immune cell multi-omics analysis reveals contribution of oxidative phosphorylation to B cell functions and organ damage of lupus

finding: The SNP rs1205 was identified within a NP-specific enhancer region and was known to be associated with C-reactive protein levels. This finding suggested that rs1205 may play a role in defining the enhancer landscape pertinent to NASH-prone individuals.
title: Super-enhancer signature reveals key mechanisms associated with resistance to non-alcoholic steatohepatitis in humans with obesity

finding: The SNP rs11121846 was associated with HPV insertions in anal squamous cell carcinomas, as reported in the study highlighting mechanistic signatures of human papillomavirus insertions.
title: SearcHPV: a novel approach to identify and assemble human papillomavirus-host genomic integration events in cancer

finding: SNP rs72699833 was identified as a core SNP in skin community 147, enriched for SNPs associated with breast cancer. It showed significant associations in both <italic>cis</italic> to gene PHGDH, involved in serine metabolism and linked to poorer outcomes in cancer patients, and through <italic>trans</italic> to multiple genes (LAD1, COL17A1, KRT10, LGALS7B, and FERMT1) which are implicated in epithelial development and related to breast cancer progression.
title: Nongenic cancer-risk SNPs affect oncogenes, tumor suppressor genes, and immune function

finding: SNP rs11249433 was associated with an increased risk of developing breast cancer and was linked in linkage disequilibrium with rs72699833. This association was found within the context of a community enriched for genes involved in epithelium development, linking it to significant cancer-related pathways.
title: Nongenic cancer-risk SNPs affect oncogenes, tumor suppressor genes, and immune function

finding: The SNP rs11552449 was reported to have a high probability (59.7%) of being an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) in both tumor and normal tissues. This finding was part of a study that aimed to analyze susceptibility loci associated with complex traits.
title: Primo: integration of multiple GWAS and omics QTL summary statistics for elucidation of molecular mechanisms of trait-associated SNPs and detection of pleiotropy in complex traits

finding: The GWAS SNP rs2992756 was associated with expression, methylation, and global protein abundance levels of the cis-gene KLHDC7A. It had a high probability (94.2%) of being associated with all four omics traits, although it showed only a moderate association with gene expression in normal breast tissue, underscoring the importance of analyzing QTLs under varied conditions.
title: Primo: integration of multiple GWAS and omics QTL summary statistics for elucidation of molecular mechanisms of trait-associated SNPs and detection of pleiotropy in complex traits

finding: The SNP rs12082181 was associated with the adaptation of pancreatic cancer cells to AKT inhibition, indicating a significant role in regulating stemness in these cells amidst AKT signaling disruption.
title: Down-regulation of AKT proteins slows the growth of mutant-KRAS pancreatic tumors

finding: The SNP rs1136410 resulted in the V762A missense mutation in the HD region of PARP1, which was associated with reduced enzymatic activity of PARP1. This variant was linked to lung cancer and follicular lymphoma, indicating its significant implications in cancer susceptibility. It was noted for serving as a protective factor against breast cancer and coronary artery disease in the Han Chinese population, while also posing an increased risk for age-related cataracts and other cancers.
title: Computational Compensatory Mutation Discovery Approach: Predicting a PARP1 Variant Rescue Mutation

finding: The MTHFR rs1801133 variant was associated with increased risk for Coronary Artery Disease (CAD), pointing to its influence on homocysteine metabolism and cardiovascular health.
title: Screening key genes and signaling pathways in COVID-19 infection and its associated complications by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: Similar to rs1801133, the MTHFR rs2274976 SNP was found to be linked with the risk of Coronary Artery Disease (CAD), indicating a shared pathway in cardiovascular disease susceptibility.
title: Screening key genes and signaling pathways in COVID-19 infection and its associated complications by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The KCNA3 rs2821557 variant was associated with the severity of Multiple Sclerosis, indicating a genetic link to neurological conditions.
title: Screening key genes and signaling pathways in COVID-19 infection and its associated complications by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The variant rs262680 demonstrated a monotonic increase in the frequency of the non-reference allele in Northwest Europe, suggesting that this variant may have undergone positive selection during certain historical phases.
title: DORA: an interactive map for the visualization and analysis of ancient human DNA and associated data

finding: The SNP rs12040694 was associated with the assessment of Giant Kelp (Macrocystis pyrifera) forests and intertidal green algae using Sentinel-2 imagery. This finding highlighted the importance of high-resolution global mapping for understanding kelp forest dynamics and responding to environmental changes.
title: Kelpwatch: A new visualization and analysis tool to explore kelp canopy dynamics reveals variable response to and recovery from marine heatwaves

finding: The SNP rs11576137 acted as a meQTL for the CpG site cg13058819, which is located in the SLC35F3 gene. It was associated with diverticular disease, IBD, ulcerative colitis, and Crohn's disease, showing a significant link to methylation changes that may influence these gastrointestinal diseases.
title: Linking the gut microbiome to host DNA methylation by a discovery and replication epigenome-wide association study

finding: The SNP rs6700162 was identified as a middle dynamic eQTL associated with inter-individual variation in gene expression. Specifically, it was linked to fibroblast cell type proportions and cardiac muscle cell proportions in the heart left ventricle (HLV) with p-values less than 0.0009 and 0.003, respectively, as derived from GTEx data. Additionally, it exhibited a trans eQTL p-value of 1x10^-5 in coronary artery tissues. This finding highlighted the utility of embryoid bodies (EBs) in uncovering dynamic regulatory processes that were not detectable in static adult tissues.
title: Human embryoid bodies as a novel system for genomic studies of functionally diverse cell types

finding: The SNP rs12041050 was identified in the context of DNA damage and repair mechanisms associated with cancer, specifically noted within the research of Alhmoud et al. (2020). This finding highlighted the significant role this SNP may play in the pathology of cancers, linking it to alterations in DNA damage management.
title: coRIC map: a framework for the exploration of multifaceted subcellular RNA-binding proteins

finding: Linked with the eGene TYW3 and CRYZ in relation to cis-pQTL interaction, implicating its role in protein expression modulation in the context of geographic atrophy.
title: Transcriptomic and proteomic retinal pigment epithelium signatures of age-related macular degeneration

finding: The variant rs1062976 was identified as associated with mRNA stability of <italic>SCYL3</italic> (stQTL, FDR = 5e-07) but showed no association with its expression (eQTL, FDR > 0.1). Thus, this genetic variant affects mRNA stability without influencing the transcription rate.
title: Genetic variants associated mRNA stability in lung

finding: The SNP rs6603785 was identified as a cis-eQTL located on enhancer chr1:1186391-1186507, which positively impacted the expression of the tumor suppressor gene TNFRSF18 in thyroid carcinoma (THCA). It was significant that the mutation from base A to T led to notable differences in the expression levels among different genotypes (p<1.76e-4). Additionally, miR-200a, a target of the enhancer, was shown to be highly relevant to the survival of thyroid cancer patients, where low expression of miR-200a corresponded with reduced survival time. This finding highlighted the role of miR-200 in regulating epithelial stromal transformation in thyroid cancer.
title: Genome-wide identification and analysis of enhancer regulated microRNAs across 31 human cancers

finding: This variant was associated with an increase in protein abundance of coagulation factor F3. It was absent in non-Finnish European ancestry individuals. The variant’s derived allele significantly influenced thrombosis-related outcomes, warranting further evaluation for pharmacological implications.
title: A survey of proteomic variation across two ethnic groups in Nigeria and its relationship to obesity risk

finding: The SNP rs642961 was associated with risk for non-syndromic orofacial cleft, as determined by data derived from a multi-species conserved sequence analysis.
title: Analysis of zebrafish periderm enhancers facilitates identification of a regulatory variant near human KRT8/18

finding: The SNP rs872376 on chromosome 1 was associated with the parietal operculum cortex in relation to regional grey matter volume.
title: Genetic signatures of human brain structure: A comparison between GWAS and relatedness-based regression

finding: Linked to type 2 diabetes through its phenome-wide significance, emphasizing its metabolic role.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: Associated with breast cancer, suggesting convergent evolutionary pathways impacting cancer susceptibility.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: Co-localized with GWAS peaks for systemic lupus erythematosus; disruption of MYC motifs was observed, emphasizing its role in regulation.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: In strong LD with SNPs for multiple sclerosis and RA, disrupting important TF binding motifs, implicating its role in immune cell pathways.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: Disruptions found in its ASM region point to a functional relationship with multiple sclerosis.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The SNP rs12092351 was associated with an increase in intracellular Ca<sup>2+</sup> concentration in metastatic breast cancer cells. Specifically, in the triple-negative MDA-MB-231 cells and Her2<sup>+</sup> SKBR3 cells, Na<sup>+</sup> depletion led to significant alterations in [Ca<sup>2+</sup>]<sub>i</sub>, supporting a role for the SNP in calcium signaling in breast cancer contexts.
title: Sodium regulates PLC and IP3R-mediated calcium signalling in invasive breast cancer cells

finding: The lead eVariant rs11589479 was associated with the expression levels of the ADAM15 gene's isoform ENST00000271836.10_1. This eQTL signal was found to disrupt the splice donor site for exon 19, leading to significantly reduced expression of this exon in heterozygous and homozygous alternative alleles, with an approximate 80% reduction in expression compared to surrounding exons.
title: Fine mapping spatiotemporal mechanisms of genetic variants underlying cardiac traits and disease

finding: Identified as the lead eVariant for ACTN2, this SNP might regulate pulse rate through altered expression of the gene, related to observed associations with heart failure.
title: Fine mapping spatiotemporal mechanisms of genetic variants underlying cardiac traits and disease

finding: The SNP rs12040822 was highlighted in research by Saleh et al. concerning therapy-induced senescence. This SNP was related to responses in ovarian cancer treatments, emphasizing its potential role in understanding drug resistance mechanisms faced in the treatment of HGSC.
title: Coordinated protein modules define DNA damage responses to carboplatin at single cell resolution in human ovarian carcinoma models

finding: The SNP rs6688233 was associated with the regulation of BMI and BMI-adjusted waist-hip ratio (WHR), pinpointing GPR157 as a related gene involved in these adiposity traits.
title: Genome-wide analysis of promoter contacts identifies novel regulators of late-stage adipogenesis

finding: The SNP rs599839 was initially identified as explaining approximately 1% of the phenotypic variation in circulating LDL levels. However, in the new analysis using BANNs, its effect size was reported to be shrunk towards 0, indicating it had lesser significance compared to rs4970834.
title: Multi-scale Inference of Genetic Trait Architecture using Biologically Annotated Neural Networks

finding: The SNP rs4970834 was linked to LDL levels with a posterior inclusion probability (PIP) of 0.95, confirming its role in explaining 1% of the phenotypic variation in circulating LDL levels as previously reported.
title: Multi-scale Inference of Genetic Trait Architecture using Biologically Annotated Neural Networks

finding: The SNP rs2295079 was identified as a specific TF-SNP-Gene interaction where the transcription factor MAX binds to it to regulate the expression of the MTOR gene in Whole Blood. The expression of MAX significantly decreased with age. Notably, this SNP was not captured by the GTEx eQTL study but was supported by various epigenetic marks indicating its potential functional role.
title: A transcription-centric model of SNP-Age interaction

finding: The variant rs1142888 accounted for the over 2.8-fold higher levels of GBP7 expression in Europeans compared to Africans, highlighting its role in immune response variability.
title: Environmental and genetic drivers of population differences in SARS-CoV-2 immune responses

finding: The introgressed variant rs11119346, specific to East Asians, was found to downregulate TRAF3IP3, which encoded a negative regulator of the cytosolic RNA-induced IFN response after IAV infection.
title: Environmental and genetic drivers of population differences in SARS-CoV-2 immune responses

finding: Variants rs569414 and rs1559828 at the DR1 locus exhibited high levels of population differentiation and were linked to reduced expression of DR1, which suppresses type I IFN responses.
title: Environmental and genetic drivers of population differences in SARS-CoV-2 immune responses

finding: Similar to rs569414, the SNP rs1559828 at the DR1 locus presented with strong population differentiation linked to COVID-19 severity.
title: Environmental and genetic drivers of population differences in SARS-CoV-2 immune responses

finding: It demonstrated significant chromatin contacts with CR1, a well-known locus related to Alzheimer's disease (AD).
title: A Semi-Supervised Ensemble Approach to Rank Potential Causal Variants and Their Target Genes in Microglia for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: It showed chromatin contacts with CR1L, contributing to the understanding of genetic variants associated with AD.
title: A Semi-Supervised Ensemble Approach to Rank Potential Causal Variants and Their Target Genes in Microglia for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs12030565 was associated with variations in landbird stopover distributions, which were influenced by broad-scale weather patterns during flight. This finding highlighted the relationship between meteorological conditions and migratory behavior, suggesting that specific weather conditions could have profound effects on bird mortality due to building collisions.
title: What causes bird-building collision risk? Seasonal dynamics and weather drivers

finding: A significant association was identified between rs72703203 in CELSR2 and high cholesterol (p=1.5×10⁻¹⁷, OR=0.85, 95% CI: 0.81-0.88). This SNP has been linked to cholesterol levels in prior studies.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank study

finding: In the WNT4 locus, rs3820282 was identified as the likely causal variant. It was previously demonstrated that the T allele of this SNP disrupts the binding of estrogen receptor 1 (ESR1), demonstrating its relevance to gestational duration.
title: Transcriptome and regulatory maps of decidua-derived stromal cells inform gene discovery in preterm birth

finding: The SNP rs1762920 on BTA28 underwent massive shifts in allele frequency in three breeds: RAN, SIM, and GEL. It resulted in highly significant q-values, indicating a strong association with year-of-birth phenotypes, reflecting rapid shifts in allele frequency consistent with significant adaptive changes in those populations.
title: Powerful detection of polygenic selection and environmental adaptation in US beef cattle populations

finding: The rs2745557 SNP in the PTGS2 gene was associated with an increased risk of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) development in a Tunisian cohort, demonstrating its potential as a biomarker for COPD.
title: Identification of key genes and biological pathways in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs12123566 was associated with the effects of combined CDK2 and CDK4/6 inhibition in breast cancer. Specifically, the analysis indicated that this SNP may influence the senescence response to palbociclib and indisulam treatments. The original study demonstrated that cells with the specified genetic background could show enhanced sensitivity to senescence-inducing therapies, which highlighted its importance in overcoming palbociclib resistance in metastatic breast cancer.
title: Indisulam synergizes with palbociclib to induce senescence through inhibition of CDK2 kinase activity

finding: The SNP rs12123716 was associated with phenotypic heterogeneity in melanoma, as described in the context of the study demonstrating the role of MITF in regulating ECM composition and organization, which in turn influenced tumor microarchitecture and mechanotransduction. This finding highlighted the importance of tumor cell-ECM interactions and its effects on tumor heterogeneity and response to therapy, relevant to the understanding of cancer cell plasticity and stemness.
title: Phenotypic melanoma heterogeneity is regulated through cell-matrix interaction-dependent changes in tumor microarchitecture

finding: This SNP was associated with alcohol intake frequency, with interactions observed that aligned with behavioral influences on BMI.
title: Leveraging phenotypic variability to identify genetic interactions in human phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs12030757 was associated with LRRC15 expression, which was noted to play a role in mediating the interactions between the spike protein of SARS-CoV-2 and human cells. The findings indicated that LRRC15 is expressed in tissues that exhibit high levels of ACE2, suggesting a potential modulatory effect on SARS-CoV-2 infection. This SNP's original discovery contributed to the understanding that LRRC15 acts as a host factor in the context of COVID-19.
title: LRRC15 mediates an accessory interaction with the SARS-CoV-2 spike protein

finding: The SNP rs11121946 was associated with increased levels of exosomal Thrombospondin-1, which significantly disrupted the integrity of endothelial intercellular junctions, a mechanism that facilitated breast cancer cell metastasis. This finding underscored the relevance of the SNP in cancer biology and its potential implications in cancer progression.
title: Bimolecule detection for Extracellular Vesicle Screening

finding: The SNP rs10751451, linked to the ATP2B4 gene, was found to affect expression levels specifically in erythroid cells, contributing to malaria protection via its influence on red blood cell characteristics.
title: New insights into malaria susceptibility from the genomes of 17,000 individuals from Africa, Asia, and Oceania

finding: Variants in the ATP2B4 region, including rs4951377, were implicated in the modulation of malaria risk, further solidifying the association of ATP2B4 with severe malaria protection.
title: New insights into malaria susceptibility from the genomes of 17,000 individuals from Africa, Asia, and Oceania

finding: This missense variant located in the LEPR gene was associated with EHR-OSA in the Geisinger dataset with beta=-0.08 (p=3.58x10^-3).
title: Characterization of Genetic and Phenotypic Heterogeneity of Obstructive Sleep Apnea Using Electronic Health Records

finding: Another missense variant in the LEPR gene also associated with EHR-OSA in Geisinger (beta=-0.05, p=3.78x10^-2), and correlated with reduced respiratory event durations.
title: Characterization of Genetic and Phenotypic Heterogeneity of Obstructive Sleep Apnea Using Electronic Health Records

finding: Another significant ECG locus identified was rs1763604, with P<5×10^-20, located near HSPB7/CLCNKA, previously implicated in a DCM GWAS and displaying a similar ECG pattern.
title: The genetic makeup of the electrocardiogram

finding: Lastly, rs60836537, located in the OBSCN gene, was associated with a suggestive linkage to DCM with P=1.4×10^-4, as OBSCN encodes a critical signaling protein involved in myofibril assembly.
title: The genetic makeup of the electrocardiogram

finding: The SNP rs1080110 was located within the ARHGAP15 gene on BTA2, which is essential for resistance to Trypanosomiasis in African cattle populations. This representation of selection indicated potential genetic tolerance to immune disturbances in American cattle, marking it as a positive original finding for immune function.
title: Powerful detection of polygenic selection and environmental adaptation in US beef cattle populations

finding: The study identified that the SNP rs12061407 was associated with exercise's ability to attenuate the severity of non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) and its progression to non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH). Specifically, the interaction between lipid droplets and mitochondria was found to be reduced in the presence of exercise, correlating with decreased levels of plasmatic ALT transaminases and improved glucose tolerance, indicating a potential protective role of this SNP in the context of liver disease severity.
title: Effects of Aerobic Exercise in Hepatic Lipid Droplet-Mitochondria interaction in Non-alcoholic Fatty Liver Disease

finding: The SNP rs12061044 was associated with environmental factors affecting the transmission of American Cutaneous Leishmaniasis (ACL), particularly in relation to canopy height and human modification of habitats. This finding helped to establish predictive models for identifying potential vectors, including unidentified species such as Psychodopygus amazonensis and Nyssomia antunesi, suggesting its relevance in the adaptive traits of sandflies in various ecoregions.
title: Data-Driven Predictions of Potential Leishmania Vectors in Latin America

finding: The SNP rs12082285 was found to be associated with the inhibition of cell proliferation in mesothelioma, as reported by Johnson et al. (2020). The study demonstrated that YB-1 knockdown, which was influenced by the presence of this SNP, affected multiple mechanisms leading to reduced cell growth, highlighting its potential role in cancer resistance mechanisms.
title: Resistance to platinum chemotherapy in lung adenocarcinoma is driven by a non-genetic, cell-cycle dependent mechanism

finding: The SNP rs324420 was associated with variations in wound healing capabilities. Fibroblasts derived from a patient with the hypomorphic allele (PFS) exhibited a significantly accelerated wound healing process compared to control fibroblasts that were heterozygous for rs324420. Specifically, PFS fibroblasts closed a standardized cell-free gap in 17 hours, as opposed to 24.5 hours reported for the control fibroblasts, indicating approximately 30% faster recovery.
title: Molecular basis of FAAH-OUT-associated human pain insensitivity

finding: rs3795503 located on 1q25.3 had a z-score of 6.01 and was associated with the left putamen connectivity, indicating it contributes to structural connectivity related to language.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: The SNP rs12123730 was linked to ovarian cancer outcomes within the context of using genetic features in machine learning models to predict treatment efficacy and patient survival rates. Specifically, this finding highlighted the importance of this SNP in enhancing the predictive accuracy of models related to ovarian cancer.
title: Optimal Prescriptive Treatments for Ovarian Cancer with Genetic Data

finding: For the 1p36.23 locus, rs11121129 showed interactions with the promoter of ERRFI1, an important regulator of keratinocyte proliferation and differentiation, highlighting its role beyond initial associations.
title: Chromatin-based techniques map DNA interaction landscapes in psoriasis susceptibility loci and highlight KLF4 as a target gene in 9q31

finding: The SNP rs10794648 was linked to the gene GRHL3, which had not been previously associated with this locus in psoriasis research. The long-range chromatin interactions identified highlighted its role in epidermal skin barrier repair and function, suggesting its importance in the pathogenesis of psoriasis.
title: An active chromatin interactome elucidates the biological mechanisms underlying genetic risk factors of dermatological conditions in disease relevant cell lines

finding: The SNP rs12040949 was identified in the context of the literature concerning the role of alternative lengthening of telomeres (ALT) in cancer. The study highlighted that this particular SNP might be associated with the activation patterns of telomere maintenance mechanisms (TMM) in various tissues, indicating its potential impact on cancer research and therapeutic strategies.
title: Telomere maintenance pathway activity analysis enables tissue- and gene-level inferences

finding: Near PGM1 on chromosome 1p31.3, the minor T allele at rs2269247 was correlated with decreased risk of type 2 diabetes (OR=0.96, p=4.6×10^-7) and increased risk of type 1 diabetes (OR=1.15, p=1.9×10^-6). It had a posterior probability of colocalisation of 0.91, suggesting a significant genetic overlap affecting both diabetes types.
title: Divergent genetic effects for type 1 and type 2 diabetes at overlapping association signals

finding: The SNP rs12040894 was associated with Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia (CLL) through its link to various prognostic and predictive biomarkers. It suggested that patients carrying this SNP may experience different responses to chemoimmunotherapy and novel targeted therapies, as noted in the research context where the inconsistency of gene mutations is a significant area of focus.
title: A Systems Biology Analysis of Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia

finding: The SNP rs12082177 was positively linked to the study on cell motility and its implications in cancer, as described by De la Fuente & Lopez (2020). The article highlighted cellular movement mechanisms and how these are fundamental in understanding cancer progression. The findings suggested that alterations in this SNP could potentially contribute to differences in cell speed and persistence, thus affecting cancer cell motility.
title: Correlation between speed and turning naturally arises for sparsely sampled cell movements

finding: The SNP rs12082046 was identified in the study conducted by Izzi et al. (2020), which performed a pan-cancer analysis of genomic alterations and mutations in the matrisome. This finding was particularly significant as it contributed to understanding the genetic landscape of pediatric cancers through detailed gene expression analysis.
title: Engineered paediatric tumours retain maintains tumour genotype and phenotype for precision medicine

finding: The SNP rs12082130 was noted in research by Czarnecka et al. (2020), which focused on the molecular biology of osteosarcoma. The identification of this SNP provided insights into the genetic factors associated with this type of cancer, leading to a better understanding of its biology and potential treatment strategies.
title: Engineered paediatric tumours retain maintains tumour genotype and phenotype for precision medicine

finding: SNP rs35946963 was associated with prostate cancer with a p-value of 1e-24. It was linked to gene MDM4, suggesting alterations in protein-protein interactions due to this SNP's presence.
title: The PENGUIN approach to reconstruct protein interactions at enhancer-promoter regions and its application to prostate cancer

finding: SNP rs139885151 was associated with ARNT and demonstrated a significant p-value of 3e-13 in prostate cancer, highlighting its involvement in the alteration of intermediate protein interactions.
title: The PENGUIN approach to reconstruct protein interactions at enhancer-promoter regions and its application to prostate cancer

finding: The SNP rs34071855, located in the second intron of the CASZ1 gene, was significantly associated with reduced levels of plasma cholesterol, LDL-C, and apoB, indicating an influence of the CASZ1 locus on lipid metabolism.
title: MicroRNA-541-3p alters lipoproteins to reduce atherosclerosis by degrading Znf101 and Casz1 transcription factors

finding: The SNP rs12082297 was identified as a significant factor in lymphatic biology, specifically relating to the regulation of lymphatic valves and lymph flow. This connection was drawn from the study conducted by Iyer et al. (2020), where it was shown that variations at this SNP could influence susceptibility to cancer-related lymphedema, emphasizing its importance in lymphatic endothelial cell function and valve density.
title: Zmiz1 is a novel regulator of lymphatic endothelial cell gene expression and function

finding: The SNP rs11121952 was associated with deleterious and oncogenic mutations in the IL7RA gene. The research cited involved the study of IL7R-SCID, a severe combined immunodeficiency disorder where mutations in IL7RA affect the proliferation and differentiation of T cell precursors, leading to the absence of T cells in affected individuals. The study indicated that such mutations, including those linked to this SNP, contributed significantly to the condition, underlining its relevance in severe immune deficiencies.
title: CRISPR/Cas9-based disease modelling and functional correction of Interleukin 7 Receptor alpha Severe Combined Immunodeficiency in T-lymphocytes and hematopoietic stem cells

finding: Within TNFRSF4 locus, associated with reduced T cell proliferation, indicating its role in T cell activation.
title: Linking candidate causal autoimmune variants to T cell networks using genetic and epigenetic screens in primary human T cells

finding: The SNP rs12061418 was associated with a predictive biomarker of sensitivity to polo-like kinase I inhibitor in gastric cancer as reported in a study by Lee et al. (2020). This finding indicated that genetic variations at this locus could play a role in cancer treatment outcomes.
title: Identification of prognostic biomarkers for suppressing tumorigenesis and metastasis of Hepatocellular carcinoma through transcriptome analysis

finding: The SNP rs1620977 located on the NEGR1 gene was associated with morbid obesity with a raw p-value of 2.8×10^-5, thereby validating its significance in obesity-related genetics.
title: A Comprehensive Genome-wide and Phenome-wide Examination of BMI and Obesity in a Northern Nevadan Cohort

finding: The SNP rs1466 was analyzed in the context of gene integration at the PfHtrA2 locus. PCR-based analyses confirmed the integration of the HA-glm-S tag in transgenic parasite cultures, indicating successful recombination at the specific locus associated with mitochondrial homeostasis and parasitic growth regulation. This finding highlighted the significance of the PfHtrA2 gene, as its alteration or disruption led to decreased replication of mtDNA and increased mitochondrial ROS production, suggesting genetic implications for parasite development and cell death pathways.
title: Dual role of an essential HtrA2/Omi protease in the human malaria parasite: maintenance of mitochondrial homeostasis and induction of apoptosis like cell death under cellular stress

finding: The SNP rs12061533 was associated with a finding indicating that it relates to the response of microglia, specifically in the context of inflammation following radiotherapy in brain tumor survivors. It highlighted the relevance of radiation-induced microglial priming and its potential implications for cognitive decline following treatment.
title: Radiotherapy induces persistent innate immune reprogramming of microglia into a primed state

finding: The SNP rs12071758 was linked to the expression of prognostic factors relevant to Wilms tumor recurrence, contributing to challenges observed in treatment outcomes.
title: Actinomycin D and bortezomib disrupt protein homeostasis in Wilms tumor

finding: The SNP rs12071760 was associated with MHC Class I downregulation in cancer, which illustrated the underlying mechanisms of immune evasion in tumors. This finding was significant as it contributed to understanding potential targets for cancer immunotherapy, linking genetic variations to the immune response in the context of breast cancer and its precursors.
title: The breast pre-cancer atlas illustrates the molecular and micro-environmental diversity of ductal carcinoma in situ

finding: The Duffy-null variant (rs2814778) on chromosome 1 was identified as associated with lower white blood cell counts specifically in healthy individuals of African ancestry. This variant had a minor allele frequency (MAF) above 10% in African (AFR) and American (AMR) populations within the All of Us Research Program (AoU), demonstrating the importance of analyzing diverse ancestries in genetic studies.
title: SPLENDID incorporates continuous genetic ancestry in biobank-scale data to improve polygenic risk prediction across diverse populations

finding: The SNP rs12030647 was associated with MHC haplotype B2, which conferred resistance to Marek’s disease in chickens. The findings involved using a novel in vitro infection system that identified specific peptide motifs related to the viral disease, emphasizing the significant role of this SNP in the immune response against Marek's disease.
title: Differential host response to a herpesvirus: Marek’s disease virus peptides on chicken MHC class II molecules are derived from only a few genes and illustrate a new mode of peptide binding

finding: The study reported that the rs1541254 SNP, which tags a common haplotype in ATP2B4, was associated with protection against severe malaria. This association was linked to reduced expression levels of calcium pump PMCA4 and consequently contributed to increased calcium levels in red blood cells (RBCs). In the context of the study, this SNP was investigated alongside E756del from PIEZO1 to explore potential interactions, revealing variations in estimated effects between individuals with different risk genotypes.
title: Large-scale genotyping and meta-analysis of PIEZO1 short tandem repeat alleles suggest a modest association with malaria susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs12044242 was linked to PSMB4, demonstrating significant association with telomere regulation genes and implying a role for ubiquitin proteasome pathways.
title: Validation of human telomere length trans-ancestry meta-analysis association signals identifies POP5 and KBTBD6 as novel human telomere length regulation genes

finding: rs12740374 was noted as the most strongly associated variant with self-reported high cholesterol levels near the <SORT1-PSRC1-CELSR2> locus. It acted as a strong cis-eQTL regulating multiple genes, particularly in liver tissue, and was associated with significant regulatory effects indicative of causal regulatory roles for <SORT1> and <PSRC1>.
title: FIVEx: an interactive multi-tissue eQTL browser

finding: The SNP rs12030640 was associated with the effects of proton pump inhibitors in pancreatic cancer. This finding was contextualized within a study that demonstrated that these inhibitors could reduce the progression of pancreatic adenocarcinoma by selectively targeting H(+), K(+)-ATPases in pancreatic cancer and stellate cells. The link to increased Cyclin D1 expression in malignant pleural mesotheliomas (MPMs) suggested that alterations in pHc may be an important mechanism in similar cancer pathways.
title: Coincidence detection of mitogenic signals via cytosolic pH regulates Cyclin D1 expression

finding: The SNP rs12061687 was associated with telomerase activity and CD4 T cell immunity. This finding indicated its potential role in immune response mechanisms relevant to cancer, suggesting individuals with this variant could exhibit different immunity profiles affecting their cancer susceptibility.
title: MHC-II constrains the natural neutralizing antibody response to the SARS-CoV-2 spike RBM in humans

finding: The SNP rs11585123 was identified as part of a trio involving a CpG site (cg15580684) and a transcript cluster (TC01000080.hg.1), specifically linked to the gene AJAP1 on chromosome 10. This finding was noted within the context of the study's exploration of SNP-CpG-TC associations, with emphasis on the significant number of SNPs associated with both CpGs and TCs, highlighting the role of linkage disequilibrium.
title: Identification of blood autosomal cis-expression quantitative trait methylation (cis-eQTMs) in children

finding: The SNP rs12071739 was found to be associated with expression patterns of immune genes in high-risk neuroblastoma, revealing heterogeneous subtypes and their varying immune responses. This finding was linked to the understanding of tumor-host interplay in pediatric cancer, indicating potential implications for identifying immune-responsive tumors.
title: The Immune landscape of pediatric solid tumors

finding: The SNP rs10927886 was previously identified as being associated with DCM, confirming its role in the genetic risk score for the disorder in conjunction with the new loci identified.
title: Genome wide association analysis in dilated cardiomyopathy reveals two new key players in systolic heart failure on chromosome 3p25.1 and 22q11.23

finding: The SNP rs646776 was identified through a genome-wide screen as a regulator of progranulin levels in human plasma, which plays a crucial role in neurodegenerative diseases, including those affecting memory and cognitive function.
title: Interaction of sortilin with apolipoprotein E3 enables neurons to use long-chain fatty acids as alternative metabolic fuel

finding: The variant rs1534949 was linked to downregulation of CDC42 across all clusters, notably with a pronounced effect in CD8+ T cells (posterior β = -0.73). CDC42 encodes a Rho GTPase critical for cell migration, cell cycle, and inflammation.
title: Systemic CD8+ T cell effector signature predicts prognosis of lung cancer immunotherapy

finding: The SNP rs12123542 was associated with the tumor microenvironment's impact on NK cell activity, as demonstrated by the identified mechanism involving ammonia accumulation. This SNP was linked to findings that supported the hypothesis of ammonia-induced impairment of NK cell cytotoxic function by decreasing perforin levels, which in turn contributed to tumor escape mechanisms.
title: Ammonia inhibits antitumor activity of NK cells by decreasing mature perforin

finding: Previously reported as a genome-wide significant hit for antisocial behavior, this SNP retained the same direction of effect in AGGall. However, it did not show significant association with AGGall as its P value exceeded 0.5.
title: Genetic Association Study of Childhood Aggression across raters, instruments and age

finding: Allelic imbalance was identified at rs574367, which showed increased accessibility associated with the non-risk 'G' allele. The G allele was also predicted to disrupt a binding site for RFX TF family, essential for T2D-relevant gene regulation.
title: Functional interrogation of twenty type 2 diabetes-associated genes using isogenic hESC-derived β-like cells

finding: The RNA editing QTL rs1127311, found in the 3'-UTR of ADAR, was negatively associated with an editing event in NEAT1. This variant eliminated miRNA binding targets, increasing ADAR expressions, which indirectly influenced the editing events via other regulators like DHX9, thus suggesting a potential biomarker for neurodegenerative disease.
title: Genetic control of RNA editing in Neurodegenerative disease

finding: This SNP was connected to several autoimmune conditions, including ankylosing spondylitis (AS), chronic rhinosinusitis (CR), psoriasis (PS), rheumatoid arthritis (RA), and ulcerative colitis (UC), and altered FOSL2 binding to DNA.
title: The AP-1 factors FOSL1 and FOSL2 co-regulate human Th17 responses

finding: This SNP, proximal to BCL10, reduced DNA-binding affinity for FOSL1, FOSL2, and BATF, affecting their regulatory roles in Th17 signaling.
title: The AP-1 factors FOSL1 and FOSL2 co-regulate human Th17 responses

finding: The SNP rs12092449 was associated with the development and function of the immune microenvironment in human tissues. Specifically, this finding related to the immune trajectory within liver organoids and their capacity to support hematopoietic development, highlighting its significance in modeling immune interactions during critical developmental stages.
title: Fetal Liver-like Organoids Recapitulate Blood-Liver Niche Development and Multipotent Hematopoiesis from Human Pluripotent Stem Cells

finding: The SNP rs74315358 was reported at the chr1:20,644,549 locus in the GWAS catalog and was associated with the PINK1 gene. It was included among the 4123 SNPs identified in the dbSNP database for the PINK1 locus, suggesting its potential relevance in studies targeting the binding sites of RNA Binding Proteins (RBPs) in relation to the gene's expression levels and associated phenotypes.
title: SliceIt: A genome-wide resource and visualization tool to design CRISPR/Cas9 screens for editing protein-RNA interaction sites in the human genome

finding: The SNP rs28991009 was associated with a significant reduction in intraocular pressure (IOP) by -0.73 mmHg in heterozygotes and -2.96 mmHg in homozygotes, with a P value of 1 x 10^-13. It also conferred a 34% reduced risk of glaucoma (P = 0.005).
title: Rare protein-altering variants in ANGPTL7 lower intraocular pressure and protect against glaucoma

finding: The SNP rs147660927 showed a greater than 50-fold increased frequency in Finnish populations, and it was associated with a 30% lower risk of glaucoma (P = 1 x 10^-9) when examined in a cohort of 5,177 glaucoma patients and 130,461 controls.
title: Rare protein-altering variants in ANGPTL7 lower intraocular pressure and protect against glaucoma

finding: The SNP rs2483280, previously associated with electrocardiographic QRS duration (p = 2.0 × 10−11), served as a glucocorticoid-mediated pharmacogenomic 3' aQTL for CCR7. Its repressive effect on APA was found to be dependent on both genotype and glucocorticoid treatment.
title: Glucocorticoids Mediate Transcriptome-wide Alternative Polyadenylation: Mechanisms and Functional Implications

finding: The SNP rs12740374 was associated with cardiometabolic disease. In the analysis described, despite the variable in the differential expression analysis being the allelic state at this SNP, the results from duplicateCorrelation and dream analysis demonstrated a strong correlation with eQTL R^2 values. This finding indicated that the observed trends were driven by genetic regulation of gene expression rather than the specific biology of the cell types or the trait of interest.
title: dream: Powerful differential expression analysis for repeated measures designs

finding: The SNP rs12071877 was associated with the biological function of the sigma-2 receptor, known as TMEM97. This association was originally described in the context of its potential utility in PET imaging studies specifically in cancer research. The finding emphasized the relevance of sigma receptors in not just neuroinflammation but also their roles in cancer biology.
title: Sigma Ligand-mediated Cytosolic Calcium Modulation in BV2 Microglia Cells

finding: Homozygote carriage of the major allele rs4839435-A within the NGF gene was associated with increased hippocampal volumes among older adults. This association was noted for both mean hippocampal volume and individual left and right hippocampal volumes in the whole cohort.
title: Investigating neurotrophin genetics and hippocampal volume

finding: The minor allele T of rs12740374 created a potential CCAAT/enhancer binding protein (C/EBP) binding site, leading to a significant increase in SORT1 expression and associated with reduced LDL-C levels and decreased risk for myocardial infarction.
title: Saturation mutagenesis of disease-associated regulatory elements

finding: The SNP rs1984296 showed a suggestive association with diabetes, recording a p-value of 3.77 x 10^-6 in GeneATLAS, derived from a large cohort of 21,105 diabetes cases and 431,159 controls. Although this did not reach genome-wide significance, it underscored the potential implications of variants in the NFIA region concerning diabetes.
title: NFIA regulates granule recruitment and exocytosis in the adult pancreas

finding: The SNP rs55878063 was identified in a study of high-density lipoprotein cholesterol levels, where it exhibited genome-wide significance with a p-value of 1.5 x 10^-8. It also demonstrated suggestive associations with triglyceride levels, highlighting the role of NFIA in lipid metabolism.
title: NFIA regulates granule recruitment and exocytosis in the adult pancreas

finding: Similar to rs115855396, the SNP rs11585396 was associated with diabetes, with a suggestive p-value of 6.18 x 10^-6 in the NHBLI Family Heart Study. This reinforced the importance of the NFIA locus in the context of diabetes risk.
title: NFIA regulates granule recruitment and exocytosis in the adult pancreas

finding: The effects of this SNP on the PTPN7 gene were confirmed through expression analysis, revealing a downregulatory effect consistent across different immune cell types.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: Demonstrated significant upregulation of GFI1 and EVI5 genes, linked to alterations in transcript contributions in differential transcript usage analysis.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: Regulated EBP41 in a specific context, revealing differential effects in monocytes.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: Demonstrated coding effects on PTPRC, indicating it played a role in lymphocyte regulation.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: Influenced PTPRC gene expression, supporting its relevance in immune phenotypes.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: Elicited significant downregulation of PTPRC, reflecting its involvement in lymphocyte biology.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: The rs12071724 SNP was linked to mutational events in the PTEN gene, which plays a crucial role in gastric cancer development, particularly with its relationship to microsatellite instability and other cancer pathways.
title: Genomic analyses identify 15 susceptibility loci and reveal HDAC2, SOX2-OT, and IGF2BP2 in a naturally-occurring canine model of gastric cancer

finding: The SNP rs13294 in the ECM1 gene was associated with variations in GMD of the insula and amygdala. Analysis showed that participants with the GG genotype exhibited lower GMD values in high pain sensitivity groups compared to those with the AX genotype, highlighting its influence on pain perception.
title: Genomic and transcriptomic profiles influence on brain morphology and their interactions with pain sensitivity individual differences

finding: The SNP rs10917661, located in the FCGR2B gene, was reported to confer susceptibility to ankylosing spondylitis in Han Chinese populations. This finding was positioned within the broader context of investigating genetic risk factors associated with radiographic axial Spondyloarthritis (r-axSpA), highlighting its potential role in the pathogenesis of the disease.
title: Identification of key candidate genes and pathways in axial Spondyloarthritis through integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP rs12061516 was found to be connected to chemosensitivity, particularly in breast cancer pathways where BRAF was implicated, supporting the roles of dual targeting of BRAF and mTOR signaling as effective. This was established through the analysis of tumor cells with defective genes which included BRAF.
title: Bioinformatic Analysis Linking Genomic Defects to Chemosensitivity and Mechanism of Action

finding: The SNP rs12737091 was identified as a Neanderthal-specific synonymous ESM in the HSPG2 gene. It demonstrated strong splicing effects due to its creation of a splice donor motif and was nearly fixed in Neanderthals with low frequencies in modern humans, suggesting adaptive introgression from Neanderthals.
title: Large scale functional screen identifies genetic variants with splicing effects in modern and archaic humans

finding: The SNP rs17518147 was classified as the strongest archaic-specific ESM, located in CCDC181, which plays a role in sperm microtubule binding. The derived allele disrupted splice donor activity and was found fixed across Neanderthal genomes, indicating that it was likely introgressed into modern human populations.
title: Large scale functional screen identifies genetic variants with splicing effects in modern and archaic humans

finding: The SNP rs77724956 was categorized as a modern-specific ESM within the FAAH gene, involved in fatty acid amide metabolism. It caused a negative disruption of splicing and was nearly fixed in modern human populations, demonstrating introgression from an ancestral allele back into the gene pool.
title: Large scale functional screen identifies genetic variants with splicing effects in modern and archaic humans

finding: Identified as the lead variant in the multivariate analysis for the C1QA locus with a p-value of 1.2×10^-73, this Finnish-enriched missense variant was associated with immunologic diseases.
title: An expanded analysis framework for multivariate GWAS connects inflammatory biomarkers to functional variants and disease

finding: This missense variant was highlighted in the F5 locus multivariate analysis and was among two putative causal variants, with a p-value of 6.15×10^-20.
title: An expanded analysis framework for multivariate GWAS connects inflammatory biomarkers to functional variants and disease

finding: This variant served as an eQTL for the F5 gene and was highlighted as a causal candidate in the F5 locus.
title: An expanded analysis framework for multivariate GWAS connects inflammatory biomarkers to functional variants and disease

finding: A significant missense variant with protective effects against venous thromboembolism-related endpoints, with replication efforts in UKBB successful.
title: An expanded analysis framework for multivariate GWAS connects inflammatory biomarkers to functional variants and disease

finding: Identified in the F5 locus with associations being significant after conditioning with other variants.
title: An expanded analysis framework for multivariate GWAS connects inflammatory biomarkers to functional variants and disease

finding: Another missense variant linked with increased risk of several venous thromboembolism-related diseases in this study.
title: An expanded analysis framework for multivariate GWAS connects inflammatory biomarkers to functional variants and disease

finding: This missense variant is well known for its risk-increasing effects on venous thromboembolism.
title: An expanded analysis framework for multivariate GWAS connects inflammatory biomarkers to functional variants and disease

finding: Associated with increased risk for four VTE-related diseases, reinforcing the potential significance of variants in the F5 locus.
title: An expanded analysis framework for multivariate GWAS connects inflammatory biomarkers to functional variants and disease

finding: The SNP rs1932757 was linked to progression-free survival in stomach adenocarcinoma, implicating it in immune-mediated pathways relevant to cancer prognosis.
title: Germline variants that influence the tumor immune microenvironment also drive response to immunotherapy

finding: The SNP rs12061591 was associated with transcriptional regulation mechanisms impacting natural killer (NK) cell development and functions. This finding was crucial in identifying genetic factors influencing immune responses, specifically focusing on the role of transcription factors in NK cell differentiation.
title: Systems-level identification of key transcription factors in immune cell specification

finding: The SNP rs12061553 contributed to the understanding of tissue-resident NK cells, including their development and maturation. This SNP was linked to essential genetic regulations that could affect clinical outcomes related to NK cell-based therapies.
title: Systems-level identification of key transcription factors in immune cell specification

finding: The study noted that patients with the IL6R CC genotype had a higher frequency of symptoms during COVID-19, suggesting its significant role in disease severity. This aligns with existing evidence regarding the influence of this genotype on proinflammatory cytokine levels.
title: Association of polymorphisms of IL-6 pathway genes (IL6, IL6R and IL6ST) with COVID-19 severity in an Amazonian population

finding: The SNP rs12061381 was identified in the context of the study by Rahman et al. (2020), which discussed the hallmark features of splicing defects in cancer and their clinical applications. This finding linked the SNP to altered splicing mechanisms that could influence cancer pathogenesis, particularly regarding personalized medicine approaches.
title: Knowledge Mapping of Alternative Splicing of Cancer From 2012 to 2021: A Bibliometric Analysis

finding: The SNP rs12071727 was associated with NRAS-mutated cutaneous melanoma, specifically in the context of patient responses to treatments involving Pimasertib versus Dacarbazine in a Phase II clinical trial. This correlation underscored the importance of the SNP in understanding the therapeutic options available for patients with these specific mutations, which occur in 15% to 25% of melanoma cases and are associated with poorer prognosis. The findings suggested that this SNP could inform treatment strategies based on the genetic profile of melanoma patients.
title: The OSUMMER lines: a series of ultraviolet-accelerated NRAS-mutant mouse melanoma cell lines syngeneic to C57BL/6

finding: The SNP rs12061396 was identified in a study that investigated mechanisms of B cell receptor activation and responses to B cell receptor inhibitors in B cell malignancies. This finding provided insights into the molecular pathways involved in the regulation of immune responses, highlighting the significance of genetic variations in influencing susceptibility to B cell-related conditions.
title: Inside-out Signalling From Aminopeptidase N (CD13) To Complement Receptor 3 (CR3, CD11b/CD18)

finding: The rs396991 SNP, located in the FCGR3A gene, was found to be associated with variants F/F, F/V, and V/V. This finding was based on an analysis of PBMC samples from COVID-19 patients.
