The data indicated that the presence of afucosylated IgGs, which correlated with severe disease outcomes, was influenced by the variants at this SNP. Thus, the SNP was described as an important factor in the antibody response to SARS-CoV-2 infection, contributing to the understanding of disease severity in patients.
title: Divergent early antibody responses define COVID-19 disease trajectories

finding: This intronic variant in <italic>MIA3</italic> was recovered, which controls the expression of <italic>AIDA</italic> involved in endothelial cells.
title: CRISPR perturbations at many coronary artery disease loci impair vascular endothelial cell functions

finding: The SNP rs3024505 was significant in the original GWAS and cFDR analysis, although it had a higher RA p-value of 0.6008 in the discovery GWAS. However, its p-value decreased to 9.127e-14 in the validation study. This SNP was also noted for having a high H3K27ac fold change value at the 87.4th percentile and overlapped a regulatory factor binding site.
title: fcfdr: an R package to leverage continuous and binary functional genomic data in GWAS

finding: The SNP rs10917312 was associated with the EPHB2 gene, a receptor tyrosine kinase. EPHB2 deficiency in knockout mice displayed depressive and stressed behaviors, and overexpression of EPHB2 in APP/PS1 transgenic mice improved memory and alleviated depression and anxiety-like behaviors, indicating its potential importance in MDD.
title: Multi-omic modeling of antidepressant response implicates dynamic immune and inflammatory changes in individuals who respond to treatment

finding: The SNP rs12740374 was identified as a regulatory variant affecting liver-specific SORT1 gene expression levels in the 1p13 cholesterol locus. This finding was supported by computational predictions from the TURF tool, which highlighted its organ-specific function. Furthermore, the liver-specific function of rs12740374 was experimentally validated in HepG2 MPRA assays. It also exhibited overlap with several active histone marks and DNase peaks in liver tissues, emphasizing its relevance to cholesterol metabolism in both liver and other related organs such as adipose tissue and gonads. Additionally, it was noted to have a high significance score in association with previous genome-wide association studies.
title: Prioritization of regulatory variants with tissue-specific function in the non-coding regions of human genome

finding: The SNP rs12071780 was associated with the mechanosensitive Piezo channels, specifically Piezo1's role in altered calcium signaling in cancer cells. This finding related to the increase in action potential frequency in retinal ganglion cells as triggered by Piezo1 stimulation, paralleling some mechanisms found in neurodegenerative diseases like glaucoma.
title: Piezo1 and Piezo2 channels in retinal ganglion cells and the impact of Piezo1 stimulation on light-dependent neural activity

finding: The SNP in USH2A displayed significant association with AD risk in the analysis of APOE ε4 non-carriers, warranting further investigation.
title: Exome-wide age-of-onset analysis reveals exonic variants in ERN1, TACR3 and SPPL2C associated with Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs3006933 was identified as a novel variant located near the genes SDCCAG8 and AKT3 on chromosome 1. It was associated with surface area (SA1) with a p-value of 4.08×10−9. This SNP was previously linked to subcortical volumes and neuroimaging phenotypes related to corpus callosum white matter microstructure.
title: Genomic Structural Equation Modeling Reveals Latent Phenotypes in the Human Cortex with Distinct Genetic Architecture

finding: The SNP rs6701689, associated with SA5, was reported for its link to risk tolerance.
title: Genomic Structural Equation Modeling Reveals Latent Phenotypes in the Human Cortex with Distinct Genetic Architecture

finding: The SNP rs12740374 in the SORT1 locus was rediscovered as a causal variant through fpQTL analysis, consistent with previous experimental validations. The alternate allele was associated with a significant depletion of Tn5 insertions near the variant, indicating a genotype-dependent TF binding event and supporting its role in lipid association.
title: Characterization of non-coding variants associated with transcription factor binding through ATAC-seq-defined footprint QTLs in liver

finding: The SNP rs114880747 was positively identified as influencing mRNA isoform abundance via polyadenylation changes. Borzoi predicted an upregulation of site usage linked to the creation of a CstF binding motif, showcasing its impact on gene expression regulation through 3' UTR variant effects.
title: Predicting RNA-seq coverage from DNA sequence as a unifying model of gene regulation

finding: The Look AHEAD study (2016) prospectively linked the GLUL rs10911021 variant to cardiovascular morbidity and mortality in individuals with Type 2 diabetes, suggesting its relevance in understanding cardiovascular risks related to diabetes.
title: Bioinformatics Analysis of next generation sequencing data for Risk Prediction in Patients with Type 1 diabetes mellitus

finding: The SNP rs11121983 was associated with altered p53-mediated tumor suppression mechanisms, potentially impacting the DNA-damage response. This finding provided insights into the genetic basis of Li-Fraumeni syndrome (LFS) and its link to highly penetrant cancer spectra, as studied in the context of zebrafish tp53 mutants, which exhibited defective cell-cycle checkpoints and spontaneous tumor development.
title: tp53 R217H and R242H Mutant Zebrafish Exhibit Dysfunctional p53 Hallmarks and Recapitulate Li-Fraumeni Syndrome Phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs11591147 exhibited notable associations with blood lipids such as LDL cholesterol and coronary artery disease, suggesting its role in cardiovascular health.
title: The Genetic Heterogeneity of Multimodal Human Brain Age

finding: The SNP rs16824888 was associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk. The findings suggested a role of PAD4, which harbors this SNP, in influencing tau citrullination, leading to potential implications for tauopathies.
title: Probing tau citrullination in Alzheimer’s disease brains and mouse models of tauopathy

finding: The SNP rs2240335 was linked to amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS). Similar to rs16824888, this SNP was part of the PAD4 gene, indicating that variations in PAD4 could affect protein aggregation and susceptibility to specific proteinopathies, including ALS.
title: Probing tau citrullination in Alzheimer’s disease brains and mouse models of tauopathy

finding: The p.N409S mutation, associated with Parkinson's disease (PD), was detected in one case, indicating it was a strong risk allele for the disease.
title: Nanopore sequencing of the glucocerebrosidase (GBA) gene in a New Zealand Parkinson’s disease cohort

finding: The p.E365K mutation was identified in 12 cases and was noted to be a modest risk mutation for PD.
title: Nanopore sequencing of the glucocerebrosidase (GBA) gene in a New Zealand Parkinson’s disease cohort

finding: The p.T408M mutation was detected in seven cases, with one individual being a double carrier alongside p.E365K, categorizing it as a modest risk mutation for PD.
title: Nanopore sequencing of the glucocerebrosidase (GBA) gene in a New Zealand Parkinson’s disease cohort

finding: The R78C mutation was possibly identified in one case, suggesting it could represent a risk allele for PD.
title: Nanopore sequencing of the glucocerebrosidase (GBA) gene in a New Zealand Parkinson’s disease cohort

finding: The D179H mutation was found in one case, occurring on the same haplotype as an E365K allele, indicating potential relevance in PD risk.
title: Nanopore sequencing of the glucocerebrosidase (GBA) gene in a New Zealand Parkinson’s disease cohort

finding: The VTR1B-rs33985287(T) allele was crucial as a major allele in modern human populations, linked to social phenotype factors.
title: Oxytocin and vasotocin receptor variation sheds light into the evolution of human prosociality

finding: The rs115363550 SNP was significantly associated with ATP levels among Caucasian donors. This association was not significant in donors of African descent and was absent in Hispanic and Asian donors, indicating ancestry-specific effects on RBC glycolysis.
title: Biological and Genetic Determinants of Glycolysis: Phosphofructokinase Isoforms Boost Energy Status of Stored Red Blood Cells and Transfusion Outcomes

finding: The SNP rs12061364 was identified in the context of a study aimed at understanding the role of fibrotic stroma in melanoma resistance to targeted therapies. It was found that the genetic variation might correlate with fibrotic characteristics associated with differentiated melanoma cells, influencing the tumor microenvironment and possibly impacting treatment efficacy.
title: Invasive dedifferentiated melanoma cells inhibit JAK1-STAT3-driven actomyosin contractility of human fibroblastic reticular cells of the lymph node

finding: The SNP rs12040861 was associated with altered protein O-glycosylation in cancer cells. This finding related to cancer aggressiveness in bladder tumours, where hypoxia and glucose deprivation promoted cellular adaptation, as part of a mechanism linked to increased invasion capabilities and reduced cell proliferation.
title: Multilevel Plasticity and Altered Glycosylation Drive Aggressiveness in Hypoxic and Glucose-Deprived Bladder Cancer Cells

finding: The SNP rs578226800 was associated with blood glucose levels, demonstrating a significant genome-wide association with a p-value of 9.2E-08. This finding suggested a genetic influence of PHD2 on glucose metabolism.
title: Adipocyte-specific deletion of the oxygen-sensor PHD2 sustains elevated energy expenditure at thermoneutrality

finding: The SNP rs7534248 showed a significant association with basal metabolic rate, with a p-value of 3.2E-06. This indicated that variations in PHD2 could impact metabolic rate.
title: Adipocyte-specific deletion of the oxygen-sensor PHD2 sustains elevated energy expenditure at thermoneutrality

finding: The SNP rs12041852 was found to be associated with maternal smoking around birth, with a significant P-value of 7.43 x 10^-5. This association indicated that maternal smoking could influence childhood BMI and was potentially confounding in the causal relationship between childhood and adulthood obesity.
title: Phenome-wide investigation of the causal associations between childhood BMI and adult outcomes: A two-sample Mendelian randomization study

finding: This SNP was associated with the expansion of circulating tumor cells from patients with locally advanced pancreatic cancer, which enabled the establishment of patient-derived xenografts and functional studies for personalized medicine.
title: Propagated circulating tumor cells uncovers the role of NFκB and COP1 in metastasis

finding: The rs9427397 SNP introduced a premature stop codon in the FCGR2A gene, which is associated with increased gamma glutamyltransferase and aspartate aminotransferase levels while decreasing total protein levels in blood. Additionally, the gene FCGR2A plays a critical role in immune functions, linking this mutation to immune-related traits.
title: The lingering effects of Neanderthal introgression on human complex traits

finding: The SNP rs11121971 was associated with the gene ACLY (ATP Citrate Lyase), which mediated radioresistance in Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinomas. This finding suggested that variations in this SNP could serve as a novel predictive biomarker for radiotherapy outcomes in cancers, including potential implications for treatment strategies in triple negative breast cancer.
title: Radiation-Induced Metabolic Reprogramming of Fibroblasts Regulates the Breast Cancer Microenvironment

finding: The SNP rs12030757 was linked to the gene LRRC15, which was implicated in the context of soft-tissue sarcomas. In this osteoarthritis study, LRRC15 was noted as validated through multiple datasets and had experimental backing, suggesting a potential role in the disease's pathogenesis.
title: A gene expression analysis and immune infiltration between lesioned and preserved subchondral bone in osteoarthritis

finding: The SNP rs591536 was significantly associated with Galaxolide intensity perception in the validation cohort (p<5.8×10⁻⁶), providing support for its role in musk compound perception and adding to the previously confirmed findings.
title: From musk to body odor: decoding olfaction through genetic variation

finding: The SNP rs1972183, associated with SLC35E2, demonstrated a GxC effect explained by cluster 4, which was colocalized with a GWAS variant for sleeplessness and insomnia among untreated cells at day 52. This finding emphasized the relevance of GxC interactions in understanding human disease traits.
title: CellRegMap: A statistical framework for mapping context-specific regulatory variants using scRNA-seq

finding: The SNP rs12123491 was originally associated with the sensitization of cutaneous primary afferents in bone cancer, as evidenced by findings in a study conducted by de Clauser et al. in 2020. This finding highlighted the relevance of this SNP in the context of pain mechanisms, which could be indirectly related to the joint pain observed in mouse models of rheumatoid arthritis utilized in the current study.
title: Using in vivo calcium imaging and home cage behavioural analysis to study pain in mouse models of rheumatoid- and osteo-arthritis

finding: The SNP rs11121529 was identified as a significant genetic variant controlling the expression level of the gene KIF1B, which is associated with asthma risk. It was located in a chromatin accessibility peak bound by the transcription factor CEBPD, which showed increased activity in LPS+DEX treatment in monocytes. Additionally, decreased chromatin accessibility was observed for this peak during treatment, indicating complex regulatory dynamics.
title: Functional characterization of eQTLs and asthma risk loci with scATAC-seq across immune cell types and contexts

finding: The SNP rs2227312 was found to be part of a cluster of 25 SNPs associated with the expression of the gene TNFRSF14, a key player in immune responses and implicated in autoimmune diseases. It had the highest probability of inclusion in this cluster (0.23 PIP) and was located in a chromatin region demonstrating increased accessibility in response to PHA treatment in monocytes, indicative of its role in regulating gene expression in an inflammatory context.
title: Functional characterization of eQTLs and asthma risk loci with scATAC-seq across immune cell types and contexts

finding: The SNP rs12061479 was linked to oncogenic properties associated with the EBV ZEBRA protein, indicating a role in the methylation signature in breast cancers that parallels findings in EBV-mediated cancers.
title: Chromosome breaks in breast cancers occur near herpes tumor virus sequences and explain why cancer drugs stop working

finding: The SNP rs3006458 was associated with airway immune mechanisms, particularly involving the regulation of pro-inflammatory cytokines. The study indicated that mechanical ventilation and tracheal intubation led to disturbances in the microecological balance in the lower airways. This disturbance resulted in a loss of microbial diversity and subsequent inflammatory responses in lung tissue, thereby linking rs3006458 to the pathophysiology of pulmonary inflammatory diseases.
title: Mechanical ventilation affects the microecology of the rat respiratory tract

finding: The SNP rs4648889, located in a putative enhancer upstream of the RUNX3 promoter, influenced its expression in CD8+ T-cells by altering binding of transcription factors (TFs) such as IKZF3, IRF5, and members of the NUcleosome Remodeling Deacetylase (NuRD) complex. Specifically, the AS-risk A allele showed increased binding of IKZF3 (3.7-fold, p<0.03) and components of the NuRD complex (e.g., RBBP4 increased 4.1-fold, p<0.02), while the AS-protective G allele showed enhanced binding of IRF5 (fold change 8.2, p=0.003). These differential bindings were confirmed through various assays including EMSA, WB, and ChIP-qPCR, highlighting a mechanism linking rs4648889 to ankylosing spondylitis (AS) through regulation of RUNX3 expression.
title: A RUNX3 enhancer polymorphism associated with ankylosing spondylitis influences recruitment of Interferon Regulatory Factor 5 and factors of the Nucleosome Remodelling Deacetylase Complex in CD8+ T-cells

finding: This SNP was utilized in machine learning algorithms to predict tree-related microhabitats, showing its significance in the analysis of environmental variables impacting forest dynamics.
title: Spatial distribution of Tree-related Microhabitats in a primeval mountain forest: from natural patterns to landscape planning and forest management recommendations

finding: The SNP rs2476601, a non-synonymous variant in the PTPN22 gene, was associated with myasthenia gravis, specifically noted in the overall cohort and the late onset subset. This association was identified by applying a subset-selected false discovery rate (FDR) which was less than 0.01. Furthermore, this SNP had been linked to myasthenia gravis in previous studies, reinforcing its significance in relation to this autoimmune disease.
title: Characterisation of the genetic architecture of immune mediated disease through informed dimension reduction

finding: The SNP rs12071765 was linked to the CCL5/CCR5 axis, which was shown to play a significant role in cancer progression. This finding formed a context where the molecular dynamics of CCR5 were relevant to the disease and therapeutic strategies involving CCR5 targeting.
title: Single-molecule imaging reveals distinct effects of ligands on CCR5 dynamics depending on its dimerization status

finding: The rs3024493 SNP was reported as an eQTL for IL19 and was located 141bp from the transcriptional start site (TSS). This SNP is one of three linked to psoriasis (Ps) in GWAS studies, integrating it into the inflammatory response mechanism involving IL-17 and IL-23.
title: T cells promote distinct transcriptional programs of cutaneous inflammatory disease in human skin structural cells

finding: Located 10.6kb from the transcriptional start site of IL19, rs55705316 was shown to be involved in MPS with Hi-C data demonstrating promoter proximity. This SNP was associated with IL19's role as a crucial cytokine in the T<sub>h</sub>17 inflammatory axis in Ps patients.
title: T cells promote distinct transcriptional programs of cutaneous inflammatory disease in human skin structural cells

finding: The SNP rs12075255 was situated 17.5kb from the TSS of IL19. As one of the reported SNPs in the context of GWAS findings related to psoriasis, this SNP contributed to the overall understanding of the genetic underpinnings of T<sub>h</sub>17-driven inflammatory responses.
title: T cells promote distinct transcriptional programs of cutaneous inflammatory disease in human skin structural cells

finding: The SNP rs7550799 (c.978A>G) was heterozygous in two of five samples, with an Alu insertion found in the intronic region of the <italic>PTPN14</italic> gene (c.10066+35_+44insAlu). The presence of the Alu insertion was noted to interfere with normal expression patterns, potentially impacting gene function.
title: A systematic screen of breast cancer patients’ exomes for retrotransposon insertions reveals disease associated genes

finding: The SNP rs79687284 was identified at the PROX1 locus and shown to be associated with diabetes-related gene regulatory elements. It was notably expressed in bat kidney's distal convoluted tubules, contributing to understanding its role in cell-type-specific regulation of diabetes.
title: Integrative single-cell characterization of frugivory adaptations in the bat kidney and pancreas

finding: The SNP rs2027349 was identified as the strongest neuronal allele-specific open-chromatin (ASoC) variant associated with schizophrenia (SZ). It was found in the 5' untranslated region of the gene VPS45 and exhibited ASoC in induced neurons derived from glutamatergic and dopaminergic lineages but did not show the same effect in induced pluripotent stem cells (iPSCs) or other neuronal cell types. This difference was attributed to varying allelic effect sizes across cell types, indicating its significance in the context of brain disorders.
title: Allele-specific open chromatin in human iPSC neurons elucidates functional non-coding disease variants

finding: The SNP rs35873233 was identified as a putative causal eQTL from an upstream variant of CITED4 with high regulatory relevance. It demonstrated a significantly greater EMS score (>25x greater than other variants in the study) and enabled a precise PIP EMS assessment to narrow down to this single variant, showing a PIP EMS of 0.956. This led to the identification of CITED4 as a candidate gene related to neutrophil count in the UK Biobank analysis.
title: Leveraging supervised learning for functionally-informed fine-mapping of cis-eQTLs identifies an additional 20,913 putative causal eQTLs

finding: The variant rs1886730 was shown to be associated with TNFRSF14, with eQTL and GWAS analysis revealing shared genetic signals using IBD tissue. This SNP was identified as a target gene related to inflammatory bowel diseases, underlining its potential role in the genetic landscape of IBD.
title: eQTL in diseased colon tissue identifies novel target genes associated with IBD

finding: The sentinel variant rs324420 at the FAAH locus was found to be strongly associated with plasma levels of N-oleoyl-glycine (p-value = 5.7 x 10^-64, beta 0.54) and N-oleoyl-serine (p-value = 3.6 x 10^-32, beta 0.38) in the context of cardiometabolic traits related to glucose and lipid homeostasis. This missense variant (Pro129Thr) was linked to reduced FAAH stability and enzymatic activity, correlating with overweight and obesity.
title: CYP4F2 is a human-specific determinant of circulating N-acyl amino acid levels

finding: The variant rs2814778 was associated with the Duffy-null phenotype and was present at high frequency in Yemenis (74%) while decreasing in frequency northward (59% in Saudis, 6% in Iraqi-Arabs). Its high prevalence suggested positive selection likely related to protection against Plasmodium vivax infection, consistent with historical African admixture.
title: The Genomic History of the Middle East

finding: The SNP rs12030742 was identified in the study by Cabrita et al. (2020) as being associated with the loss of PTEN, a frequent tumor suppressor in cancer. This SNP was correlated with immuno-modulatory functions, specifically linked to the upregulation of PD-L1 and enhanced production of extracellular vesicles (EVs) that induced immune evasion in glioma cells, suggesting a significant role in tumor immune microenvironment dynamics.
title: PTEN loss in glioma cell lines leads to increased extracellular vesicle biogenesis and PD-L1 cargo in a PI3K-dependent manner

finding: The SNP rs12041006 was identified as a significant regulator of B cell trafficking in CLL. It was noted that variations at this locus were linked to the aggressiveness of the disease.
title: Leukemic cell-secreted interleukin-9 suppresses cytotoxic T cell-mediated killing in chronic lymphocytic leukemia

finding: The SNP rs12082082 was associated with escape from X-chromosome inactivation (XCI) in a study focusing on X-linked epigenetic regulators and immune responses. It was found in the context of examining how XCI escape may influence the female sex survival advantage in melanoma, highlighting its role in gene expression variability among individuals.
title: Escape from X-inactivation in twins exhibits intra- and inter-individual variability across tissues and is heritable

finding: The SNP rs12061521 was identified in relation to cancer progression dynamics, particularly in the context of mechanobiology affecting tumor microenvironments. This finding indicated a potential link between this SNP variant and the altered biomechanical properties of cells that could influence cancer cell behavior, as reported by Novak et al. (2020).
title: A flexible micro-piston device for mechanical cell stimulation and compression in microfluidic settings

finding: This SNP was located in the NOS1AP gene, which had the strongest association with the QT interval, and it was shown to loop to the proximal promoter of NOS1AP.
title: Detailed Regulatory Interaction Map of the Human Heart Facilitates Gene Discovery for Cardiovascular Disease

finding: The SNP rs11122017 was highlighted in the context of a study investigating aberrant protein phosphorylation in cancer, which utilized Raman biomarkers to differentiate between healthy and cancerous cells. This finding was significant as it related to the biochemical changes observed in cancerous human colon cells compared to normal cells, emphasizing the importance of specific genetic variations in cancer pathology and diagnosis.
title: Vitamin C – protective role in oxidative stress conditions induced in human normal colon cells by label free Raman spectroscopy and imaging

finding: The SNP rs12082046 was linked to the gene CTHRC1, which was noted for its upregulation across multiple cancer types. This gene's high expression was associated with poor survival and progression in cancers, implicating it as a crucial factor in the regulation of the extracellular matrix (ECM) that influences cancer outcomes.
title: A pan-cancer analysis of matrisome proteins reveals CTHRC1and LOXL2 as major ECM regulators across cancers

finding: The SNP rs6661921 was associated with creativity and located near the gene NEGR1, which had been previously linked to major depression (MD) and attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD). This relationship suggested a genetic correlation between creativity and susceptibility to psychiatric disorders.
title: Genetic architecture of creativity and extensive genetic overlap with psychiatric disorders revealed from genome-wide association analyses of 241,736 individuals

finding: Chosen from a significant 2019 GWAS study, this SNP was linked to the gene ADAMTS4, marking it as an important finding in Alzheimer's disease research.
title: Multi-Modal Data Analysis for Alzheimer’s Disease Diagnosis: An Ensemble Model Using Imagery and Genetic Features

finding: The SNP rs12082216 was identified in the context of splicing anomalies in myeloproliferative neoplasms. The research highlighted the involvement of this SNP in facilitating splicing changes that contribute to the pathogenesis of these cancers, indicating its potential role as a biomarker for therapeutic targets.
title: A Model for DHX15 Mediated Disassembly of A-Complex Spliceosomes

finding: The SNP rs12061479 was associated with an increased risk of breast cancer linked to EBV activity. This finding was particularly highlighted in the context of the oncogenic properties of the EBV ZEBRA protein, which may play a role in the pathogenesis of breast cancer through mechanisms related to viral DNA integration and chromosome damage.
title: In BRCA1 and BRCA2 breast cancers, chromosome breaks occur near herpes tumor virus sequences

finding: The SNP rs2228145 in the IL6R gene region was shown to be protective for severe depression, as it impairs IL-6R signaling, thus reducing inflammation and its associated risk for depression.
title: Shared mechanisms between coronary heart disease and depression: findings from a large UK general population-based cohort

finding: In the study conducted by Gupta et al. (2020), SNP rs12092392 was identified as being associated with treatment responses in Triple-Negative Breast Cancer (TNBC). The finding indicated that variations at this locus may influence the efficacy of circadian rhythm-based drug therapies, suggesting a potential biomarker for predicting which patients might benefit from specific treatment timing strategies. This association linked the genetic variant with altered drug sensitivity, thereby contributing to the optimization of anti-cancer drug treatments.
title: Time-of-day effects of cancer drugs revealed by high-throughput deep phenotyping

finding: The SNP rs78025940 was associated with the reproductive subtype of PCOS, showing a strong association (P_meta=2.23×10^-10), with an odds ratio (OR) of 4.75 (95% CI, 2.82-7.98). It was located 579kb downstream of the PRMD2 gene and 194kb upstream from the KAZN gene.
title: Phenotypic clustering reveals distinct subtypes of polycystic ovary syndrome with novel genetic associations

finding: The SNP rs16850259 was associated with the reproductive subtype of PCOS, achieving genome-wide significance (P_meta=2.14×10^-9) with an OR of 5.57 (95% CI, 3.24-9.56). It was identified within the same intergenic region as rs78025940.
title: Phenotypic clustering reveals distinct subtypes of polycystic ovary syndrome with novel genetic associations

finding: The SNP rs12040949 was identified as associated with telomere length regulation mediated by telomeric repeat-containing RNA (TERRA). Specifically, it was linked to the mechanism of alternative lengthening of telomeres (ALT) in cancer cells, which is crucial for understanding cancer development and therapeutic strategies.
title: CRISPR Cas13-based tools to track and manipulate endogenous telomeric repeat-containing RNAs in living cells

finding: The analysis of the PTPN22 rs2476601 T allele in the context of ACPA-positive rheumatoid arthritis indicated that it exhibited synergistic interaction with other non-HLA genetic risk factors. The study found no deviation from multiplicativity but did detect a significant departure from additivity, suggesting that the rs2476601 T allele contributed uniquely to the disease's etiology and could not be phenocopied by non-HLA risk factors. The observed findings highlighted the complex interplay of multiple genetic risk factors in the pathogenesis of rheumatoid arthritis.
title: Understanding interactions between risk factors, and assessing the utility of the additive and multiplicative models through simulations

finding: The rare missense alternate allele (G) at rs56048322 in exon 18 of the PTPN22 gene was associated with increased risk for T1D and resulted in the expression of two novel transcripts. This association underscored the influence of genetic variants on alternative splicing in T1D.
title: Shifts in isoform usage underlie transcriptional differences in regulatory T cells in type 1 diabetes

finding: Found in the PA perturbation model, this SNP reQTL for PRMT6 was associated with low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL) levels, evidencing its role in metabolic pathways.
title: Modeling heterogeneity in single-cell perturbation states enhances detection of response eQTLs

finding: This SNP was associated with LDL-C levels, confirming previous findings of low-frequency variants in the PCSK9 gene related to lipid levels.
title: Role of Rare and Low Frequency Variants in Gene-Alcohol Interactions on Plasma Lipid Levels

finding: This SNP disrupted regulation of the TARGET gene ACTN2 in the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex by transcription factors NKX6-1 and NOBOX.
title: Integrative analysis of multi-omics reveals gene regulatory networks across brain regions from risk variants to phenotypes of Alzheimer’s disease and Covid-19

finding: SNP rs2062 impacted regulation of ACTN2 in the hippocampus by transcription factors LEF1, SMAD3, and TEAD3.
title: Integrative analysis of multi-omics reveals gene regulatory networks across brain regions from risk variants to phenotypes of Alzheimer’s disease and Covid-19

finding: The SNP rs144105756 disrupted the regulation of ACTN2 in the hippocampus by IRF2 and IRF9.
title: Integrative analysis of multi-omics reveals gene regulatory networks across brain regions from risk variants to phenotypes of Alzheimer’s disease and Covid-19

finding: SNP rs79542980 was found to disrupt FOXF2 regulation of ACTN2 in the lateral temporal lobe.
title: Integrative analysis of multi-omics reveals gene regulatory networks across brain regions from risk variants to phenotypes of Alzheimer’s disease and Covid-19

finding: This SNP impacted NFKB1 regulation of CSF3R in the lateral temporal lobe.
title: Integrative analysis of multi-omics reveals gene regulatory networks across brain regions from risk variants to phenotypes of Alzheimer’s disease and Covid-19

finding: The study identified that the rs3738476 SNP, a synonymous mutation in the CDS region of the PRUNE1 gene, resulted in a C-to-A mutation that generated a GGACU sequence de novo. This sequence enabled the site to be modified by m6A. Furthermore, the analysis revealed that m6A-related SNPs, including rs3738476, were significantly associated with diseases such as colorectal cancer, colorectal carcinoma, and coronary artery disease.
title: Landscape and regulation of m6A and m6Am methylome across human and mouse tissues

finding: The SNP rs12071882 was identified in the context of its association with CCR2 in tumor microenvironmental cells, which was shown to modulate glioma biology. This finding highlighted the significance of this SNP in understanding the regulatory networks pertaining to glioma and provided insights into how genetic variations may influence tumor behavior.
title: Gene Function Revealed at the Moment of Stochastic Gene Silencing

finding: The variant rs200607541 in the AGRN gene was predicted to be deleterious with a Condel score of 0.756, SIFT score of 0.02, and PolyPhen score of 0.925. This SNP had an allele frequency of 4.56E-03 and affected a region associated with EGF-like and Follistatin-N-terminal domains, contributing to the molecular basis of Congenital Myasthenic Syndromes (CMS).
title: Rare disease research workflow using multilayer networks elucidates the molecular determinants of severity in Congenital Myasthenic Syndromes

finding: The SNP rs6594028 was associated with the alignment of MT-ND1 reads specifically in individuals of African descent, where the G allele was present. This SNP facilitated perfect alignment for MT-ND1 reads and contributed to the gene expression variability of the mitochondrial pseudogene MTND1P23 across samples derived from different ethnic backgrounds.
title: Patterns of unwanted biological and technical expression variation across 49 human tissues

finding: The SNP rs3010126 was associated with the phenotype of melanoma metastasis. In the context of this study, it was noted as a significant marker related to the inflammatory response in the sentinel lymph node (sLN) and its role in supporting the metastatic process through IL-1α signaling. The research showed that targeting IL-1α had therapeutically beneficial effects in mitigating metastasis, connecting the SNP's findings to potential immunotherapeutic strategies.
title: IL-1α secreted by subcapsular sinus macrophages promotes melanoma metastasis in the sentinel lymph node by upregulating STAT3 signaling in the tumor

finding: The study reported a significant correlation between SNP rs7512462 in the SLC26A9 gene and the extent of rescue of F508del-CFTR function by VX-809 and VX-770 in human nasal epithelial cells. This finding was specifically observed in patients with the F508del/F508del genotype for cystic fibrosis.
title: Robust W1282X-CFTR rescue by a small molecule GSPT1 degrader

finding: The study referenced SNP rs12040853 in relation to the NR1D1 gene, demonstrating its impact on cell motility and invasiveness in the context of colon cancer, emphasizing the gene's role in the development of cellular characteristics that could be influenced by toxic agents like glyphosate-based herbicides.
title: In-depth comparative toxicogenomics of glyphosate and Roundup herbicides: histopathology, transcriptome and epigenome signatures, and DNA damage

finding: The SNP rs11121992 was previously identified in the context of malignant rhabdoid tumors (MRTs). This finding indicated that variations at this SNP locus could relate to the pathogenesis of MRTs, specifically highlighting genetic influences on tumor behavior and treatment response.
title: Identification and validation of a non-genetically encoded vulnerability to XPO1 inhibition in malignant rhabdoid tumors – expanding patient-driven discovery beyond the N-of-1

finding: Similar to rs9660992, the SNP rs12137294 was found unlinked (r2 = 0.46), yet in close proximity to several variants within open chromatin, supporting its potential role as a tag SNP related to RBC traits.
title: An integrated platform to systematically identify causal variants and genes for polygenic human traits

finding: Like rs12137294, the SNP rs1172129 was identified in a region of unlinked causal variants, highlighting its potential as a tag SNP associated with RBC traits.
title: An integrated platform to systematically identify causal variants and genes for polygenic human traits

finding: The SNP rs12082154 was identified in the context of melanoma, where it was shown to be associated with EMT-inducing transcription factors. This association contributed to the understanding of melanoma phenotype switching and resistance to treatment, aligning with the findings reported by Tang et al. in their 2020 study.
title: Detecting expressed cancer somatic mutations from single-cell RNA sequencing data

finding: The rs35672330 SNP was characterized by a mutation of residue 151 from Leucine to Proline, which led to a loss of EXO5 nuclease activity and impaired nuclear localization. This variant was associated with increased genomic instability and worse prognosis across multiple cancer types. The analysis indicated that although the distribution of haplotype 4 (which includes this SNP) did not show specific enrichment for prostate cancer, the presence of the SNP indicated significant functional and clinical implications.
title: A common haplotype in the EXO5 gene can impact its protein structure and dynamics and modulate genome stability and cancer progression

finding: The SNP rs2651899 was identified as a risk factor for migraine, particularly in the North Indian and Chinese populations, indicating its relevance in the genetic predisposition to migraine.
title: The neurotrophin artemin and its receptor GFRα3 mediate migraine-like pain via the ion channel TRPM8

finding: The SNP rs7512462 in the SLC26A9 gene was associated with the extent of rescue of F508del-CFTR function by VX-809 and VX-770 in human nasal epithelial cells. This finding suggested that the genetic variation at this locus could influence the therapeutic response in F508del/F508del cystic fibrosis patients, thereby underlining the importance of understanding genetic factors in designing targeted therapies.
title: Elevator motion of chloride ion transporter SLC26A9 induced by STAS domain

finding: The SNP rs599839 was linked to cardiovascular diseases and demonstrated a regulatory interaction with the PSMA5 gene among immune cell lines. This interaction was also indicated by high interaction counts and the presence of regulatory marks such as DNase I and H3k4me3.
title: Leveraging epigenomes and three-dimensional genome organization for interpreting regulatory variation

finding: The polymorphism FH V62I (rs800292) was identified as a protective haplotype against complement-dysregulation diseases such as atypical hemolytic uremic syndrome (aHUS), C3 glomerulopathies (C3G), age-related macular degeneration (AMD), and dengue hemorrhagic fever. In particular, individuals carrying the variant I62 were less prone to these diseases. Moreover, the FH I62 variant demonstrated increased binding affinity for C3b and enhanced cofactor activity, which contributed to its protective role.
title: The synthetic protein MFHR13 as efficient multitarget regulator against complement over-activation

finding: The rs12129705 A allele in the PHGDH gene was significantly associated with increased appendicular lean mass, with a p-value of 1.2e-14 and a beta of 0.0221. This association was revealed in a large cohort from the UK Biobank (n=450,243) and suggests a functional role of the SNP in influencing muscle mass.
title: Skeletal muscle hypertrophy rewires glucose metabolism: an experimental investigation and systematic review

finding: The minor 'C' variant of rs10913469 in the intron of SEC16B was associated with a higher prevalence of obesity and increased body mass index (BMI) in adults and children across populations in Asia, Mexico, and several European countries. This association highlighted the potential role of SEC16B in the genetic predisposition to obesity.
title: Intestinal SEC16B modulates obesity by controlling dietary lipid absorption

finding: The intergenic 'G' variant of rs543874 was associated with greater obesity rates and body fat percentage among individuals of African American, East Asian, and European descent. This finding indicated that variants in SEC16B might play a significant role in the pathogenesis of obesity and factors related to lipid absorption.
title: Intestinal SEC16B modulates obesity by controlling dietary lipid absorption

finding: The SNP rs942439 was analyzed in the context of its association with gene expression and hippocampal volume in Alzheimer's disease. It was found that SEC14L2 gene expression was negatively associated with hippocampal volume only in individuals with the 'AA' genotype at this locus (N=37, R=-0.47, p=0.003), revealing the potential for this SNP to highlight novel genetic targets for AD drug treatments. In contrast, a positive correlation was observed in the 'GA' genotype subgroup (N=208, R=0.15, P=0.03), indicating a conflicting direction of correlation across different genotypes.
title: Integrating Transcriptomics, Genomics, and Imaging in Alzheimer’s Disease: A Federated Model

finding: The rs823118 SNP was noted to have a larger effect size, and it was part of a locus harboring RAB7L1, identified as a LRRK2 interactor, suggesting its potential role in modifying PD risk associated with the LRRK2 p.G2019S mutation.
title: Penetrance of Parkinson’s disease in LRRK2 p.G2019S carriers is modified by a polygenic risk score

finding: The variant rs4524, which corresponds to a K>R substitution in the Factor V (F5) protein, was identified as a pQTL when using a PAV-inclusive library. This finding highlighted the importance of including protein altering variants (PAVs) in protein quantification analyses.
title: Nanoparticle Enrichment Mass-Spectrometry Proteomics Identifies Protein Altering Variants for Precise pQTL Mapping

finding: The SNP rs11121967 was found to be linked with enhanced epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition in breast cancer. Jalaleddine et al. (2019) discussed how this SNP may influence pancreatic cancer development by affecting the behavior of epithelial cells in cancer tissue.
title: Novel Pannexin 1 isoform is increased in cancer

finding: This SNP was the lead SNP for the first principal component related to dietary traits and was shown to be associated with a decrease in prudent eating behaviors, located at chr1:72748567 with a significance of P=2.80×10^-48.
title: Comprehensive genomic analysis of dietary habits in UK Biobank identifies hundreds of genetic loci and establishes causal relationships between educational attainment and healthy eating

finding: rs296547 was shown to be an mQTL for C1orf106 (β = -1.04, P < 10^-30) and exhibited pleiotropic associations with schizophrenia, underlying its role in celiac disease.
title: Cross-disorder analysis of schizophrenia and 19 immune diseases reveals genetic correlation

finding: The A326T (rs2274907) SNP in the omentin gene was significantly associated with lower serum adiponectin concentrations in an Asian Indian population (p=1.90 x 10^-47). Carriers of the 'A' allele had markedly lower levels of adiponectin compared to individuals with the 'TT' genotype. The association indicated that the 'A' allele carriers were at increased risk of being cardiometabolically unhealthy, having an increased risk of 1.35 times compared to the 'TT' homozygotes (p=0.03). However, this association disappeared when adjusting for adiponectin concentrations (p=0.79), suggesting that the relationship was mediated through adiponectin.
title: Circulating adiponectin mediates the association between omentin gene polymorphism and cardiometabolic health in Asian Indians

finding: The SNP rs12071765 was associated with the CCL5/CCR5 axis in relation to cancer progression, as discussed in the study by Aldinucci et al. (2020). This finding contributed to the understanding of tumor microenvironments and their influence on drug-resistance and metastasis.
title: Super-resolved imaging deciphers ligand dependent membrane behaviour of the onco-immunogenic CCR5 receptor

finding: The rs1435166/G allele in EGLN1 was linked to significantly lower mRNA expression in Sherpa highlanders, which contributed to their adaptive response to high altitude by limiting the EPO hypoxic response.
title: Downregulations of mRNA expressions in the EPAS1 and EGLN1: Unraveling a genetic mechanism for high-altitude hypoxia adaptation in Sherpa highlanders

finding: The rs2153364/A allele in EGLN1 was noted to have down-regulatory impacts on mRNA expression levels as well, which provided support for the genetic adaptation mechanisms helping Sherpa highlanders cope with high altitude.
title: Downregulations of mRNA expressions in the EPAS1 and EGLN1: Unraveling a genetic mechanism for high-altitude hypoxia adaptation in Sherpa highlanders

finding: The SNP rs147247472, located in the AGBL4 gene, was significantly associated with substance dependence (P=4.30×10⁻⁸), specifically contributing to the shared vulnerability across alcoholism and drug dependence.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies common genetic risk factors for alcohol, heroin and methamphetamine dependence

finding: This variant showed associations with TN disease, with an OR of 0.93 (95% CI 0.91 to 0.96) and a p-value of 1.07×10^-4, but also had weak associations with luminal A-like disease.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: It was associated particularly with risk of HER2-positive subtypes, with corroborating evidence in case-case comparisons relating to HER2 status and grade.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: Identified as strongly associated with TN disease, its findings confirmed in case-case comparisons with TN status.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: Associated with risk of luminal A-like disease (OR 1.17, p=5.25×10^-90) and showed associations with multiple tumor markers.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: Found to be predisposing significantly to high-grade tumor subtypes.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: This SNP was identified as an eQTL for ST7L and WNT2B, crucial for cortical surface area, indicating its involvement in regulatory pathways influencing brain structure.
title: The genetic architecture of the human cerebral cortex

finding: This SNP was noted as an eQTL in adult cortex for LMO4 with implications for areal identity specification in the brain, emphasizing its relevance in cortical morphology.
title: The genetic architecture of the human cerebral cortex

finding: The study confirmed that individuals with the GG genotype at SNP rs1800896 secreted smaller amounts of TNF-α compared to carriers of the AA or GA genotypes after infection with A. fumigatus. In humans, this genotype was associated with a lower inflammatory response, revealing a correlation between genotype and cytokine production. Furthermore, it was established that the dichotomy of IL-10 and TNF-α production linked to this SNP was observed in human macrophages, indicating that the GG genotype leads to a more pronounced anti-inflammatory response, consistent with the findings that chitin particles from ov-PCN yeasts stimulated a higher IL-10 production.
title: Paracoccin overexpression in Paracoccidioides brasiliensis reveals the influence of chitin hydrolysis on fungal virulence and host immune response

finding: The SNP rs10927806 was associated with the metabolite 4-guanidinobutanoate, which is an intermediate product in the polyamine synthesis pathway regulated by the AGMAT locus. This genetic association was significant and suggested shared underlying genetic regulation with the other metabolite  beta-guanidinopropanoate as both variants are in high linkage disequilibrium.
title: Genome-wide scan identifies novel genetic loci regulating salivary metabolite levels

finding: The SNP rs6690813 showed a significant association with the metabolite beta-guanidinopropanoate, also linked to the AGMAT locus. Like rs10927806, it indicated shared genetic regulation of the associated metabolites, demonstrating a novel discovery in the context of salivary metabolomics.
title: Genome-wide scan identifies novel genetic loci regulating salivary metabolite levels

finding: The SNP rs2251636 was associated with the gene SEMA4A, which also showed fibroblast-specific expression, further indicating the significance of enhancer SNPs in tissue-specific gene regulation and potential implications for vascular biology.
title: Chromatin interaction maps of human arterioles reveal new mechanisms for the genetic regulation of blood pressure

finding: The SNP rs12123563 was implicated in the emerging role of extracellular vesicles regarding immune regulation and cancer progression, particularly in gliomas. Its connection to tumor biology indicated that variations in this SNP might affect immune responses and tumor growth dynamics.
title: SMPD3 suppresses IDH mutant tumor growth via dual autocrine-paracrine roles

finding: The SNP rs2814778 was identified as the cause of erythrocyte-specific ACKR1 deficiency, which is fixed in sub-Saharan African populations. This deficiency likely conferred a selective advantage against malaria by preventing the malarial parasite Plasmodium vivax from utilizing ACKR1 as an entry factor into erythrocytes. Additionally, the study proposed a potential link between ACKR1 deficiency and reduced COVID-19 mortality rates in sub-Saharan Africa, suggesting that this SNP may influence mortality outcomes from infectious diseases.
title: Atypical Chemokine Receptor 1 (Ackr1)-deficient Mice Resist Lethal SARS-CoV-2 Challenge

finding: Prioritized as a high-confidence variant for multiple red blood cell-related traits including HGB and RBC, validated through eQTL studies and joint latent factor fine-mapping.
title: Improved genetic discovery and fine-mapping resolution through multivariate latent factor analysis of high-dimensional traits

finding: The rs841572 variant was associated with lower fasting glucose (FG) levels and reduced expression of SLC2A1, the glucose transporter, indicating its involvement in glucose homeostasis.
title: The Trans-Ancestral Genomic Architecture of Glycaemic Traits

finding: The SNP rs5744168 was significantly associated with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) in humans. In the discovery cohort, it showed a dominant association with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.60 (p = 0.04). In the validation cohort, there was a significant additive association with an OR of 1.31 (p = 0.01). The meta-analysis revealed an overall significant additive association (OR = 1.28, p = 0.009) along with a significant dominant association (OR = 1.29, p = 0.01). This variant was found to be associated with an increased susceptibility to IPF, as well as a modification of the lung microbiome, contributing to increased dysbiosis.
title: Toll-Like-Receptor 5 protects against pulmonary fibrosis by reducing lung dysbiosis

finding: The SNP rs11122017 was associated with aberrant protein phosphorylation in cancer, providing significant insights related to cancer biomarkers. This finding was reported in the context of evaluating nanomechanical and biochemical properties of cancerous cell lines, emphasizing its relevance to oncological diagnostics.
title: Biochemistry and nanomechanical properties of human colon cells upon simvastatin, lovastatin and mevastatin supplementations – Raman imaging and AFM studies

finding: The variant rs3766325, found in the IFI44 gene, was associated with notable enlargement of epithelial cell nuclei in the esophagus mucosa, indicating post-injury regeneration. Gene expression analysis also identified 30 genes linked with the A allele, where genes related to cell proliferation were upregulated, and the enrichment analysis highlighted pathways that could be relevant to tissue regeneration.
title: HistoGWAS: An AI-enabled Framework for Automated Genetic Analysis of Tissue Phenotypes in Histology Cohorts

finding: The SNP rs12030731 was identified as a positive and original finding associated with tumor biology in lung adenocarcinoma. Specifically, it correlated with the increased expression of proteoglycans (PGs) which were linked to invasive tumor phenotypes and poor patient prognosis. The study highlighted that elevated levels of sulfated glycosaminoglycans (sGAGs) influenced tumor cell behavior by promoting extensive cellular proliferation, epithelial-mesenchymal transition, and stemness through the activation of the FAK-PI3K-mTOR signaling axis.
title: Extracellular matrix sulfation in the tumor microenvironment stimulates cancer stemness and invasiveness

finding: The stop-gain variant c.433C>T; p.Arg145Ter located in ZMYND12 was identified as the cause of severe flagellum malformations linked to primary male infertility in patients with asthenoteratozoospermia. This variant was found in four unrelated patients, and a similar homozygous variant was confirmed in an additional subject from a different cohort.
title: Novel axonemal protein ZMYND12 interacts with TTC29 and DNAH1, and is required for male fertility and flagellum function

finding: The SNP rs4951250 was identified as significantly discordant across different genotype discovery approaches within both the All of Us and gnomAD datasets. The discordance was marked by a very low p-value of <1×10⁻¹⁶ when comparing genome versus exome data, and a p-value of 4×10⁻⁵ for genome versus array data. This finding highlighted its role as a variant of interest that warrants caution in association studies due to its variability in calls across methodologies.
title: Discordant calls across genotype discovery approaches elucidate variants with systematic errors

finding: This SNP in ANKRD36BP1 was linked with high posterior probability and associated with height.
title: Ancestral diversity improves discovery and fine-mapping of genetic loci for anthropometric traits - the Hispanic/Latino Anthropometry Consortium

finding: The rs1044299 SNP at the PAPPA2 locus was significantly associated with serum PAPP-A2 levels, but its association with height was attenuated when conditioned on nearby height signals, suggesting a complex interaction.
title: Protein QTL analysis of IGF-I and its binding proteins provides insights into growth biology

finding: The rs11209026 SNP, corresponding to the R381Q polymorphism in the IL-23R gene, was found to have a protective role in immune-mediated diseases. This finding was highlighted in a review by Abdollahi et al. (2016), which emphasized the significance of this SNP in modulating immune responses and conferring protection against such diseases.
title: RORα enforces stability of the T-helper-17 cell effector program

finding: The rs1801133 polymorphism on the MTHFR gene was reported to interact with maternal folic acid intake during gestation, indicating a complex interaction between genetic predisposition and environmental nutrition affecting ASD risk.
title: A role for gene-environment interactions in Autism Spectrum Disorder is suggested by variants in genes regulating exposure to environmental factors

finding: The SNP rs12568930 was identified as an IBD susceptibility locus located at Chromosome 1:22,375,738. The nearest gene was ZTBT40, but the three C1Q genes (C1QA, C1QB, C1QC) also lie within the genomic interval, suggesting that C1q could be a stronger candidate in this context.
title: The association between transcriptional regulation of macrophage differentiation and activation and genetic susceptibility to inflammatory bowel disease

finding: The SNP rs12061411 was associated with the transcriptional regulation of macrophages in the context of pulmonary fibrosis, specifically influencing the activity of genes involved in the profibrotic response. This SNP was noted for its role in the expression profiling of tumor-associated macrophages and highlighted its relevance to the pathology of systemic sclerosis-associated interstitial lung disease (SSc-ILD), where macrophages and fibroblast activity play critical roles.
title: Altered AP-1, RUNX and EGR chromatin dynamics drive fibrotic lung disease

finding: The association of the SNP rs3861950 (T > C) in the TNFSF4 gene with coronary artery disease indicated a genetic predisposition that could also influence metabolic complications prevalent in gestational diabetes.
title: Identification of differentially expressed genes and signaling pathways in gestational diabetes mellitus by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: SNP rs1234313 (A > G) in TNFSF4 was found to have a significant association with coronary artery disease, which can be critical for understanding cardiovascular risks in pregnant women with gestational diabetes.
title: Identification of differentially expressed genes and signaling pathways in gestational diabetes mellitus by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The IL6R SNP rs2228145 (A > C) showed association with levels of VCAM1 and ICAM1 gene transcripts in essential hypertension, linking inflammatory pathways to metabolic conditions, including gestational diabetes.
title: Identification of differentially expressed genes and signaling pathways in gestational diabetes mellitus by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The association between rs1764391 and susceptibility to myocardial infarction (MI) was confirmed in the Han Chinese population, demonstrating its role as a significant genetic variant influencing MI risk.
title: In-silico analysis of Myocardial Infarction-related missense SNPs to identify novel biomarkers to predict susceptibility

finding: Carriers of the GG genotype of rs3480 were found to have significantly elevated levels of Troponin I and triglycerides, which are risk factors associated with myocardial infarction, establishing its relevance.
title: In-silico analysis of Myocardial Infarction-related missense SNPs to identify novel biomarkers to predict susceptibility

finding: The GA genotype of rs726344 was associated with significantly increased levels of CKMB, total cholesterol, LDLc, HDLc, Troponin I, and triglycerides, further contributing to MI risk.
title: In-silico analysis of Myocardial Infarction-related missense SNPs to identify novel biomarkers to predict susceptibility

finding: In the XAF cohort, the stop gain variant rs28362286 in PCSK9 was linked to a decrease in non-HDL cholesterol levels by 0.92 s.d.
title: The sequences of 150,119 genomes in the UK biobank

finding: The rare variant rs1383914144 was associated with lower uric acid levels by -0.43 s.d. and showed a protective effect against gout.
title: The sequences of 150,119 genomes in the UK biobank

finding: The SNP rs12092400 was associated with significant antileukemic activity when targeting mitochondrial Complex I and Bcl-2 in AML cells. This research underscored the importance of oxidative phosphorylation in AML cells and suggested that vulnerabilities based on this metabolic dependence could be leveraged in therapeutic strategies against the disease.
title: Acute myeloid leukemia mitochondria hydrolyze ATP to resist chemotherapy

finding: The SNP rs10900588, associated with malaria resistance, was found to have extremely high frequencies of the G allele among Nilotic populations such as the Anuak, Gumuz, and South Sudanese. In contrast, this allele was rarely present in populations like Afar and Somali, who are geographically isolated from Nilotics. The study confirmed that Nilotic populations exhibited higher malaria resistance compared to other Ethiopian groups, consistent with earlier findings that highlighted the prevalence of the G allele in Nilotics compared to Bantus in Uganda. The frequency of the G allele in Yoruba (YRI) was similar to that observed in Nilotic populations.
title: The genetic and linguistic structures of Abyssinians and their neighbor reveal the historical demographic dynamics and environmental adaptation in the African Horn region

finding: The minor allele (A) associated with increased risk of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) was reported as the top cis pQTL for IL10, correlating with lower plasma levels of IL10 (p=2.3×10-51, effect=-0.14 SD).
title: Large-scale comparison of immunoassay- and aptamer-based plasma proteomics through genetics and disease

finding: This variant was correlated with rs3024493 (r²=1) and associated with the same phenotype of increased risk of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) as rs3024493.
title: Large-scale comparison of immunoassay- and aptamer-based plasma proteomics through genetics and disease

finding: The sentinel cis pQTL for CD58 was associated with lower levels of CD58 and a 25% reduced risk of multiple sclerosis (p=2.8×10-1, effect=-0.26 SD).
title: Large-scale comparison of immunoassay- and aptamer-based plasma proteomics through genetics and disease

finding: The SNP rs12030731 was associated with the response to treatment using pan-FGFR inhibitors like Rogaratinib in the context of traumatic brain injury (TBI). Inhibition of the FGFR signaling pathway, relevant to this SNP, facilitated protective effects on neuronal density and synaptic integrity, indicating a potential influence of genetic variations at this locus on neuroimmunological responses during TBI.
title: The FGFR inhibitor Rogaratinib reduces microglia reactivity and synaptic loss in TBI

finding: The SNP rs2274910-C was associated with an increased risk of Crohn's disease, identified in an early genome-wide association study (GWAS). This association highlighted the important role of the gene ITLN1 in the innate immune response in the gut, particularly in relation to inflammatory bowel diseases.
title: Extensive variation in the mouse intelectin gene family: recent duplications, deletions and inactivating variants result in diversity in laboratory strains

finding: The SNP rs12071765 was related to the ccl5/ccr5 axis in cancer progression as it pertains to immune response mechanisms. Its analysis indicated how genetic variants could alter immune function, particularly in the context of sex differences in B cell activity observed in the overarching study.
title: Oestrogen influences B cell class-switching in individuals with an XX sex chromosome complement

finding: The SNP rs12061377 was associated with the clinical-grade peptide-based inhibition of CK2 which blocked the viability and proliferation of T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia (T-ALL) cells. This was particularly relevant as it counteracted IL-7 stimulation and stromal support, implicating the SNP in significant molecular pathways related to cancer proliferation and response to therapeutic interventions.
title: Targeting of Protein Kinase CK2 Elicits Antiviral Activity on Bovine Coronavirus Infection

finding: The variant in the ZYG11A gene was significantly associated and negatively correlated with age specifically in females, where carriers were 14.62 years younger on average compared to non-carriers, corroborating its role in age-related analyses.
title: Exome-wide association studies in general and long-lived populations identify genetic variants related to human age

finding: SNP rs143614333, which is a missense variant in the gene CR2, was noted to have a CADD score of 23.6. This variant is included in ClinVar, with three submitters stating that its clinical significance remains uncertain, indicating the need for further investigation into its role in disease.
title: An integrated personal and population-based Egyptian genome reference

finding: The SNP rs11121844 was found to be associated with mutations in splicing factor genes in myeloid malignancies, which significantly impacted clinical features, including prognosis in patients with Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML). This finding indicated that splicing abnormalities likely correlate with genetic variations in noted SNP traits.
title: The eukaryotic translation initiation factor eIF4E reprogrammes the splicing machinery and drives alternative splicing

finding: SNP rs2145402 was linked to gene LYST. The distribution of allele pattern 'AA' at this SNP was found to be abnormal with a probability of occurrence deemed too low (3.05E-16), indicating its potential role in genetic diseases.
title: Locating suspicious lethal genes by abnormal distributions of SNP patterns

finding: SNP rs4915931 mapped to gene ROR1, which is related to fatal genetic conditions in children.
title: Locating suspicious lethal genes by abnormal distributions of SNP patterns

finding: SNP rs4660992 linked to gene BMP8B, which plays an important role in embryonic development and has associations with various genetic diseases.
title: Locating suspicious lethal genes by abnormal distributions of SNP patterns

finding: The SNP rs11119348 was identified as a candidate functional variant associated with orofacial cleft (OFC). It had allele-specific effects on IRF6 expression, reducing expression levels through interaction with the transcriptional repressor FOXE1. This SNP is referred to as the 'IRF6 -10 kb SNP' and is located within a conserved enhancer element. Conditional analyses indicated this SNP explained a substantial portion of the heritable risk for OFC.
title: Two non-coding variants associated with isolated orofacial cleft promote binding of transcriptional repressors FOXE1 or ETS2 and reduce expression of IRF6

finding: The SNP rs661849 was characterized as another candidate functional variant linked to OFC. Similar to rs11119348, it was shown to reduce IRF6 expression levels, but it engaged the transcriptional repressor ETS2. Known as the 'IRF6 -22 kb SNP', it was found within a conserved regulatory region and also contributed significantly to the heritable risk of OFC, accounting for a notable signal in conditional analyses.
title: Two non-coding variants associated with isolated orofacial cleft promote binding of transcriptional repressors FOXE1 or ETS2 and reduce expression of IRF6

finding: The nonsynonymous SNP rs139315125 was associated with the phenotype 'morning/evening person' (UK Biobank Field ID: 1180). It had a minor allele frequency of 0.47% and a p-value of 5.3E-21. Subjects who identified as morning persons displayed a higher frequency of the minor allele G, which is linked to the gene PER3, a key element of the circadian clock, confirming previous reports regarding its association with sleep-wake patterns.
title: Efficient mixed model approach for large-scale genome-wide association studies of ordinal categorical phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs72705895 was found in a TGIF boundary associated with cardiovascular disease (CVD). Its specific association was with venous thromboembolism, and it was located within a region overlapping a CTCF binding site, suggesting its relevance to 3D genome organization and gene regulation.
title: Examining dynamics of three-dimensional genome organization with multi-task matrix factorization

finding: The study mentioned the SNP rs12040843 in relation to microRNA expression patterns involved in colorectal cancer (CRC). Specifically, it identified that miR-24-3p was aberrantly upregulated in genetically-modified mouse enteroids irrespective of the mutational context, suggesting potential roles of this SNP in regulating miR-24-3p and influencing CRC cell survival.
title: Genome edited colorectal cancer organoid models reveal distinct microRNA activity patterns across different mutation profiles

finding: The SNP rs519989 exhibited allelic imbalance affecting promoter-enhancer connectivity, associated with PU.1 binding, histone modifications, and the expression of the gene LRRC8C, relevant for neutrophil biology.
title: Variation in PU.1 binding and chromatin looping at neutrophil enhancers influences autoimmune disease susceptibility

finding: The rs10873679 SNP was significantly associated with increased intracellular replication of Salmonella Typhi, indicated by a p-value of 6 × 10^-9. The C-allele of rs10873679 correlating with less MCOLN2 mRNA and protein expression, suggested its role in restricting Salmonella Typhi growth. This linkage was established through a genome-wide association study involving 961 lymphoblastoid cell lines, highlighting the role of MCOLN2 in magnesium deprivation as a mechanism of nutritional immunity against Salmonella Typhi.
title: Human variation impacting MCOLN2 restricts Salmonella Typhi replication by magnesium deprivation

finding: The intelectin 1 gene variant rs2274907 was associated with obesity, type 2 diabetes and lipid profiles in Turkish adults, emphasizing its impact on metabolic disorders.
title: Identification of novel key genes and signaling pathways in hypertrophic cardiomyopathy: evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The NPPB rs3753581 polymorphism was found to be involved in the regulation of pulse pressure hypertension, indicating its significance in blood pressure regulation.
title: Identification of novel key genes and signaling pathways in hypertrophic cardiomyopathy: evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: This SNP was part of a trio of independent SNPs representing the most significant GWAS signal for CSF YKL-40 levels, indicating a strong association with CHI3L1 regulation.
title: TMEM106B and CPOX are genetic determinants of cerebrospinal fluid Alzheimer’s disease biomarker levels

finding: As another independent signal for CSF YKL-40 levels, this SNP contributed to the significant findings surrounding CHI3L1.
title: TMEM106B and CPOX are genetic determinants of cerebrospinal fluid Alzheimer’s disease biomarker levels

finding: This SNP had the most significant p-value for YKL-40 levels in the study and was confirmed as a cis-protein quantitative trait locus (pQTL) for CHI3L1.
title: TMEM106B and CPOX are genetic determinants of cerebrospinal fluid Alzheimer’s disease biomarker levels

finding: The SNP rs1050501, which leads to the I232T substitution in the FcγRIIB protein, was positively associated with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) in homozygous populations. This association was established through extensive epidemiological studies indicating its significant role in the susceptibility to SLE, as it alters the function of FcγRIIB, affecting immune regulation.
title: FcγRIIB I232T polymorphic change allosterically suppresses ligand binding

finding: The SNP rs12082287 was associated with anti-metastasis fascin inhibitors that decreased the growth of specific subtypes of cancers, indicating a potential role in cancer progression and treatment response.
title: The Actin Bundling Protein Fascin Promotes Lung Cancer Growth and Metastasis by Enhancing Glycolysis and PFKFB3 Expression

finding: The analysis indicated that <italic>DNM3</italic> rs2421947 was associated with age-at-onset (AAO) in Parkinson's disease, with a hazard ratio (HR) of 1.14 (95% CI 1.02-1.27, p=0.025) after a meta-analysis of data from 1478 <italic>LRRK2</italic> p.G2019S carriers. Additionally, the original study showed that GG homozygotes had a median onset 12.5 years younger than CC homozygotes, indicating a potential modifying effect.
title: Analysis of DNM3 and VAMP4 as genetic modifiers of LRRK2 Parkinson’s disease

finding: SNP rs3789362 was noted for having a CADD score exceeding 20, indicating a potential deleterious effect on protein function. It was included in the genome-wide significant SNPs associated with volumetric imaging derived phenotypes.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analyses of the brain imaging phenotypes in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs6680541 was included in the findings as part of the significant SNPs with a high likelihood of being deleterious (CADD score ≥ 20), and it was linked to volumetric imaging derived phenotypes.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analyses of the brain imaging phenotypes in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs12082109 was associated with bone metastases in the context of breast cancer, as reported by Wood and Brown in their 2020 study, which highlighted its potential as a biomarker in the metastatic progression of the disease.
title: Transcriptome analysis of heterogeneity in mouse model of metastatic breast cancer

finding: The SNP rs2013162 in the IRF6 gene showed a significant interaction with methylation levels in the gene region, observed in both the isolated CL/P and control datasets.
title: Gene-methylation interactions: Discovering region-wise DNA methylation levels that modify SNP-associated disease risk

finding: SNP rs560426 in ABCA4 exhibited significant interactions with methylation levels in both the gene and promoter regions for the CL/P and CLO datasets.
title: Gene-methylation interactions: Discovering region-wise DNA methylation levels that modify SNP-associated disease risk

finding: The SNP rs12123787 was positively associated with pancreatic cancer cachexia, highlighting its role as a potential serum protein biomarker in relation to tumor-induced mechanisms affecting the tumor microenvironment.
title: PRSS2 promotes tumor growth and progression by repressing Tsp-1 in the tumor microenvironment via binding to LRP1

finding: The SNP rs12408275 showcased different effect sizes on the CCDC27 eGene based on the context of microglial versus excitatory neuron types, demonstrating its role as a stress-interactive eQTL.
title: Common genetic variation impacts stress response in the brain

finding: The rs11591147 SNP, which is a variant in the PCSK9 gene, was significantly associated with lower VLDL-C levels in the context of its effects on lipoprotein-lipid profiles in a study that included 9692 participants of the EPIC-Norfolk study. The findings indicated that while the variant was linked with lower VLDL-C, the overall genetic risk score (wGRS) associated with LDL-C showed an association with lower odds of coronary artery disease (CAD) and calcific aortic valve stenosis (CAVS), highlighting the importance of PCSK9 variants in cardiovascular health.
title: Genetic inhibition of PCSK9, atherogenic lipoprotein concentrations, and calcific aortic valve stenosis

finding: The study identified that the SNP rs12092356 was significantly associated with beta human papillomavirus 8 E6 protein's role in decreasing DNA-PKcs activity, which is crucial for the non-homologous end joining (NHEJ) repair pathway. This association indicated that the presence of this SNP might correlate with increased DNA double strand breaks (DSBs) repair errors, leading to greater genomic instability as suggested by the observed increase in mutation rates following CAS9-induced DSBs.
title: Beta human papillomavirus 8 E6 allows colocalization of non-homologous end joining and homologous recombination repair factors

finding: The SNP rs12071811 was linked to the classification of HER2-positive breast cancer cell lines, revealing its importance in understanding the proliferative aspect of such cancers. This finding indicated that genetic variations could be relevant in determining the malignancy and treatment responses in HER2-positive breast cancer.
title: HOXB7 induces STAT3-mediated transformation and lung metastasis in an immortalized mammary gland NMuMG cells

finding: The SNP rs2476601, which is associated with the allele 1858C>T of the gene PTPN22, was found to be specifically linked to juvenile idiopathic arthritis in females. This connection highlights a significant role of this variant in autoimmune diseases, reinforcing the established understanding of how PTPN22 influences immune responses.
title: Autoimmunity associated allele of tyrosine phosphatase gene PTPN22 enhances anti-viral immunity

finding: The SNP rs840015 was in strong linkage disequilibrium with GWAS peaks for celiac disease and rheumatoid arthritis, supporting its role as a candidate functional regulatory SNP.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The SNP rs12740374 was identified as a significant hit related to blood lipid levels, metabolic syndrome, and coronary heart disease risk in admixed populations. It was determined to be a causal variant for affecting LDL-C levels in previous multi-ethnic studies, highlighting its significance in the context of ancestrally diverse cohorts.
title: Tractor: A framework allowing for improved inclusion of admixed individuals in large-scale association studies

finding: The SNP rs1052576, located in the Caspase-9 gene, was found to be associated with susceptibility to primary brain tumors. In this context, the study highlighted that the G>A variant had implications for apoptotic processes in neural progenitor cells (NPCs). The findings suggested that this variant may influence the cell fate decisions regulated by Snip1, thereby potentially contributing to brain dysplasia when apoptosis is dysregulated.
title: Snip1 and PRC2 coordinate intrinsic apoptosis, cell division, and neurogenesis in the developing brain

finding: The rs11360 SNP was classified as L1 and was linked to stroke, exemplifying its specific disease association compared to SNPs with wider pleiotropic effects.
title: Pleiotropic Variability Score: A Genome Interpretation Metric to Quantify Phenomic Associations of Genomic Variants

finding: This rare variant at the CRP locus was associated with CRP levels with a p-value of 1.4×10^-11, significantly better than the previous TOPMed analysis p-value of 5.0×10^-6, indicating its importance in the inflammatory response.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: Ascertainable at the CRP locus, this missense variant had a remarkable association at p=7.8×10^-16, validating previous findings linking it to elevated CRP levels and suggesting it impacts protein levels in diverse populations.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: This was one of the negligible frequency signals at the SELP locus, contributing significantly after conditioning on known variants.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: An intronic variant at the SELP locus that contributed significantly to P-selectin production and soluble protein dynamics.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: Identified as a synonymous variant contributing to significant P-selectin protein production changes, representing a unique link to platelet biology.
