title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: This coding variant in the SELP locus sat at the center of significant rare variant analyses, demonstrating conservation and function scores indicating its key role.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: This notable variant at the IL6R locus was critically linked with IL-6 levels, identified in the single variance analysis effectively.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: Significantly linked at the IL6R locus after conditioning on prior variants, highlighting its role in further understanding IL-6 related pathologies.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: Identified in analyses of E-selectin, this SNP showcased significant associations in the multi-ancestry context provided by TOPMed.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: Valid findings were repeated in connection to CRP in the extensive TOPMed dataset, showcasing important relationships within inflammatory pathways.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: Identified as distinct in CRP associations within population diversity, underscoring complex interrelations in the inflammatory context.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: The SNP rs12061524 was identified as having implications for treatment effects in uveal melanoma, where specific GNA alterations were linked to the aggressiveness of the cancer and response to therapeutic interventions. This finding contributed to advancing precision oncology by integrating SNP information into drug response predictions.
title: An interpretable deep learning framework for genome-informed precision oncology

finding: The SNP rs756655831 was evaluated in the context of its alignments to two RefSeq Genes: TBCE and B3GALNT2. This SNP served as a reference point in the remapping process, demonstrating its connection across various sequence alignments with the GRCh38 assembly.
title: SPDI: Data Model for Variants and Applications at NCBI

finding: The SNP rs11161862 was associated with variations in disease susceptibility and responses related to infectious diseases such as dengue. This finding highlighted its relevance when analyzing the role of genetic factors in epidemiological models, specifically in the context of predicting dengue incidence in Brazil.
title: Unlocking the Predictive Power of Heterogeneous Data to Build an Operational Dengue Forecasting System

finding: SNP rs646776, located on chromosome 1p13, was identified as a strong trans-pQTL for progranulin (PGRN). This SNP was associated with low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol levels and myocardial infarction risk, linking it to cardiovascular disease (CVD) through its effect on platelet counts.
title: Integrative Genomic Analysis and Functional Studies Reveal GP5, GRN, MPO and MCAM as Causal Protein Biomarkers for Platelet Traits

finding: The SNP rs12061694 was found to be associated with the regulation of Bcl-xL, which plays a critical role in apoptosis, particularly in the context of viral infections. This finding was significant in the development of broad-spectrum antivirals (BSAs) that leverage this apoptotic pathway to enhance antiviral efficacy.
title: Broad-spectrum mono- and combinational drug therapies for global viral pandemic preparedness

finding: The study confirmed that individuals with a FVIII deficiency alongside the FV Leiden variant (rs6025) exhibited a milder bleeding phenotype. This observation highlighted a distinct context from the mechanism demonstrated in the study, where low FV levels were shown to promote thrombin generation, allowing for increased FVIII binding to FXa under conditions of FVIII deficiencies.
title: A mathematical model of flow-mediated coagulation identifies factor V as a modifier of thrombin generation in hemophilia A

finding: The SNP rs12092368 was associated with the efficacy of neoadjuvant chemotherapy in colorectal cancer, indicating a positive relationship between this specific genetic variant and improved therapeutic outcomes. This finding was significant as it contributed to the understanding of individual responses to chemotherapy treatment.
title: Longitudinal examination of perfusion and angiogenesis markers in primary colorectal tumors shows distinct signatures for metronomic and maximum-tolerated dose strategies

finding: The rs1452628:T variant was associated with reduced sulcal widths across the brain and exhibited correlation with increased KCNK2 expression in the cortex.
title: Genetic map of regional sulcal morphology in the human brain

finding: The SNP rs12040906 was identified as related to the expression levels in cancer cells undergoing hybrid Epithelial/Mesenchymal transitions, and it was highlighted as a potential prognostic marker for predicting aggressive cancer phenotypes.
title: Network Topology Metrics Explaining Enrichment of Hybrid Epithelial Mesenchymal Phenotypes in Metastasis

finding: This variant was associated with mean corpuscular hemoglobin concentration (MCHC) and was found in a credible set for MCHC, indicating its regulatory role in erythroid cell types linked to SPTA1.
title: Mapping enhancer-gene regulatory interactions from single-cell data

finding: Associated with hemoglobin A1C (HbA1c) and mean corpuscular volume (MCV), rs200830867 was highlighted in credible sets for both traits, suggesting its involvement in erythroid regulatory mechanisms at the SPTA1 locus.
title: Mapping enhancer-gene regulatory interactions from single-cell data

finding: The SNP rs12092667 was identified as a significant finding in the context of EVI1 in leukemia and solid tumors. It was linked to altered cellular behaviors such as invasive and proliferative states influencing cancer progression, particularly through mechanisms involving transcriptional regulation.
title: Dynamic compartmentalization of the pro-invasive transcription factor NHR-67 reveals a role for Groucho in regulating a proliferative-invasive cellular switch in C. elegans

finding: The SNP rs12092413 was associated with the effects of Vitamin D on cell differentiation and stemness in cancer, particularly highlighted in colon carcinoma. This finding demonstrated the importance of vitamin D in upregulating SIRT1 activity, further emphasizing its role in cancer cell dynamics.
title: Vitamin D induces SIRT1 activation through K610 deacetylation in colon cancer

finding: The SNP rs12071992 was linked to severe COVID-19 outcomes as described in the study by Duployez et al. (2020). This research highlighted the association of specific clinico-biological features and the role of clonal hematopoiesis in patients experiencing severe manifestations of COVID-19. The findings suggested that variations at this SNP could impact immune responses, potentially influencing disease severity.
title: COVID-19 virtual patient cohort reveals immune mechanisms driving disease outcomes

finding: The SNP rs12030569 was identified in the context of FMRP's role in stress responses relevant to lung health. It was associated with regulation of the Integrated Stress Response Pathway (ISR) and the transcription factor ATF4, which were crucial findings derived from studies on murine and human bronchial cells. The context suggested that this SNP might influence susceptibility to oxidative and genotoxic stress in airway cells.
title: The Fragile X Mental Retardation Protein protects the lung from xenobiotic stress by facilitating the Integrated Stress Response

finding: The SNP rs151193009 in the PCSK9 gene exhibited a protective effect against CAD development and was associated with a decrease in serum total cholesterol levels (β TC-raw = -24.3 mg/dL, P = 2.3 x 10−111). This variant altered the amino acid sequence, Arg93Cys, reducing the affinity for LDLR.
title: Population-specific and transethnic genome-wide analyses reveal distinct and shared genetic risks of coronary artery disease

finding: Also in the PCSK9 gene, rs564427867 was linked to an increased risk for CAD (OR CAD = 1.31, P = 2.7 x 10−8) and an increase in total cholesterol levels (β TC-raw = 26.4 mg/dL per allele, P TC-adjusted = 6.0 x 10−91).
title: Population-specific and transethnic genome-wide analyses reveal distinct and shared genetic risks of coronary artery disease

finding: The SNP rs12123692 was identified as part of the study by Fan et al. in 2020, which established that ZIP4 is a novel cancer stem cell marker specifically in high-grade serous ovarian cancer. This finding contributed to the understanding of the genetic factors influencing cancer biology, particularly in regard to cancer stem cells and their role in tumorigenesis.
title: Molecular insights into substrate translocation in an elevator-type metal transporter

finding: The SNP rs2814778 was identified as part of a selective sweep associated with the Duffy Antigen Receptor for Chemokines gene (DARC). This locus is significant because it has been implicated in malaria resistance, where the nonexpression allele of DARC confers protection against the malaria parasite Plasmodium vivax. The analysis using Flex-sweep revealed a 430 kbp region around the DARC locus affected by the sweep, which narrows to 370 kbp at a more stringent confidence threshold. The findings confirmed the presence of the sweep with high confidence, supporting the role of the DARC gene in adaptive evolution against malaria.
title: Versatile detection of diverse selective sweeps with Flex-sweep

finding: The SNP rs4606268 was characterized as a population-biased eQTL for the gene SLC44A5 in esophagus mucosa. The derived allele decreased expression in European Americans (allelic fold change = -4.82) but had a significantly small effect in African Americans (allelic fold change = -2.85, permutation p-value = 1.2×10−3). This finding highlighted the different regulatory effects of genetic variants across populations.
title: The GTEx Consortium atlas of genetic regulatory effects across human tissues

finding: The minor (T) allele was associated with higher triglycerides (TG) in both Africans (β 0.29 TG, p=4.5 × 10⁻⁷) and African Americans (AA) (β 0.14 TG, p=0.0035). This variant had a higher frequency among those of African ancestry compared to other populations.
title: GWAS in Africans identifies novel lipids loci and demonstrates heterogenous association within Africa

finding: The findings associated with rs6421482 indicated its relationship with DrnkWk, demonstrating its role in redundant SNP associations to problematic alcohol use.
title: Meta-analysis of problematic alcohol use in 435,563 individuals identifies 29 risk variants and yields insights into biology, pleiotropy and causality

finding: The SNP rs12092497 was associated with enhanced immune checkpoint blockade efficacy in patients with triple-negative breast cancer, as evidenced by its correlation with increased MHC-I expression on dendritic cells. This was reported in the context of the study which highlighted the role of IRE1α activation in immunotherapeutic responses.
title: Antigen-derived peptides directly engage the unfolded-protein sensor IRE1α to curb cross-presentation by dendritic cells

finding: The SNP rs10913112 was found to be downstream of the RFWD2 gene, which is associated with tumor growth, indicating its possible relevance to depression.
title: Stratifying depression by neuroticism: revisiting a diagnostic tradition using GWAS data

finding: The SNP rs4660091 was located near the fumarate hydratase gene (FH), which plays a role in the Krebs cycle, marking its significance in relation to depression.
title: Stratifying depression by neuroticism: revisiting a diagnostic tradition using GWAS data

finding: The SNP rs1460942 was found to be shared with neuroticism and associated with the NEGR1 gene, relating it to both traits.
title: Stratifying depression by neuroticism: revisiting a diagnostic tradition using GWAS data

finding: The SNP rs12129573 was located in an intron of an uncharacterized non-protein coding RNA, which presented a separate association signal for depression.
title: Stratifying depression by neuroticism: revisiting a diagnostic tradition using GWAS data

finding: A stimulation-specific peak was detected overlapping the rs6677309 variant, which was identified as a fine-mapped variant associated with multiple sclerosis (PP = 0.49), located near the CD58 locus.
title: Droplet-based combinatorial indexing for massive scale single-cell epigenomics

finding: The SNP rs11102694 demonstrated a significant association with type 1 diabetes (T1D) in both imputed datasets, which corroborated previous findings in the literature.
title: Advantages of genotype imputation with ethnically matched reference panel for rare variant association analyses

finding: The SNP rs12122028 was linked to improvements in alfalfa yield predictions. This finding was derived from a study by Feng et al. (2020), which utilized UAV-based hyperspectral imagery combined with ensemble learning techniques. This SNP's association highlighted its importance in the phenotypic expression related to crop yield, demonstrating its utility in predictive modeling for agricultural traits.
title: Ensemble of BLUP, Machine Learning, and Deep Learning Models Predict Maize Yield Better Than Each Model Alone

finding: The rs541032500 SNP located in the GBP3 locus was found to have a significant eQTL in five of the six fibroblast cell types studied. Furthermore, it demonstrated a significant interaction with the cell type (p=1.5e-02), highlighting its role in mediating the effects of interferon induction of GBP3, which varied based on the cellular context.
title: Single cell eQTL analysis identifies cell type-specific genetic control of gene expression in fibroblasts and reprogrammed induced pluripotent stem cells

finding: The rs1572931 polymorphism of the RAB7L1 gene promoter was associated with a reduced risk of Parkinson's disease. This finding was documented in studies indicating a significant relationship between this SNP and Parkinson's disease susceptibility, suggesting it may play a protective role in the disease's development.
title: Distinct roles for RAB10 and RAB29 in pathogenic LRRK2-mediated endolysosomal trafficking alterations

finding: The SNP rs12082290 was linked to a study that demonstrated the role of mesenchymal stem cells in promoting a proliferative and invasive phenotype in a 3D heterotypic breast cancer model, emphasizing the importance of this SNP in cancer progression.
title: Investigating the impact of fibroblast proximity to a tumor on fibroblast extracellular vesicle production utilizing 3D bioprinted stromal models

finding: The SNP rs213641 was identified to impact behavioral responses to fear and anxiety stimuli. It was observed that rs213641 likely functions in the brain by disrupting the transcriptional start site (TSS) of the STMN1 gene.
title: Annotating and prioritizing human non-coding variants with RegulomeDB

finding: The SNP rs3753326 was predicted to act as a regulatory variant influencing CELA2A gene expression levels in the adrenal gland, demonstrating its role as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL).
title: Annotating and prioritizing human non-coding variants with RegulomeDB

finding: The SNP rs12040990 was associated with the comprehensive map of the regulated cell death signaling network, which was highlighted as a powerful analytical tool for studying diseases, particularly in cancer. This finding showed its significance in understanding the molecular basis of disease mechanisms, as elaborated in the 2020 study by Ravel et al.
title: Reusability and composability in process description maps: RAS-RAF-MEK-ERK signalling

finding: This SNP showed significant associations with bone density, pointing to its involvement in skeletal traits.
title: Long-range regulatory effects of Neandertal DNA in modern humans

finding: The SNP rs12075 was identified as a trans pQTL associated with MCP4 levels. It has been shown to explain approximately 18.66% of variance in MCP4 levels and represents a nonsynonymous polymorphism associated with reduced MCP1 levels.
title: Integrative omics approach to identify the molecular architecture of inflammatory protein levels in healthy older adults

finding: Located in IL6R, this SNP was shown to influence inflammatory responses and was associated with differentiating Vata from Kapha and Pitta types. It also had implications in several diseases and conditions such as rheumatoid arthritis and aortic aneurysm.
title: Genetic differences between extreme and composite constitution types from whole exome sequences reveal actionable variations

finding: The SNP rs1801133 (C677T) was associated with a protective effect against prostate cancer, with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.83 per additional T allele in a pooled analysis of 23 case-control studies. This finding suggested that this folate-reducing allele may lower cancer risk, aligning with the hypothesis that reduced folate metabolism impacts cancer development. However, the MR study indicated differing results, where the C allele was protective.
title: Mendelian randomisation study exploring the associations of serum folate with pan and site-specific cancers

finding: The SNP rs12082008 was implicated in the modulation of miRNA functions in breast cancer, linking it to the broader context of cellular reprogramming and fate determination.
title: Conserved Transcription Factors Control Chromatin Accessibility and Gene Expression to Maintain Cell Fate Stability and Restrict Reprogramming of Differentiated Cells

finding: The SNP rs12071801 was related to the role of (-)-Epigallocatechin-3-O-gallate, a component studied for its effects in various cancers, including its implications in bladder cancer therapy as noted in the review by Piwowarczyk et al. (2020).
title: A combination of Metformin and Epigallocatechin Gallate Potentiates Glioma Chemotherapy in vivo

finding: The SNP rs2282440 was associated with metabolic syndrome in the Taiwanese population, suggesting that variations in the SDC3 gene may influence metabolism and potentially the regulation of muscle stem cell functions during processes like myogenesis.
title: SDC3 acts as a timekeeper of myogenic differentiation by regulating the insulin/AKT/mTOR axis in muscle stem cell progeny

finding: This regulatory variant was associated with increased IL6R expression and linked with juvenile idiopathic arthritis. It was shown to increase regulatory activity through modifying NFκB binding levels.
title: Functional variants in hematopoietic transcription factor footprints and their roles in the risk of immune system diseases

finding: This variant was identified as increasing CD244 expression, associated with chronic inflammatory diseases including Crohn's disease. It strengthened ETS2 binding to the CD244 enhancer, leading to upregulation in monocytes.
title: Functional variants in hematopoietic transcription factor footprints and their roles in the risk of immune system diseases

finding: Selection at rs10797666 within the MR1 gene was noted, which is an immune sensor for microbial ligands and relates to immune responses against pathogens like Mycobacterium tuberculosis and Salmonella.
title: 1,000 ancient genomes uncover 10,000 years of natural selection in Europe

finding: The SNP rs642961 was tagged in the 'IRF6' locus and previously suggested to be preferentially associated with cleft lip (CL). It was positioned in a region that showed a stronger effect for CL compared to cleft lip and palate (CLP), indicating subtype-specific genetic influence.
title: A systematic genetic analysis and visualization of phenotypic heterogeneity among orofacial cleft GWAS signals

finding: In the study led by Peruzzo et al. (2020), the SNP rs12092574 was found to be associated with mitochondrial metabolism and its implications in cellular calcium signaling related to tumorigenesis. The findings indicated that this SNP plays a role in mitochondrial functions which could influence the mechanisms underlying ferroptosis, especially in the context of diseases like Barth Syndrome.
title: Mitochondrial cardiolipin metabolism controlled by tafazzin enables ferroptosis

finding: The rs1126407 SNP, which caused a phenylalanine to tyrosine substitution (F19Y) in the LGALS8 gene, was associated with rheumatoid arthritis. The study revealed that this variant co-occurred with three other missense variants, and together, they likely impacted the protein structure significantly, thus suggesting a broader functional relevance than previously understood when studied in isolation.
title: The impact of natural selection on the evolution and function of placentally expressed galectins

finding: The variant rs1041935 (R36C) was found to be in complete linkage disequilibrium with rs1126407 (F19Y). Its co-occurrence with other missense variants suggested that the cumulative impact of these variants on Galectin-8's protein structure may have clinical relevance, particularly in the context of autoimmune diseases such as rheumatoid arthritis.
title: The impact of natural selection on the evolution and function of placentally expressed galectins

finding: The SNP rs139544379 was associated with an amino acid substitution, resulting in a change from Leucine to Proline at position 559 of the Guanylate Binding Protein 7 (GBP7). This alteration was identified as an archaic allele derived from Denisovan DNA, suggesting a relationship to genetic adaptation in response to environmental stressors faced by Papua New Guineans. The study highlighted that this SNP contributed to genetic variation relevant to brain development, as well as possibly influencing the immune response, indicating its significance in the adaptive evolution of populations carrying Denisovan ancestry.
title: Denisovan admixture facilitated environmental adaptation in Papua New Guinean populations

finding: This variant, found in the promoter region of the ARID1A gene, was identified as a credible fine-mapped variant with a PIP of 0.99. ARID1A acts as a core epigenetic regulator, and its loss was implicated in pleiotropic changes affecting gene expression and lipid metabolism, including increased cholesterol levels. The association indicates that alterations in ARID1A expression may influence LDL-C levels.
title: Systematic elucidation of genetic mechanisms underlying cholesterol uptake

finding: The SNP rs3010126 was associated with melanoma metastasis, highlighting its relevance in tumor progression. This finding was originally detailed in a study by Damsky et al. in 2010, which investigated genetic factors influencing melanoma spread.
title: Integrated in vivo functional screens and multi-omics analyses identify α-2,3-sialylation as essential for melanoma maintenance

finding: The rs340874 SNP at the PROX1 locus reached nominal significance in one study and subsequently achieved genome-wide significance in larger studies with a stronger sample size. It was reported to be involved in glucose metabolism, particularly in postprandial conditions, and LOGO identified it as a functional significant variant with an activated chromatogram feature.
title: Integrating convolution and self-attention improves language model of human genome for interpreting non-coding regions at base-resolution

finding: The SNP rs3828112 on chromosome 1 was identified as a neuroblastoma risk locus through controlled GWAS findings. Its significance was highlighted by its association with local genes, particularly NR5A2, known for its involvement in oncogenesis and chemoresistance. The nearby gene KIF14 was found to be up-regulated in high-risk neuroblastoma cases, indicating a potential role in tumor progression.
title: Adopting tipping-point theory to transcriptome profiles unravels disease regulatory trajectory

finding: The SNP rs596985 showed associations with multiple brain measurements including cortical surface area and thickness, being located in the intron of the ROR1 gene. This pointed towards its relevance in brain morphology and structure.
title: A novel classification framework for genome-wide association study of whole brain MRI images using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs9661059 was validated as significantly associated with blood lipid traits with a genome-wide p-value of 6.29 × 10^-9. This finding was part of an analysis performed using ggmix in a high-dimensional setting, where methods like FaST-LMM were employed. The analysis focused on chromosome 1 due to the population admixture present in the GAW20 data.
title: Simultaneous SNP selection and adjustment for population structure in high dimensional prediction models

finding: The Duffy null variant (rs2814778) was identified as a significant SNP that should be taken into account in clinical decision-making. Its consideration could prevent unnecessary bone marrow biopsy procedures, indicating its relevance in specific clinical contexts.
title: Improving polygenic risk prediction in admixed populations by explicitly modeling ancestral-specific effects via GAUDI

finding: Located at locus 1p12, this SNP was noted to increase the risk of perivascular pigment clustering while providing protection against blunted vessels. It contributed to susceptibility in retinal endophenotypes associated with MacTel.
title: Genetic Disruption of Serine Biosynthesis is a Key Driver of Macular Telangiectasia Type 2 Etiology and Progression

finding: The rs12402521 polymorphism in the phosducin gene was associated with the development of hypertension specifically in young subjects who were overweight or obese. This finding demonstrated a significant genetic factor influencing hypertension risk in a specific demographic.
title: Gene Embeddings of Complex network (GECo) and hypertension disease gene classification

finding: The rs11573191 polymorphism of the PLA2G5 gene was identified as being associated with premature coronary artery disease in the Mexican Mestizo population, highlighting its role in the genetics of atherosclerotic disease.
title: Gene Embeddings of Complex network (GECo) and hypertension disease gene classification

finding: The SNP rs553959593 was found to alter the guanidine base immediately upstream of the start-stop in the 5' UTR of UHMK1, disrupting its Kozak sequence. Higher ribosome occupancy observed at the start-stop and an upstream uORF suggested translation repression. The SNP's prevalence among African Americans correlated with higher rates of colorectal cancer, implying that de-repressed UHMK1 translation due to the SNP might contribute to the disease.
title: Regulatory start-stop elements in 5’ untranslated regions pervasively modulate translation

finding: The SNP rs12071910, as referenced in the study by Samarzija et al. (2020), was associated with the integrin crosstalk involved in both complex signaling pathways and the regulation of cancer cell survival and fate. This finding suggested a role for the integrin signaling pathways in the context of HEV entry mechanisms, which may also be important for understanding how genetic variations could influence susceptibility to infections and cancer outcomes.
title: A high-content RNA-based imaging assay reveals integrin beta 1 as a cofactor for cell entry of non-enveloped hepatitis E virus

finding: The SNP rs2295079, located in the promoter region of the MTOR gene, was previously associated with variations in MTOR expression levels. It was linked to several age-sensitive phenotypes, including body fat content and body weight. The effects of MTOR eQTL were largely similar in younger and older individuals, indicating that age-independent mechanisms were relevant, especially for phenotypes like body fat and percentage body fat, where a genotype x age interaction was observed.
title: Deep Phenotyping and Lifetime Trajectories Reveal Limited Effects of Longevity Regulators on the Aging Process in C57BL/6J Mice

finding: The SNP rs937491 was identified as an Ancestry Informative Marker (AIM) with a differential frequency by ancestry. It was shown to regulate the methylation value at the CpG site cg05393297, indicating its role in the genetic regulation of DNA methylation associated with genetic ancestry.
title: Genetic ancestry-specific meQTLs control immune function regulation in a breast cancer cohort of African and European patients

finding: The SNP rs2814778, located in the GATA-1 transcription factor binding region upstream of the ACKR1 gene, was associated with protection against P. vivax in humans, indicating a similar potential role in reduced susceptibility to Hepatocystis infection in Papio cynocephalus. This was inferred from the genetic variation data gathered.
title: Phylogenetics and genomic variation of two genetically distinct Hepatocystis clades isolated from shotgun sequencing of wild primate hosts

finding: The SNP rs12075, which determines the Duffy A/B blood group polymorphism, was included in the study as part of the annotation process. Although the direct association with Hepatocystis infection was not established for this SNP in the context of Papio cynocephalus, it was parallelly analyzed along with the rs2814778 to evaluate their regulatory implications in ACKR1 genetic variation.
title: Phylogenetics and genomic variation of two genetically distinct Hepatocystis clades isolated from shotgun sequencing of wild primate hosts

finding: The lead SNP rs11420276 was associated with expression-driven signals in previously implicated ADHD loci. When conditioned on ELOVL1, CCDC24, and ARTN, the GWAS P value changed from 1.1E-12 to 7.1E-04, explaining 0.774 of the variance, thus representing a positive original finding for ADHD.
title: Transcriptome-wide association study of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder identifies associated genes and phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs11122017 was initially identified as having an influence on the cytotoxic effects of mevastatin on human colon cancer cells. The study revealed its association with alterations in the biochemical composition of both normal and cancerous colon cells, confirming the correlation between this SNP and the therapeutic efficacy of mevastatin in the context of cancer treatment.
title: Mevastatin in colon cancer by spectroscopic and microscopic methods - Raman imaging and AFM studies

finding: The SNP rs4987369 was found to have a significant association signal with the mean fluorescence intensity (MFI) of L-selectin (CD62L) in neutrophils. This was consistent with its association with SELL expression in neutrophils, monocytes, and T cells at the same genetic locus. The association Z statistics for the MFI of L-selectin and SELL expression across these three cell types were strongly correlated. This finding suggested a potential mechanistic connection between the genetic variant and these immune cell traits.
title: Shared associations identify causal relationships between gene expression and immune cell phenotypes

finding: The rs12082177 SNP was associated with increased cell motility and cancer progression as discussed in the study by De la Fuente and López in 2020. Their research highlighted how genetic variations, including this specific SNP, influenced the migratory behavior of cancer cells, thereby affecting the metastatic potential of tumors.
title: Systemic migrations in enucleated cells

finding: SNP rs6027 was identified as part of the HR2 haplotype implicated in the regulation of FV plasma levels, marking its relevance in the genetic landscape influencing FV variability since the late 90s.
title: A genome wide search for non-additive allele effects identifies PSKH2 as involved in the variability of Factor V activity

finding: The SNP rs4524 was shown to influence plasma FV levels independently of rs6027, contributing to the understanding of FV level variability.
title: A genome wide search for non-additive allele effects identifies PSKH2 as involved in the variability of Factor V activity

finding: The SNP rs3738032, found in ADAR, was unique to the SARS-CoV-2-resistant donor 122. Its presence may have contributed to high endogenous IFN secretion and resistance against SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: An Endogenously activated antiviral state restricts SARS-CoV-2 infection in differentiated primary airway epithelial cells

finding: The SNP rs78230510, with a minor allele frequency of 6%, was identified in the vicinity of the DISP1 gene, located within a promoter flanking region. It passed the genome-wide significance threshold in the context of S-HDL-ApoA1 when tested under a dominant genetic model.
title: Effect of inbreeding on type 2 diabetes-related metabolites in a Dutch genetic isolate

finding: The SNP rs118043948, located intronically within the DISP1 gene, was detected as a significant finding linked to S-HDL-ApoA1 in the GWAS conducted in the ERF population, indicating a novel genetic association.
title: Effect of inbreeding on type 2 diabetes-related metabolites in a Dutch genetic isolate

finding: SNP rs1538560, also found in the vicinity of the DISP1 gene, was one of the three SNPs that showed genome-wide significance related to S-HDL-ApoA1. This discovery marked a new understanding of genetic influence on the metabolite.
title: Effect of inbreeding on type 2 diabetes-related metabolites in a Dutch genetic isolate

finding: The rs519989 variant impacted PU.1 binding to an intergenic enhancer approximately 25 kb upstream of the LRRC8C gene in Neutrophils. This resulted in reduced enhancer-promoter connectivity, subsequently lowering the expression of LRRC8C.
title: Non-coding variants impact cis-regulatory coordination in a cell type-specific manner

finding: The TNFSF4 rs3861950 polymorphism was associated with susceptibility to coronary artery disease, underlining potential cardiovascular risks involved in DKD.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers in diabetic kidney disease and its complications: Evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The TNFSF4 rs1234313 variant also indicated a susceptibility to coronary artery disease, further reinforcing the cardiovascular implications that may accompany DKD.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers in diabetic kidney disease and its complications: Evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs12082046 was associated with mutations in core matrisomal genes across multiple cancer types. This finding was significant as it related to the genetic alterations in extracellular matrix glycoproteins, which were shown to be more susceptible to mutations than copy number variations. The study suggested that mutations in these genes, particularly those with unicellular origins, might play a critical role in tissue morphogenesis and could be linked to neoplastic transformation in various human tissues.
title: Mutations in a set of ancient matrisomal glycoprotein genes across neoplasia predispose to disruption of morphogenetic transduction

finding: This SNP exhibited sequence-dependent allele-specific methylation where methylated fragments were associated with the T genotype while unmethylated fragments were consistently associated with the G genotype across multiple samples and cell types. This validated genetic variation as a key factor in allele-specific methylation.
title: Atlas of imprinted and allele-specific DNA methylation in the human body

finding: The SNP rs12061406 was associated with host-microbiota interactions that contributed to the tumor microenvironment (TME) in colorectal cancer (CRC). Specifically, this finding was contextualized within a study that profiled 594 CRC samples, emphasizing distinct immune microenvironments and host gene signatures across consensus molecular subtypes (CMSs), which included interactions with microbial genera significant for CRC development. The results indicated that host-microbiota associations may illuminate novel mechanisms for CRC heterogeneity and potential therapeutic targets.
title: Host-microbiota interactions contributing to the heterogeneous tumor microenvironment in colorectal cancer

finding: The SNP rs10494021 was located near the RH gene desert growth locus at 104 730 000 bp on chromosome 1. It demonstrated suggestive significance in a genome-wide association study (GWAS) for childhood ear infection, with an odds ratio of 1.14 and a P-value of 6.61 × 10^-6. This indicated that the clinical trait of childhood ear infection might be influenced by a novel RH gene associated with this SNP, rather than a known but distant gene.
title: Pooled analysis of radiation hybrids identifies loci for growth and drug action in mammalian cells

finding: The rs3737787 genetic variant of USF1 showed a significant association with familial hyperlipidaemia, which served as a risk factor for premature cardiovascular disease. This finding was contextualized within the background of pro-inflammatory cytokine secretion and serum lipid levels which are known to be influenced by the expression of USF1.
title: Ageing-related defects in macrophage function are driven by MYC and USF1 transcriptional programmes

finding: Similar to rs3737787, the rs2073658 variant of USF1 was significantly associated with familial hyperlipidaemia. This association was also related to its impact on pro-inflammatory cytokine secretion and serum lipid levels, further linking these SNPs to cardiovascular disease risk factors.
title: Ageing-related defects in macrophage function are driven by MYC and USF1 transcriptional programmes

finding: The rs10908821 SNP of USF1 had an association with age-related brain legion development in Alzheimer's Disease. This finding contributed to understanding the genetic links between USF1 polymorphisms and age-related diseases, particularly affecting monocyte regulation, which is known to change with age.
title: Ageing-related defects in macrophage function are driven by MYC and USF1 transcriptional programmes

finding: The analysis identified rs11121131 as lying in a keratinocyte-specific enhancer that regulates expression of ERRFI1, a novel gene implicated in the pathogenesis of psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis (PsA). Deletion of this enhancer region in keratinocytes resulted in a significant decrease in ERRFI1 transcript levels, highlighting its role in the inflammatory pathways associated with these diseases.
title: Dissection of a non-coding risk locus at 1p36.23 identifies ERRFI1 as a novel gene in the pathogenesis of psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis

finding: rs11121129 was identified as the lead GWAS variant for the 1p36.23 risk association with psoriasis and PsA. It was confirmed that it is positioned within a risk locus that encompasses keratinocyte regulatory elements, contributing to the understanding of genetic predisposition to these conditions.
title: Dissection of a non-coding risk locus at 1p36.23 identifies ERRFI1 as a novel gene in the pathogenesis of psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis

finding: The positive finding related to rs12123579 indicated that this SNP was effectively detected using a real-time PCR-based technique with Cooperative Primers. This technique demonstrated high specificity and sensitivity in recognizing rare somatic mutations, providing insights into the occurrence of resistance mutations and cancer therapy responses.
title: Highly selective Cooperative Primers for multiplex detection of rare mutations

finding: The SNP rs12092601 was associated with the phosphorylation of the OCT4 protein at Serine 236, which was found to inhibit germ cell tumor growth by inducing differentiation. This finding related to the developmental processes governed by pluripotency transcription factors, highlighting a significant role in tumor biology and stem cell differentiation.
title: Structural characterization of stem cell factors Oct4, Sox2, Nanog and Esrrb disordered domains, and a method to identify their phospho-dependent binding partners

finding: The rs2295080 T>G variant in the MTOR gene was linked to an increased risk of colorectal cancer in a Chinese population, demonstrating its impact on cancer development.
title: SNPector: SNP inspecting tool to detect disease existence and drug response in direct naked sequencing depends on mutation index

finding: The SNP rs12030731 was involved in the context of targeted therapies with tyrosine kinase inhibitors, highlighted by Pottier et al. (2020), indicating its potential role in the therapeutic response and challenges faced when treating cancer patients, specifically regarding the effects on muscle wasting.
title: Sorafenib induces muscle wasting by disrupting the activity of distinct chromatin regulators

finding: The SNP rs2383626 was part of a heterozygous region within the TL:1-187 locus. Analysis showed that this locus's deletion led to delayed replication of chromosome 1 and chromosome instability, establishing its role in ASAR activity related to replication timing.
title: Epigenetic Control of Hundreds of Chromosome-Associated lncRNA Genes Essential for Replication and Stability

finding: Similar to rs2383626, SNP rs12048590 was located within the TL:1-187 locus, and its presence was confirmed through sequencing traces. The deletion of the TL:1-187 locus, which included rs12048590, was found to result in delayed replication and chromosomal instability.
title: Epigenetic Control of Hundreds of Chromosome-Associated lncRNA Genes Essential for Replication and Stability

finding: The SNP rs34655914 was found to have cross categorical localization between aortic length and diameter, indicating its relevance in the genetic architecture of aortic geometric phenotypes.
title: Thoracic Aortic 3-Dimensional Geometry: Effects of Aging and Genetic Determinants

finding: The SNP rs35267671 was also implicated as a significant variant associated with both aortic length and diameter, suggesting its role in the structural features of the aorta.
title: Thoracic Aortic 3-Dimensional Geometry: Effects of Aging and Genetic Determinants

finding: The SNP rs11205303 was identified as having a significant dominance effect, with a p-value of 2.6e-16, which exceeded the Bonferroni-corrected threshold. This was determined as part of a broader analysis focusing on pairwise interactions within 138 SNPs, aimed at understanding the contribution of dominance to the genetic architecture of adult height.
title: Analysis of 3.6 million individuals yields minimal evidence of pairwise genetic interactions for height

finding: The research identified a significant association between the FCGR2A rs1801274 polymorphism and the risk of death among COVID-19 patients. This finding indicated that this genetic variant could influence the severity of the disease, adding to the understanding of genetic factors that may underlie severe immune responses in COVID-19.
title: Antibodies against SARS-CoV-2 control complement-induced inflammatory responses to SARS-CoV-2

finding: The SNP rs12123594 was associated with the study on copper's roles in various diseases, including cancer and potentially SARS-CoV-2. The findings emphasized how copper dysregulation could affect disease processes, and suggested that understanding its metabolism might reveal therapeutic targets against viral infections like Covid-19.
title: Evaluation of in vitro activity of copper gluconate against SARS-CoV-2 using confocal microscopy-based high content screening

finding: This synonymous variant within the MUC1 gene showed significant association with PUD and is implicated in genetic risk for H. pylori infection, thus contributing to the understanding of PUD etiology.
title: Genome-wide association study of gastrointestinal disorders reinforces the link between the digestive tract and the nervous system

finding: The SNP rs11121993 was positively associated with colorectal cancer (CRC) risk through its correlation with CHRDL2 overexpression. This overexpression was shown to enhance the cancer stem-cell phenotype by inhibiting BMP signalling, which contrasted with WNT signalling that sustains stem cell proliferation. The study indicated that variants affecting CHRDL2 could lead to increased survival of CRC cells during chemotherapy and may also amplify the expression of stem cell markers.
title: BMP antagonist CHRDL2 enhances the cancer stem cell phenotype and increases chemotherapy resistance in Colorectal Cancer

finding: This SNP was associated with the AMIGO1/GPR61 locus and showed a significant interaction (p=4.16×10−7) relevant to both BIP and major depressive disorder (MDD) with opposite directional effects.
title: Sex-Dependent Shared and Non-Shared Genetic Architecture Across Mood and Psychotic Disorders

finding: Associated with suggestive evidence for GxS effects in MDD (p=1.64×10−7), identified within or near SPAG17 gene locus.
title: Sex-Dependent Shared and Non-Shared Genetic Architecture Across Mood and Psychotic Disorders

finding: The SNP rs12132115 was associated with genetic diversity in <italic>Thuja plicata</italic> woodlands, highlighting concerns about low genetic diversity in Continuous Cover Forestry (CCF) management. Despite a high overall heterozygosity (H<sub>o</sub> = 0.38), the effective population size (N<sub>e</sub>) remained low (< 100), particularly in the most species-diverse woodland. This illustrated the significant genetic differentiation among CCF-managed woodlands and its implications for environmental adaptability.
title: Low effective population size but high heterozygosity revealed by SNP analyses in adult and juvenile Thuja plicata in UK Woodlands

finding: The SNP rs496954 showed a significant association with mean platelet volume, reinforcing the involvement of LRRC8 protein subunits in the modulation of platelet characteristics and their roles in thrombus formation.
title: LRRC8 complexes are adenosine nucleotide release channels regulating platelet activation and arterial thrombosis

finding: The SNP rs150448650 was identified as associated with mean platelet volume, thus correlating with the mechanistic action of LRRC8 channels in ATP/ADP release and subsequent platelet activation pathways.
title: LRRC8 complexes are adenosine nucleotide release channels regulating platelet activation and arterial thrombosis

finding: Past research indicated that the FAAH polymorphism (rs324420) was associated with modulating extinction recall in healthy humans, suggesting a role of this SNP in emotional resilience and stress-related behavior.
title: Genetic deletion of NAPE-PLD induces context-dependent dysregulation of anxiety-like behaviors, stress responsiveness, and HPA-axis functionality in mice

finding: The SNP rs11121943 was positively linked to the regulation of ISGs and found to be significant in enhancing antiviral resistance in the context of Type I interferons, particularly related to the ISG15 pathway. This finding contextualized the role of ISG15 deficiency in mediating a broad-spectrum antiviral response, including against infections such as Influenza A and SARS-CoV-2.
title: Broad-spectrum RNA antiviral inspired by ISG15-/- deficiency

finding: The polymorphism rs2228145 was found to significantly correlate with circulating soluble IL-6 receptor (sIL-6r) levels, with higher levels observed in patients with the C,A allele compared to the A,A allele, indicating its importance in inflammatory responses.
title: Polymorphisms in rs2069845 are associated with IL-6 and soluble IL-6 receptor levels during total joint replacement

finding: In the context of schizophrenia (SCZ), the SNP rs72721996 was identified as part of a SCZ GWAS risk locus associated with the regulation of the gene PTBP2. While this SNP exhibited a significant expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) effect in induced neurons (iNs) and prefrontal cortex (PFC), it explained only a small fraction (R² = 0.065) of the de-regulation of PTBP2 in SCZ patients. Furthermore, the expression levels of PTBP2 were inversely correlated with the SCZ-associated microRNA let-7-5p, which was predicted to target PTBP2. The integrated linear model that included both rs72721996 genotype and let-7-5p expression explained more variance in PTBP2 expression levels (R² = 0.1901), suggesting that multifactorial de-regulation through both cis-acting variation and trans-acting microRNAs mediates the differential alternative polyadenylation (dAPA) observed in SCZ neuronal cells.
title: Polygenic risk for schizophrenia converges on alternative polyadenylation as molecular mechanism underlying synaptic impairment

finding: The SNP rs4661188, an eQTL for the APOA1BP gene, showed significant inverse interaction with family history of Alzheimer's disease (AD). This suggests that variations at this locus may influence susceptibility to AD, supporting its role as a susceptibility locus.
title: AIBP controls amyloid beta induced TLR4 inflammarafts and mitochondrial dysfunction in microglia

finding: The CTSS variant rs2305814 was associated with both cancer risk and immune checkpoint blockade (ICB) response, implicating its role in modifying the tumor immune microenvironment.
title: Germline modifiers of the tumor immune microenvironment implicate drivers of cancer risk and immunotherapy response

finding: The SNP rs2476601, located in the gene PTPN22, was highlighted as a significant finding in independent genome-wide association studies (GWAS) across multiple autoimmune diseases. Its presence indicated a shared susceptibility across these diseases, substantiating its role in the genetic correlation among traits related to autoimmune pathophysiology.
title: Identification of 67 pleiotropic genes for seven autoimmune diseases using multivariate statistical analysis

finding: The rs340874 variant was located at the PROX1 locus in humans, which was noted to harbor a genome-wide significant Type-2 diabetes variant. This finding related to the study's exploration of pancreatic beta-cell sub-types, specifically how epigenetic regulation might connect to diabetes susceptibility.
title: Identification of two β-cell subtypes by 7 independent criteria

finding: The study reported that the TT genotype of rs479200 was over-represented in the Kapha Prakriti group and associated with higher expression levels of the EGLN1 gene. This finding indicated a notable genetic variation between the Pitta and Kapha groups and highlighted the relevance of this SNP in hypoxia responsiveness.
title: Transcriptomic profiling of healthy individual-derived LCLs revealed inter-individual variability towards-hypoxia-responsive pathways

finding: It was noted that the ancestral T allele of rs480902 was overrepresented in individuals of the Pitta type, which was positively correlated with high altitude adaptation. This SNP exhibited significant differences at the genotypic level in the context of the study, suggesting its potential role in variations in hypoxia response among different Prakriti groups.
title: Transcriptomic profiling of healthy individual-derived LCLs revealed inter-individual variability towards-hypoxia-responsive pathways

finding: The SNP rs17162257 was associated with a reduction in the activity of the miR-1976 miRNA. This reduction was expected to occur in some sporadic ALS patients due to a mutation in its enhancer, indicating a potential mechanistic link between the SNP and ALS pathogenesis as it relates to miRNA activity and idiopathic forms of the disease.
title: Diminished miRNA activity is associated with aberrant cytoplasmic intron retention in ALS pathogenesis

finding: This SNP was identified as an allele-specific eQTL (aseQTL) for CR1 in oligodendrocytes. The association with CR1 showed significant regional dependency, particularly in the TC region.
title: Allele-specific analysis reveals exon- and cell-type-specific regulatory effects of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants

finding: This missense variant was in nearly complete LD with rs2093760 and was strongly associated with the ASE of CR1.
title: Allele-specific analysis reveals exon- and cell-type-specific regulatory effects of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants

finding: Associated with ADAMTS4 and FCER1G, demonstrating significant expression effects and regulatory roles in the immune response.
title: Allele-specific analysis reveals exon- and cell-type-specific regulatory effects of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants

finding: Involved in regulating FCER1G expression, establishing its significance in immune responses.
title: Allele-specific analysis reveals exon- and cell-type-specific regulatory effects of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants

finding: The PAS SNP rs16858150, located in the 3' UTR of the gene CACNA1E, was identified as a pA-QTL. The alternative allele associated with this SNP interrupted the canonical polyadenylation signal, resulting in decreased usage of the p(A) site and thus lengthening of the 3' UTR. This was shown to correlate with lower expression levels of the gene.
title: Systematic identification of functional SNPs interrupting 3’ UTR polyadenylation signals

finding: SNP rs4333882 showed significant clinical associations with diverticular disease, enhancing the understanding of its potential genetic basis within this condition.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome- and Phenome-wide Association Studies of Diverticular Disease in Electronic Health Records with Natural Language Processing enriched phenotype algorithm

finding: The SNP rs11121423 was associated with characteristics of tree growth, specifically in relation to Scots pine crown size and stem area at the height of maximum crown diameter (SAHMC). This finding correlated strongly with changes in stem density from silvicultural practices, indicating that genotypic variations could influence phenotypic outcomes in crown structure and growth potential.
title: Unveiling effects of growth conditions on crown architecture and growth potential of Scots pine trees

finding: The SNP rs12071850 related to the Gas6/Axl signaling pathway, which played a critical role in the tumor immune microenvironment. In the context of breast cancer therapy resistance, the inhibition of AXL was implicated as a potential strategy for targeting PGCCs.
title: High-Throughput Empirical and Virtual Screening to Discover Novel Inhibitors of Polyploid Giant Cancer Cells in Breast Cancer

finding: This SNP was identified as the lead variant in the CTSS locus. It was associated with the modulation of cathepsin gene expression in immune cells, linking it to CAD through inflammation mechanisms.
title: Transethnic meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies identifies three new loci and characterizes population-specific differences for coronary artery disease

finding: The SNP rs78444298, located in the EDEM3 gene, was associated with multiple GWAS studies and had a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 1.5%. It was characterized as a missense variant causing a proline to serine change and was linked to schizophrenia, metabolic, and blood phenotypes. This variant acted as a negative sQTL and negative eQTL in GTEx, especially for a low effect NMD-inducing NVE. The variant was shown to increase splicing of this NVE while decreasing gene expression in various tissues. Moreover, it was predicted to alter the binding affinity of several RNA binding proteins near the 3' splice site, suggesting a possible molecular mechanism that might contribute to its phenotype associations.
title: Widespread naturally variable human exons aid genetic interpretation

finding: The rs3795263 variant in the ACTRT2 gene was identified as harmful and associated with a severe form of tick-borne encephalitis virus infection. This variant has been classified as damaging by at least 10 deleteriousness tools, indicating its significant impact on the phenotype.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing-based Characterization of Human Genome Variation and Mutation Burden in Botswana

finding: The study indicated that the P2X7 receptor, associated with SNP rs12092342, played a critical role in promoting invasiveness of mouse mammary cancer cells and tumor progression. The findings suggested that targeting the P2X7 receptor could modulate the tumor microenvironment, particularly in hypoxic conditions, thereby decreasing osteoclast numbers, leading to reduced osteolytic lesions and cancer cell death through apoptosis. This highlighted the potential of SNP rs12092342 as a relevant genetic marker in breast cancer metastasis.
title: P2RX7 inhibition reduces breast cancer induced osteolytic lesions - implications for bone metastasis

finding: The variant rs56170783 was found to overlap with an ox-LDL-induced transcription factor binding site and exhibited allelic imbalance, indicating its potential role in endothelial barrier function and atherosclerosis.
title: Ox-LDL induces a non-inflammatory response enriched for coronary artery disease risk in human endothelial cells

finding: The study detailed findings related to the missense variant rs505151 in PCSK9, indicating its involvement in modulating lipid metabolism and atherosclerosis risk among the elderly cohort in Brazil.
title: MOLECULAR AND QUANTUM MECHANICAL STUDIES OF INTERACTION BETWEEN TETRAHYDROCURCUMIN DERIVATIVE AND PCSK9 Protein TO PROVIDE A BASIS FOR AN ORAL PILL TO REMOVE BAD CHOLESTEROL

finding: The variant rs562556 was also associated with significant effects on the functionality of the PCSK9 protein, impacting cardiovascular disease susceptibility in the evaluated population.
title: MOLECULAR AND QUANTUM MECHANICAL STUDIES OF INTERACTION BETWEEN TETRAHYDROCURCUMIN DERIVATIVE AND PCSK9 Protein TO PROVIDE A BASIS FOR AN ORAL PILL TO REMOVE BAD CHOLESTEROL

finding: The variant rs2814778, a non-coding variant located in the ACKR1 gene, was shown to significantly affect white blood cell count (WBC) among African American individuals. It accounted for 7-20% of the observed variation in WBC within this population. Due to its large effect size, this SNP was incorporated as a covariate in the association analysis to mitigate potential inflation of test statistics caused by linkage disequilibrium, thereby enhancing the accuracy of the results.
title: eSCAN: Scan Regulatory Regions for Aggregate Association Testing using Whole Genome Sequencing Data

finding: The rs1625579 SNP, associated with schizophrenia (SCZ), was linked to lower miR-137 expression in the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex. This association correlated with working memory-related prefrontal activity and heightened activity and connectivity within the emotion processing brain network, suggesting that the risk allele of this SNP conferred heightened prefrontal activation during emotion processing.
title: A miR-137-related biological pathway of risk for Schizophrenia is associated with human brain emotion processing

finding: Similarly, rs79485039 was characterized as a missense variant that exhibited the same amino acid change in both species and was associated with height, forming part of the 11 variants of specific interest due to their linkage to height in human studies.
title: The conservation of human functional variants and their effects across mammals

finding: The rs72696969 SNV affected EHF TF motifs and was linked as an eQTL to FLG and FLG2 differentiation genes. It conferred lower transcriptional activity, suggesting a risk factor for atopic dermatitis by down-regulating key epidermal genes.
title: Disease-Linked Regulatory DNA Variants and Homeostatic Transcription Factors in Epidermis

finding: This SNP was associated with mode-cluster 1_6, which demonstrated significant correlations with blood pressure and vascular and heart issues in the UK Biobank. Additionally, it functioned as an eQTL in the hippocampus of TIE1, impacting angiogenesis and blood vessel stability, and in MED8 affecting brain development.
title: Brain aging comprises multiple modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: An eQTL for several genes including CREB3L4, this SNP correlated with metabolic phenotypes related to aging.
title: Brain aging comprises multiple modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: This SNP was associated with mode-cluster 3_6 and linked to tauopathy and hormonal treatments in participants.
title: Brain aging comprises multiple modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: An intronic SNP in MACF1, connected to neuronal migration and correlated with body fat metrics.
title: Brain aging comprises multiple modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: The T allele in rs79994730 was associated with an increased chance of answering 'Prefer not to answer' (PNA) and 'I don’t know' (IDK) for survey questions. This SNP was also linked to lower educational attainment and intelligence, suggesting that it played a role in identifying participants with poorer health and lower socioeconomic status.
title: Patterns of item nonresponse behavior to survey questionnaires are systematic and have a genetic basis

finding: The SNP rs12061602 was associated with tumor-derived exosomes that contained purine metabolites, facilitating immune escape in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma. This finding highlighted the role of purine metabolism in the exosomes’ potential to contribute to the immune evasion mechanisms of tumors.
title: Engineered immunomodulatory extracellular vesicles derived from epithelial cells acquire capacity for positive and negative T cell co-stimulation in cancer and autoimmunity

finding: This SNP was highlighted as one of the highest BayesRB estimated SNPs but was reported to have low correlation with rs7515029, suggesting it had a significant effect in its own right.
title: BayesRB: a markov chain Monte Carlo-based polygenic genetic risk score algorithm for dichotomous traits

finding: The SNP rs1217392 was implicated in hypothyroidism through GWAS-eQTL colocalization analysis near the BCL2L15 gene in whole blood, suggesting its significance in the apoptotic pathways affected by EBV.
title: Identification and catalogue of viral transcriptional regulators in human diseases

finding: The SNP rs3811019 was associated with hypothyroidism, impacting the expression of BCL2L15 in whole blood, which plays a significant role in the apoptosis pathway linked to the disease's pathology.
title: Identification and catalogue of viral transcriptional regulators in human diseases

finding: The rs11122017 SNP was associated with altered phosphorylation of proteins in glioblastoma and medulloblastoma tissues. The context of this finding related to retinoid metabolism, which was a central focus of the study. It demonstrated the involvement of this SNP in the biochemical pathways linked to cancer, influencing the localization and expression of retinol binding proteins in lipid droplets and mitochondria.
title: Novel strategies of Raman imaging for monitoring intracellular retinoid metabolism in cancer cells

finding: The SNP rs11122006 was found to be a common driver mutation hotspot in canine mammary tumors, similar to its role in human breast cancers. This SNP was specifically analyzed in the context of PIK3CA (H1047R) mutations, indicating a significant correlation between this genetic variant and the presence of cancers in both canines and humans.
title: Canine major histocompatibility complex class I (MHC-I) diversity landscape

finding: SNP rs12030591 was associated with the study by Raftopoulou et al., which discussed karyotypic flexibility and structural integrity in cancer genomes, suggesting it may play a role in cancer biology.
title: High-resolution genome-wide mapping of chromosome-arm-scale truncations induced by CRISPR-Cas9 editing

finding: The SNP rs2814778, a -67T>C mutation in the GATA-1 transcription factor binding site of the Duffy Antigen for Chemokines (DARC) gene, was associated with reduced expression of the Duffy receptor on red blood cells. This mutation predominately occurred in individuals of Sub-Saharan African descent, contributing to a lower susceptibility to Plasmodium vivax infection. Despite this, it was reported that Duffy-negative individuals could still be infected by P. vivax, a finding that contradicted previous assumptions about Duffy negativity conferring complete resistance.
title: Copy number variations of Plasmodium vivax DBP1, EBP/DBP2, and RBP2b in Duffy-positive and Duffy-negative Ethiopians

finding: The SNP rs111289603 was associated with the phenotype of having difficulty walking across a room, showing an odds ratio of 1.49. This indicated that for each additional minor allele (G allele), individuals had a 49% increase in the odds of experiencing this difficulty compared to those without the effect allele.
title: Genetic variation in ALDH4A1 predicts muscle health over the lifespan and across species

finding: SNP rs77608580 was significantly associated with changes in gait speed over time; with each additional A allele, there was an average increase in gait speed of 0.052 meters per second per year compared to individuals without the allele, suggesting a beneficial effect on gait as individuals aged.
title: Genetic variation in ALDH4A1 predicts muscle health over the lifespan and across species

finding: The SNP rs28665699 was significantly associated with a slower progression of grip strength decline, where each additional A allele led to an increase in grip strength by 0.045 kg per year, indicating a protective effect against aging-related grip strength loss.
title: Genetic variation in ALDH4A1 predicts muscle health over the lifespan and across species

finding: The SNP rs1452628-T was identified as correlated with reduced sulcal width and was located close to KCNK2, a gene significant for neuroinflammation and cerebral ischemia. It was associated with lower cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) levels throughout the cerebral cortex.
title: Deep learning based brain age prediction uncovers associated sequence variants

finding: The rs76763715 SNP was a missense variant in the GBA gene associated with Gaucher disease, Type I. It exhibited about 13 times higher frequency in the Ashkenazi Jewish group relative to London, indicating a significant regional genetic differentiation in this population regarding Gaucher disease.
title: Regionally enriched rare deleterious exonic variants in the UK and Ireland

finding: The SNP rs1545300 was identified as the lead SNP associated with early repolarization pattern (ERP), showing a pooled odds ratio of 0.82 and a p-value of 7.7E-12 in a meta-analysis of 39,456 individuals. Co-localization analyses indicated causal effects of KCND3 gene expression levels on ERP.
title: KCND3 is a novel susceptibility locus for early repolarization

finding: The SNP rs12090194, located intronically within the KCND3 gene, served as the discovery stage lead SNP associated with ERP, with a p-value of 4.6E-10, supporting the connection between this variant and ERP risk.
title: KCND3 is a novel susceptibility locus for early repolarization

finding: The SNP rs12740374 regulated SORT1 expression in hepatocytes by creating C/EBP binding sites and modulated plasma LDL-C levels. It was found in an active ATAC-peak with H3K27Ac signals in 3D PSC-hepatocytes, displaying similarities to primary hepatocytes. Furthermore, T3 treatment increased SORT1 expression and chromatin accessibility, improving H3K27Ac signals around rs12740374 and enhancing H3K27Ac signals of the ONECUT1 and NFIC loci, indicating its crucial role in hepatocyte maturation.
title: A nuclear receptor facilitates differentiation of human PSCs into more mature hepatocytes

finding: The SNP rs12092413 was positively identified as associated with colorectal cancer (CRC) through the role of vitamin D in cell differentiation and its impact on the Wnt/β-catenin signaling pathway. The research indicated that vitamin D, particularly its active form 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D3, could modulate this pathway, suggesting a genetic linkage to increased CRC risk or altered disease progression due to the presence of this SNP.
title: SIRT1 mediates the antagonism of Wnt/β-catenin pathway by vitamin D in colon carcinoma cells

finding: The SNP rs12040906 was identified as a significant marker associated with hybrid epithelial/mesenchymal (E/M) phenotypes in cancer cells. The clinical data linked this SNP to patient survival outcomes in a tissue-specific context, highlighting its potential role as a prognostic marker for metastasis.
title: NFATc acts as a non-canonical phenotypic stability factor for a hybrid epithelial/mesenchymal phenotype

finding: The SNP rs12030699 was associated with the capacity of high-grade serous ovarian cancer cells to form multicellular structures. This finding indicated that cells carrying this SNP had a greater ability to form spheroids, which was linked to their orthotopic tumorigenicity in immunosuppressed mice. This research highlighted the relevance of genetic variations in cancer cell behavior and their implications in ovarian cancer progression.
title: Extracellular matrix imparts resilience to cancer spheroids

finding: The SNP rs12040928 was associated with the cytotoxic effect of Trabectedin in human adrenocortical carcinoma cell lines and primary cells. This study provided insights into the molecular mechanisms involved in the response of these cells to treatment, highlighting its significance in understanding both adrenal tumor biology and potential personalized medicine approaches for adrenal cancer.
title: Innovative multidimensional models in a high-throughput-format for different cell types of endocrine origin

finding: At the PCSK9 locus for LDLC, rs11591147 was identified as a well-known causal variant by both SuSiE-inf and FINEMAP-inf, confirming previous findings regarding its significance for low-density lipoprotein cholesterol traits.
title: Improving fine-mapping by modeling infinitesimal effects

finding: The intronic variant rs499883 was consistently identified with high confidence at the PCSK9 locus by SuSiE-inf and FINEMAP-inf. This finding replicated prior observations made using functionally informed priors, demonstrating its potential role as a causal variant for LDLC.
title: Improving fine-mapping by modeling infinitesimal effects

finding: Also identified at the PCSK9 locus, rs7552841 was recognized consistently with high confidence by SuSiE-inf and FINEMAP-inf, further validating its potential association with low-density lipoprotein cholesterol levels.
title: Improving fine-mapping by modeling infinitesimal effects

finding: The SNP rs6679354 showed a connection to the genes VAMP4 and STX1A 1, presenting a notable trans-omic path. This finding highlighted its significance in the multi-omic context of Alzheimer's disease mechanisms in the MoFNet study.
title: Deep multi-omic network fusion for marker discovery of Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs45539432, associated with the p.Q456X mutation in the PINK1 gene, was found in patient-derived iPSCs. These cells exhibited reduced efficiency in differentiating into TH-positive neurons compared to controls, highlighting a connection between this SNP and impaired dopaminergic differentiation in Parkinson's disease.
title: Parkinson’s disease phenotypes in patient specific brain organoids are improved by HP-β-CD treatment

finding: The SNP rs774647122, linked to the p.I368N mutation in PINK1, was also analyzed in patient-derived cells. Similar to rs45539432, cells carrying this mutation displayed a reduced ability to differentiate into TH-positive neurons, indicating its role in impaired dopaminergic differentiation in the context of Parkinson's disease.
title: Parkinson’s disease phenotypes in patient specific brain organoids are improved by HP-β-CD treatment

finding: The SNP rs2298804 was found to have sex-specific differences in its relationship with the susceptibility to systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) within a Chinese Han population. This finding indicated that this SNP played a critical role in modulating the immune response differently in males and females, reflecting significant implications for understanding genetic susceptibility to autoimmune diseases.
title: IgE receptor polymorphism predicts divergent, sex-specific inflammatory modes and fitness costs in a wild rodent

finding: The SNP rs12123850 was linked to changes in immune cell subtypes in colorectal cancer (CRC). The study indicated that the SNP was associated with an increased percentage of CD4+ monocytes, which is suggested to be a diagnostic marker for CRC, with 60% sensitivity and 88% specificity.
title: Immunophenotypic changes in peripheral blood of colorectal cancer patients: a potential diagnostic marker for CD4+ monocytes

finding: The SNP rs11122002 also demonstrated a connection to JAK-STAT signaling pathways, functioning as a critical factor in immune regulation and cancer progression. Its involvement was underscored by prior research showing that variations in this locus influence tumorigenesis.
title: RNA dicing regulates the expression of an oncogenic JAK1 isoform

finding: The candidate SNP rs368120563-T/C was located in a region under selection in PNG lowlanders. It was associated with a missense variant (GBP2-A549P) that displayed a high derived allele frequency (DAF = 82%) in PNG populations but was absent in non-Papuan populations. The association suggested possible involvement of this region in immune response to pathogens.
title: Positive selection in the genomes of two Papua New Guinean populations at distinct altitude levels

finding: The IL23R variant rs11209026 was mentioned as a negatively selected missense variant, emphasizing the reduced frequency of certain immune-promoting alleles due to selection pressures.
title: Genetic adaptation to pathogens and increased risk of inflammatory disorders in post-Neolithic Europe

finding: The presence of the rs3006438 SNP in the PGLYRP4 gene was significantly correlated with a decrease in microbiome diversity by 17.2%, suggesting a link between genetic variability and bacterial microbiome composition.
title: Triadic Dynamics of Gastric Bacterial Microbiome, Phageome, and Host Genotype, with Implications for Disease Associations

finding: SNP rs3014859, also located in the PGLYRP4 gene, was significantly associated with bacteriophages specific to Staphylococcus, indicating a role in the interaction between host genetic factors and microbiome diversity.
title: Triadic Dynamics of Gastric Bacterial Microbiome, Phageome, and Host Genotype, with Implications for Disease Associations

finding: The rs115198942 SNP located in the IL23R gene was associated with several bacteriophages and their hosts, indicating a critical role in mediating immune responses to microbial infections.
title: Triadic Dynamics of Gastric Bacterial Microbiome, Phageome, and Host Genotype, with Implications for Disease Associations

finding: The SNP rs41313262 in the IL23R gene was also correlated with phages, emphasizing the involvement of this gene in shaping the bacteriophage community in response to host immune dynamics.
title: Triadic Dynamics of Gastric Bacterial Microbiome, Phageome, and Host Genotype, with Implications for Disease Associations

finding: The presence of SNP rs2102654780 in the IL23R region was correlated with Inovirus phages, suggesting that immune regulatory variants can influence the bacterial virome.
title: Triadic Dynamics of Gastric Bacterial Microbiome, Phageome, and Host Genotype, with Implications for Disease Associations

finding: The SNP rs4846033 was associated with susceptibility to schizophrenia in human GWAS, with a reported p-value of 4×10^-6. This indicates that the variant could have important implications for understanding the genetic background of psychiatric conditions.
title: Analysis of Structural Variation Among Inbred Mouse Strains Identifies Genetic Factors for Autism-Related Traits

finding: The SNP rs12045323 was identified as being associated with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) in human GWAS, demonstrating a significant p-value of 7×10^-6. This highlights its potential relevance in the genetic factors contributing to ASD.
title: Analysis of Structural Variation Among Inbred Mouse Strains Identifies Genetic Factors for Autism-Related Traits

finding: The c.740C>T mutation in the ACTN2 gene (rs755492182) was associated with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM) in a heterozygous state. It was shown to induce an electro-mechanical phenotype in human induced pluripotent stem cell-derived cardiomyocytes (hiPSC-CMs). The study further demonstrated that in a homozygous state, it resulted in significant cardiomyocyte structural changes, including myofibrillar disarray, multinucleation, and hypocontractility, which are characteristic of dilated cardiomyopathy.
title: ACTN2 missense variant causes proteopathy in human iPSC-derived cardiomyocytes

finding: The rs340874 SNP was found to influence transcriptional activity in both human HepG2 hepatocytes and EndoC-βH1 beta cell models. This demonstrated its involvement in gene regulation relevant to pancreatic function.
title: Single-Cell Multi-Omic Roadmap of Human Fetal Pancreatic Development

finding: The analysis suggested that the rs79687284 variant might alter transcriptional activity earlier in development, indicating its potential regulatory impact in developmental stages.
title: Single-Cell Multi-Omic Roadmap of Human Fetal Pancreatic Development

finding: This SNP was shown to influence transcriptional activity specifically in beta cells but did not affect activity in human HepG2 cells, highlighting its context-specific regulatory role.
title: Single-Cell Multi-Omic Roadmap of Human Fetal Pancreatic Development

finding: The SNP rs12060915 was positively identified as a significant component in enhancing forest Leaf Area Index (LAI) prediction workflows using satellite data. This finding related to the assessment of workflow feature selection and its implications for forest management and monitoring.
title: Scientific opportunities for developing essential biodiversity variables from satellite remote sensing in the context of the post-2020 global biodiversity framework

finding: The CDA rs602950 polymorphism was linked to increased expression of CDA, affecting the metabolism of capecitabine in CRC patients.
title: Pharmacogenomics, biomarker network and allele frequencies in colorectal cancer

finding: CDA rs532545 was also associated with enhanced expression of CDA, which could influence therapeutic outcomes in capecitabine treatment.
title: Pharmacogenomics, biomarker network and allele frequencies in colorectal cancer

finding: This SNP at 1q32 was associated with multiple cancers and is in linkage disequilibrium with known cancer risk variants.
title: Pan-Cancer Study Detects Novel Genetic Risk Variants and Shared Genetic Basis in Two Large Cohorts
