While the primary findings centered on structural variants (SV) and single nucleotide variants (SNV) associated with FGFR family proteins, the study highlighted that alterations, including those at loci like rs12123825, were particularly prevalent in pediatric gliomas. Specifically, FGFR1 alterations, potentially influenced by such SNPs, were linked to types of tumors like glioneuronal histologies and pediatric low-grade gliomas, thereby underscoring the relevance of rs12123825 in the proliferation and treatment response of FGFR-altered gliomas.
title: A diverse landscape of FGFR alterations and co-mutations defines novel therapeutic strategies in pediatric low-grade gliomas

finding: The SNP rs1801160 in the DPYD gene was associated with response to treatments in DLBCL and specified as relevant for patients receiving 5-fluorouracil.
title: Epigenetic inhibitors sensitize DLBCL cells to rituximab and doxorubicin

finding: The SNP rs2297595 in the DPYD gene was linked to toxicity in patients treated with 5-fluorouracil, highlighting its important role in pharmacogenomic responses.
title: Epigenetic inhibitors sensitize DLBCL cells to rituximab and doxorubicin

finding: In the study led by Borsos et al., it was found that SNP rs12061617 was associated with the regulation of the ubiquitin-proteasome system, specifically relating to the removal of S2P RNAPII following DNA double-strand breaks. The findings indicated that individuals carrying this SNP might experience variations in transcription elongation processes and DNA repair mechanisms. The involvement of P53, ATM, and DNAPK in this regulation highlights the potential functional consequences of genetic variations in relation to DNA damage response pathways.
title: Old players in new posts: the role of P53, ATM and DNAPK in DNA damage-related ubiquitylation-dependent removal of S2P RNAPII

finding: The rs946528 variant was identified as a significant locus associated with platelet count (PLT) in a Bangladeshi population. It was associated with a 95% credible set of 343 variants spanning eight coding genes. Importantly, this locus contained regulatory elements that suggested rs946528 was part of a haplotype block influencing platelet phenotypes, where PIK3R3 was identified as the likely mediator due to its involvement in platelet regulation and prior associations with cardiovascular complications.
title: PIK3R3 is a candidate regulator of platelet count in people of Bangladeshi ancestry

finding: The rs1707303 variant, found in intron 1 of PIK3R3, was noted for being adjacent to a transcription factor binding site for RUNX1, a critical factor in megakaryocyte development. It was linked with regulatory activity and was part of the haplotype associated with PLT, thus suggesting its functional relevance in the context of platelet production.
title: PIK3R3 is a candidate regulator of platelet count in people of Bangladeshi ancestry

finding: The SNP rs1183832067 A>C in gene RFX5 was classified as likely pathogenic due to its role as a splice donor variant with implications for Bare lymphocyte syndrome.
title: Genetic landscape of recessive diseases in the Vietnamese population from large-scale clinical exome sequencing

finding: The SNP rs748270285 G>A, which acted as a splice acceptor for the same exon of RFX5, was also classified as likely pathogenic with connections to splicing pathways historically associated with pathogenic outcomes.
title: Genetic landscape of recessive diseases in the Vietnamese population from large-scale clinical exome sequencing

finding: The SNP rs2228145 in the interleukin-6R (IL6R) gene, associated with hyperlipidemia phenotypes, demonstrated improved detection of associations when analyzed using the MAP algorithm compared to the standard PheWAS method based on ICD codes. The PheWAS revealed significant associations, particularly with ischemic heart disease, where the odds ratio estimated through MAP was 0.945 with a p-value of 3.89 × 10^-19, indicating a strong association. The analysis showed MAP yielded 13 significant associations post-Bonferroni correction, versus 12 for ICD, and had a higher average negative log10 p-value, highlighting its power in detecting genetic associations.
title: High-throughput Multimodal Automated Phenotyping (MAP) with Application to PheWAS

finding: The SNP rs1106529 was associated with bone mineral density and obesity-risk traits. It was located in the Myob-hyperm DMR immediately upstream of the TBX15 promoter region, where DNA sequences were found to be unmethylated in osteoblasts. This SNP was part of a super-enhancer that significantly upregulated TBX15 expression, which was contingent on the absence of methylation in that region. It was not in linkage disequilibrium with any other SNP, thus highlighting its independent biological significance.
title: Promoter-adjacent DNA hypermethylation can downmodulate gene expression: TBX15 in the muscle lineage

finding: The NOS1AP rs12742393 (A/C) polymorphism also influenced therapeutic outcomes of nateglinide for type 2 diabetes mellitus, further emphasizing the role of genetic factors in diabetes management.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Underlying Mechanisms in Cystic Fibrosis and its Associated Complications Based on Bioinformatics Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The urotensin II gene polymorphism rs228648 was linked to type 2 diabetes mellitus risk, suggesting its relevance in the metabolic regulatory processes.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Underlying Mechanisms in Cystic Fibrosis and its Associated Complications Based on Bioinformatics Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The association of rs2890565 with type 2 diabetes mellitus was established, indicating its contribution to the genetic factors influencing this condition.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Underlying Mechanisms in Cystic Fibrosis and its Associated Complications Based on Bioinformatics Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The SNP rs12030699 was implicated in the ability of high-grade serous ovarian cancer cells to form multicellular structures along disease progression. It influenced the tumorigenicity in a model system indicative of its relevance in the context of cancer progression and therapeutic responses.
title: Nelfinavir induces cytotoxicity towards high-grade serous ovarian cancer cells regardless of platinum sensitivity, involving induction of the unfolded protein response, modulation of protein synthesis, DNA damage, lysosomal impairment, and potentiation of toxicity caused by proteasome inhibition

finding: SNP rs736756 showed the highest PPA of 32.8% in the association signal linked to the gene NRDC in a GWAS on depression.
title: A Unifying Statistical Framework to Discover Disease Genes from GWAS

finding: The SNP rs629301 at the SORT1/CELSR2 locus demonstrated positive colocalization with liver cis-eQTL and GWAS signals, indicating that it was involved in lipid regulation, but the interactions could not be separately analyzed for SORT1 and CELSR2 due to overlapping co-localization.
title: Pairwise genetic interactions modulate lipid plasma levels and cellular uptake

finding: The variant rs1196456 increased the expression of MRPL9 in the heart and was associated with myocardial infarction, highlighting its significance in cardiac health.
title: Unveiling the role of Tdark genes in genetic diseases and phenotypes through bioinformatics-based functional enrichment and network analyses

finding: The rs12041331 variant was previously implicated in influencing platelet phenotypes through its association with PEAR1, demonstrating that the minor allele linked to decreased PEAR1 platelet protein levels could impact platelet reactivity.
title: Genome Sequencing Unveils a New Regulatory Landscape of Platelet Reactivity

finding: The SNP rs11208009 on chromosome 1 showed a genome-wide significant association with word reading (p=1.098 × 10−8). This finding was independent of known loci associated with intelligence or educational attainment and was linked to the genes DOCK7, ANGPTL3, and USP1 known for their roles in neurogenesis and cellular functions relevant to language skills.
title: Genome-wide association analyses of individual differences in quantitatively assessed reading- and language-related skills in up to 34,000 people

finding: The lead GWAS SNP rs1044595, located at 1p25.3, was found to be associated with increased expression of the STX6 gene in bulk brain samples, particularly in oligodendrocytes, indicating its functional relevance in PSP.
title: Genetic, transcriptomic, histological, and biochemical analysis of progressive supranuclear palsy implicates glial activation and novel risk genes

finding: The SNP rs3789362 co-localized with enhancers related to the oligodendrocyte-specific expression of STX6, suggesting that this variant may enhance STX6 expression through modification of an oligodendrocyte-specific enhancer.
title: Genetic, transcriptomic, histological, and biochemical analysis of progressive supranuclear palsy implicates glial activation and novel risk genes

finding: The SNP rs2789362 was linked with the expression of STX6 in oligodendrocytes and was found in high linkage disequilibrium with rs1044595, reinforcing its role in PSP-related gene expression.
title: Genetic, transcriptomic, histological, and biochemical analysis of progressive supranuclear palsy implicates glial activation and novel risk genes

finding: The cis-pQTL rs11589479 in ADAM15 was noted to co-localize with Crohn's disease, implying a strong genetic link with a shared genetic signal.
title: Cross-platform proteomics to advance genetic prioritisation strategies

finding: The missense variant rs34687326 (p.Gly99Ser) within SLAMF8 was identified as a risk factor for inflammatory bowel disease and co-localized with Crohn's disease, indicating a significant genetic connection.
title: Cross-platform proteomics to advance genetic prioritisation strategies

finding: The lead cis-pQTL rs2071579 was part of a sensitivity analysis showing significant improvement in correlation coefficients across measures post stratification.
title: Cross-platform proteomics to advance genetic prioritisation strategies

finding: The involvement of rs4950928 in the correlation discussions showcased its role in strengthening relationships between protein measurements across platforms.
title: Cross-platform proteomics to advance genetic prioritisation strategies

finding: SNP rs78444298, which was discussed in the context of EDEM3 P746S, demonstrated significant association with lower plasma TG concentrations, confirming the impacts of this missense variant detailed previously.
title: EDEM3 modulates plasma triglyceride level through its regulation of LRP1 expression

finding: This SNP was identified as a novel shared risk variant for ASD and ADHD. It was mapped to the gene DPYD as well as the gene PTBP2 in genomic loci 1p21, with its potential implications for neurodevelopmental disorders.
title: Combining multivariate genomic approaches to elucidate the comorbidity between ASD and ADHD

finding: The SNP rs1195871 was reported to be associated with hypertension, exhibiting a genome-wide significant threshold (p<5 × 10^-8). This SNP is located near the 5' end of the ADGRL2 gene and is relatively conserved among vertebrates.
title: Latrophilin-2 mediates fluid shear stress mechanotransduction at endothelial junctions

finding: The intronic SNP rs186892211 in the ADGRL2 locus was associated with large-artery atherosclerosis and subsequent ischemic stroke, as categorized by the TOAST classification. It had a very high odds ratio of 720, with a significance threshold of p< 3.134e-10.
title: Latrophilin-2 mediates fluid shear stress mechanotransduction at endothelial junctions

finding: The SNP rs11207510 was linked to T2D and was located at an LSD1-bound site that interacts with the JUN promoter in human islets. This finding suggested that rs11207510 plays a role in the regulation of genes associated with nutrient response and insulin secretion adaptation.
title: Nutrient regulation of the islet epigenome controls adaptive insulin secretion

finding: The SNP rs12061393 was associated with the response to anti-EGFR therapy in colorectal cancer (CRC). The study indicated that the presence of this SNP correlated with increased EGF secretion by cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs), which contributed to chemoresistance in CRC cells. This finding highlighted an important interaction between genetic variants and the tumor microenvironment relevant to CRC treatment outcomes.
title: Elucidating Tumor-stromal Metabolic Crosstalk in Colorectal Cancer through Integration of Constraint-Based Models and LC-MS Metabolomics

finding: The SNP rs7528684 was associated with an increased risk of Hashimoto's thyroiditis in Iranian patients, highlighting its potential role in autoimmunity. This association was determined through an evaluation using a dataset of immune-mediated diseases, supporting its relevance to disorders characterized by autoimmune features.
title: Upregulated Fcrl5 disrupts B cell anergy and causes autoimmunity

finding: The allele associated with higher intelligence was linked to a higher completion rate of the food frequency questionnaire (FFQ). This locus was previously identified in genome-wide association studies (GWAS) of intelligence.
title: Genetic predictors of participation in optional components of UK Biobank

finding: This allele was associated with higher cognitive function, positively correlating with increased odds of completing the mental health questionnaire (MHQ).
title: Genetic predictors of participation in optional components of UK Biobank

finding: This variant's allele was similarly linked to cognitive performance, which was associated with higher participation rates in the MHQ.
title: Genetic predictors of participation in optional components of UK Biobank

finding: The CASQ1 gene polymorphism rs2275703 was studied in relation to type 2 diabetes and metabolic traits, suggesting its importance in metabolic regulation.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs12092334 was identified as a significant factor associated with the response to immunotherapy in glioblastoma (GBM) patients. This finding was contextualized within the exploration of immune infiltrates in the tumor microenvironment (TME), where distinct immune cell subtypes and their molecular signatures were analyzed, highlighting a potential avenue for targeted therapeutic strategies.
title: Single-cell transcriptomics reveals immunosuppressive microenvironment and highlights stumor-promoting macrophage cells in Glioblastoma

finding: The SNP rs1047980 within LAMC2 was significantly associated (p = 9 x 10-6) with maximum habitual alcohol consumption in a cohort of approximately 140,000 U.S. European and African American veterans.
title: Genome-wide association mapping of ethanol sensitivity in the Diversity Outbred mouse population

finding: The SNP rs3820282 was identified as a C>T transition in WNT4 intron 1, which was linked to dysregulation of WNT4 signaling via estrogen receptor binding. This variant was shown to be pathogenic, influencing the metabolic remodeling in gynecologic cancers, with a significant association between the variant genotype and increased risk of ovarian cancer and endometriosis. In ovarian cancer cell lines carrying the variant genotype, WNT4 signaling was actively involved in metabolic processes, with functional studies demonstrating that WNT4 knockdown led to decreased proliferation specifically in variant genotype cells. Furthermore, the variant was coupled with enhanced AMPK activation, showcasing its role in altering metabolic pathways within tumors.
title: WNT4 regulates cellular metabolism via intracellular activity at the mitochondria in breast and gynecologic cancers

finding: The SNP rs7549250 mapped to the intronic region of IL6R and showed significant associations with myocardial infarction and coronary artery disease. It was identified as an IL6R eQTL in cardiac tissues, influencing cardiovascular disease mechanisms.
title: Dissecting Regulatory Non-Coding Heart Disease GWAS Loci with High-Resolution 3D Chromatin Interactions Reveals Causal Genes with Pathophysiological Relevance to Heart Failure

finding: The study demonstrated that the common spirometry measures forced vital capacity (FVC) and forced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1) were associated with the SNP rs4077468 located at the SLC26A9 locus. The quantitative trait association analysis of the FEV1/FVC ratio in 1,927 non-CF individuals from the UK10K cohort revealed significant association results, with p-values of 0.0392 using genotype likelihoods and 0.0375 using genotype calls. These findings replicated previous studies in a non-CF population, further suggesting that variants at this locus contribute to lung function in individuals without cystic fibrosis.
title: VikNGS: A C++ Variant Integration Kit for Next Generation Sequencing association analysis

finding: The SNP rs1414273, located in miR-548ac, was found to be significantly associated with rheumatoid arthritis (RA) with a p-value of 8.26×10^-4, indicating that its presence increased susceptibility to RA.
title: MicroRNA variants and HLA-miRNA interactions are novel rheumatoid arthritis susceptibility factors

finding: The SNP rs76763715 was linked to GBA, another previously identified risk locus for PD. It was targeted due to its established effect in coding risk variants.
title: Expanding Parkinson’s disease genetics: novel risk loci, genomic context, causal insights and heritable risk

finding: The minor allele of rs4454537 in the GREM2 region was associated with low bone mineral density (BMD) in the hips among a southern Chinese population. This finding highlighted the influence of genetic variants in the GREM2 region on BMD, suggesting a role for GREM2 in fracture risk.
title: Genetic dissection of femoral and tibial microarchitecture

finding: SNP rs9287237 was associated with trabecular bone fraction, indicating its role in modulating this specific component of bone structure. Similar to rs1021188, this finding underscored the separate impacts genetic variants can have on trabecular versus cortical bone parameters.
title: Genetic dissection of femoral and tibial microarchitecture

finding: The SNP rs12071799 was identified in the context of epigenetic profiling associated with aging and mortality risk. This finding was part of a comprehensive study that characterized the genetic and epigenetic landscape of individuals resembling those with Lynch syndrome. The analysis indicated that this SNP could play a role in understanding the epigenetic mechanisms underlying age-associated molecular changes.
title: Pseudotime analysis reveals exponential trends in DNA methylation aging with mortality associated timescales

finding: The SNP rs7528419 was associated with the gene SORT1, which influences LDL-cholesterol levels. The significance of this association decreased when adjusted for methylation, highlighting the role of surrounding DNA methylation levels (ranging from 0.12 to 0.33) on lipid phenotypes.
title: Incorporation of DNA methylation into eQTL mapping in African Americans

finding: Similar to rs7528419, the SNP rs12740374 was also linked to SORT1. Adjusting for methylation resulted in a rise in p-value indicating that DNA methylation may modulate its expression relationship to lipid measurements, reinforcing the need to consider methylation in genetic risk assessments for lipid-related diseases.
title: Incorporation of DNA methylation into eQTL mapping in African Americans

finding: The SNP rs1332018 showed a correlation with the expression of GSTM3 and DNA methylation. The T allele was associated with greater GSTM3 expression and lower DNA methylation, indicating a potential protective genetic factor against diseases like HBV and HCC which disproportionately affect African Americans.
title: Incorporation of DNA methylation into eQTL mapping in African Americans

finding: The SNP rs57711775 was linked to increased expression of HSPA6, with analysis revealing that the A allele corresponded to higher gene expression and DNA methylation. This SNP was not present in European ancestry populations, suggesting it might represent a unique risk allele for HCC in African Americans.
title: Incorporation of DNA methylation into eQTL mapping in African Americans

finding: The SNP rs11121844 was associated with mutations in splicing factor genes, which were found to have significant implications for clinical features in myeloid malignancies. This finding was underscored by prior research, which highlighted the role of splicing factors in tumor progression, indicating that the presence of this variant could potentially influence the expression or functionality of splicing-related proteins in cancers such as metastatic prostate cancer.
title: Integrative identification of non-coding regulatory regions driving metastatic prostate cancer

finding: The SNP rs115287176 located in TMOD4 was significantly associated with myocardial infarction and hypertension. This association highlighted its potential role in cardiovascular health, particularly in connection with atherosclerosis.
title: The LEPIS-HuR-TMOD4 axis regulates hepatic cholesterol homeostasis and accelerates atherosclerosis

finding: The SNP rs12061561 was associated with the modulation of ECM components in the context of TNBC following radiation therapy. It was noted that alterations in the extracellular matrix due to radiation could influence tumor behavior, with enhanced TNBC cell proliferation and invasiveness in irradiated environments. This relationship suggested that specific genetic variations might contribute to the efficacy of RT and tumor recurrence in breast cancer.
title: Mammary Tissue-Derived Extracellular Matrix Hydrogels Reveal the Role of the Irradiated Microenvironment in Breast Cancer Recurrence

finding: This SNP was highlighted for its role in recovering the association signal at IL10 despite the absence of rs2093761. Its presence contributed to a genome-wide significant association with IL10 in the context of LOAD.
title: A statistical framework for cross-tissue transcriptome-wide association analysis

finding: This SNP was found to be associated with more than 5 CpGs located within the gene body of IRF6, suggesting a connection to immune responses relevant to Crohn's disease.
title: Methylation Quantitative Trait Loci are Largely Consistent across Disease States in Crohn’s disease

finding: This SNP was part of the molecular basis of the Duffy blood group system and relevant for malaria resistance. It demonstrated a nearly fixed difference between Europeans and Africans.
title: How to choose sets of ancestry informative markers: A supervised feature selection approach

finding: The SNP rs746736545 was identified as a missense mutation in VPS13D that affects a conserved residue in helical membrane-bound regions of the gondola domain. This mutation was linked to spastic ataxia, indicating its potential role in disrupting protein docking at lipid membranes, thereby affecting lipid transfer processes.
title: In silico modelling human VPS13 proteins associated with donor and target membranes suggests lipid transfer mechanisms

finding: The SNP rs141140594 was identified with a POIROT p-value of 2.43 × 10⁻⁷, making it suggestively significant. This SNP is located 3kb from the gene ATP8B2, which has previously been associated with type 2 diabetes, contributing to understanding potential genetic influences on infant size traits.
title: POIROT: A powerful test for parent-of-origin effects in unrelated samples leveraging multiple phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs10751449 was part of a haplotype in the erythroid-specific promoter of the ATP2B4 gene that reduced expression of PMCA4b in red blood cells, altered mean corpuscular hemoglobin concentration, and provided protection against malaria. Mutations at this SNP caused decreased expression akin to the full haplotype.
title: Identification and quantitative characterization of protein-DNA interactions with the native holdup assay: GATA1 regulation of the plasma membrane calcium pump

finding: The SNP rs10736845 was identified in the erythroid promoter of the ATP2B4 gene and contributed to lower expression of PMCA4b in mature red blood cells and reduced mean corpuscular hemoglobin concentration. Its mutation also recapitulated the reduced expression seen with the full haplotype.
title: Identification and quantitative characterization of protein-DNA interactions with the native holdup assay: GATA1 regulation of the plasma membrane calcium pump

finding: The SNP rs10751451, along with others previously mentioned, was part of a haplotype in the ATP2B4 gene promoter that lowered PMCA4b expression and reduced mean corpuscular hemoglobin concentration, providing malaria protection. Mutations at this SNP were linked to diminished expression similar to the complete haplotype.
title: Identification and quantitative characterization of protein-DNA interactions with the native holdup assay: GATA1 regulation of the plasma membrane calcium pump

finding: At the 1q21.3 locus (FLG), each copy of the asthma risk allele (rs61816761) was associated with an average earlier onset of 4.57 years compared to individuals without the risk allele. This finding was significant with a p-value of 8.15×10^-27, indicating a strong link to age of asthma onset.
title: Shared and Distinct Genetic Risk Factors for Childhood Onset and Adult Onset Asthma: Genome- and Transcriptome-wide Studies

finding: The rs41281364 variant resulted in reduced gene expression in the brain and was associated with LOAD.
title: In vivo validation of late-onset Alzheimer’s disease genetic risk factors

finding: The rs1801133 variant was associated with increased risk for LOAD and other age-related disorders.
title: In vivo validation of late-onset Alzheimer’s disease genetic risk factors

finding: The SNP rs12030738 was associated with the efficacy of immune checkpoint inhibitors, as indicated by its mention in a study on FDA-approved immune checkpoint inhibitors and their evidence levels. This was significant as the research linked to immune modulation in cancer treatment.
title: DHODH inhibition enhances the efficacy of immune checkpoint blockade by increasing cancer cell antigen presentation

finding: The SNP rs12071760 was linked to mechanisms of MHC class I downregulation in cancer, which has implications for targeting therapies in cancer immunotherapy. This finding suggested potential targets for enhancing immune responses against tumors.
title: DHODH inhibition enhances the efficacy of immune checkpoint blockade by increasing cancer cell antigen presentation

finding: The SNP rs371481157 (c.C2015T, p.A672V) was identified as a rare non-synonymous point variant present in one individual within the GnomAD nNFE control dataset, with a minor allele frequency of less than 0.0001. It was predicted to be pathogenic by 13 out of 17 prediction tools and was found at a highly conserved amino acid residue across species.
title: SFPQ intron retention, reduced expression and aggregate formation in central nervous system tissue are pathological features of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis

finding: The SNP rs763571943 (c.C229T, p.P77S) was found to be a rare non-synonymous point variant present in two individuals in the GnomAD nNFE dataset, also with a minor allele frequency of less than 0.0001. Additionally, this variant was observed in an ALS patient from the Project MinE dataset, indicating its relevance to ALS pathology.
title: SFPQ intron retention, reduced expression and aggregate formation in central nervous system tissue are pathological features of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis

finding: This variant was identified as specific to African ancestry and is considered significant within the context of the pooled analysis, thus contributing to the understanding of genetic variations among non-European ancestries.
title: Cloud gazing: demonstrating paths for unlocking the value of cloud genomics through cross-cohort analysis

finding: This SNP was identified as a rare variant specific to the American ancestry group and was significant in the pooled analysis.
title: Cloud gazing: demonstrating paths for unlocking the value of cloud genomics through cross-cohort analysis

finding: The rs646776 SNP was identified as a significant regulator of progranulin levels in human plasma. This finding indicated that genetic variation at this locus could influence the concentration of progranulin, a lysosomal protein, which is crucial in the context of diseases such as frontotemporal dementia and neuronal ceroid lipofuscinosis.
title: Surf4 Promotes Endoplasmic Reticulum Exit of the Lysosomal Prosaposin-Progranulin Complex

finding: The SNP <italic>rs1967017</italic> at the <italic>PDZK1</italic> locus demonstrated strong evidence for causality, impacting serum urate levels.
title: Genomic dissection of 43 serum urate-associated loci provides multiple insights into molecular mechanisms of urate control
